text: Decided to meet my siblings at Augie's for dinner Saturday night.  I had eaten at Smiley's many times over the years and their food had always been very good.  One of my sister's got there at 7:30pm.  The rest of us were on our way.  She texted us and said she was seated and that she was told we would be the last table seated as they had a wedding in the back room at 8:00pm.  The rest of us arrived at 7:35pm and saw numerous people entering the restaurant in dress clothes.  We felt uncomfortable as though we were intruding on this couple's wedding and voiced that concern to the waitress who assured us we were fine to stay and order.  There were three other tables seated in the restaurant.  Before we ordered the bride and groom entered which made us feel even more uncomfortable and I didn't know how we would be sitting at tables next to wedding guests and eating our dinner.  We ordered quickly so as to hurry and get out of the way and I wish now that we had just left so as not to intrude on the private wedding party.  One of the two waitresses brought the table a basket of garlic french bread which was very good.  I ordered a seafood gumbo and stuffed mushroom and the rest of the table ordered chicken parmesan.  The gumbo had a good color and 5 or 6 (21/25 count) shrimp but it had NO flavor.  The stuffed mushroom appetizer had 4 mushrooms.  The mushrooms were stuffed then breaded and fried and covered with what I believe was supposed to be some kind of mayonaisse sauce but it was very lacking.  I could not taste anything but mayonaisse so I can't say whether the mushrooms were good or not as I only ate a couple of bites because I couldn't get past the taste of mayonaisse.  The chicken in the chicken parmesan was tough and the two people who ordered it did not eat it. We quickly paid the bill which was brought to the table before we even got the food but the waitress did say there was no hurry.  The twenty minutes we were there guests continued to pile into the restaurant and sit at tables around us while other staff passed hors d'oeuvres to them, other guests lined up at the bar for drinks and a band began to play as the bride and groom began their first dance as husband and wife.  I wish I could have apologized to the couple and their guests for intruding on their special occasion.  Seating regular diners within 25-30 minutes of a private function commencing was a mistake of the management who made that decision.  However, worse than that decision was the food.  I don't think I will ever give it a another chance.  I guess in the time it took to transition from Smiley's to Augie's the chef's who were preparing the delicious food found new jobs elsewhere.
name: Augie's Restaurant

text: Dined here with family for the first time and we were all met with disappointment. The waitress was great but she was by herself trying to serve many tables. It took 1-1/2 hours to get our food. Appetizers took 30 minutes and when they came out we were told they didn't have two of the items ordered. Salads finally arrived and Homemade blue cheese was bland and runny. We had just started our salads after being here an hour when the waitress advises us that they're out of oysters for one dish, out of hamburger steak for another and out of pork for another. Changes were made but we weren't happy. The entrees arrived about 30 minutes later and cold. Brisket was good, Catfish Orleans good, Veal Augie horrible, Veal Parmesan ok. Price was reasonable, about $20/person. The waitress gave us 3 gift certificates because of the service and being out of many dishes. Maybe this place rocks the lunch crowd, but they should close for dinner.
name: Augie's Restaurant

text:
They have fresh hot pizza and great Mediterranean selections, of note. I went for a slice of pizza, as well as onion rings, and fries  to hold me over from the long wait at the OMV next door. The lady who took my order was professional, and was eager to please. She apologetically acknowledged the pizza would be coming out soon (after a 15-min wait) when I arrived and it hadn't appeared to be ready. It arrived right and I was standing and she asked if I would like a bag (to which I said no, because I didn't need it and environmental waste is already too much... let's do what we can to save our planet) *steps off soapbox*

The interior of the restaurant was small, yet spacious and clean. The menu came across as garbled linguistically with its offerings of both Medi and Italian food,but yet still readable-i was able to suss it out after much staring at it ...but the pizza! The pizza was really good. I could tell the ingredients used to prepare the pizza were fresh and although the pizza itself trended on the blander side, for me, I don't mind it that way as it's nothing that a sprinkle of dried herbs and pepper couldn't remedy. Onion rings were standard fare. I wish they delivered but I doubt they'll swing by Mid-City, lol. If I am ever that way again I'll be sure to order their Mediterranean offerings - and grab a slice as well... and I'll let you know how THAT went in my next review.
name: Napoli Pizza & Subs
address: 11701 Morrison Rd, Ste 102, Lakewood Plaza Shopping Ctr

text: I don't know why I haven't written a review on this place yet - I've been going here for years. I always do take-out on my way home from work. They are always super fast and it's ready by the time I arrive. I've had almost everything on the menu over the years. Tonight I ordered the shrimp and broccoli combination dinner with egg roll and pork fried rice. Very delicious for the reasonable price. The egg roll was tasty (be sure to take a packet of the duck sauce and a packet of mustard for the egg roll.) The shrimps were large and tender and the broccoli was tender-crisp with a tasty sauce. The fried rice was very good and the portions are always large. Although I've had better Chinese food, I really think that this place is a good, healthy alternative to a burger and fries at an incredibly reasonable price and that's why I'm giving it 5 stars. Oh, and they are just the nicest people in the world. So, I'll be going back to Star Wok for take-out for many more years to come.
name: Star Wok

text:
I tried this restaurant for the first time last weekend. The service was excellent, but surprisingly the food was beyond underwhelming. First, our salads were SWIMMING in dressing and very soggy! I could also tell that it was bottled processed ranch dressing. To me that is unacceptable especially since the salad came with my pasta which cost $30! You'd think the dressing would be homemade at that price.

Everyone at my table ordered the crab au gratin pasta except my sister. The crab meat was big and plentiful, but that was the best I could say about it. The dish had no flavor at all really and not worth $30. There also wasn't much pasta given. My sister chose the Catfish Lafitte pasta and once again it was extremely under seasoned. We barely ate our food and I tried to give mine away. What a shame bc we had high expectations as it looked so delicious. Bring spare seasonings in your purse to doctor up your food if you come here. There are much better, less expensive Italian/seafood restaurants in the city.
name: Augie's Restaurant

text: Smilie's Restaurant is closed.  The owner has moved down Jefferson Hwy a couple of blocks to a small strip mall and opened Augie's Restaurant.  The menu is similar to what he served before, seafood and Italian dishes.  In addition, he is currently serving a nightly special.  I ordered the Monday night lasagna special which came with a house salad and bread.  No complaints about the service.  The salad was crisp and the meal was hot.  The price was reasonable.  They are open for lunch and dinner.  Be aware that even thought the hours are listed as 11 am to 9 pm, they are closed from 2:30 to 4:30.  This seems to be more common these days for restaurants in the area, taking a break between the lunch and dinner crowds.  There is a full bar with a TV, however, no draft beer, only bottles.  The wine list is a limited selection, but the server said they are working on it.  I forgot to ask what was the corkage fee if I brought my own wine.
name: Augie's Restaurant

text: This place is an entire VIBE y'all. I took a quick lunch break to try them out and it was totally worth it. I ordered the "Yeah with the Yeah" smoothie in 12oz ($7.95) and the Almond Berry toast (1 slice/$3.95). My only complaint is I should have ordered the 16oz smoothie because it was so delicious. The sea moss doesn't have an after taste and the fruit flavor combinations were spot on. The toast was delicious. Thick nutty bread covered in almond butter, mixed berries, agave and coconut flakes. So why you ask the 4 stars and not 5? Well they are a newly opened business so all the menu items weren't available yet. There was only two cold pressed juice options available out of the 7-8 choices that were listed. Additionally there needed to be a little more guidance on the ordering and paying process. But I'm sure they'll work out those kinks. I'll be back to try some different varieties of toast. Maybe avocado next...and of course my new fav large yeah with the yeah smoothie.
name: Botanicals Nola
categories: Health & Medical, Restaurants, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Acai Bowls, Salad, Vegan, Food, Herbal Shops

text: Augie's in Harahan was awesome.  The waiter was knowledgeable and professional.  The food was cooked properly and delicious. The great portions sizes.  Place was clean. Waiting time was great.  Received our drinks and food quickly.  I recommend this place highly.  You won't regret it.
name: Augie's Restaurant

text: The only place from which this born and bred New Yorker would order pizza. Best in town. Absolutely sublime. Thank you for your service.
name: The Crazy Italian

text: So it is very rare that I will take the time to write a review but last night's dinner at The Crazy Italian prompted me; not only the food but the atmosphere brought me back to the 4+ years I lived in NY back in the 90's. The kids were begging for pizza, and not generally much of a pizza fan, particularly in New Orleans, I decided to order a meatball sub for me and a pizza margherita for the kids. The sub was amazing. Meatballs were nearly all meat with very little filler but moist. Tangy sauce and the bread.... Now onto the pizza, as I said not much of a pizza fan since Ive been in the south, but OMG did this pizza bring me back to the family owned neighborhood pizzerias on Long Island. The kids "gavoned" the pie, leaving me a sliver. That mere sliver transported me back in time. Thin, crispy, yet chewy crust with just the right amount of char. The tangy but sweet sauce with the mozz and basil, an absolute hit. Had I known by then, I would have ordered two pies!!! We will definitely be back!
name: The Crazy Italian

Soooooo FREAKING good!! I came across their IG page and made it my business to go this past weekend! 

I ordered Dat Fiya Pitaya - a bomb choice! It's made with  Pitaya, pineapple, bananas, almond milk, sea moss and granola on top. You can choose 3 topping to to tip it with. I chose strawberry, coconut flakes and peanut butter! Y'all it's a really nice size portion for $12 bucks!

I tasted my friends smoothie that she ordered, which was The NOLA shake and it was amazing! I almost drank half of her smoothie! Lol! 

Definitely going back again and again!

text:
Wow what an amazing addition to magazine street. Thanks to empanola for creating such amazing empanadas! We tried the chorizo Mexican, the crawfish etoufee, the spinach and artichoke, and the special of the day a salmon leek. Everything was amazing and came out in a quick five minutes, although I especially loved the salmon one. The chimichurri sauce was also on point.
I like how they have a mix everything anyone could want, including more typical latin empanadas, fusion Nola-style empanadas, and plenty of choices for vegetarians and vegans. The alfajore was also lovely and so delicately sweet. Will definitely be coming back to try the other items on the menu!

Empanola is a must try. I wish I had tried the the bananas Foster flavor.

text:
My daughters and I intentionally support a BOB as often as we can, and this weekend's pick was today at Botanicals Nola. I had very high hopes going in because eating clean and green is my go-to, and they did not disappoint. The venue is conveniently located, has a great vibe, friendly staff, great customer service, and my order lived up to my expectations. The pictures posted are of a fruit bowl- Dat Fiya Pitaya, and 2 vegan muffins-a Chantilly and a blueberry. I also bought a fresh pressed juice- carrot- which I could clearly tell wasn't cut with anything. I could taste the ginger, which I appreciated. The place was full the whole time and the line was to the door most of the time, so be prepared to wait because majority of the items are freshly prepared, which is obviously a good thing. 

Also, major key- {DJ Khaled voice} the man who I believed to be the owner continuously acknowledged the line, saying that someone would be with them shortly. This constant acknowledgement clearly showed that he appreciated his customers. He also pulled someone from the back to replace him at the register, and in turn started helping his staff prepare orders when the line got really long. I particularly value quality customer service equally to a good product, so those observations were huge plusses for me. I will definitely be a repeat customer. 

P.S. Pitaya is basically dragon fruit which I had no idea until I googled it today while in line  It tastes similar to a pear, so it is a good base.
name: Botanicals Nola
categories: Health & Medical, Restaurants, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Acai Bowls, Salad, Vegan, Food, Herbal Shops

text:
The food here is very good & the staff is professional. However, I was not pleased today. I always order the chicken shawarma wrap with grilled onions, the price is 12.07. I called and ordered it today and the girl who answered told me 12.07. HOWEVER, when I went to pay she charged me 13.17. I was confused. I asked why? She said they changed it today. However when I looked at the menu it was still 10.99 and she said 12.07. I paid her the money because I'm not ignorant and I respect prices. BUT I did not like the change especially because Im a normal customer. When I opened the box I was expecting a bigger portion size of food since the price went up. HOWEVER, IT SEEMED LIKE LESS FOOD. This made me upset..... i will never come back here again. 
Im a loyal customer who spends my money & tip everytime but this is not appreciated 

This is the bullard and Morrison location
name: Napoli Pizza & Subs
address: 11701 Morrison Rd, Ste 102, Lakewood Plaza Shopping Ctr

text:
Don't let the fact that this spot is located in a small strip mall deter you. It's some of the best pizza and Italian food you will ever have. I had lunch here a few days ago and it was delicious. 

I enjoyed the margherita pizza, the white pizza, boudin egg rolls, Mount Vesuvius shrimp, meatballs, and spinach dip. Yeah, it was a lot! Thankfully, I was sharing with a few people. 

The pizza here is authentic New York style pizza with that perfect thin crust and cheese and sauce that speaks for itself. The place is family owned and the service is super friendly. It's a small spot, so give the crew some heads up if you plan on being in a big group. Otherwise, take out is a great option. I love the food here and I will absolutely be back.
name: The Crazy Italian

text:
While the pizza (Margherita) was delicious and the restaurant appeared to be as clean as a whistle, staff I encountered was not wearing a mask (I was).  The ordrer taker completely ignored me while she cleaned up old messages on the store phone.   I finally had to ask her if she could take my order. 
Customers entering the store were not wearing masks and were not asked to mask up.  No one asked to see my COVID Vaccine information.   I will return, because, like I said, the pizza was very good, but I'm disappointed that a restaurant in Orleans Parish was violating city mandates so blatantly.
name: The Crazy Italian

text: Working from home, I've tried just about every place that delivers around me. Pizza Hut and Dominos is always easy to order, and while it cures your hunger it just isn't great. I decided to The Crazy Italian and wasn't expecting much, but I have to say it was much better than expected. The pizza arrived warm and it was perfect. It wasn't soggy and the toppings didn't slide off. It was perfectly done, not over cooked or undercook. I will definitely order again!
name: The Crazy Italian

text:
We really love empanadas so we're excited to try these! Thank you for the elite perk. The perk was nice but I will still provide an objective review.

We tried six different empanada flavors:
Beef Argentina (BA)
Chicken Peruvian (CP)
Chorizo Mexicana (CM)
Ham & Queso
Crawfish Etouffee
Gumbo

They were all delicious! BA & CP were nothing like other empanadas I have had. They were all very flavourful and well filled! We would gladly buy them again as they were delicious and also affordable.

I didn't choose five stars because I prefer empanadas made with buttery rough puff pastry...nothing like buttery goodness. Otherwise, these are nearly perfect!

I also really wanted to try their salmon and leek empanada, but they ran out :( Hopefully they will have it the next time we visit!

I also got the sauces not knowing they had a fee--$0.25 each. I don't regret getting them as they are delicious and had a great flavor to the empanadas. I highly recommend getting them! Cilantro, hot sauce, and chimmicurri!

The Alfajores was also delicious!

Thank you @empanola and @yelpnola!
name: Empanola

name: Star Wok

text:
The food here and the staff/owner are fantastic. I usually go to the location on Freret, but when I heard this location was opening I felt like I was being given a personal gift. The food is unbelievable. I would eat here everyday if I wasn't worried about death by empanada. The ingredients are so well utilised, all the flavours unique. I am a current vegetarian but I have tried ALL of the empanadas at some point. The impossible vegan, yellow curry, and spinach/artichoke are my favourites. The side salads and soups are always delicious and a perfect compliment to the food.

I was so confused to see the rating. The ingredients are marked; I have sensitive and allergies and the first review is a massive bummer. I ask about allergies and read the materials, so it seems unfair that this place has not received the due diligence and care they deserve. The owner is SO kind and always so pleasant, so, if in doubt about their food, processes or ingredients, talk to the owner instead of lambasting them.

I'm a passionate New Orleanian and lover of the cuisine and people make it happen - this place is always in my top five.
name: Empanola

text:
1.) Prices changes based on the owners mood 
2.) Misinformation and representation on the labeling
3.) Once you are identified as a tourist you will be price gouged
4.) Supplements are unsealed and the correct amount of capsules is NOT inside the bottle
5.) No instructional information is given with the supplements

Although the location is aesthetically pleasing do not be misled.  I wanted to buy a smoothie but flies kept landing on the fruit as the young ladies were cutting and processing the items to be placed inside of the blender so I decided against getting a smoothie and instead support this establishment by purchasing supplements. 
While reading the supplements I decided I wanted four different items - I motioned and ask the gentleman at the register who I later found out was the owner how much the supplements on the wall cost he then quoted me $35 per bottle which was perfectly fine. Once I chose the supplements that I wanted he then proceeded to tell me that two of the four supplements were 3x the price previously quoted - (the bottles are not priced) 
I was taken aback by this and asked if there are any packages or groups of supplements that he would recommend he said yes and proceeded to hand me a paper bag with three different cleanses inside he quoted me a price of $50 - I paid and left to come home with my bag upon opening each one of the purchased supplements I realized the bottles are half empty and open - completely unsealed which is alarming - I'm extremely disappointed considering I don't live in Louisiana and cannot easily return these bottles to the store. I feel lied to and I feel like he took advantage of me because I was not from New Orleans I would not recommend patronizing this place for supplements.
*Each 100 capsule bottle only has 30 pills in it
name: Botanicals Nola
categories: Health & Medical, Restaurants, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Acai Bowls, Salad, Vegan, Food, Herbal Shops

text:
Pretty good. The whole family seemed to enjoy the pizzas. 

I used the Slice app to find an open pizza restaurant. Given Hurricane Ida and the pandemic, it's been difficult to find open restaurants, in general, much less pizza places. I gave Crazy Italian a try based on the reviews and they did not disappoint. The taste of the back crust reminded me of Papa John's, but not as sweet. 

At 18", these pizzas are huge! I ordered pepperoni for the kids and a Hawaiian for me and my wife. I also ordered a side of fried mozzarella sticks. I added pepperoni, sausage and red peppers to the Hawaiian, but they forgot the pepperoni. The pizzas were lukewarm by the time they reached us, but they had a nice flavor. I popped a few slices in the air fryer the next day and they were cheesy and tasty. I will say the bottom crust is very soft. I wish the bottom crust was crispier or firmer to hold up to the toppings. The mozzarella sticks were crispy, cheesy and seasoned. I didn't care for the tomato dipping sauce, though, but they went well with a sauce I got from Bavette Grill in Plano, TX. 

I expect we'll be ordering again in the future. Maybe we'll eat there in person.
name: The Crazy Italian

text:
Ate here on a Tuesday and it was steak night. My husband got the veal parm, I had a steak and my daughter got fish and fries. Everything was excellent. Even the vegetable medley was so good!! I usually don't enjoy the veggies that come with a steak. But these  were so tasty!
We will definitely be back soon. It was slow
name: Augie's Restaurant

text:
Finally got the chance to try the new Magazine Street location of this awesome local two-store chain.  

For locals who are familiar with Natchitoches meat pies, empanadas are their Argentinian counterpart, and Empanola is the New Orleans version of that delicacy!  In addition to South American favorites like Peruvian Chicken, Argentinian Beef and Chorizo, you'll find local favorites like crawfish etouffee, gumbo, shrimp and cheese, etc.  Plenty of vegetarian options, too.  If you're into super sweet, try the bananas foster empanada with chocolate sauce drizzled over it, or a slice of pie from the dessert case.  Both times I've been in, they've had a very good tomato basil soup available, too. 

Bottom-line, you can keep it light with just an empanada, or go full meal with a couple empanadas, soup and dessert.  Very reasonable pricing for the quality, too!  

Clean store.  Super friendly staff.  Limited drink offerings, so if you need more than a water or green tea to wash down your empanada, you may want to grab a beverage elsewhere.
name: Empanola

text: Small, clean Chinese cafe with a few tables and a thriving takeout business. Very friendly and accommodating family greeting customers and providing cheerful service. Large variety of items on the menu at very reasonable prices. Excellent execution of traditional Chinese dishes such as Singapore noodles and Cashew Chicken. Spring rolls are light, crispy and delicious. Although they do not normally deliver, they kindly delivered to our reception for a memorial service. In the pandemic, we wanted to serve guests safely. The individually boxed meals were perfect and devoured with relish by all. If you are in the neighborhood, I highly recommend a visit to Star Wok.
name: Star Wok

text: As if...I cannot believe I found another new place doing NY pizza in two weeks.  Last week I find NOLA Pizza Co. and this week it's the Crazy Italian in Lakeview!  What is happening in New Orleans?  The crust, the sauce..it seriously reminded me of a dive pizza parlor in Wildwood, NJ.  They also had an authentic Caprese that I learned to love in Italy.
name: The Crazy Italian

text: Stopped in the Crazy Italian for the second time in one week. During my first visit I ordered a whole Supreme pizza, which was huge. The taste was awesome and just the right amount of toppings. During my second visit of the week, I ordered a slice of the White pizza and slice of the Supreme. The white pizza was very good and again had the right amount of toppings - cheese. The crust is perfect not too thin and not thick. The supreme slice was just as tasty as the first time I had it.  This is not your fast food food pizza, it is very fresh and tasty. The place is small but has ample seating. The folks working there are very warm, welcoming and friendly. Will definitely be going back soon. Great addition to the Lakeview area!
name: The Crazy Italian

text:
Great vegan/healthy eatery. They have everything from smoothies, smoothie bowls, coffee, sea moss, vegan cupcakes and much more. This place has great customer service and the perfect ambiance to enjoy your treats, indoor and outdoor seating. 

The staff is very helpful and friendly. I have tried all the smoothie bowls but my favorite one is Dat Fiya Pitaya (pitaya, banana, pineapple, almond milk, seas moss complete with whatever toppings I pick). 

This is a a great place and I love that it's black owned! Great location a NOLA must try. Also, love that they have a point reward system.
name: Botanicals Nola
categories: Health & Medical, Restaurants, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Acai Bowls, Salad, Vegan, Food, Herbal Shops

text:
The pizza was amazing. It reminded me of being in New York. Better than any other pizza in New Orleans hands down. The owners were 2 of the nicest people you'd ever meet. They were so sweet with my wife and I and our toddlers. Can't wait to go back! 

From the water to the flour to the sauce to the toppings to the oven it is cooked in ... this place knows detail and the importance of using high quality ingredients and the proper cooking technique to achieve the perfect pie. Anyone who says anything different doesn't know pizza or, should I say, good pizza.
name: The Crazy Italian

text:

text: What could be better than authentic South American homemade empanadas? How about the fusion of those with traditional New Orleans fare?! With options ranging from Beef Argentina to Crawfish Etouffee and Spinach Artichoke to Impossible Vegan, Empanola has something for everyone. And their empanadas are simply the best. I've travelled Central and South America and have tried empanadas all over the place and these are by far my favorite. The only thing they're doing is wrong is not being open Mondays and Tuesdays, because I'm addicted. But I have feeling that will soon change and we'll all be happier for it!
name: Empanola

text:
The employees here are very nice and extremely helpful. I had the shrimp and cheese, beef argentina, and gumbo. My sisters had the impossible, yellow curry, and crawfish etouffee. The flavors came through and were well balanced. The wrapper was light and just thick enough to hold all the deliciousness in without falling apart. They broke apart easily for sharing (or pictures in this case). We found them to be quite filling and well priced.

The shrimp and cheese was hands down my favorite since it was filled with cheese and shrimp. The gumbo and crawfish etouffee both had lots of flavor and you knew what dishes they were representing. The beef argentina came in last for me personally because the flavors weren't as strong as the others. The tiramisu was light and creamy, just as it should be. We also had the alfajores which were light, flaky, and not too sweet.

I would recommend coming here with a friend to share and try several different flavors.
name: Empanola

text:
12/4/2021
Recommend? Yes.

It's a cute little spot with some seating. Great selection of empanadas featuring local flavors. I got the two vegan flavors that they had; the yellow curry and the impossible. It's served with sauces, the two vegan ones are hot sauce and chimichurri. I liked the impossible better than the curry. The crust is a bit soft, not flaky. The impossible had a deep flavor, it may be too salty for some people. The yellow curry was actually really good and would go really well with a bowl of rice.

If I'm shopping in the area I would definitely stop for a little snack.

text:
I've been wanting to try this place for a minute and I'm glad I finally did. I came with my niece who also enjoys a good smoothie bowl. When we walked in it was very modern and there were live plants everywhere. While I'm like I was just admiring how great their plants look and getting some ideas for plant stands lol. 

The names for the items on the menu are cute. Very New Orleans. If you know you know. My niece and I both got "Dat Fiya Pitaya" bowl. She said she wanted a tropical vibe so she ordered hers with strawberries, blueberries, and kiwis. I got mine with strawberries, almond butter. And vegan chocolate chips. 

We were going to take it to go but it was a really nice day out and we spotted the order dining area. So we sat and enjoyed the New Orleans fall day. Our smoothie bowls were soooo good. They are also very filling. 

We'll be back!
name: Botanicals Nola
categories: Health & Medical, Restaurants, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Acai Bowls, Salad, Vegan, Food, Herbal Shops

text:
Very Good Pizza!
I'm reviewing the new location,  Broad and Bienville. (It doesn't exist yet on Yelp)
I would really rate it at 4.6 stars, but those comments are mostly about personal preferences. 
I'll start bottom up.
Crust - really good. Good flavor, texture, etc.  I might prefer it a little crispier, and maybe they would do it if I asked.
Sauce - it's a little sweet for me, but my wife loves it.
Toppings- this (IMHO) is where they could step it up a little.  To be fair, I don't like vegetables on my pizza. Maybe those are really good.  The meat toppings are good, but don't wow me.
Service - always great,  no complaints.
name: Napoli Pizza & Subs

text: Born and raised in nyc and basically grew up on pizza, ive been searching for a decent pizza place in new orleans for years. Ive been to the all cities so called ny style pizza joints but all were disappointments. That being said the crazy italian is a hidden gem for nyc style pizza, it truly hits the mark.
name: The Crazy Italian

text:
Empanola has two locations, and this one on Magazine just opened about 3 months ago. The little empanada shop is spacious with a casual vibe. The Christmas tree in the window is cute!  When you walk in, you can see all of the empanadas displayed in a glass box, and each one is baked fresh upon ordering. You always know you'll get a freshly baked treat. I also love that they have SO many flavors and about 5 vegetarian options. I think they have a few extras that are not listed online as well.

I tried 7 different flavors and they were all FANTASTIC!! Seriously delicious!! Each empanada is about the size of your palm with plenty of filling in every single one!  No skimping on the best parts (the filling, obviously) with these! I would say eating 3 or 4 is enough to fill you up for a meal, so the portion is fair! Especially for being located on a hoppin' popular street like Magazine, the empanadas and the desserts at Empanola are VERY reasonably priced! Not expensive for what you get at all!

I also bought a few extra sauces to try, but in all honestly, the empanadas are flavorful enough on their own, that you don't really need the sauces. However, that being said, the cilantro lime sauce and the chumichuri sauce (blend of oil, herbs, spices, and garlic) were really yummy. I put it on the "crusts" of my empanadas after I ate all the parts with filling in them!

I was able to pick out 3 to try complimentary with my Yelp Elite Perk, but I also purchased 4 extras to try. I had the:

*Crawfish Etouffee ($4.75) - Amazing, just what you would expect. Very "New-Orleans-y"
*Gumbo ($3.75) - I would prefer it to be a little runnier and zestier, but still really good! *Shrimp and cheese ($3.75) - Creamy and delicious
*Chicken Peruvian ($3.75) - Flavorful and perfect
*Mushroom and cheese ($3.75) - Fabulous, just what I wanted as a mushroom lover
*Yellow curry ($3.75) - This one was a little but bland, but still yummy! (Keep in mind, I have high standards for curry though, since I'm used to eating great curries due to my boyfriend being Nepali and an amazing cook!)
*"Impossible" empanada - Fantastic!! (This is the same as their Beef Argentina, but using the vegetarian "Impossible burger meat" instead.)

I also got to try their alfajores complimentary with the Yelp Perk. The alfajores is a traditional Argentinian cookie, but the ones at Empanola have a New Orleans praline twist. It was two cookies with a soft praline filling sandwiched in the middle with pecans surrounding it. The cookies are crumbly and light with the praline cream being rich and sweet. It was delicious!

Because I was feeling particularly hungry that day, I also purchased their torta tres leches dessert ($4). It was like a creamy parfait minus the fruit. Soft moist cake with cream and meringue on top! Plus, you get a good amount for the $4, so it's not overpriced at all. 

I will definitely be coming back soon! I LOVED this place!!
name: Empanola

text:
I am a connoisseur of ALL THINGS CRAWFISH... and while this CAJUNS is not my 1st choice, it does ok to come in 5th.

The crawfish were nicely flavored, not too spicy where you're sucking on ice after sucking each head & not too bland where you're reaching for the Tony Chachere's, #IJS.  

The corn, turkey-necks and pig feet are prepackaged, so to speak.  I guess to be more expeditious while filling orders, the staff has pre-bagged those items.  Not a bad Idea, I guess, but for me I like to have my pig feet, turkey necks and corn sitting in the juicy juices, yeahhhhhh baby!!!!!! 

This day in particular, this Cajun's restaurant's crawfish were about .50 cent cheaper that one of the others that I frequent & the line wasn't too long either.  As at other Cajun restaurants there's a line for cooked seafood & a line for the food that has to be prepared.

All in all this place was there for me in a time of crawfish-feining, I got my fix & i was good!!!!
name: Cajun Seafood

text: Random New Orleans thing where Cajun food is prepared by traditional Asian restaurants. This place is basically like a converted Mini Mart. You can have booked seafood, shrimp, turkey necks, corn, crawfish potatoes. Or you can have beef and broccoli, Kung Pao etc. People who are not from here will be confused by this place but the food is very good. Great quick stop. All the boiled food will be very spicy. FYI

text: You never know what you're going to get with this place. Sometimes the food is good. Sometimes they cook their pasta and other food with shrimp with the shell still on them so that they are hard and sticking to the shrimp. It should not be like that in pasta or in broccoli shrimp. It's gross and disgusting. Sometimes they are not lazy and the shrimp are actually peeled and clean before they put them in and the pasta is good. Go there for the egg rolls and boiled seafood. Nothing else. The location on Claiborne is amazing though!

text:
Delicious plant based comfort food on Maple Street!!
I've been so excited for this place to open and it didn't disappoint. We all had the generous-sized & hearty Fried chick'n sandwich, served on a luscious brioche roll. 

The house-made seitan chick'n patty is huge with a great feeling of crunch. The sandwich so tall you can hardly take a bit. Heavenly. We also had side of yucca fries $7 ( a MUST DO), French fries $4, and Mac &cheese $5. All fantastic. The Mac& cheese is creamy with a hint of turmeric. The side portion is low rent special big. Like what my kids would scoop into a cereal bowl. The yucca fries are crispy, starchy and a generous portion. My teenage vegan foodie loved loved loved this place. 

The daiquiris were the biggest surprise. We had a mojito and a pina colada. Oh.My.God!! Come for the drinks. $12 each for a big 20oz go cup. The mojito had loads of mint, and was not sweet at all. Fresh lime juice. So good. The pina colada tasted fresh and again not too sweet. 

Service was great- very attentive. The owner said they hope to expand the menu to include breakfast, desserts, and they may even get a smoker for the house made seitan. I can't wait to return!
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text:
We were told upon visiting San Antonio this is the place to go for seafood... Boy were they WRONG!!! To sum it up the mediocre food is way overpriced for the amount you are served by the ounce.  My husband told me it's depending on what you are comparing it too. Well that is true but I'm comparing it to majority of the seafood spots like this that I patronage. 
Overall, if you have about $30 bucks to waste go ahead, try it for yourself.  Warning: they CHARGE for EVERYTHING, nothing comes in the boil bag except what you order.  There's no complimentary small golf ball size potato, corn or chopped up bite size pieces of sausage, which is what I chose to add on and paid $4 in addition to.  I'm sorry but this was a waste of our money.  My husband ordered the fried combo basket and the fish and shrimp and it was good. I will not be returning to this place.
name: Cajun Seafood

text:
Visiting New Orleans and read the reviews on this place .... Decided to go as it was within walking distance of my hotel. 

This is NOT an eat-in place. More like a convenient store that sells some amazing food. They've got boiled shrimp that are larger than the law should allow, boiled crab and huge crab legs and the crawfish... EXCELLENT. It was perfectly seasoned to allow for the taste of the crawfish and some heat but not overdone where you are just eating super hot seasoning with a crawfish flavor to it. They also have hot, fried items: seafood platters, boudin balls, etc. 

It definitely lived up to the reviews. Great food.
name: Cajun Seafood

text: This was THE perfect place to show my friends what TRUE boiled seafood tastes like. This spot is no-frills-- you can't dine inside, and don't expect fancy decor either. But the food cancels all that out. They offer a wide selection of seafood and cajun food, crawfish, shrimp, crab, poboys,  etc, along with Chinese dishes. There's something for everybody here. Now the line and wait were pretty long because this place is popular, but it was well worth it. The boiled shrimp was to die for. Perfectly seasoned. We hauled our food down to the lake and enjoyed it there. a New Orleans STAPLE
name: Cajun Seafood

text: 3 stars for customer service. Pizza would get 2 stars. For some reason I never noticed this place tucked into the corner of a strip mall on Williams Blvd. I went in to grab a menu but they don't have printed menus because I was told prices vary often.  All you get to look at are the circular flyers to view pizza options. Not knowing how much something costs before ordering did not sit well with me. There are a few, maybe 4, tables inside. they have a beer cooler and there is an adjoining bar if you wish to carry in.  This must be a 100% delivery service because the place was empty at 7pm on a Friday. Order at the counter and they bring it to you with paper plates. It was eerily quiet.  First I must explain that this is a National Chain. It is the only location in Louisiana. There is a choice of dough, one made in-house which is supposed to be thinner. And one franchise dough. We ordered the in-house but it was still pretty puffy, sort of like Rotollo's. We ordered pepperoni, ground beef, Canadian bacon and mushrooms. The pepperoni was bland. The ground beef was very well done with dry crumbles sprinkled on top. The Canadian bacon and mushrooms were diced into TINY uniform cubes and sprinkled on top. I assume the toppings are frozen franchise products and wonder how the heck they cube the toppings so tiny and perfect? This gave the pizza an almost gritty texture. There wasn't much sauce to taste so I can't comment on it.  I never heard of Mr. Jim's pizza and really wanted to like the place since the new owners are a mom and pop operation and were really friendly and I wanted to support them. Sadly the pizza fell into the bottom 25% of my pizza experiences. And not knowing what it may cost is a big turn off. I hope they do well, but unfortunately I can't support the operation.
name: MrJims.Pizza - Kenner

text:
I kind of swear by Adams Street Grocery po boys, because you can get decent po boys for very cheap. But I had a friend in town and we were planning on getting po boys for dinner, and Adams Street isn't open for dinner, so I was thinking Parkway. But K told me to check out Cajun Seafood, especially if we are getting seafood po boys. I decided to listen to my wise boyfriend who is allergic to all shellfish and give this place a try. Lol.

My friend J and I walk in and even though it was really early for dinner on a Sunday the place was quite busy. Maybe everyone was trying to grab some food and go back to their houses and watch football.

There were two lines--boiled seafood and fresh seafood. I wasn't sure where I should line up for po boys, so I just lined up behind everybody for boiled seafood. I had to wait for a while but I got to the front of the line and said I wanted to order po boys and they told me I could have gone to the other line. Oh well. Next time.

I was skeptical and found myself comparing prices to Adams Street. But we were already there, so I went ahead and ordered a shrimp po boy. J got the fried catfish po boy, which he enjoyed very much. I too enjoyed my shrimp po boy immensely. I don't know if it was just a placebo effect because I was told that their seafood is good, but I felt like the shrimp was much more plump than in any other shrimp po boy I had recently.

I will definitely be back here for a shrimp po boy. And maybe I'll try some of their boiled seafood when my sister is in town.
name: Cajun Seafood

text:
I tried this place while staying in the New Orleans area. Our hotel wasn't near many restaurants except for some fast food chains and I wanted something slightly healthier (not fried).

Although- there are no tables here. It is best to call in your order for pickup, considering it gets packed in there while people are waiting in line for boiled seafood. It is clearly a pretty popular place for the locals in the community.

I ordered the grilled fish plate and was pleasantly surprised with the generous portion of fish and how fresh and well seasoned it was. I also enjoyed the corn on the cob, but my boyfriend and I were not too thrilled with the shrimp fried rice...it was lacking in flavor. 

Overall, this is definitely an authentic little seafood place and I was glad I stopped in.
name: Cajun Seafood

text: The absolute worst customer service I've experienced. My hotel on Airline Drive in Kenner, LA  had their delivery menu in our room. I called and ordered a medium pizza with green peppers, onion, and mushrooms on the whole thing, pepperoni on only one half. I also ordered the half garden salad. I should of known I was in trouble when the person on the phone asked for my phone number three times before getting it right. I inquired about a delivery charge and was told it only applied to orders under $15.00. I went ahead and placed the order and was told 20-30 mins. Well and hour and 15 mins later they finally showed up. I tipped the delivery boy and after he left we realized our order was completely wrong. One half had mushrooms, onion and olives and the other was plain. WHAT? My salad was nothing but iceberg lettace and one chunk of tomato. Plus they charged me $21.85 which included a delivery charge! . Well I called back to inquire why I was paying so much. I asked how much a 1.5 topping pizza and half salad was. I was told $15.65. I then asked why, since that's what I basically got , was I charged $21.85. The girl on the phone proceeded  to tell me that I actually got 4 toppings. When I explained that there were 3 toppings only on 1/2 of a pizza and there was no pepperoni she said that it didn't matter I still get charged for a whole pizza topping and since the computer said I ordered pepperoni I was obliged to pay for it even though I told her I never got it. At this point I'm completely flabbergasted. I told her she had to be freakin kidding me. You can't charge someone for something they didn't get not to mention my entire order was wrong, 45 mins late and cold. Really? At this point I asked to speak to the manager and guess what? She IS the manager. I told her the service was atrocious and I would be contacting the BBB. They owe me like $5.00 at the least. I would never ever recommend them to anyone....ever!
name: MrJims.Pizza - Kenner

text: We've been twice for dinner since they've opened.  Had the burger and the tuna sandwich and split an order of fries on the first visit and wife had the white Russian daiquiri.  All the food was very good and my wife really raved about the daiquiri.  On our second visit, we were looking forward to trying the chicken sandwich, but was told once there that they were out of chicken, so ended up with burger and tuna sand again as menu was pretty limited.   Both still good but was disappointed about being out of chicken.  Also, their set up was a bit different each time.  First time walking up to counter to order and next time being told that order would be taken at table.  We will visit again as it is a good comfort food vegan place, but looks like still has a few kinks to work out.
name: Kindred

text:
Their specialty pizzas are da bomb!!! I tried their Sticky Fingers pizza and it was loaded with toppings. It came with pepperoni, beef, ham, sausage, mushrooms, onions, and green peppers. Delicious!

I also really enjoyed the Nacho Stix. Gooey goodness in the form of stuffed crust packed with chicken, jalapenos, and cheese.

This Mr. Jim's has been here for decades so they must be doing something right. I love the service and the pizza is yummy!

text: I love coming home back to the city because I always go to Cajuns to get some crawfish and a hot sausage poboy! Nothing compares. I was so sad to leave because I knew I wasn't going to be able to find food like this in Dallas. The first time I came was on Saturday around lunch time. And we got 6 pounds of crawfish with 2 big shots. Then later on that day we got 2 more pounds of crawfish lol. Yeah, we had been craving some good crawfish so we had to double back. And finally, right before we left to come back to Dallas we got hot sausage poboys, 2 more big shots, and a box of mama noodles. Yes, you can say it was a pretty good experience. I'm just counting the days I can come back home and get some again.
name: Cajun Seafood

text:
let me start off saying this is the best cajun seafood i had while visiting Louisiana.

My best friend, boyfriend and I visited from California. I really wanted some cajun food, so we decided to try cajun seafood. Out of the whole week there, that meal was the best meal I had and honestly still crave for it. 

The place was a togo place with no dine-ins. It is a grab and go, however fried food does take a while to order. Now onto the food:

- crawfish- their dry seasoning is so good.... I will always choose it over boiling crab in 
california any day
-turkey necks- this was my first time trying this, and omg they were so good!!! I didnt know it was going to be huge so i got 4 pieces.... i couldnt even finish 1 turkey neck by myself... but it was soo moist and tender that the meat fell off the skin.
-fried shrimp and oysters- my best friend loves this...
-fried rice- The rice was just ordinary fried rice that my mom makes
-fried chicken wings- basic chicken wings. Probably could leave without it

It was so much food... everything totaled to be only 60-70. It was amazing. I would definitely come back!!!! Im salivating thinking of their food.. We definitely cant find that kind of food here with that kind of price.
name: Cajun Seafood

text: The sign out front claimed "made to order lemon/limeade", yet I was delightfully surprised when the bartender started hand squeezing fresh limes for my individual drink, rather than using batched lime juice. Love it!  Could taste the difference the fresh lime juice makes. Also real strawberry pieces. Refreshing and light. Perfect balance of tart and sweet. I will definitely be back for more.
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text: This place not only has a great atmosphere but an astonishing menu. I have not been disappointed one bit. Every bite is magical. One of my favorite spots in NOLA by far. I am a carnivore but this place makes me want to be vegan. The classic burger and spicy chicken sandwich are to die for, along with the hash browns and cauliflower mac n cheese. The food is hearty and makes you full but does not feel heavy in your stomach. 11/10. Wonderful!
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text:
UPDATE 5/2019: Much better as of late.  Shrimp po-boy usually stuffed with large well seasoned shrimp, Great prices. And they usually answer the phone for call in orders, and have it ready in about ten minutes.

Review of Apr '18: last couple of times not so good. Dry, overcooked, and not well seasoned shrimp. Tried calling in an order Good Friday, phone just rang. Must've had it off the hook.

Unfortunately if you get a hankering for a seafood po-boy after 8:30 pm you're out of luck. They close the kitchen early.
name: Cajun Seafood

text:
yum AF!!

i got the mac and cheese plate with creole greens, BBQ cauliflower wings and cornbread. was that three cheese AND paprika on the mac and cheese!? my partner got the build your own plate with lemon-pepper cauli-wings, mac and cheese, fries and cornbread. we also got the vegan fish tacos (oyster mushrooms, seaweed, romaine, vegan cheese and tomatoes). the customer service was warm and welcoming and they were consistently busy from when we placed the order until we picked up. would post pictures but we inhaled the food and then fell asleep. :)

i really like their "about us" statement on their website, that they are family owned and putting a great twist on new orleans soul food!

text:
This was the BEST bowl of anything I've had, period. The Nourishment Bowl and a chocolate chip walnut cookie saved me on a hectic work day in Treme.  I stumbled upon I-tal when caught between appointments and in need of fuel.  I was short on time so I popped in and ordered to go at the counter.  There was a pretty decent lag in greeting/order taking but I'm giving them a break cause once I did get someone to take my order, he was funny and friendly.  The food only took about 10-12 minutes and that gave me time to pop over to the plant store next door and buy some greenery.  
Overall, the food was AMAZING and I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.  The Nourishment bowl included a roasted veggies, glazed sweet potatoes, coconut curried chickpeas, avocado and salad. I will struggle to try something different as it haunts my dreams. The desserts all look incredible and I chose a cookie which was huge!  But that cake though... The prices are super reasonable considering with the quality of the food, and well worth it for your mind, body and soul!
name: I-tal Garden

text: What a treat!  Kindred fills a special niche in the New Orleans vegan scene.  It's so nice to go out for a fried chicken sandwich and mac n' cheese and a big ol' daiquiri. Vegan food tends to be health-centric and while I appreciate that a lot of time, sometimes it's nice to be able to indulge your hangover with something a little dirty.  Their daiquiris are also to die for!  Certainly not the same price point as the regular ones, but worth it.  Best daiquiri I've had, hands down.  Love Kindred, can't wait to go back!
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text:
Really cool plant-based restaurant with great customer service. 

I ordered a veggie burger with fries and "mac and cheese". The burger was cooked nicely, but there was too much mayo. I had to scrap mayo with the napkin which was super messy. The fries were nice, and although the mac and cheese did not taste like traditional mac and cheese, it was so good. I would go out my way to get this mac and cheese. 
For my hubby, I took him and "chik'n sandwich", and he loved it. He went on and on about the taste. Like me, he enjoyed the mac and cheese, but agreed that it didn't taste like the real thing. 
For dessert, I got the lemon cupcake to go. It was so sweet and lemony. 
My family and I will definitely return especially since we are vegetarian. The only problem was trying to figure out what to eat because there were so many options.
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text:
Visiting New Orleans and read the reviews on this place .... Decided to go as it was within walking distance from my Airbnb. 

This is NOT an eat-in place. More like a convenient store that sells some amazing food. They've got boiled shrimp that are larger than the law should allow, boiled crab and huge crab legs and the crawfish... EXCELLENT. It was perfectly seasoned to allow for the taste of the crawfish and some heat but not overdone where you are just eating super hot seasoning with a crawfish flavor to it. They also have hot, fried items: seafood platters, boudin balls, etc.

If you're an fan of seafood, you cant go wrong with this place. More of a stop n go joint. But you cant go wrong neither.
name: Cajun Seafood

text: Kindred is quickly becoming a favourite local vegan spot for me. The food is delicious and the staff are impeccably attentive. Susan is amazing!  The Veggie Burger is on point! I added cheese to mine and was blown away! Do yourself some justice and order the Yucca Fries!  Crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Ridiculously AMAZING! The Brussels Sprouts will have you're eyes rolling into the back of your head as your tastebuds overload from magical deliciousness! Yes, they are that good!
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text: This is my new favorite restaurant. I don't usually get super excited about food, but I was absolutely floored at how amazing their food is. I've been trying to go vegetarian or at least a flexitarian for a long time but usually give in to a chicken sandwich. I was really craving chicken today so I got the fried "chicken" sandwich with fried seitan. It honestly might be the best sandwich I've ever had, real chicken included. I would've taken pictures but I forgot to because I ate it all too quickly! I also got the fried brussels sprouts, lavender lemon soda (true lavender taste and not sugary sweet which I love), and a fresh strawberry muffin. Everything exceeded my expectations and went above and beyond. I'll be a repeat customer for sure. Thank you!!!
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text: I am not a burger person so was reluctant to come here but enjoyed it!  The chicken sandwich was fried perfectly and tasted great. The Three B's sauce was a tangy, spicy, mayo based sauce and really added to the sandwich. I also opted to add fried jalapeÃ±os which spiced it up a bit!  After the meal I decided to order the Cinnamon Toast Crunch shake which is the special shake of the month. I was a little disappointed with the shake because it was very bland and needed a little extra something to kick it up. A little pricey for what you get, but all in all was a pretty good meal.
name: Three B's Burger & Wine Bar

text:
My husband wanted to try this place. I was a bit reluctant since I don't eat burgers. I obliged him though, and I was not disappointed! 

The decor is kind of a mash up of fancy and cafe. It really works for this place. You can feel comfortable coming here for a nice date or a quick bite. 

The smoked wings were on point. They were bursting with flavor and not overly fatty. I got the guacamole app, delicious!  The guac comes with fried wontons. The wontons alone were delectable! 

They have a really fun cocktails and also had some seasonal cocktails. They were delicious. 

I'd say we'll definitely return!
name: Three B's Burger & Wine Bar

text: Stopped in for a quick dinner.  Should have known by the parking lot on a Saturday night to turn around and go.  Never write reviews but I am a little upset about this experience.  Food was meh.  Wouldn't go back.  What I am upset about is I ordered a pretzel for an app, asked for a side of cheese rather than the mustard it comes with.  Waitress says ok and brings it.  Next I order a salad without the dressing it comes with and asked for some hot sauce.  Waitress bring meals, apparently hot sauce was on another's plate.  Still whatever.  My issue is when the check arrived she charged us $5 for the cheese (which had she told us I would have used the mustard) and $0.50 for hot sauce! I am not hard up for money and this isn't breaking my bank.  The point is why are you charging for things that should be complimentary?! Surprised we were allowed to use the ketchup without charge.  And I ate only a tiny bit of the salad as it was overpowered by cheese and bacon.  Again usually I would just say eh the food sucks not going back buttttttt the fact you are charging for hot sauce has really got me friggen mad.  Will never give my money to them again.  Wish we went to five guys.  At least I would have left satisfied.
name: Three B's Burger & Wine Bar

text: Alright let me start by saying this meal had so much more potential. I gave it a fourth star because the rice, beans, salsas and tres leches cake were some of the best I've ever had and I've been all over southern America and lived on the boarder for 20 years. But the skirt steak which is my favorite cut of meat to cook with as a chef was so disgusting I fed it to my dog!! Literally Azule ate the meat. The beef enchiladas with the Texas gravy which is traditionally dark and rich but in this case it was flat out burnt. Charred beyond recognition. The skirt tasted like it had been cooked frozen thawed out then served again. As a PRofessional chef im so sad because this cut of meat is very forgiving but today? It was dog food. The charro beans? Delicious and seasoned well. The rice was fluffy and cooked perfectly. I smothered it with salsa and it was award winning. The tres leches cake was creamy, cold, sweet and a touch of heaven. The chips were hot and fresh surprisingly having it delivered from doordash. The queso sauce? Forget about it. It was not memorable. Canned or trio bag sauce. Do not order this. Get the chips and guacamole. I called and asked that they make sure and send salsa with order and the guy was rude saying "we have to charge for that, I can't add on to your order". Dude, I got money! I don't need free salsa I just need a normal amount to be sent with my order. I expressed that the previous time I got none. If I as a chef heard that I would have made sure the customer had double triple salsa. Shut up dude! Anyhow, normally this would have been a 2 star review but the rice and beans n salsa that  did get were award winning! Hands down some of the best I've ever had! Somebody fix the skirt steak issue, make sure they don't burn the Texas gravy and for the love of god retrain that guy.
name: La Patrona

text: This place is very good. And you get a good value for your money. Personally I didn't enjoy a lot of the sides, when I did the build your own plate, but when I came back for a burger, that burger was out of this world. Chef Ra dresses them up so well and there are so many different flavors coming at you, which is what I love in a burger. I came another time for the Ra Pasta and that was a solid dish as well. Very unique. cauli wings were alright, but my absolute favorite thing I have had here was the nachos. This man dressed up the nachos so well, you get a huge portion for your money, and the cheese sauce in it tastes so reminiscent of cheese sauce and nachos I had as a child, so nostalgic and amazing, but is all vegan which is the best part! Location is pretty nice. It's a cute indoor setting and it's pretty easy to find parking in the area. One thing I will complain about is I would like to know what the vegan meats are made from. For example I got the vegan chikn on my build your own plate, expecting it to be homemade vegan chikn or seitan but instead it was fried mushroom, which it was still good, but I was hoping it would have some protein. If I knew it was just fried mushroom I would have gotten a different vegan meat. Anyway food is great and I hope to come back for the nachos or a burger! Sorry my photos aren't the best quality but I hope they help
name: I-tal Garden

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': None, u'hipster': None, u'casual': None, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': None, u'romantic': None, u'classy': None, u'upscale': None}

text:
This new Chinese spot is everything I have been waiting for here in New Orleans, where 5 Happiness and PF Changs are way too played out. Yuyan Kitchen features authentic Chinese cuisine rather than typical General Tso's and beef and broccoli. 

All of the food is insanely delicious and comes out quickly. Service was attentive and very kind. We ordered all of the handmade appetizers of bao, 2 kinds of dumplings, and egg rolls, all fantastic. The flavors remind me of the best Chinese food I have had in San Francisco (never been to China). The shrimp fried noodles beat any lo mein I have ever had. The beef soup noodles were also excellent, the beef was tender and delicious. Also, I have no idea how so much flavor can stick to the noodles here.

We will definitely back to this great new local find. Highly, highly recommend! (Excuse the half-portions in the pictures, we couldn't wait to dive in!)
name: YuYan Kitchen

text: The food is over priced and not that good it's regular , the customer service is horrible ... you want to support your own but that's ridiculous.... The food was cold coming off the steam table the seafood pasta was soggy and the potato salad was dry ... the prices of the food was way over the top for fast food .. the prices are restaurant prices first and last time !!!! I'm speaking of the location in New Orleans East !!!

text: Where do I start.  This place was recommended as having the best crab cakes.  They do. The red velvet cake - awesome.   Other than those items, the food sucks.  I ordered catfish -  it was Swai.   I don't know why restaurants think we don't know the difference between the two.  There were four of us and only one enjoyed her meal.  She had the shrimp and broccoli salad.  I asked to speak to the manager, server said twice she was on her way.   Waited 10 more minutes- no show.  Would not recommend unless you get the crab cake.  Which is probably why it's Peewee's Crab Cakes.
name: Peewee's Crab Cakes

text: Three B's was just right! The new location is convenient, the service was great, and the food was so delicious.  My wife got the City Park with fries and she loved it. I ordered The Duke with tots and it did not disappoint! The crunchy fried jalapeÃ±os, melted cheese, and the juicy burger was perfect.

text: Gave this place a try for someplace different. (Anyone else end up at the same places over and over again?) Nice atmosphere and wait staff, but the food wasn't overall impressive. The waffle sweet potato fries were delicious and their 3 B's sauce was tangy and worth a try. I would give them another chance for a different experience. text: What a wonderful comfort food vegan place! I got the spicy chicken sandwich, and as I'm not a vegan, it was surprising how much it truly tasted like chicken! At times the seiten was a bit too chewy, but at others, the sandwich was wonderfully textured. Was definitely comparable to the Popeyes chicken sandwich. The fries were nicely seasoned with tony's seasoning. My friend got the spicy chicken tenders, and she enjoyed them as well. They were seiten, paired with a nice agave mustard. The only qualm I would have is that the seiten was a bit greasy. Overall, enjoyed this place for a late lunch, and would come back to try their lemon coconut cupcake!
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text: Three B's NEVER disappoints! I have been to the Lakeview location at least 10 times, and the Metairie location was even better. Although I live in Lakeview, I would likely come to the Metairie location before Lakeview in the future. Great experience. 12/10 would recommend!

text:
The only reason I'm giving two stars is because the server was amazing, and the restaurant is clean as well.

My friend and I have been wanting to try this place since they opened a year ago, but ya know, life and stuff happens, so we just now got to it. 

We tried the Mac and Cheese, which to me was awful, and had a mustardy taste. She ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and fries, the only good thing about it was the bun. Very chewy, not appetizing . The fries were ok. 

I ordered a meatball sandwich, which wasn't that hot, and the cheese was not melted on it like I thought it would be. The meatballs were tasty though. 

Overall a huge disappointment, but we may return to try other items, who knows.
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text: Like most people say when they give one star, if I could give 0 I would. What is the purpose of having a restaurant with crab cakes in the name of you aren't going to put the crab cakes in the plates ordered?  When calling to request the crab cakes 1) they continued to answer and hang up the phone. 2) when they finally answered they proceeded to say that crab cakes did not come on the plate and then says oh yes it does. The website says entrees come with crab cakes and they confirmed when we placed the order. The woman on the phone then wants someone to come back with all the plates. I would love to know what they needed the plates for. To try to locate the missing crab cake? Or maybe they would find remnants of crab cakes and prove we are lying that they did not put them on the plates. Or maybe they needed to remake the entire plates instead of just adding the crab cakes because by the time someone went back and forth the food would be cold. Either way....We Will never go again. The food is too expensive to leave things off of the plate and the staff apparently aren't clear what belongs on their plates. As far as the food we got, the fish was ok, pass on the seafood rice and the potato salad. Looked forward to dinner all day. Very disappointed.
name: Peewee's Crab Cakes

text:
First time trying their seafood in years! Keep in mind I'm a local, and in New Orleans, we grew up eating crawfish for breakfast! This place's seafood, particularly their pig feet and turkey neck were undercooked and lacked flavor! The crawfish were hella spicy but lacked flavor! Only a true Orleanian would understand my point! The corn and potatoe lacked flavor! The corn was still crisp yet super spicy and the potatoe top portion-only spicy! Very disappointed! Thank goodness I did not spend too much here!  It's sad what these folks are preparing for the New Orleans east area knowing people will go there for convenience, or limited of  where they are able to travel to for good seafood!
Then they had the nerve to be very pricey! $1.99 for an undercooked neck! Goh!
name: Cajun Seafood

text:
I was a little hesitant to check this place out since it only had 1 review thus far, but glad we didn't let that deter us. We had been somewhere else and the menu only had 1 option that even looked good, so it was great when we got here and I immediately saw 4-5 things I was excited about. 

We landed on the tuna and avocado roll, spicy kimchi udon, and teriyaki hot plate. I really appreciate that the roll was only $7.50 and the slices were not so large I felt like I needed to cut them, which isn't really possible with chop sticks. My udon was good although not spicy at all. The bf liked the teriyaki plate but just be aware that the meat is not cooked in the sauce so it may not be as strong of a flavor. 

All-in-all we will definitely come back to try some Ramen and a few other things!
name: Hangout Ramen

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': None, u'hipster': None, u'casual': None, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': None, u'romantic': None, u'classy': None, u'upscale': None}

text:
I dined here for lunch one day. The young man at the front of the house was very friendly. The owner came out to greet me and chat about the restaurant. I told her how much I loved the space, it was so open and asked about the tables with the grill on top. She mentioned it used to be Korea House where they would cook on the table. The owner is from China and wanted to bring authentic food here and I was pleased. Each dumpling is hand made. The menu had fried and steamed handmade dumplings. I wish there was a sample option to try multiples because you get a set of 6 for $12 or something like that. I wanted to try so much more. I thought I would like the fried more than the seamed, but I really enjoyed the steamed dumblings. I also had some friend noodles, which was ok, there was too many veggies in it for my liking. 

Overall, I think this is a really great option in Fat City and for the area in general.
name: YuYan Kitchen

Walked in and the smell grabbed me and held my heart. The inside is immaculate! Very clean restaurant. The food was delicious. My 6year old picky son ate his Krispy tenders (mushrooms) and was licking his fingers. I had the Jackfruit and skrimps, Mac and cheese, coconut curry black eyed peas, sweet potatoes. Everything was delicious. Even my fiance , who doesn't like to try new foods was impressed. We stuffed ourselves and still tried the pumpkin spice cookies.  Very satisfied and we will be back VERY VERY SOON!!!!

text:
This was a really yummy meal! ordered pick-up for dinner, and it was ready quite quickly. Called in to order and paid when I got to the restaurant. Our food selections were great!

**By far the best white cheese dip I've ever had, definitely get it! Homemade chips too! 

Meal: Texas Nachos with the refried beans on the side and Green Chicken Enchiladas. The Texas nachos with steak were delicious and also came with jalapeÃ±os, a nice surprise since it's not mentioned on the menu. Good meat/chip portions, though I will note the refried beans were verrrryy salty, and I'm glad we got them on the side. green enchiladas were yummy and had plenty of flavor! The beans that came with that meal were like pinto beans in a broth, and tasty. 

Will definitely return here when I crave queso again. Those enchiladas will definitely be calling my name again soon too!
name: La Patrona

I really loved the fried shrimp; I've had vegan shrimp prepared just about every way but I've never had it like this, full of flavor and spices. I have a list of staple restaurants every time I visit the NO and this one just got added.

Extremely good food was here there is a very nice variety of dishes the crabcakes were tasty the stuff seafood potato was amazing they even gave complementary crawfish seasoned very well to be honest with you guys for a black owned and managed  Establishment they are doing an amazing job the fool will definitely not disappoint you

text: I was so disappointed. My wait was 30 minutes which would have been ok if I was satisfied with my order. I ordered the seafood baked potato and a catfish poboy. The baked potato was hard, crab cake burnt, and the sauce was just meh. The catfish poboy was bland. I'm not sure how you can mess up catfish. I won't be visiting again. All I can say is try it for yourself.  You be the judge. People were in and out. Maybe try a different location.
name: Peewee's Crab Cakes

text: Excellent, home-made style food. Absolutely loved the camrones a la diabla. Authentic food. Family-owned. Only 1 outdoor table. When safe to do so, will return.

text:
We have eaten here before when it was still Andy's and we are now trying Three B's. The food is amazing. 

Acoustic ceilings and all noise absorbing features have been removed. It's entirely too loud in here. I'm leaving with a headache and God help you when someone drops a utensil on the floor. The sound is reverberating through my head. I'm miserable. 
We did a decibel reading and it came in at 80 after the noise level went down a little. 

Recommend takeout only unless you enjoy screaming at your table

text:
It's hard to review this place as the experience was very underwhelming! While the folks were friendly, they had their masks under their chins the entire time and two others were wandering about with no masks and putting hats on customers head and taking pictures. 
The portions were small for the prices they charged, and we want to support everything vegan, but this place really has to get their act together to charge the prices they charge, and improve their quality of food! The pasta had so much salt in it, it was inedible! Terribly saddened! Maybe we just caught them on an off day, but I think I'll try another place for now.
name: I-tal Garden

text:
EVERYTHING was amazing. The owner/chef makes everything herself and you can tell it's all made with love. 

Chips and Salsa are included with the meal (she makes some of the best salsa I've ever had). My party all had the 5 tacos for $10 and they were absolutely incredible. The carnitas were everyone's favorite!! They came with a salsa verde that was really spicy but so good that even though our mouths were burning we kept dipping the tacos in it. 

The place only opened up 4 months ago. If you're looking to support a local/family owned business, definitely give this place a try!!!
name: La Patrona

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': None, u'casual': True, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': True, u'romantic': False, u'classy': None, u'upscale': False}

text:
Wasn't bad! But had a few kinks - read below!
----------------------------------------
For this visit, I went with my mom.  We ordered the crab cake deviled eggs to share.  They were delicious! The crab cake on top was a really nice touch. I grabbed the stuffed shrimp special with a side of broccoli and Who Dat alfredo.  It had good flavor, but salty. My mom got the lobster pan with the cajun sauce... it was GROSS AND SALTY!!  Too salty!  In fact, my mom couldn't even eat it. She tried to add lemon, but it was way too salty. 


Atmosphere = 4/5. Parking is super tight!  But the place was fully staffed and it was clean inside. Definitely gives the vibes of being in New Orleans and supporting a Black Owned Business.

Food = 3/5. Very salty!  The seafood pan with the "cajun butter" sauce was wayyyy too salty.  That is not a butter sauce.  It's thick and yellow and tastes like a mustard sauce.  It's gross! 

Staff = 3/5. Â She was nice and provided suggestions on the menu. However, once we complained about the saltiness of the food, the waiter just stared at us... She didn't offer a discount or to take the food off the ticket. A discount would have been nice.

Would I recommend? EH!  Just avoid that damn cajun sauce.  It's really gross. If you think I'm over exaggerating, check out the photos on this restaurants' Yelp page.  None of the seafood photos have the sauce on it. 

I think the highlight of the visit was the crab cakes and being in the presence of a successful Black owned establishment.
name: Peewee's Crab Cakes

text: The roasted chicken salad was fresh and delicious. It was definitely enough for two meals. It was a nice quick lunch with my family.

Seriously, you will be blown away by everything at Kindred!!! My non vegan bf (he's working on it ) loves everything there and always asks to go back as often as possible. text:
This place is SPECIAL! I am a south Louisianan and this place hits the mark! DO NOT be distracted by the outward appearances of the area this place has the perfect ambiance tucked away inside. 

Now to the meat of this review lol! This is a vegan restaurant but the southern twist of the food makes it enjoyable for non-vegan foodies. My favorite dish amongst the many we ordered was the RA-cho supreme. The flavors of the fresh ingredients and the hot cashew cream ex-cheese were EVERYTHING. The next great thing that I enjoyed was the fried eggplant poboy. There is a medley of flavors between the roasted peppers to the aioli that compliment the eggplant so well. The fries were a bit over cooked but I don't think anyone comes here for fries. 

My family (of 6) tried many other dishes and there wasn't a complaint from anyone even the kids. This place gets 5 stars not only for the food but the customer service was spectacular.
name: I-tal Garden
