text:
This is one of the few all vegan restaurants in New Orleans and I definitely had to try it. Came by on a Saturday evening and it was pretty empty. There were 3 girls chilling at the bar. My sisters and I were promptly greeted and seated. We ordered the fried chicken sandwich, the spicy fried chicken sandwich, brussel sprouts, mac'n cheese, fries, carrot cake, and cheesecake. I tried everything except the regular fried chicken sandwich.
-spicy chicken sandwich was really good the first couple of bites. Perhaps because I was hungry? It has that beautiful crunch that I love so much. But that really stops there. Because the patty itself on the inside is a bit chewy/bouncy and maybe that's the texture of the seitan and I'm not familiar with it? I also noticed that it lack the spicy in a spicy chicken sandwich.
-brussel sprouts were really good. Everyone loved it. It was fried well, light, crunchy, and not oily when you bite in to it. We loved it so much we got another order.
-mac'n cheese was good, but just be mindful that you won't get that usual mac'n cheese flavor and it's more nutty.
-fries were just plain old fries
-carrot cake was moist and dense which is always good in my book. My little sister loved it so that's a plus.
-cheesecake tastes just like a real cheesecake to me and it was so good.

They won't always have the cakes since the cakes are made by local vegans and dropped off so it changes all the time.

Overall I would say give this vegan chicken sandwich a try if you're ok with the chewy texture of the seitan, but that batter is really life though. Maybe they could try frying portobello mushrooms in that batter?
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text: We made about 15 mins before closing on a Sunday evening and I am SO grateful we hustled to get there. The food was really flavorful and made fresh (though I will note that it took us more than 30 minutes to receive our fairly straightforward order of proteins and sides). They were sadly out of a lot of main items (like the mac) by that point -- but we really enjoyed the crab cakes, fried oyster mushrooms, and the creole greens. Black eyed pea curry was just okay, as was the jambalaya - wouldn't order those again. I also thought the price point was a little steep for the amount of food (and this is coming from someone who lives in DC where food is not cheap!) and I was disappointed by the wait time. That said, I would absolutely return to try other menu items (their specials look particularly excellent) - but will order ahead next time.
name: I-tal Garden

text:
We swung through to grab some food to go to bring over to a friend's house for snacks, and PeeWee's came through on all fronts. We called ahead and our order was ready in about 20 minutes. We got a lump crab salad, which was perfect - actually a huge salad! The crab was a solid amount, as well. 

We got two lump crab cakes, which surprised me in terms of how big they are. I grew up in the Chesapeake Bay area (Maryland and Virginia) and the crab cakes in that region are much smaller and condensed, where PeeWee's are HUGE and a bit thinner. I cannot complain about these crab cakes at ALL, they were big and really unique. They have sort of a sweet chili sauce that comes with them, as well, which I really liked. 

We grabbed a Pontchartrain fried soft shell crab, too, which was cooked perfectly. My only lament is that I didn't order two of them - they're fantastic. 

The only drawback to this place is how insanely busy it gets, and trying to park. Parking is a full contact sport here - be warned.
name: Peewee's Crab Cakes

text:
I saw a Facebook ad for this place. I was unaware of it (last I knew it was a hot dog joint!). Anyway, decided to check it out. 
For parking, this area is a problem. It's got a spot or two in front, but with Cooters there, it's street and "where ever you can" sitch'.
Small place with seating for maybe 20? 
THE FOOD: A lot of the menu looks good, and they do have Taco Tuesday everyday,  5 for $10. 
I got 2 lengua tacos and TampiqueÃ±o, which is 2 cheese enchiladas, flank steak, rice and charro beans. 
The lengua tacos were good, and had some kind of thin gravy on them. First time I had gravy on lengua tacos. But it tasted good. Cilantro and onion. 
They had a very tasty salsa (green) that had a little heat and good flavor. 
The charro beans were good and had good flavor also. 
The cheese enchiladas were a "miss" for me. Kind of bland, tasteless. 
The skirt steak was really good. Had a nice char on it, seasoned well and very tender. The rice is not typical spanish rice. It's really good though.
name: La Patrona

text:
This is always easily a 5 out of 5 stars for me. However, this last visit really showed the spirit of this establishment. I came in on a Sunday 20 minutes before closing. The ladies at the register took my order as if they had all the time in the world! I ordered for 6 people plus an appetizer of the crab cake deviled eggs. 

The loaded potatoes were on point. My Seafood stuffed fish was amazing. We didn't receive our food until 10 minutes after closing with a smile and thank you. 

I had just came from Mississippi and was looking forward to this meal. PeeWee's did not disappoint!

The atmosphere is always welcoming and lively. The food never needs additional seasoning. Even if I eat somewhere else next time I'm in New Orleans I will still get some PeeWee's togo. 

Thank you PeeWee's 

Love, 
@bossmom.koriwins
name: Peewee's Crab Cakes

text:
I'm not always one for Ramen, but as the weather has finally felt a bit more like fall,it seemed like time to finally try this place out. I made the mistake of not checking the listing before heading inside,I just saw the open sign in the window.  Turns out, I showed up just as they were closing for their lunch time.  Thankfully, the server was so sweet,she said if we could order, she'd catch the kitchen before they closed down for their afternoon break. We made quick work of a simple late lunch, and it was absolutely delicious!

It was one of those hangover feeling type of days, so nothing crazy was required, but they have all kinds of ramen, sushi, teriyaki, fried rice.... All the yumminess!  It came out hot and fast,and was absolutely perfect for the easy lunch we were hoping for. Huge fan of the ramen and the fried rice, and I can't wait to go back and try out more of the menu.  And, I promise,I won't go at closing as I'm now that's a huge pet peeve and I don't ever want to be "that guy"!
name: Hangout Ramen

text: I have attempted to eat here multiple times and they often stop you at the door and say 'we're not taking anymore orders, you have to go to the uptown location'. text:

The Psychedelic Burger is phenomenal. We love Swiss mushroom burgers and this juicy bad boy does not disappoint. The tater tots are crispy and perfect. 
The decor is light and airy and it is equipped with TVs on every wall for news and sports fans.

Great lunch stop or fun group hangout for dinner.

text: Brought the family here after stalking them on Instagram, couldn't wait to try their food and they did NOT disappoint. The host told us it'd be a 40 min wait but about 10-15 min later, we got the text that our table was ready. Our waitress was very sweet, answered all our questions, gave great suggestions & handled our one issue swiftly & efficiently. My children shared fried shrimp & mac n cheese, they devoured the shrimp but not so much the mac. Us adults shared Hennessy bbq wings which could've been crispier but that sauce was so good that we kept it ok! And seafood pontchartrain fries, they liked them but I didn't. The crab cake deviled eggs were some of the best deviled eggs I've ever had in my life, even my husband thought were good & he hates deviled eggs. It was my first time trying Rockefeller oysters but man they were amazing. Parrain got the surf & turf, had a lil hiccup with the steak but they fixed it & the final product was beautiful, a nice char & sweetness to it. Husband got the stuffed baked catfish with who dat alfredo (the alfredo was the worst thing we had) & a stuffed seafood potato for me, I liked his fish more than mine but both dishes were soooo flavorful & filling. I'll definitely be back!!!
name: Peewee's Crab Cakes

text:
Great Vegan place.

I highly recommend the Buffalo Cauliflower Po-boy and the Spicy Fried Chicken (Seurat) Sandwich. A good friend of mine also hosted his wedding reception here and it was great! Also try the brunch. French Toast, Hash Browns, Brussel Sprouts, and Scrambled "eggs".
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text:
Located next to Drago's where Korea House used to be. I saw their flyers at the local Asian market for weeks but decided to wait a while before trying it to give them enough time to work out any kinks. Every time I drove by, they seemed slow. Decided to order takeout one night and there were no diners in sight. The owner seemed nice and made a comment stating that my order was the first order all day. It made me felt so bad for them because it was pretty late into dinner service. At least my order wasn't too small, so they made some sort of transaction that day.

I read all of the other reviews prior to ordering. So my food choices were pretty much from those recommendations. I ordered two spicy beef noodle soups, pan fried beef dumplings, bao, salt and pepper shrimp, and salt and pepper chicken. Starting with the dumplings, they were ok. Some were a little soggy even though some looked burnt. I liked that the shrimps were still fully shelled and head on. The chicken were extremely dry, hard to take down. I originally wanted the salt and pepper wings but they said it was discontinued. The salt and pepper dishes were tossed with onions and green bell peppers, which were a nice touch but they were extremely oily. The bao..the bao were the most disappointing. They were generously filled but it tasted like straight soy sauce. I couldn't even get pass the first bite. Finally, the noodle soup. They were also ok, nothing too memorable. I really hoped to love this restaurant but man..I hope they do well.
name: YuYan Kitchen

text:
Nice to see a new restaurant in this nice location.
Triple B's is no more and no less than they say.  It is a BURGER restaurant.  The menu is very short featuring several burgers, a couple of others sandwiches, two salads and several appetizers/bar snacks.  The wine selection looks fair, but I normally don't do wine with burgers.
The building has a great bar that we have enjoyed for years.  Hope they keep it vibrant and alive.
The burger we tried was excellent with flavorful meat, not overly cooked.  The chicken sandwich was also juicy and well prepared.
IMHO Hope the menu expands a bit more, with maybe Po Boys or plates like red beans, fried catfish, etc. to keep the choices fresh and interesting.

text: I really enjoyed this spot, the vibes were good and the crew was really chill. It almost felt like a peace and love park with food, a roof, and walls. I had a few items off the menu. The parfait was delicious without being overly sweet or too bitter. The avocado toast was missing something, probably salt. I have had better and it's not that hard to make. text: This place was huge. Anyone know what it used to be? Anyway, we cane here for dinner one someone chilly night looking for so ramen. We've been getting spoiled here with Kin and Union opening in the last few years. (So sad Kin is closed for good now). Anyway, we ordse some sushi to start and that rice was perfection. I really enjoyed the sushi alot. I also order the hangout ichimi ramen. I was going to order the heat as burning but I stuck with mild when the waitress said burning was too hot for her. There are three levels of heat. It comes with pork belly and that was tender and flavorful! The shrimp were fried on a stick, just thought that was oddly served that way. I guess I thought it would be sautÃ©ed or boiled shrimp in the ramen. The egg unfortunately did not have much soaked in broth flavors. I am guessing they don't cook the egg with the broth. The broth itself had great flavor and some heat so I can see why I may never be able to go with the burning heat level. I absolutely loved the extra corn I got, those were soaked in the flavors and so good. I felt the noodles were a but thin, I do prefer them to be a little thicker. It was a huge portion and I ate all of it. The service was great here as well. What a great addition to our city!
name: Hangout Ramen

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': None, u'hipster': None, u'casual': None, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': None, u'romantic': None, u'classy': None, u'upscale': None}

text:
My partner and I are pleasantly surprised that we've never heard of this place before. They opened right after hurricane Ida and I was just so preoccupied with other dire needs I was just frequenting the same places on my days off. 

So today I went about Yelp trying to find new eats. As always I always prioritize finding new Asian cuisine foods and saw that this place was opened relatively recent and decided to check them out.

We came at 2:00pm on a Monday and there was no one here but us. We ordered the jian bing, the spicy beef noodle soup, the pan fried shrimp pork and egg dumplings, the bao, and the sichuan chicken.

Spicy beef noodle soup: wow! The broth is really good! It was such a great mouthful of soy-base soup broth and a hearty serving of wheat noodles with braised beef
And bok Choy. The chilies were a nice pop-in-the mouth with each bite and really was flavorful. Everything was lacking in terms of spiciness but I'm Thai and I love everything of mine to be fire. I added more chilies that they have on the table. 

Sichuan chicken: they stir fried this with sichuan peppers, jalapeÃ±os, and ginger. The dish lacked a little salt so we sprinkled some on and voila! Perfect. Chicken was nice and crispy and very tender inside, the fresh jalapeÃ±os was a nice bite from the subtle sweetness of fresh peppers, and the ginger had a really nice aroma that resonated throughout the entire dish.

Jian Bing: the Jian bing was so unique. I've never had jian bing like this before, but it's also a regional difference as China is such a large country. It was filled with some type of fermented bean curd type sauce and a crispy wonton skin wrapper inside. Definitely worth a try!

Bao: the texture of the steamed buns were exceptional. It had a nice bite and chewiness to the bread but it was also moist and soft from the inside. The fillings shrank and left small pocket holes but they were filled with the juices of the filling. Win win win! 

Shrimp, egg, and pork dumplings: amazing! This dish was one of the winners. Crispy on the outside and amazingly succulent in the inside. The flavors were phenomenal. I made my own soy-sauce vinegar on my own plate and dipped these in there.

The service was very prompt and we were in want of nothing. The owner came out and greeted us and we felt really welcomed. Really glad we took the chance and tried this place today! 

Overall solid 5/5!
name: YuYan Kitchen

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': None, u'hipster': False, u'casual': None, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': None, u'romantic': None, u'classy': None, u'upscale': None}

text:
Forever a La Patrona stan. Their small but mighty restaurant and team gets sh*t done and continuously puts out amazing food. While everything on the menu sounds great, we stick to our same order every time. Don't sleep on the Smoked Cheese, a must-get if you're dining at the restaurant. It comes in a sizzling hot skillet with homemade tortilla chips and is the best thing ever.

The green chicken enchiladas are always piping hot out of the oven and have plenty of flavor. Enchiladas come with rice and beans. The Nachos Mix are layered with plenty of meat (shrimp, chicken, AND steak), plus sour cream, guac, and jalapenos. We get the refried beans on the side so it doesn't make the chips soggy. And it's all super affordable too. 

Give them a try next time you want Mexican food in NOLA that is actually authentic and prepared with lots of love.
name: La Patrona

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': None, u'casual': True, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': True, u'romantic': False, u'classy': None, u'upscale': False}

text:
Please keep in mind my review is from a meat eater at a VEGAN restaurant. 
I came here with my sisters, one of which is a vegan. We shared the brussel sprouts, fries, Mac n cheese, chicken sandwich, and classic burger. Our server was very knowledgable and helpful. The texture of the burger and sandwich is quite chewy, I did not enjoy it. I did enjoy the flavor of the breading on the chicken though. The sprouts were so good, we ordered a second one! The fries were fine, nothing great and definitely not bad. The Mac n cheese tasted like curry pasta.
We ended with carrot cake and cheesecake. My sisters loved them. I on the other hand, did not care for either. I do have a huge sweet tooth so I am a bit pickier on dessert. I found the texture of the carrot cake to be too dense. And the cheesecake too heavy with an odd texture.
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text: New Mexican spot on the radar! In my efforts to seek out the best Mexican food in New Orleans, I decided to try this new place that just opened in August. I saw that they were doing 5 tacos for $10 and thought at the very least it would be a good deal. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that not only was the food reasonably priced, it was all delicious! We got the mix nachos, mole enchiladas, and 5 tacos with 3 different pork, carne asada, and cow tongue. Each chip in the nachos was loaded and tasty -- probably my favorite part of the meal. The tacos were all incredible too. They also have great happy hour deals and tasty margaritas, including a jalepeno one. Definitely coming back so I can try more of the menu. I would recommend carry out as they only have 5 tables for indoor seating (+ it's still COVID). 5 stars!!
name: La Patrona

I also got to try the BBQ shrimp (comes with head on and wasn't my favorite but still good) and the deviled eggs. BEST deviled eggs I have ever had. They definitely made me a fan with that one. I will definitely be back if not for anything but those amazing crab cake deviled eggs!! Definitely worth it and affordable.

text:
Visited this place twice in one day. At our morning arrival they were packed and suggested reservations. We decided since we had a large party we would get out order to go. At 5:30, we called to place our order for pick up. At 6:20 we arrive at the place and the women let us know that they are not accepting anymore dine in or to go orders. 

This information could have been given when the call was placed. Instead of saying you need to come in and place the order. On top of that It isn't 7 and the door actually says they close at 7:30. So not understanding what is happenIng. Poor service and unprofessional.
name: Peewee's Crab Cakes

text:
They have a lemon - ginger drink and a hibiscus drink and I got them mixed and it was absolutely delightful. Too bad they don't sell it by the gallon! Seriously. There's just a hint of ginger and the combination of joining the lemon - ginger (which the man behind the counter told me about) and the hibiscus made a perfect melding of all the flavors without anything being too much. 

I ordered the "oyster mushrooms" which is described as  "chickpea battered oyster mushrooms deep-fried too a crisp with your choice of dipping sauce."  THEY ARE AMAZE-BALLS. I'm going to start using chickpea flour on my deep-fried foods. 

Their web site says "Derived from a well known term used in the Caribbean for healthy vegetarian food, the root word, "vital", which means important, essential, absolutely necessary for life, highlights our goal to create satisfying dishes that incorporate carefully selected ingredients that heal." They are family owned and operated,

P.S. I ordered a gluten free chocolate chip and almond cookie and it was ON POINT!
name: I-tal Garden

text: boyfriend and I followed these folks over from their old restaurant La Mansion. The food is authentic and everything tastes homemade. Fresh squeezed margaritas are perfect and don't taste like a mix like most places. 5 for $10 Street style tacos everyday! Ample portions, lovely family atmosphere, wonderful service. If you're tired of Mexican food that tastes like literally nothing (I'm looking at you Carreta's ) and inauthentic dishes please try this place out!

text:
OMG! 1st time customer and may I say, "I'll be back". Peewee's food was so scrumptious and well advertised on plate. I couldn't help but look on others plates to get and idea of what I was getting into. There's so much on their menu. Thanks to some very nice ladies who didn't mind my nosiness and told me what they were eating and gave good reviews for the dish. So I gave it a try. I ordered the Seafood Knockout Bell Pepper. Yall, the potato salad had pieces of the potato skin in the salad. Different,  but now I wouldn't want it any other way. 
This place is truly a gem. It was clean and the service was fast. Because of COVID once I placed my order at the counter I had to return to my vehicle to be called when ready. I can't wait to try other dishes. Pricey but well worth it. The amount of food leaves you extremely full. Did I mention how good the food was . 
The only complaint I have is the parking sucks. Can be very congested. Not enough parking to accommodating their business especially once it really catches on. But no matter where they're locate, if they continue to keep the quality of food and service up they will have a gold mine....Correction. There's plenty parking space on side of site.
name: Peewee's Crab Cakes

text: This place should have a line out the door...just for the smoked wings. Try them without sauce, they don't need it!burgers are tasty AF and the tots are crispy and addictive. Some solid craft beer choices too!

text:
Found a new Chinese spot on the block and we decided to give it a try. My boyfriend thought the soy ribs were okay. It had good flavor but it was on the dry side. The salt & pepper shrimp was pretty good. Did not lack in flavor. The combo fried noodles was probably everyone's favorite. The fried pot stickers is a 8/10. Lastly, the bao was probably the most disappointing thing for me. It was so salty that I felt like it was dipped into the ocean. Hopefully they make the bao less salty in the future. Overall, everything was pretty good. 

Environment : This location is the old Korean restaurant. Everything inside still remains the same. Therefore, the parking spots are still tight and small. 

Service: there was a nice sweet man that greeted us and cashed us out. The restaurant itself didn't have many customers when we arrived so hopefully this business gets more customers so it can keep running. 

I would rate this place a 7/10 from the food we got.
name: YuYan Kitchen

text: I've had takeout kindred pre-corona and it was always great! Today was the first time I got to go in person and even with limitations due to covid, my experience was TOP NOTCH!! There were limited seating areas in the dining room which made for a very comfortable, well spaced out experience. The server, Susan, was absolutely as sweet and helpful as can be! She helped me narrow down what I wanted (which was everything!) and was quick and safe. Susan wore gloves and mask the whole time, and even made doing so look comfortable and easy, which was really nice.  The owner and wonder chef, Caroline, was there too and she personally came out to ask how our meals were. She is so friendly and kind and the food was so out-of-this-world-amazing, it's no wonder this restaurant is a staple in the neighborhood and raved about by the vegan community near and far. The spicy chicken sandwich is to die for!!!!!!!!!! They use their own seitan which is spot on and then cooked to perfection topped with lettuce tomatoes and pickles. I also got sides of cauliwings drenched in tasty buffalo sauce, coleslaw which was so good and refreshing, and the tastiest mac and cheese this side of the Mississippi! I HIGHLY recommend you check it out! Oh and they have daiquiris!!!! I've heard the watermelon and mojito ones are crowd favorites but tbh all the flavors looked and sounded amazing. Can't wait to try one next time I go! Thank you, Kindred for an oh-so-tasty lunch, a wonderful experience, and amazing cruelty free neighborhood restaurant! 12/10 gold stars.
name: Kindred
categories: Bars, Vegan, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Comfort Food, Nightlife

text: Excellent authentic Chinese food w large portions & reasonable prices, near Lakeside Mall in the building that used to house Korea House for so many years. There was absolutely no wait time and the service was excellent.

text: Really excellent food, great service. text:
I just had a delicious lunch at Hangout Ramen.

So as crazy as it seems, the only ramen I've ever had has come from a plastic bag and costs around 25 cents.  Well, as you can imagine, this was a treat.

I was warmly welcomed when I arrived and was given menus right away.  I ordered a hot green tea and Tonkotsu Ramen, which was described on the menu as creamy pork broth and pork belly.  Well, as it turns out it's much more than that. All of the ramen bowls come with corn, bamboo shoots, bean sprouts, fish cakes, egg, green onion and seaweed sheets.

Y'all, this stuff is good. Like solid good.  I loved it and am looking forward to a return trip.  The pork belly was so tender that it was  literally falling apart. The broth was very flavorful and this was really a hearty dish. I have a feeling that when I return I'll order the same dish because 1. that's who I am, and 2. it was that good.

The service was wonderful too.
name: Hangout Ramen

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': None, u'hipster': None, u'casual': None, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': None, u'romantic': None, u'classy': None, u'upscale': None}

text:
I went into this hoping I would absolutely love this place because we really need more restaurants with outdoor seating.  I came away with mixed feelings.  I'm not trying to hurt this business.  Rather, I hope they consider my honest feedback and make some changes.  

The positives:  Burger tasted great and outdoor seating was nice.  It looked like there was even an outdoor TV (which wasn't on).  The ambiance was good.

What didn't I like?  Burger was very small for the price.  A fountain drink cost a ridiculous $3 plus tax and tip.  Drink was served in a small glass which empties too fast, and glass melts ice fast when it is outdoors in warm air.  LARGER plastic or foam cups would be much better.  In any event, I refuse to order a soft drink in a casual restaurant for $3 plus tax and tip, so next time I will drink water.  If they were content to make a reasonable profit on a soft drink I would order it.  They make no profit from water, so it's their loss.  Instead of serving soft drinks to almost everyone at a reasonable price, they will charge an outrageous price and sell fewer.  That's a lose - lose for everyone because I enjoy a soft drink with my meal.  I am more likely to eat somewhere if I can order a drink. 
And by the way, they conveniently elect not to list soft drinks on the menu, so you don't know the price of nearly $4 until you get the bill -- a sneaky thing to do.  

There was an understandable upcharge for sweet potato fries, but they were not very good.  I get these at a lot of restaurants, and I'd rank these near the bottom for taste and quality.  Waffle fries are a novelty, but I prioritize taste over novelty.  Just give me a good quality, tasty regular cut fry and I'll be happy.

Now for the part that really irritated me.  If I don't go back it will be for this reason:  I ordered a $15 hamburger that was supposed to have BBQ sauce on it.  It didn't have much sauce at all, so I asked for a little more.  The waiter brought out a tiny plastic cup with about a tablespoon of BBQ sauce in it and CHARGED ME AN EXTRA $.50 for a "side" of sauce.  Okay, sorry -- THIS IS A DEAL-BREAKER FOR ME.  If a $15 hamburger doesn't have enough BBQ sauce on it I don't expect to be charged extra to make it right.  Plus, it was a SMALL hamburger. 

The more I think about it, the more irritated I get about the sauce.  So now that I've reminded myself of this, I probably won't go back.  It's not only the cost.  It's the principle.  And if management thinks people are too stupid to notice things like this on a bill, they are mistaken.  It's an outrageous policy, considering their already high prices.  Two small hamburgers, fries, and one soft drink was more than $35.  I don't think so... Sadly disappointed in all of that.  In addition, they don't offer a burger under $9, and every burger on the menu has cheese on it.  Newsflash: Not everyone wants cheese on their burger, and almost no one wants to pay for cheese they're not going to eat.  Again -- just a little sneaky.

I do have to say though... burger tasted good.  But there are good burgers in other more reasonably priced restaurants who don't price gouge and nickel and dime customers to death.  I'm afraid if they keep these policies up, they will be closed reasonably soon.
name: Three B's Burger & Wine Bar

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': None, u'hipster': None, u'casual': None, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': None, u'romantic': None, u'classy': None, u'upscale': None}

text:
Good ramen is hard to come by in this city. There just simply isn't enough great selection. I was pretty impressed by the overall complex flavors of my broth and extremely impressed by the pork chashu inside the ramen and our pork bao.

We were seated immediately and was offered free sake. I passed on the free sake but changed my mind. The free sake is not something to write home about, it's flavors are not the best but it's free so no complaints. If you like sake you might look for a mouthfeel that is subtly sweet and nutty from the grains, but the sake itself is mostly a quick hit of alcohol with subtle rice aromatics. But once again it was free and the sentiments were nice.

We started off with three appetizers:

Crawfish gyozas: these were okay, we weren't enthusiastic about it. It's served with sweet chili sauce, very likely Maeploy brand. 

Agedashi Tofu: these were less than okay. For a couple blocks of tofu the rice-flour coated tofu were very plain on its own (understandably) but the dashi-soy sauce was also very plain. Overall plain and bland was the takeaway of this dish.

Pork Chashu Bun: it's in a crescent style bun and the pork chashu was perfect! Delicious! Just salty enough and just sweet enough it literally melted in our mouths. The cook on the pork belly was extremely well executed. I was impressed! I ordered two more orders to go for my family!

Bang Bang Ramen: my partner got this ramen and I tasted the broth. Can't really remember the flavors well but I enjoyed it and that was what matters.

Hangout Ichimi Ramen: I got it at explode. As a spicy food connoisseur I looooove spicy food. The explode was not an intense spice but it was really well done. I'm not sure if they make their own chili-garlic spices but it reminded me of schezuan spice like LaoGanMa. The pork inside the ramen was the same pork from the bao so naturally it was really tender and yummy. The soft boiled eggs were seasoned well, the noodles were good, and the broth was delicious. I literally drank the whole bowl. 

Overall pretty impressed!
name: Hangout Ramen

text:
Third times the charm for this Japanese
inspired restaurant location. One thing that been consistent though, is quality Ramen.  I started off rocky, like Masterpiece before them, answering the phone is hit or miss. I called 4 times and had tried on other days with no answer so I just showed up to order in person. They offer Uber Eats and Waiter orders but for a fee. 

Despite the disappointment of having to sit and wait for take out, they were fast and efficient with service. The phone rang often, the dining room was full and online orders were constant, so I can see why you won't always get an answer. It only took about 10min for my Spicy Bang Bang Ramen to be ready. One bite at home and all was forgiven. It's the perfect level of spice for me, enough to feel it but still enjoy all the flavors of their creamy rich Pork broth. There was a larger amount of pork belly than usual, the noodles were fresh, had great pull, and the egg was perfection! Even the corn that is included (extra at other spots) was an on point sweet and crisp addition to the dish. 

I've heard great things about their sushi and saw a few Other ramens I'd like to try but it's going to be hard not to revisit the spicy bang bang over and over (even if I have to wait at the counter ).  Grateful Hangout is so close!!
name: Hangout Ramen

text:
I really wanted to give this place 5 stars but it just did not warrant it. 

Pros: cool decor, friendly staff, clean bathrooms, vibes everywhere! 

I ordered a 2 protein, 3 sides plate. The oyster bites with the maple sarrachi sauce was amazing! I would totally come back and order just a plate of the oyster bites. The cornbread was good as well and counted as one of my sides. I also ordered the mixed juice ( ginger, lemon, & hibiscus) and oh my goodness it was amazing. They also filled my cup up and I didn't need any ice. 

Cons: portion sizes. 

I also had the crab-less cakes, vegan mac and cheese, and creole greens. The cakes were small and very "bready". It needed some more hearts of palm to give it that "crab" taste. The Mac and cheese was bland but a decent portion size. The creole green caught me off guard. I was expecting collards or mustards or even turnip greens but it was a mix of kale, cabbage, and mustards I believe. The flavor was ok and if in a pinch I'd order again but I had my mouth set up for some "green" greens. 

I ordered my food inside but togo and the staff forgot to call my name. My food was warm but not hot when they finally brought my order up. 

For $26 before gratuity, I expected way more food and flavor. However I will be back and hopefully the next items I try will raise this rating.
name: I-tal Garden

text:
I went to I-tal Garden today. I got the build your own plate. BBQ jackfruit ribs, crispy cauli wings, mac n cheese, grilled veggies, and salad. I was full half way through my food but I'm not about that leftover business so I sucked it up and finished the plate like a champ.

-BBQ jackfruit ribs are sweet and tender
-Crispy cauli wings would be good for those that likes cauliflower. Sauce is also slightly sweet but not as sweet as bbq.
-Mac n cheese was definitely cheesy. Not too salty.
-Grilled veggies was normal grilled veggies
-Salad came with a sweet sauce. I did not care for this at all.

The mac n cheese was my favorite. I would definitely come back just for it.
name: I-tal Garden

text:
Peewee's

I live for a good crab cake! All I need is a pile of crab meat, with a little seasoning and a nice crunch. So I was excited to try @peeweescrabcakesonthego. I have heard mixed reviews about this place, so I had to try it out on my own. 

 I went on a Friday during lunch, at the Gentilly location, and the business was busy. Almost all of the tables were filled and there were two people ahead of me before I could order. The service was pretty good. They definitely wanted to get you in and out.

 I ordered the special of the day, which was a seafood potato for $12 and a single crab cake on the side. The presentation  was OK. Maybe it would have been better if I would have dined in. The actual potato  was a good size and the sauce complemented everything. The consistency was creamy and it had fresh peppers  , overall it was pretty flavorful. The seafood in the potato included shrimp , crawfish , a fried piece of fish  and finished with a crab cake. Also there was some shredded cheese  under the fish. In addition I ordered a single crab cake on the side, by itself. 

 The potato was simply sliced in half and was not mashed down so the sauce is not smothered in the potato. As I started to make the potato, I would scoop the sauce in the middle from the bottom. All the seafood was cooked well, except the crab cakes. To confirm my tasting I took a few bites from the single cake and I was disappointed. It reminded me more of a stuffing instead of a crab cake. It was very mushy, and the sauce on the single was a little sweet and not at all crabby. I was pretty shocked considering this was a star item on the menu! 

 While I didn't care for this dish, I plan to go back and try some of their wings  and/or pasta.
name: Peewee's Crab Cakes

text: Omg. It was so loud in there. They, for some reason rook the sound board down and the sound decibels were over 80! Couldn't hear each other talk! On top of it, they had what sounded like music playing.  Food was good but couldn't enjoy.

text: I think YuYan will be a new favorite for me.  This place is a must try!! The food has the feel and taste of great home cooking. Wonderfully simple, fresh, well spiced food. The owner takes pride in the recipes of her home country and it shows. I loved the bao and egg rolls.  Both are hand made fresh and the flavors are amazing.  My husband had the soy sauce braised pork ribs which just fell off the bone and were plentiful. For something different, I recommend the dragon eye meatballs that my son ordered- the New Year's recipe passed on to the owner from her father. I know this new restaurant has only been open a short while but it  already has captured my heart and stomach.  Please stop in and give the food a try...you won't be sorry....and I would love for YuYan Kitchen to be around for a long time.
name: YuYan Kitchen

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': None, u'hipster': False, u'casual': None, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': None, u'romantic': None, u'classy': None, u'upscale': None}

text: I ordered pizza and cheese bread and a cookie pie for my family in Louisiana due to family emergency. I live out of state and wanted the kids of my family to have a nice dinner for the evening. Pizza was the choice but where do you get something good that you haven't tried.  There is the usual pizza chains but the reviews were something left to be desired. This place had great reviews and Bryan who took my order was patient and courteous and gave advice that helped me to get enough delicious food to fill the belly and to lift the spirits of my family. That being said the Pizza was really good which is a big complement from kids who thoroughly enjoyed dinner. Do I recommend this place?....YES!  Would I order from here again?..YES! However Bryan made the whole experience worth paying a little more for Delicious Kindness on a plate served up as PIZZA!  Thank you for a clutch experience during a difficult circumstance. Everyone should try the hospitality that makes their food sooooo good!  I highly recommend this pizza place to locals and out-of-towner's like me.
name: MrJims.Pizza - Kenner

text: We visited YuYan for the first time this evening and will definitely be back! I am not normally a fan of Chinese food as everything is so greasy and covered with sauce, but this was the best Chinese food I have had. Everything tasted super fresh and the flavors were delicious. We got the beef and onion dumplings (obviously homemade and delicious), I got the shrimp fried noodles and my husband got the spicy beef noodles. The portions were very generous. It might be slightly more expensive than the Americanized Chinese food you are used to, but the quality of food is a lot better. I am looking forward to going back!
name: YuYan Kitchen

text:
Three B's 
Everyone does burgers and beer  , but how about burgers and wine? Well @threebsmetarie is the spot for you. 

After a busy and eventful morning, I was definitely looking for a hefty meal and a light
cocktail  , and they did not disappoint.

With so many options to choose from, the West Coast  was perfect for me. The bun was awesome, grilled and soft. The all beef patty was  juicy, and I am a sucker for buttery leafy lettuce  . Topped with a juicy tomato  and fresh pickles, how could you not be happy? My first bite was just right.

 For my side, I asked for their "totnachos", fried tater tots, topped with queso, jalapeÃ±os, sour cream, chipotle, green onion, and my favorite bacon  

I paired this great meal with a glass of Riesling. On top of the meal being delicious, the service was perfect. Justin was very on point-- and all of this for only 20 bucks.

Great food, great service, great cost. @threebsmetarie is a win all around. 


Service 
Food   
Cost
name: Three B's Burger & Wine Bar

text:
Peewee's Crab Cakes is awesome!! Not sure how we came across it, but we knew when we went to New Orleans we had to try it. It did not disappoint! We chose this location because we wanted the opportunity to dine in if our schedule allowed, and we are so glad we dined in. 

We got the soft crab, Hennessy BBQ shrimp, and the boiled crawfish. The Hennessy BBQ shrimp was by far our favorite. The sauce was so flavorful we started dipping out crawfish tails in it! I had never eaten boiled crawfish and it is now an experience I am glad I have had and that I had it at PeeWee's! The staff found out I hadn't had it before and they hyped me up, which was wonderful and what I needed before I pulled apart my first crawfish. 

Overall, food was delicious and experience was great! Definitely stop by and eat there if you can!
name: Peewee's Crab Cakes

text: Enjoyed a lunch here. Great food and nice atmosphere. The menu is limited, but if you're looking for some quality bar food and a glass of wine, you should definitely stop in. The butterfinger chocolate milkshake was amazing!

Would go back, but please play something else.

text:
YuYan is such a great addition to the local food scene! I am no expert on Chinese cuisine, but I thought every dish excellent. All the noodles had a great chew, and the Sichuan Chicken peppers in particular were perfectly fried. I had never seen a lot of the dishes on the menu in any other restaurant, so I definitely recommend YuYan to anyone interest in Chinese cooking. 

The owner is also a sweetheart -- she came out and talked to our table about the food and our experience completely unprompted.

text:
We got some catering from this place and it was delicious!

We ordered big trays of pasta, jambalaya, salad, finger sandwiches and brownies. I personally tried the pasta, salad and finger sandwiches. The pasta was penne pasta that was nice and cheesy and had tons of flavor. My favorite was definitely the salad because it was packed with goodies- it had spinach, avocado, walnuts, feta, dried cranberries and it was topped with a yummy vinaigrette. It was one of the best salads I have ever had and it made me want to go to Cafe Royale and have more. The finger sandwiches were pretty good, but didn't really blow me away and I've had better elsewhere.

If you need something catered, I would chose Cafe Royale because I was more than pleased with the food.

text:
I was so glad that I found myself in the neighborhood since I had heard that this is one of the better Ideal Markets.

This is a small market, but they have the good stuff- namely sweet breads made fresh. After looking around, I got a sweet bread (it had a fancy name in Spanish, but I forgot to make a note of it) and it was delightful! I could tell that it was made in store and I enjoyed it later that evening.

If you're in the mood for something hot, they have a hot bar where they are serving up delicious looking authentic food, that must be good because there was a pretty sizable line for it. The staff is always working to keep everything fresh, and when I was here they were adding fresh pastries to the pasty case, so you can bet that no matter what time you get here you're sure to enjoy something that is tasty and fresh.

Like any convenience store, they have basic groceries and a nice selection of cheeses, fruits and other produce so you should be able to find whatever you might be looking for as far as that goes.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: Red Beans and Rice was the order of the day for a Monday. Very good. Reasonably priced. Comfortable, very casual atmosphere. Koz presides over his establishment. A local place catering to everybody.
name: Koz's

text:
You need tortillas? Guacamole? salsa? Marinated fajita meat? What about cow tongue? Yes? Well mi gente at Ideal Market gotcha!

Yep they have it all in a very small footprint. I usually go in to get marinated fajita meat which my friends (pale and brown) love and Arina-Pan for my arepas. 

They also have tons of  options for hot plate lunches. My favorites is the costillas (ribs for the non-Spanish speakers) with yuca and white rice. They also make a killer pork coconut milk stew that will bring you back from the dead after a night of drinking. Their barbacoa and chicharrones are also on point.

Great place to get beers from allover Central and South America and their Tres Leches cake is delicious and not overly sweet. 

If your recipe calls for some spice you've never heard of and can barely pronounce there's a 95% chance they have it. 

So "Ã¡ndale" and check it out you'll thank me!
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food and the service! I definitely have recommended this place to everyone. The salads are amazing and the gumbo is to die for!

text: I love this market! I love that I can find everything I need to make my oxtail stew (and they cut the pieces just how I like it too!) The fruits and veggies are usually sold at or very close to ripe so I know I can nip in there for a mango or an avocado that is just right for use in that day or the day after. The service I've received has been good and I'm just so glad I stumbled upon this place when I moved here a few months ago!
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text:
I went to lunch with a couple of co-workers this past week and was not disappointed.

You can get pretty much anything on the menu for under $10. For example, when I went they had a white beans + meat (sausage, fried chicken, grilled chicken, pork chop) for $7.50. There is a HUGE variety of po boys and dinner plates as well.

I opted for the special with grilled chicken. The beans were kind of bland for my liking, but nothing a bit of hot sauce couldn't fix. Still a great value for $7.50, as it was a huge portion, served with a piece of french bread.

It can get a little crowded at lunch time and parking can be a challenge. However, food is served quickly and with a smile.
name: Koz's

text: This is such a great addition to MidCity, A real Latin market, clean and well stocked. My wife and I go and just walk the admittedly narrow aisles staring at the exotic offerings. We get our usual items to support her Mexican cooking, but occasionally succumb to the deli items. A roasted chicken we got there was sublime, juicy and ringed with grilled green onions. We did find the guacamole too fiery, but bought some avocadas (plentiful and RIPE!) and added them til the guac took on a yancqui spice level. The staff is tolerant of the occasional "gringo" and is very pleasant and engaging when asked about the products. Not a place for xenophobes, but for those enjoying our community's diversity, well worth it!
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: Stopped in for lunch while on business. Service was great and fast. Enjoyed the club sandwich. Definitely a locals type place which was nice. I would definitely recommend for a good, quick meal.

text:
This is a nice little place for breakfast and lunch. They are not open for dinner so that's the only negative.

Service is always friendly. Usually the same two young ladies are always there and they remember us every time we come.

The croissant sandwich with eggs, meat, and cheese is my wife's favorite. I like their breakfast plate and their omelets.

Today I had their lunch special, baked chicken with Mac-n-cheese, corn, and a salad. Delicious! A little pricey at $9.99 for only a 1/4 chicken but not too bad. 

We had my brother-in-law with us today, and he got the Thai Chicken Salad and liked it.

My wife was able to get her croissant sandwich even though it was past breakfast hours. She was very pleased.

We will continue to come to this place.
name: Chap's Chicken

text: This place is about as solid as it gets. Best fried catfish around. They have the big fillets and not the little strips or nuggets that most places serve. Also, the fried chicken and pork chop are delicious. I've never had a bad meal here. The only negative thing about this place are the restrooms. They have to be the smallest, dirtiest, restrooms in the city. We joke that you actually feel dirtier when coming out of there when you went in to wash your hands. Great food though!

text:
Cafe Royale is a sweet, friendly place that I cannot believe I hadn't discovered yet. My girlfriend and I popped in for lunch on a Saturday. 
We ordered paninis and, I must say, the spinach and artichoke panini was glorious. It is quite larger than my panini experiences from other establishments and it was served with a side of chips.
The owner, Julie, was our server and she was as lovely as can be. She took care of us just as if we were one of the several regulars that were dining that day. It was nice hearing her talk to her customers by name. I'm sure I'd be one if I lived closer to this fine example of a family cafe. 
Thanks for the wonderful lunch and I'm sure I'll see you again sooner rather than later.

text: Huge servings and always delicious. Highly recommended - best po boys in the Harahan/River Ridge area.  Service is always very friendly and efficient.  Try the BBQ ham po boy.  It sounds as good as it tastes.  If you really want to punish your stomach with awesomeness, order the "whole loaf" option to split between a friend or two.  Or, go for "Will's Chamber of Horror": roast beef, ham and turkey, plus swiss and american cheeses, white onion, mayo, creole mustard, and Italian salad dressing.
name: Koz's

text:
This place is like the narnia of latin american foodie goodness.  It doesn't appear to be that big from the outside, but if you walk inside you'll find yourself surrounded by a grocery store and cafeteria style fooderie (sadly, no faunos). The food is pretty decent, perhaps not the best you'll ever have but it's tasty, cheap, and pretty authentic.  

The service is also pretty quick and friendly, so I can get behind that.  In spite of it's wardrobesque appearance, it's still a relatively small store so while the prices may not be dirt cheap, they aren't bad if you need something quick (and are no worse than Rouses "ethnic" section).  I'll definitely be going back, so if you see a fat guy on the curbside of broad street nuzzling a gallon of horchata, please don't step on me.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text:
Great Mexican / Central American grocery. Nice Mexican cheese selection, great meat counter (they have a real butcher, evidently) and complete selection of Mexican produce and cheeses. The lunch counter is quite good as well, but no seating. This is the place for hard to find Mexican and Central American items in town. The parking's terrible but what can you do.
Aisles are narrow and when the place is packed with customers, err, almost any weekday evening - and can be a chore to shop, but totally worth it. If you are into Central American/Mexican food this is the only place in town that has what you will want. 
Most of the staff does not speak English at all so brush up on your Spanish! I don't know Spanish at all, but get by with just pointing at things. The butcher counter is just amazing.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: First of all our server Amanda was really great and attentive. Second the food was really delicious. For put appetizers we had Spinach Dip, Wings, and the Beef Lasagna. Everything was really delicious. We shared everything family style and was nearly full, before the pizza came. We ordered the 18" Meat Feast Pizza(Pepperoni, Sausage, & Ham). We only ate one slice a piece and it was amazing. We wanted to try the dessert also so we ordered the 8" Colossal Cookie! We will be back soon !!!!
name: Rotolo's Pizzeria

text:
What a jewel in Harahan!  

They have a huge menu of poboys, salads, plate lunches and other sandwiches.  Inexpensive pricing - most plate lunches are around $8 and the staff is very friendly.  I had a pulled pork poboy that was sloppy and delicious.  The onion rings are thin sliced and nicely cooked.    

Resist the urge to do fastfood in Harahan and go to this neighborhood jewel.
name: Koz's

text:
We were shopping in the area on Saturday with our friend and he suggested we go to Koz's for lunch. My boyfriend and I hadn't been there in about 5 or 6 years, so we decided to try it out again.

It's tucked away in a little area off of Hickory by a small park. It's real old school Jefferson Parish inside. Their moniker is "Home of the Whole Loaf." You can get huge full size poboys for parties or events. (I don't know the exact measurements, but we saw a guy carry one out on his shoulder.)

I got the roast beef poboy and my boyfriend got the bbq beef poboy. Our friend also got the roast beef poboy and an order of the onion rings The poboys were very tasty. The onion rings were the thin ones and they were delicious.

Besides poboys, they also have plate specials and seafood platters.

We would come back again.
name: Koz's

text: Hands down my favorite place for casual Italian food. The atmosphere is lovely and the staff is absolutely amazing and run by a manager that is truly passionate about the customers, quality of the food, and the service.  We ate there on a Wednesday night where they had an amazing deal on calzones.  I'm a vegan so Italian can be a bit tricky but we made it work. I ordered The Popeye without feta not realizing the calzones come with Parmesan on top.  I heard the manager (who was also my waitress) tell him I was vegan and no cheese.  I think it was genuinely an accident and she was very apologetic about it and saw that it was corrected straight away while educating her staff on exactly what vegan means.  While I waited for mine to be remade I had an amazing house drink called a blood orange margarita.  This is my new favorite cocktail!  When my calzone arrived it was incredible.  Their dough is amazing and all of the ingredients were fresh.  The portions are extremely generous as well.  This is also an incredible place to dine if you're not a vegan or vegetarian.  My husband also raved and raved over the quality of his meal.  It's worth the drive to Chalmette from New Orleans just to eat at this restaurant.
name: Rotolo's Pizzeria

text:
The best thing I've got to getting the Mexican grocery items that I need in NOLA!  

Rouses hardly ever has the speciality items I'm looking for, so I make the double grocery trip to IDEAL. I'm just happy to have a place to get the little things I love like pan dulce, sopa de estrellas, my enchilada sauce, etc.  They also have great meat, including some already marinated for ya.

And it's nice to go somewhere in this city and be able to speak Spanish.

This store has a great selection of affordably priced hot food, groceries, and imported goods from South America as well as some from Mexico. text: Not great. Plain, overpriced french fries, for $2.50. You have to add your own salt at the table. They have what appears to be a Tony Chachere's type seasoning on every table which is hard as a rock, so you can't even use it. The French bread is what ruins the entire poboy. It is way too soft and they don't heat or toast it. The meatball poboy was soggy, which made it awful. The flavor was decent. If I wanted a soft, meatball sandwich I would have gone to Subway for a $5 footlong. The meatballs are all chopped up. $15 for a poboy, drink and a small side of fries. Won't be back. Way too many other better poboy places around that are much better quality and less or equally priced. The service is fine.
name: Koz's

text: Great grocery store with awesome latin inspired prepared foods.  I generally check out the produce as it can be significantly cheaper than Winn-Dixie/Rouses (let alone Whole Foods) although sometime quality can be sketchy.  Great selection of tropical fruits so my go to when I am craving some papaya.  However the highlight of this joint is the prepared food and the meat counter.  The prepared food is always delicious - just wait in line and point and you have enough delicious meat and rice for the entire day for less than $10 (seriously - split it between two people for a regular sized meal).  Also a huge fan of the al pastor spit they have in the back - although it is often not ready or sometimes not even on.  Pick up some ready made salsas from the bin near the meat counter including my personal favorite the spicy guacamole con chili.  The meat counter is also serious business.  You can't beat the pre-marinated carne asada (get the whole flank steak version - not the fajita strips).  It is around $6 a pound and comes out perfect and delicious each time.  Also a surprisingly good place to pick up flanken style short ribs - which I use for Korean BBQ at home.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: This is a respectable Latin American market. It isn't large, but is quite clean and well kept as these things go, and has a lot of fresh vegetables and some delicious looking baked goods. Cheap tortillas, bulk dried beans, and so on, even cactus (what do you do with edible cactus?). They also have a few basic household items. Prices aren't bad at all. I don't know that it's my "ideal" market, but it seems worth an occasional trip.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: Impeccable market with the widest selection you could ever hope to find in this kind of store. Didn't get anything from the hot food bar, but everything looked great. Prices are low and the wide variety is impressive. Will definitely be back, and I want to check out their other locations, as they seem even bigger!
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: Great family restaurant with friendly service. They make you feel at home. Have daily specials that are reasonably priced. Substitutions are ok depending on taste. We go here two to three times per week. If you're looking for a quiet place for dinner, this is it.
name: Koz's

text: Ideal... oh how you won me over with your fresh sweet pastries. Although this location is smaller than the Clearview , it definitely suffices. All the offerings but on a smaller scale. Granted, I do enjoy the hot plated lunches they sell but I was feeling low on sugar that day. Churros filled with vanilla cream, tres "drenched in that leches" cake, and flan. Yasss....
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: I live in Seattle, WA & ordered a king cake online. It was a quick & easy process. They filled my order timely & shipped it out. Due to unexpected weather it delayed my delivery by 2 days. But, Caluda's wrapped & packed it & there was no flavor lost. This is by far one of the most flavorful cakes I have tried! Its full of cinnamony goodness. So good :) Thank you.
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text:
I've been to the other location before and loved it. Now that I'm working in Harahan and looking for good places for lunch and heard there's a second Koz's nearby it was an easy decision. I would definitely call Koz's a hidden gem in Harahan.

I decided to get that day's plate lunch special rather than a poboy, smothered veal with peas and potato salad. The veal was incredibly tender and full of flavor. Often when something is smothered the gravy is used to hide a lower quality meat but not this time. I'd definitely recommend it. When it comes to potato salad, everyone has a grandmother that makes the best (or at least they will claim to), myself included. Koz's potato salad is a good contender to go up against grandma's any day.

One last note, if you don't know where it is or aren't looking for it you may drive right past it. Hell, you might drive past even if you are looking for it. So keep a sharp eye and you won't miss out on a good lunch.
name: Koz's

text:
I absolutely love this little grocery; phenomenal deals on produce, homemade bread, and an incredible selection of Latin products. The main draw, even still, is the food prepared in the kitchen and served in the hot bar.
It is phenomenal food, authentic and perfectly prepared. The barbacoa is tender and flavorful. The carnitas have the perfect smoky sweetness and caramelized edge. The rice and the beans are simple and excellent; loved the fried rice also, it is loaded with meat and could constitute a meal on its own. Our favorite, and what has become a staple, is the whole grilled chicken; ask for the pollo asado. They have this beautiful red shade from a seasoned marinade, are constantly watched and turned over a large open grill and develop a perfect char. They come with grilled jalapeÃ±os and baby leeks. 

You should go eat here. Don't expect anyone to speak English but if you are persistent you will receive the prize.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text:
Outstanding meal! I read the reviews here on YELP...and I was not disappointed in the least.
It was very friendly, full of locals, and so tasty- quite perfect for an out of town girl who wanted to experience a real New Orleans sandwich shop.
I had the Roast Beef Po Boy and the Red Beans and rice with Sausage.
I shall return to Koz's on future trips!
Looking forward to trying other items- the menu looked great!
name: Koz's

text: This is a great spot. Genuine New Orleans po-boy shop in a suburban neighborhood for any visitors reading this. But why not? This site opened after Katrina - their original New Orleans spot on Franklin was flooded, and they obviously wanted to keep their business going (and their employees employed), and the site does good business, so why close it after they re-opened in New Orleans? To the good-fortune of all of the locals in the area, it is now a solid part of the neighborhood.
name: Koz's

text:
Probably some of the best food I've had so far in Chalmette and I wasn't expecting much. My husband's co-workers told us that this place "sucked". Boy, were they wrong. We had a fantastic dinner here and they've got a full bar with nice craft beer selections. 

We were immediately seated in a booth facing the window and ordered the "Chalmette" breadsticks as an appetizer. WOW. So cheesy and a little spicy because I'm pretty sure it had hot sauce on top. We should have just ordered this and been done because it was the size of a small pizza. We ordered the wings in garlic Parmesan and although they were delicious and cooked all the way through, they didn't taste like garlic Parmesan....at all. The lasagna with beef was phenomenal! Some of the best I've ever had, for sure. My husband paired his meal with a delicious local NOLA beer and it paired perfectly with the Italian cuisine. 

They've got TV's everywhere, a little game room for the kids and excellent service. Highly recommend.
name: Rotolo's Pizzeria

text: As soon as I walked in the doors I immediately knew I was in the right place. From the outside it can appear to be nothing but a hood little grocery store but in the inside are cramped little aisles full of all of my favorite things. Call me corny but an aisle full of Goya products and Spanish seasonings for the low low $$ excites me. Certain items that I cringe at buying at Winn Dixie and other grocery stores in N.O because I know I'm paying probably triple the price I can now get here without feeling like I'm getting raped. Although the produce section isn't huge, everything is fresh and CHEAP. They have seasonings for days and tons of other little Spanish treats throughout the store. Glad to know this is here and am even more glad I decided to go inside after driving by it constantly. Be warned its crowded to the max on Saturdays but whatever just move swiftly and get in and out and you'll be fine.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text:
To my surprise they had a cuban sandwich on the menu. Even more surprising , it was very good! 

My wife had their daily special, baked chicken w/  two sides. Very good deal for $7.50. She enjoyed it very much.

text:
I'm a Cuban chick who was born and raised in Miami, so Ideal Market is basically my salvation especially living in the South. Their produce is amazing, their meat prices are crazy cheap, and their hot plates are delicious. I recommend their breakfast. I normally get a quesadilla with Crema, Queso, Avocado, Beans, and Chorizo. It comes out to the low price of $3 and holds me over till lunch. Speaking of lunch, do yourself a favor and grab one of their Maltas to give you some pep in your step later in the day! I've lived in NOLA for a couple years now and this place helps keep me from feeling homesick.

Obviously knowing/speaking some Spanish is super helpful at this place but if you don't know any, do NOT let it stop you from eating/shopping here! This place is a gem and everyone is super helpful and friendly.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: Ok. This three stars is in comparison to the other ideal markets in the Nola area. In comparison, this place is smaller, not as clean, and the food isn't as good. I was sorely disappointed in the flan and tres leches that I ate the other night. It was still edible, but definitely wasn't mouth-wateringly delicious. This ideal isn't as clean and the employees are not very friendly.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: Great service from Ginelle! ( I hope I'm spelling her name correctly. )  We ordered the spaghetti & meatballs dinner and I started w/ a blood orange margarita. It was all delicious. I recommend this place !
name: Rotolo's Pizzeria

text:
This is my go to coffee spot in Nola! They have variety selection of coffee, it has a very nice cozy vibes, and the service from the baristas is what really makes this place stand out.

This is the spot to get your work done or have a nice conversation with your friends over good coffee
name: HEY Coffee Co.

text:
This place is the bomb dot com. It is right down the street from my office, and I come here for weird things I have never even heard of!

The other night we got the hot plate dinner....beef, rice, beans. Holy awesomesauce. So good. It fed two of us for about $10.

The fruit and veggie selection is unparalleled and cheap as hell.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text:
This is a cute little cafe that my co-workers and I will often order from. They have daily lunch specials, a good selection of sandwiches and salads, and made to order specialty coffee. I like ordering a latte every now and then but only when I have cash on me since the prices are so low, my mornings won't get me to the $5 card minimum (FIRST WORLD PROBLEM). Most of the time, I order the same thing: their Caesar salad and grilled chicken pita. The portion is exactly right to fill me up and be consumed in 15 minutes. 

The part I like about walking in here is all the regulars hanging out, drinking beer in the middle of the afternoon, and playing video poker. It's totally a neighborhood hangout. The owner is always smiling and sweet and it's just a pleasant place to be.
name: Chap's Chicken

text: The coffee is delicious, easy access right off the greenway and an interesting shop off a quiet street. Cute little spot for relaxing with a cup of coffee in the morning or on the weekend. It seems like many of the customers come here often, which just shows that this cafe does right by its customers. WiFi has always been good to me, too. One of my favorite coffee spots.
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text:
This is my new favorite place in New Orleans. No. This is my new favorite place in the world.

This market is right down the street from my office, and it makes me look forward to going to work, simply so I can look forward to my lunch break.

This place is clean, the staff is really friendly, the produce is super fresh and everything is cheap as hell.

They have an insane amount of fresh produce, a baked good section, a prepared food section, a deli counter, raw meat, booze, sodas...I think they also sell money orders.

If you are near the courthouse definitely make it your beeswax to stop in!
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text:
Literally the greatest king cake ever. I love their cream cheese king cake and surprisingly they're cookie dough king cake too!  how can something be so delicious!!? 
Also the fact that you can buy Caluda's king cakes at PJ's coffee and at other local grocery stores makes it all the better! Driving out to Elmwood is a pain because it's not close to me, but making this cake king available at other hubs is awesome! Consistently delicious.
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text: Delicious, affordable breakfast, brunch & lunch!  The daily specials of home style New Orleans cooking can't be beat. Staff is exceptionally friendly & make you feel at home.  My family's favorite corner cafe for 6+ yrs!

text: Cool, hidden gem, right off the greenway.  The service is excellent, and the coffee is high quality with a perfect drip.  I mean, perfect. text:
The food here is nothing shy of amazing. For an appetizer we had the Garlic Parmesan Bites, then the Angry Pig and Popeye pizzas for entrees. All three were cooked to perfection. 

Unfortunately the great quality food doesn't take away from the hour and a half wait for two soups, three side salads, and two pizzas. The restaurant wasn't even halfway occupied, at that. Service was acceptable, but the kitchen is certainly understaffed.
name: Rotolo's Pizzeria

text: I found a very good and friendly barista here. He made exactly what I wanted, and even went out of his way to make sure I had raw sugar. The atmosphere is even great, quiet. I simply didn't care for the taste of the bean. The coffee had an unusually bitter and odd after taste that I've never experienced, and I'm a regular espresso drinker who has ordered the beverage around the country and a bunch of others. Perhaps it was a fluke. I didn't complain. I had a couple of swigs of it and discarded the rest.
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: We stopped by on a whim (visitors to NOLA) and could not have been happier with everything HEY Coffee Co had going on: their commitment to leaving a minimal environmental impact (they have noodle straws!!) and the quality of their ingredients (best iced mocha I have ever had) will not disappoint! We already have plans to come back during our stay here.
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: Great service, loved the vibe and decor. Tasted a shot of the espresso blend and an iced short latte. Love the aim for minimal waste and sustainability and the gluten bucatini pasta straws in lieu of plastic straws for iced drinks was a creative touch!
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: Love the service and food here! Everyone is always so nice and the food is always fresh. Plus it's the only place around that takes Apple Pay.
name: Rotolo's Pizzeria

text: I live in Texas but I'm from New Orleans..It's a family tradition to have king cake during Mardi Gras season ...We were coming upon the end of the season & just about everybody had cut off shipping ..We didn't want to try the king cakes that were being sold here in Texas ..I was shook ..One day while on FB Caluda's showed on my news feed..I immediately went to the web site & just in the nick of time ..It was one day still available for shipping ...Our king cake would be shipped that Monday & delivered on Tuesday (Mardi Gras Day) PEERRRRFECCTTT! Yes! I met the Fed Ex guy at the door...I immediately opened & it faired just about perfect during delivery ...I've ordered king cakes in the past, & at least two were delivered a MESS! I've learned though, if the weather is warm; it's best NOT to order for shipping ...The weather plays an important role in how your cake will be delivered...This king cake is so moist & delish..The only issue I had, which I don't believe was on Caluda's part; the box it was delivered in was half opened..As though while in route, someone took a peek inside ..Nonetheless, we're eating it...I have half in the freezer for later..
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text: Five stars for service! Everyone is sooo nice here! It's a plus that it's right by my apt. I love the variety of king cakes and the different non-traditional flavors they offer.  I definitely go for fun flavor Friday's.  This week, I got the Oreo cream king cake and Wedding cake king cake.  But in actuality, it was not a wedding cake king cake.  instead i recieved a pineapple/lemon filling.  I'm not a fruit filled typed king cake eater.  My co workers at the hospital enjoyed it. but i wasn't able to enjoy it cause i was sold a "wedding cake" flavored king cake and received something different.  The oreo cream cheese king cake was good, but i would have liked the filling to be an oreo's and cream (buttercream).  I was expecting a buttercream oreo filling.  It was good, but i probably won't get these two flavors.  The bread is more of a brioche with a hint of citrus to it.  The bread is soft, which i do enjoy.  I don't like thick dense breads.  therefore i love the texture of this bread.  I paid roughly for two filled cakes about $55.
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text: Been two times with two different baristas.  They both cared a lot about the coffee they were serving and provided a damn good cup o joe/espresso.  As tourists in these two separate occasions they were quirky kind in their recommendations.  We have been able to try some of the recommendations so far and did not disappoint.  Highly suggest.  Dog friendly.  Clean.

categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: This is the best lunch place I've ever been to in my life! Amazing service, extremely friendly and great atmosphere!   We were given free fries just because I asked to add them to my order.  I could go on and on about this place. Definitely come try it out!

text:
Honestly, Lichelle is enough reason to visit this location in the morning if I have to say so myself. I work close by, so I visited early morning and her smiling face and great personality will perk you up in the morning. Just having a conversation with her as she makes you a delicious treat is what I call superb customer service!

This location has some great coffee available! You can also get lattes (currently only flavor available, if you are a flavor person is vanilla). Also, some pastries and a few breakfast items are available!

The location is cute. It's a small section to sit, so not good for big groups, but great for a nice day of reading or something. 

There is street parking in the area and you shouldn't have any issues in that!
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text:
This is the best!

I've been ordering from a "famous" bakery for years until I stumbled on to Caluda's. Holy cow! These king cakes are by far the best I've had!!! They arrive in perfect condition. Always fresh and ready to eat. I will be a lifer as long as they are open and I can order!! xoxoxo

text: Chap's chicken is excellent.  In a personal survey of fried chicken, including Copeland's, Galley, Mr. Ed's Oyster Bar, Church's, Brother's KFC and the King (Popeye's), Chap's is tied for first with Popeye's, having similar qualities such as crispiness and spiciness.  It definitely stands out for quality control, compared to Popeye's, because the chicken is individually prepared for each order and staff attitude is in a different world.  You don't have to worry about things like getting the wrong pieces and other mistakes that are common to every Popeye's visit, including the shabby treatment.  Just wish Chap's had some Cajun rice!
name: Chap's Chicken

text: I ordered three king cakes for Mardi Gras and unfortunately due to the winter weather they have been delayed. I completely understand that Caluda's cannot control the weather or the operations of their shipper. However, I NEVER received a tracking number nor shipping notification for any of my three cakes. I tried calling Caluda's five times to obtain a tracking number. Their voice message has not been updated since January and it instructs you not to leave a message on that phone number. I searched for another phone number. There isn't one. There is no email address to contact them. They have not replied to numerous inquiries, not only from me, on their Facebook and Instagram pages. There is NO way to contact them. I DO NOT blame them for the weather, but customer service that is non-existent. I have never ordered anything online and not received some sort of tracking information. I am very disappointed. I will never order from them again!
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text: Very disappointed - Caluda's wouldn't ship to the DC area, so I had to ship it myself. Because they were too cheap to even put the king cake in a bag (like every bread product), it arrived sloppy and bare. Sticking to the original Randazzo's, like the old days.
name: Caluda's King Cake
