text:
I never stay to enjoy my cup of joe there, but it's a nice, quiet spot to chill for sure. It's small, but just big enough to have a couple of different types of seating inside and a set of cafe table and chairs out front. 

I always get the cold brew! It's reasonably priced for high quality coffee beans. You can enjoy your coffee looking out onto the pretty Lafitte Greenway or take it to go. The baristas are always nice and quick! They sell a variety of pastries although I've never tried any.
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: This is one of the worst experiences I have had at a restaurant. There was only one waitress and she couldn't keep up. We ordered hamburgers cooked medium ( she asked us) we waited for at least 30 min to get the order. The hamburgers were so over cooked they looked and felt like charcoal. While eating they set someone beside us which a towel wrapped around her neck coughing and sweating. I told my family to leave and I stayed to pay the bill that was held up because their computer had to reboot. After I paid I start walking to the front door and almost slipped down. The air conditioner is leaking from a vent on ceiling to the floor leaving a good size puddle in the walkway. No sign and no warning.  I'll never go back to that place again.  Good luck to you if you go.
name: Daisy Dukes Diner

text:
Yummy chicken! Ordered the Wednesday special . 8 pieces for $10. Fried perfectly.
Cute restaurant but we took ours to go.If you are in a hurry you may want to call ahead as the chicken is cooked to order.
name: Chap's Chicken

text:
I'm visiting New Orleans this week and decided to visit the newish mid-city location of Hey! Coffee. 
First, I wanted a couple pounds of their delicious Ethiopian beans. They were freshly roasted and packaged for me. They smell so good in my suitcase!
I ended up going back three times for morning lattes...yummy!
Micah was so nice and is a great barista. We also met a lot of really nice people there!  They feature local artists, with some of their work displayed for sale. 
Heading home in the morning, but will definitely be back!  And I learned that they have an online store, so I can keep supplied with my favorite brew
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: Awesome and amazing location on the Lafitte Greenway on St. Louis Street just riverward from Broad. Really amazing people and a good quiet place to work and/or relax. Coffee is delicious and the food looks amazing too though mostly just bagels and pick-me-ups. I love Hey! CafÃ©. They also were a sponsor in the Greenway Festival at which everyone had a great time!!!
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text:
Brittany is an asset! 
On our trip we had a pool day and Brittany kept us entertained with good vibes and good drinks. She was attentive, had great customer service, and was fun to talk to. While there we ordered the Cali Cajun from the kitchen and it was delicious. Overall, our experience here was great and we were very happy to be taken care of by the staff, mainly Brittany at Batture.

text:
I really hate everything about this place. The generic hipster vibe that can make it anywhere. Just blink and this place can be in Austin, Portland, Denver etc. 
But what really annoys me is that a culturally diverse city can be reduced to this generic blob.
During my last visit there was a guy with a dog. I will assume that it's an emotional support dog because every entitled brat moving to the city has one for his/her dog to take it on the subway, coffeeshop etc. This particular dog  had it's paw on the counter, sniffed around my food and bag. And the entitled owner did nothing. Sorry but not everyone wants a dog around their food. Skip this gentrified mess of a place.
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text:
A LATINO "SUPER ROUSES": and once inside it's like Mary Poppins' carpet bag, seemingly getting deeper and wider with squeaky-clean "WholeFoods-ian" aisles of groceries & produce.

HUGE 40+ FOOT BUTCHERY & HOT FOODS COUNTER: located  in the back (to the left of the Western Union kiosk) and the prices are reasonable.

KNOW YER SPANISH: ordering is reminiscent of Madrid's El Corte InglÃ©s cafeteria. I employ "Rick Steve's" broken language method: point and ask "tu favorita?". This trick almost always yields satisfactory results. Today I had the delicious chorizo breakfast burrito on freshly made corn tortillas, $2!
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: This is a precious little place that gives back to the community but I don't love it. I guess I was confused by  the fact that  my soy milk cappucino didn't appear to come with soy milk? Or maybe, there was a tiny tiny splash that was frothed but it was mostly espresso with a little bit of water? The espresso was not bad but not amazing. Not much seating, pretty small. Kindof slow service. I'm going to try it again for the food I suppose.
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: First time visiting Rotolo's tonight. I'm not sure the significance but Wednesday if you order starts before 6pm they are half off and on this particular night calzones also happened to be half off. They offer gluten free pizza crust and are pretty open about the possibility that there is a chance for cross contamination - their online allergy menu was very helpful. I went with the Kickin chicken salad, was warned it was spicy. It was not spicy at all but still very tasty. Overall good experience
name: Rotolo's Pizzeria

text: My Team Family and I camr to Daisy Dukes from Cali and Houston just. Y checking Google. We were met by a gracious host and then....Ms Charmaine & Brittni entered our world and if felt like we were friends forever. Charmaine's customer service and Sass lit up our world!!!. The Chicken & waffles was to die for and the Customer service was off the Charts... Thank you Daisy Duke for the food & hiring the Queen of Confidence
name: Daisy Dukes Diner

text:
I stopped in here during a work trip after reading a couple of reviews. I'm so happy I did! Everything about daisy dukes was great, from my server, Wes, to the atmosphere and the awesome food! I got a modified omelette and everything came out perfectly. I'm from the north so we don't have biscuits all that often, whenever I see them on a menu I make sure to order them, and they were so good here! 

Wes was so attentive and helpful-- I wish I lived closer and was able to go more often but if I'm ever in the Kenner area again I will 100% stop in and make sure to request him!
name: Daisy Dukes Diner

text: Great place to dine in and have some New Orleans food! I saw a review that talked about a waitress with pink hair... he goes on to talk down about this sever. I wanted to clear something up. This waitress waits on me all the time, I go in because of her. She goes above and beyond to make my experience the best! She interacts with her customers... like waitresses should. She shouldn't be shamed for doing her job. My wife is a server also, and I could never do their job. They have to deal with rude customers like you, and are expected to remain professional. & for the person who said she's racist, she's far from it. I'm Hispanic and get treated the same as any other customer, compared to most places where I'm treated differently. The atmosphere is wonderful, along with the service. From the time you walk in to the time you leave, you are treated with the best service! & definitely ask for the waitress with the pink hair! She's wonderful!!! You won't regret it!
name: Daisy Dukes Diner

text: The Food is really good and the Service is friendly! The only compliant I have is the Men's Restroom. It needed a lot of TLC! It was dirty and needs renovation. I will back for the Food and Service however!
name: Koz's

text:
Hot spot! I love finding new places to writec about. 

 Batture Bistro + Bar just opened a few weeks ago. I wanted to check them out and try their menu. The bar area has a very cozy & chill feel to it. You can chill by the fireplace and delight in cocktails by the poolside deck. Oh, the pool is heated. There's also a climate-controlled porch that is designed for socialites to sip in style.  

I  am here for the dining al fresco. We ordered the artisan flatbread pizza. The options are a wide array ranging from Prosciutto, Italian sausage , Creole tomato, and blackened chicken. There are so many fabulous cocktails. Pictured below, are the Blood - Orange Revenge and Sidecar.  I will try the Hot & Spicy Cilantro Mule on my next visit. I can't wait to staycation here. 

Happy Hour is 3-6p daily.
name: Batture Bistro and Bar

text:
First off is this cafe royal or chaps now or same owners?  Anyway,  got 2 pieces w mashed potato and an extra side of potato  salad.  Sweet tea. 
Takes the full 20 minutes to cook.  Chicken was was very fresh juicy and not fried to death.  Like moms out of a skillet.   Problem is I like chicken fried to death after all these years of gas station crap and Kentucky Fried.   Mashed potatoes and gravy real good, maybe not fresh peeled but good.  Potato salad needed the tabasco but most everybody's does compared to mine.  And it's in the New Orleans style all mixed up fine.  I make it so you have pieces of hard boiled eggs and celery and pieces of black pepper in it. So I actually had over half the breast and most of the potato salad left. 

Here's the clincher:   It tastes great COLD !   
That's a true measure of good cooking. Like pizza, steak or spaghetti.  So I'm changing from 3 to 4 star.   I'd like a little more zip in chicken batter though.   And service is great.
name: Chap's Chicken

text:
An absolutely wonderful little neighborhood cafe! 

I like to grab breakfast or coffee from Cafe Royale if I'm in the area, which is usually when I'm due for a haircut/color. It was nice and quiet the morning I stopped in, and it seemed to be filled with regulars which is a strong indicator of consistency for me. Friendly, fast service and great prices make this place the perfect spot to grab a quick bite. 

They had a decent selection available on the menu; including the daily special, breakfast platters, sandwiches and omelets as well as speciality coffees. During my last visit I opted for the combination breakfast, which included eggs, sausage or bacon, hash browns or grits, and toast or biscuit - FYI I went with eggs, sausage, hash brown and a biscuit with a regular cup of coffee and bottled water. The food was cooked well, portion sizes were generous and the waitress made sure my cup of coffee was always full with a smile. 

I left completely satisfied; from service, to food quality and price- everything was just right. I'm definitely looking forward to trying some of the lunch items on their menu next time I'm in the area.
name: Chap's Chicken

text:
Three days in the quarter and we needed a break from "creole/cajun everything". No offense intended but you can only eat so much Gumbo. 

Brunch was lovely - presentation, atmosphere, and taste all very good. The banana's foster mini waffles, fresh blueberry mini waffles, rosemary potatoes, al were excellent with out trying too hard. My son inhaled the Pecan Praline mini waffles but said somehow, that he was still able to taste it and it was "yum".

Steve served us promptly and efficiently with refills on water and coffee and a few lovely bourbon milk and grasshopper cocktails, which were well balanced after three days of heavy "pour decisions"

Saturday morning at 9 AM there was no wait at all as they are nestled in the One11 hotel and brand new. 

Food was devoured before we thought to take an pictures.
name: Batture Bistro and Bar

text:
This place looks a little off the beaten path. Parking was fine. The street was lined with cars when we went in and absolutely empty when we left (20-30 minutes inside), so definitely a poppin' place for lunch for locals, I assume. 

I got the fish poboy with no mayo so the bread was a bit dry, but the fish was moist and smooth and delicious and cooked to perfection! Combine that with the average shredded lettuce and tomato slice and we've got a pretty good sandwich! Gumbo was also good. Wasn't a fan of the hard greasy slice of toast it came with though. 

The ambiance is causal. Seems like everyone knows everyone. The bathroom was a little danky but it served its purpose. There's a corner sectioned off with signs saying you're not allowed in unless you're 18 or 21 (I forgot) ... not sure if a joke or they've got some adult games back there! Who knows!!
name: Koz's

text:
Just off Canal St. on North Broad, This is a great little market with all sorts of Central American cooking ingredients at really good prices. Yesterday, for instance, 10 limes for a dollar and fifty cent cilantro bunches. If you need tomatillos, they have the best prices in town.

Amazing produce prices & a great selection for Mexican or Central American-style cooking, plus most of the other things one would expect at a grocery store. I haven't tried the lunch counter in the back, but it all smells DELICIOUS! My favorite part about this Latin market is that it makes me feel like I have just stepped into another country.

The parking is sort of tight, especially around lunch time, but they have a few skinny spots behind the store.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: I went in late at night and had a great experience. Staff was friendly and food was prompt. I am not sure what made it so special but I tried their club sandwich and it was the best club sandwich I have ever had. Must have been the perfect ratio of all the ingredients. Will defiantly go back next time I am in town.
name: Daisy Dukes Diner

text:
Great prices, great service, great menu, and above average food. 

The wrap was stuffed with ingredients and they did not skimp on the avocado. 

The fried chicken was above average, had a super crispy batter so I recommend eating it ASAP to really experience the crisp! The batter had an ok flavor, just super salty. 

The fries were thin and well seasoned, no complaints there! These fries are better than any fast food joint, that's right I said it! 

Jambalaya was OK at best. It didn't taste bad by any means but was mediocre. Nothing too special about it, I would have to say their other sides are probably much better. The fries for sure. 

The biggest gripe would probably be parking, that lot stays packed. But what can ya do about it... Give Chap's a try, you won't be disappointed, especially for the price!
name: Chap's Chicken

text: We got a low carb king from Caluda's and it was delicious!! This is our first year doing Keto so it was nice to find a bakery that has low carb options. It was a lot more pricey than a regular sized king cake. It was the size of a small plate, not very big for $15. But we enjoyed it very much. Worth the price. It reminded me more of a cinnamon pound cake and a little more dense than the usual king cake. But again it was delicious and we didn't have to miss out on our Mardi Gras treat.
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text:
A great funky little coffee shop right on the Lafitte Greenway. Perfect place to stop while on bike or foot. I have been here often and have worked here. They have WiFi and outlets. The drinks are quality and they have a fizz bar (Sodajerks) that is awesome!! I love a good bubbly drink and these do not disappoint. 

This is very much a community feel here with everyone saying hello. Hey Coffee Co. hosts many events like latte art competitions and one event I saw recently was a Holiday Market. 

If you go here you'll be greeted warmly and will want to come back! It truly is unique and a treasure in the neighborhood.
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text:
We came here this morning for some coffee and baked goods. It's a cute spot where you walk up into a storefront vestibule and they bring everything out. There are some cafe tables outside for sitting, but since it had rained that morning, we just made a picnic under the awning around the corner.

We got two drip coffees that were strong and tasted fine, but seriously cannot believe that you would open a coffeeshop with neither cream nor half-and-half in stock (also, Whole Foods is two blocks away: why not make a quick run?). The whole milk didn't cut it for us. Our daughter's hot chocolate was solid. Baked goods (chocolate croissant and candied orange-currant scone) were not up to snuff: both were rubbery and didn't strike us as fresh.

Service was friendly and had we been able to cream our coffees the way we like to, this review would probably be a rounded-up four stars. We're not saying you shouldn't go here--you should because it's a sweet lil local business--but we think there's better to be had in the city.
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: One of the best fried chicken places I've ever eaten at. The chicken was fried when you order it instead of sitting under a heat lamp which made the experience much better than chicken that has been fried a long time ago. I ordered the jambalaya on the side which was pretty good but not my favorite the chicken far out rated anything else on the menu. It would be hard to beat this place for the price and the taste.
name: Chap's Chicken

text:
I live in Arizona but it has become a tradition each year for our family to order a king cake for Mardi Gras. I usually order from another place but they were sold out, so based on reviews, I went with Caluda's. I ordered a raspberry and cream cheese filled king cake. & Oh my goodness we are very happy that we found Caluda's. One of the best king cakes I have had so far and I have tried them from a few different places on my trips to NOLA.
FedEx had some issues getting it to me on time, but that is no fault of the business & even with the extra days the cake was still fresh and delicious. 
We will definitely make this our go to for king cake here at home, and when we visit New Orleans.
Looking forward to trying other flavors next season.
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text:
HEY Coffee Co. is amazing. I love this location because it's right on the Greenway. So fun to stop for an iced coffee on my way down to the Quarter. My favorite is their cold brew with a splash of cream. It's delicious!!!

COVID Stuff:
The inside is very small and is currently closed due to COVID, so they are only doing walk up service. They have tables outside and in the grass. It's really cute, actually. Gotta have a mask! 

Really though, I love this coffee co and everything they stand for. They lost their shop uptown this year so drop on by and support them on the Greenway :)
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: Overall, the coffee is delicious. There were no vegan food available, but there was oat milk for my latte. The coffee is strong, and super creamy. I bought a bag of coffee (Ethiopean) and a free BLM poster. This would definitely be more stars if i didn't come mid-pandemic during a heavy rain storm since there's an only take out window since it's considered a bar/night club/whatever.
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: LICHELLE is AMAZING!! She was so knowledgeable about everything  in the store! She went in Depth  about the different  coffees they offered and i was also able to try the draft cold brew coffee!! There was also a lil sexy foam on top of the coffee draft shot(I was so UP and ALERT AFTER  I must SAY!) She was friendly and really helpful. I ordered  a LATTE  and it was sooo delicious!+A!!!! The inside was nice and cozy with a window that got great sunlight !! I loved the whole set-up space wise.
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: Koz's is a great place for poboys and seafood. Came here for lunch today and was tempted to get their lunch special. Had to pass b/c my friend keeps raving about the bbq ham poboy so I gave it a try. The bbq ham is mouth-watering delicious!! Will definitely get the same poboy again. Great service! Seymour's, Red Wagon, and Kim Anh you now have some serious competition for my lunch money. I love all of you but Koz's may have just risen to the top of the lunch pecking order.
name: Koz's

text: Not sure why there aren't enough reviews of this place and photos of their food on Yelp...but I'll give my two cents. This was my first time at a Rotolo's, and everything was delicious. It seems like a casual place. The store was clean. They had nice food presentation. The service was pretty solid and accommodating. If you're looking for a perfect combo of quality and quantity when it comes to pizza, this is the place for you. In terms of quantity, they have all sorts of choices to choose from, all made from high quality ingredients. I think the photos speak for themselves. The crispness of the pepperonis were perfection. The dough was drenched in oil though. The calzone was so delicious with the vegetables in them. I will definitely be back to try the chicken wings, pasta, and other items on the menu.
name: Rotolo's Pizzeria

text: I was invited to a brunch for a close friend's birthday and I absolutely loved the space and the service. This place is it!  Upon entering the various spacious main room, there were tables and a lounge area so to speak and there was plenty of space. I was there on a weekend and there was not many people so I suggest that you go now!!  We gathered in the glass room that sits facing Decatur and also has a lovely view of the pool. The service was perfect. Our entire experience was on point from the beginning until the end.  Everyone in the group complimented the food. All I had was the waffles with pralines and bacon. Both were delicious. I can't wait to return.
name: Batture Bistro and Bar

text:
Definitely add this spot to your list for Happy Hour in New Orleans! Their HH is daily from 3-6pm and includes specials on drinks plus half off of their flatbread selections and half off of their deviled egg apps. Other than that, the food options are a bit expensive for what you get (flatbread is normally $15-16 without HH discount).

The vibe inside is really cool and it's a lot larger than what it looks like on the outside. Music was 5/5 for the indie electronic music fans. Service was also great and personable! A place to visit before dinner or when you want a chill happy hour. 

There's also a pool connected to the bar for hotel guests, which was pretty cool!
name: Batture Bistro and Bar

text:
Horrible customer service and communication for online orders, consider a different company for your King Cake needs if you actually want to celebrate. 

I placed an online order on January 29th for delivery on February 14th - a first King Cake surprise for my husband. 

The 14th arrives and nothing is delivered - disappointment for all. I contact the company on Saturday, February 15th since I also never received a tracking number. During my call they provide me with a tracking number and tell me that the order shipped late but should arrive by the evening of the 15th. 

I contacted FedEx with the tracking number and was informed that while Caluda's created a shipping label they actually never provided the package for shipment. I called Caluda's again and the customer service representative tracked the order and was confused when she saw that my order hadn't been shipped. She was supposed to check-in with her supervisor and call me back with next steps but never did. 

I called again today (2/19/20) to check-in since FedEx still hasn't received the order. This time the customer service representative was openly hostile and refused to let me talk to her supervisor while claiming that my item was sent to FedEx - regardless of the fact that FedEx's website clearly shows otherwise when the order is tracked. 

While this team is happy to take your money, they handle challenges extremely poorly. I'm going to submit a complaint through my bank. Next year I will go back to ordering from Randazzo's since they are reliable and respectful.
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text: The atmosphere is wonderful and the service was fantastic! So glad I choose to celebrate my anniversary here. Everything felt very safe and socially distanced.
name: Batture Bistro and Bar

text:
Such a pleasant experience with great food! We ate at Batture for brunch and the food, service, and atmosphere was fantastic. We were waiting in line for another local restaurant outside foreverrrr when my husband stumbled upon Batture nestled in a local hotel lobby. It was such a nice break from the crowds and heat of NOLA. The service was wonderful and the food was great. We are serious travel foodies and we're thoroughly impressed with the taste and quality. Don't follow the herd only to wait in  line for food that's half as good--head over to Batture before everyone else figures out what a gem this place is!

PS. This might not be a big deal to others, but I give bonus points for the bathroom. It was sooo nice and clean. Definitely a luxury in NOLA to have a nice toilet.
name: Batture Bistro and Bar

text: I don't know where to start, the good or the bad. I'm a fan of Caluda's King Cakes, particularly the cream cheese and the praline/cream cheese. I bought a praline/cream cheese king cake today and it was amazing, just as expected. It was very fresh and moist. I also bought the flavor of the week, chocolate chip cookie dough. It was a huge disappointment, just a big conglomerate of bread with hardly any cookie dough to be found. When I was finally able to find some cookie dough, it tasted like chocolate only. I didn't get any hint of cookie dough. It also was a bit dry. After today, I think I'll pass on trying any more flavors of week and stick to what I know is good.
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text: This is a simply an old style diner with good selections of breakfast and lunch.  Service is very friendly.  Ambiance is "happy days".  Pricing is very reasonable.  We love the breakfast offerings.  Lunch is pretty good too.   Recommended!
name: Daisy Dukes Diner

text:
Nice little coffee place with solid food and drink offerings and seating right next to the Lafitte Greenway. We got a cold brew, an iced chai, and praline-flavored king cake (it was the week before Mardi Gras). The king cake slice was baked by a local bakery, and they had a wide variety of flavor options, but we went with the novel praline flavor. Everything was delicious!

What really brought HEY Coffee Co to five stars for me was their social responsibility and mission. A portion of their profits go to local food security oriented non-profits and all of their products (including coffee) are all sustainably crafted. In addition, all of their surplus pastries go to a local community fridge at the end of the day, thereby eliminating food waste. How cool is that?
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text:
Located in Northern California. Ordered online, received in 2days via fedex as promised.
Delicious and fresh.
Good amount of diabetes..err, I mean icing just how I like it lol.

Was my first time trying King Cake, I will for sure use them for all my future King Cake purchases.

Cheaper than a lot of other websites as well.

Comes in a cool Mardi Gras FedEx box as well lol.

Only gripe is I wish they would hide the baby, instead of having it on top of the cake. No fun in finding out who gets the lucky slice!
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text: This was my first visit to this location. The menu is smaller than the others I have been to. The service was good, and the food was good as well. I got the 1/2 shrimp po boy and gumbo. My husband got the blt with an egg and a side of sweet potato fries. The shrimp was hot and cooked properly, and just needed a little salt. The gumbo was pretty thick but the flavor wasn't bad, although I probably would not get it again. My husband enjoyed his sandwich and his fries. The portions were decent for the prices. We would go back!

text:

Reply back to Owner "verifying" ..... what part of "tasteless food" didn't You understand????? text: Huge fan of Koz's! It's the true definition of a hole in the wall with great food like no other. They have a fairly large menu filled with daily specials, all sorts of poboys, salads, and Cajun dishes. They have local beers and a self serve fountain drink machine. The staff is super friendly and inviting and the food quality is always consistent and top notch! Definitely the perfect place for lunch with co-workers or dinner with the family! The gumbo was rich and filled with ingredients. The shrimp Creole was absolutely loaded with huge shrimp and was a fairly large portion. Give this place a shot, it's well worth the drive!
name: Koz's

text:
Beautiful breakfast.
Out of the way location.
You call to me still.

So, can I do all of my reviews in Haiku?
Probably not, but this is a special little place.
Just off the Airline in NOLA, is a little breakfast joint with substantial offerings.
I had the Breakfast Wrap, sausage, egg and cheese.
Beautiful, not fancy but then again I didn't want fancy.
Taste so darn good, and such low prices.
If you are not in the mood for some of the more artsy uptown digs, give this place a try.
Parking, good food, good coffee.
What more can you ask for?
name: Chap's Chicken

text:
Rotolo's is my go to place for an Italian salad. They are alway pretty, fresh and filling, providing multiple servings. This visit I tried their spinach dip with crostini instead of flat bread. The dip was pretty good, I just added a little more salt. Their pizzas, from past visits were delicious. My favorite is the Bayou BBQ that is topped with BBQ sauce, cheddar cheese, chicken, mozzarella, and red onions. Not a pizza you will find at other pizza chains. There are other extraordinary pizzas you can choose from on there menu. 
Not a big pizza eater but I visit this location more other often for the salad. The restaurant is alway clean, and the staff is always friendly and takes care of you.
name: Rotolo's Pizzeria

text:
A great funky little coffee shop right on the Lafitte Greenway. Perfect place to stop while on bike or foot. I have been here often and have worked here. They have WiFi and outlets. The drinks are quality and they have a fizz bar (Sodajerks) that is awesome!! I love a good bubbly drink and these do not disappoint. 

This is very much a community feel here with everyone saying hello. Hey Coffee Co. hosts many events like latte art competitions and one event I saw recently was a Holiday Market. 

If you go here you'll be greeted warmly and will want to come back! It truly is unique and a treasure in the neigjborhood
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text:
YOU WON'T ONLY BE SORRY, YOU WILL DIE OF THIRST..... a Bactrian camel could not survive we were so thirsty.......SAD THING IS THE STAFF COULD NOT CARE LESS...... Zero GLOVES WORN BY COOKS, kitchen help came out to get a drink and never the 1st handwashing......WOW!!

I don't know where to start. I live here in New Orleans, my brother and his daughters were in from Arizona. I was wanting to show them an iconic New Orleans Staples, such as Daisy Dukes. I remember when this place was American Pie Diner and it could not have been better. Upon Daisy Dukes taking over, service has declined, the quality of the product is not the same as they are at other locations, and the staff was inherently rude. Never mind the fact there were food particles all over the place and in this growing age of COVID-19, I felt very uncomfortable. Nevermind the fact there is no handwashing going on, people touching their faces that were behind the line and the service desk..... I did not see the first repository of hand sanitizer anywhere in the building nor did I noticed any red buckets for cleaning.

So, we walk in at 11:33 a.m., according to my Google timeline, and we then proceeded to sit there for about 5 minutes before a middle-aged woman, with a bad case of resting bitc* face, with pinkish hair, and a wrinkled face finally came over to us and dropped off menus. She then proceeded to handle other guests and sit at least two or three tables. Those tables got sat, they got served, and they got menus, they got drinks placed on their table, meanwhile, they entered the building 10 minutes after we did. At the 15 minute mark, she comes over to say "hey I have your drinks on the bar and I'm going to get them to you shortly." Another table comes in and they get from sat,, drinks, and menus. Meanwhile, I'm staring at a menu in a table with four other people and my brother says to me "is this the best New Orleans can do?" We persisted to wait while other guests continue to get served and handled before we did despite coming in after us. We never once had an interaction with this woman so it's not as if we're being unreasonable. We were just sitting here for 15 minutes and not one drink was placed on the table. After another 10 min, I finally asked her, "hey, other tables get served, sat, menus, and drinks. Why exactly is my table being made to suffer?" She again said "well your drinks are on the bar and I'm trying to do the best that I can", to which I responded, "well if this is the best you can do, it's definitely not good enough." "25 minutes and not even a drink..... she then snapped around and nastily claimed it hadn't been 25 minutes Honey, you lost the point. Take care of your customers and quit having personal conversations and you might be able to get something done

Stay away!  this place is horrible since Daisy Dukes has taken over and I could not be more disappointed at a New Orleans pillar of hospitality and foodservice.

YOU WON'T ONLY BE SORRY YOU WILL DIE OF THIRST..... a Bactrian camel could not survive we were so thirsty......

COVID-19 IS A REAL POTENTIAL HERE WITH THE DEPLORABLE CONDITIONS INSIDE......

PARCHED NEW ORLEANIAN!!
name: Daisy Dukes Diner

text: Kozs is tucked away in a corner off of hickory. When I worked I Harahan a few years ago, we even used to buy their huge poboys for work meals all of the time. Great for big families, offices, small groups, etc! The bread there is perfect poboy bread; slight chew, crunchy and fluffy. Be prepared for the crumbs and messy fingers, cause as we know, poboys are messy  worth it! I've had seafood all over Harahan and I find their fried seafood, and poboys, are the best balance of salt, flavor and crunchiness. You pop in, order your food and drinks at the front counter, and wait for your food within 10 minutes. The softshell crab poboy was my personal favorite.

text:
Larder Gourmet has the MOST DELICIOUS FOOD!  Everything on their menu is TRULY AMAZING!

It is  located  next to Trader Joe's on Veterans.

They even make their own breads for their sandwiches. Their cheeseburger and fries is the best I ever had. How about roasted turkey on  focaccia bread!

Their salads are FABULOUS with lots of choices. The food is so creative.

The soups are SPECTACULAR!  Lunch time is always busy.

The environment and dÃ©cor  is so beautiful.  The service and staff  are outstanding, friendly and with the best attitudes!

You go up to a counter to order, sit at tables  and the food comes out very quickly.  Many  people pick up their food to go and they also  have lots of  prepared foods to take home to in their cases.

They open for breakfast at 8:00 a.m. The avocado toast is to die for!

Larder is now open every Friday and Saturday night for dinner. My husband and I go every Saturday night. There are nightly specials.

The owner of Station 6 and a corporate chef from Emeril's are the team behind Larder.

If you are looking for very HIGH QUALITY FOOD IN A GORGEOUS RESTAURANT you must try Larder Gourmet.

It is our favorite place to eat in all of Metairie and New Orleans!

Once you go you will be addicted!
name: Larder Gourmet Market  Eatery
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Delis, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Bakeries

text:
Love it here. I can grab lots of Hispanic goodies and fresh, fresh fruit, get a taste of Hispanic/Latin music all while I head home. Hello, cactus ears... I've not seen those ANYWHERE, until now. 

I stopped in for an ensalada treat, buuuuuutttttt I didn't know the proper name, gotta get better with that; but I was able to get something similar to what I came for. Thanks be to God for my 'johnny on the spot' impromptu translator. Guess he felt sorry for me... I asked for the menu. Tuh. He said, "here's the menu right here" (pointing to the label in front of each food dish in the kitchen... Hello talked about embarrassed, the brown face turned BEET RED, well maybe not, but you get the picture. 

Everyone I encountered was nice, friendly, considerate & patient (which I need lots of).  Like a community of family & friends. 

I was floored once I stepped in, to hear the Latin music overhead and the bulk of the signage in Spanish... I knew then I'd frequent this place to bone up on my Espanol; just call me The Bilingual Babe!!!!

Nos Vemos!!!!
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: We stopped at Batture to celebrate two friends birthdays with a group of 12 over the weekend.  The restaurant is beautiful -- there are couches and tables so great place to hang out with a large group of friends.   We ordered several things off of the menu to split between everyone, and everything we ordered was FANTASTIC.  Specifically the flatbreads (we ordered 4 and they were all wonderful and not just your standard pizza), charcuterie board (the blue cheese was so good and I don't even like blue cheese!) and the boudin eggrolls.  Everything was very clean and felt safe considering the current covid guidelines.  We also tried several different cocktails and can't wait to go back to try more.  Would highly recommend stopping by when in the city.  The views from the rooftop are unbeatable, too!
name: Batture Bistro and Bar

text:
Mardi Gras is a state of mind. And Caluda's can help you keep that state of mind all year long with their outstanding King Cake. I first found out about King Cake at a Baton Rouge Yelp event on Zoom . It was supposed to be a bake-along event but I didn't bake; I watched and took notes from the chat, including a most important note about ordering King Cakes online from Caluda's. 

Which is exactly what I did. 

My King Cake was supposed to arrive a week before it did but in these crazy times in which we live, not only did we endure a pandemic but a massive ice storm in Texas shut down shipping impacting the whole country. I called Caluda's to see what was up and heard an outgoing message saying, basically, chill. Your cake will get there when it gets there and it will be fresh. 

Which it did and it was. 

Caluda's King Cake is yeasty, moist and flavorful. The icing is the perfect sugary compliment to the dough. And of course it's sprinkled with sugars  (purple for justice, green for faith, and gold for power.) It arrived on my doorstep with a Mardi Gras cup and three strings of Mardi Gras beads. Talk about putting me in the Mardi Gras spirit. Just what the doctor ordered as we come up on one year of pandemics, lockdowns and quarantines.
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text:
Â¡Ay, diÃ³s mÃ­o, amo este mercado! And since I'm moving a block down the street from it, I'm gonna be there a lot!

Their standard produce beats Rouse's prices a lot of the time, and then of course there's all the Hispanic food you can't find in regular grocery stores. The store is clean and fairly easy to move around in for a small place.

But the best thing about Ideal to me is the hot food counter! For $10 I left with enough barbacoa and black beans & rice for two big lunches. The beef was really flavorful, and not as greasy as some I've had. The beans and rice were above average also, and now that I live close, I'll never buy tortillas anywhere else.

It helps if you're ordering food to speak a little bit of Spanish, but I didn't see anybody having trouble getting it done. Getting out of a parking space is a bit of a mess, but I don't have to worry about that!
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: So glad I took a friend recommendations to try a new place for King Cakes. Since I went late in the day, they only had traditional  and Oreo Cream Cakes left. I purchased the Oreo Cream Cakes and was also tempted to purchase a mini individual size traditional king cakes also. I've always get our King Cakes from Haydel Bakery, which I had some earlier in the Mardi Gras season. We were having a get together so I decided to bring a King Cake from a different place to try. We had Caluda's Oreo Cream Cakes and also Dong Phuong King Cakes. Most of use enjoyed the Caluda's better then from Dong Phuong. Caluda's is moist and fresh and cinnamon taste with Oreo Cream in the middle. The shop keeper recommend to go early if I want different flavors next time because I wanted to try their raspberries cream cheese king cake. They serves fresh king cakes to the New Orleans Metro Area year-round so I might just come when it dies down.
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text: Apple flan... that's all they needed to tell me and I was sold! I love apples and I love flan, so this king cake was perfect for me. First off, Caluda's main location was easy to get to. Customer service was great and they know what they're doing when it comes to king cakes. The box was sealed nicely with plastic to keep cake fresh. There is a small section on the box, where you can see part of the king cake. Just looking at it was a treat... so aesthetically pleasing. Opening it and smelling it was the best, but tasting it was the absolute bestest. Before I get into the taste, let me just tell you how beautiful of a presentation the king cake was, with sliced apples layered over the top topped with edible glitter. It looked too beautiful to eat. I couldn't resist and had to cut into it and start chowing down. The cake itself was so moist and the layer of flan was incredible + the apples took the cake. I was in heaven. This was the best $32 I ever spent on a king cake and I would do it over and over again! There are no places in Baton Rouge that do this, so I was glad to be able to get down to NOLA the day before Mardi Gras to grab one. Caluda's... I'm a fan for life =)
name: Caluda's King Cake
address: 1536 River Oaks Rd W, Ste A
categories: Bakeries, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts, Event Planning & Services, Caterers

text: This places food was great, I had the two egg breakfast i got grits, bacon, a biscuit, I added blueberry pancakes. Everything was so good!! The grits were the best I ever had, they were buttery and creamy. The pancakes had real blueberries in them and it was so good I didn't need the syrup. They were thick and fluffy.. The biscuit was huge and it was moist buttery crispy. It was great. Wish I got a picture before I ate lol. My fiancÃ© got a 6 inch fish poboy and a 6 inch shrimp poboy they had the really poboy bread, it was more than 6 inches probably about 8 it was a whole filet of fish on it and the shrimp poboy didn't have many shrimp in my opinion but they were real shrimp and they were the big shrimp you would boil, he didn't care for them he said they were shrimpy and he tasted the grease first than shrimp after and he didn't care for the batter it was fried in. They use romaine lettuce for poboy & the fruit cup comes with strawberries, blueberries, 1/4 banana and melon.
name: Daisy Dukes Diner

text: I stumbled upon this cute little coffee shop on a backstreet, on my way to pick my boyfriend and family up for lunch. It gave me all the hipster vibes and reminded me of home (The Bay Area) which I greatly appreciated. I got a couple of Americanos and they were perfectly prepared. Such a friendly, colorful little spot, I loved the plants - if I lived in the city I'd definitely be a regular.
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: Ignore the negative reports. I have now eaten here twice. Staff is attentive and extremely friendly. Food is honest, fresh and what you would expect from a traditional diner. The pancakes are some of the best I've ever had in a diner. Again, don't expect gourmet food at a diner and you will not be disappointed!
name: Daisy Dukes Diner

text:
HEY Coffee Co. is amazing. I love this location because it's right on the Greenway. So fun to stop for an iced coffee on my way down to the Quarter. My favorite is their cold brew with a splash of cream. It's delicious!!!

COVID Stuff:
The inside is very small and is currently closed due to COVID, so they are only doing walk up service. They have tables outside and in the grass. It's really cute, actually. Gotta have a mask! 

Really though, I love this coffee co and everything they stand for. They lost their shop uptown this year so drop on by and support them on the Greenway :)
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: Amazing service, food, drinks, and ambiance. My husband and I loved experiencing drinks and food on the porch. My cab was excellent and my husband loved his marg. The flatbreads are excellent. I highly recommend!!!

text:
I popped over here to grab some donuts from PawPaw's donuts (he was doing a pop up here) and that how I discovered this little gem. While I was there, I ordered coffee, a slice of quiche and a breakfast taco. 

The quiche was the largest slice of quiche I had ever seen. I have a big mouth but I couldn't open wide enough to bite into this slice of heaven! And it was the creamiest, flavorful and most decadent slice of quiche I have ever devoured. 

The breakfast tacos were flavorful and packed solid with deliciousness. Nothing skimpy about them.

I will definitely return!
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text:
Such a cute spot near Lakeside mall and Trader Joe's in Metairie. I was pleasantly surprised to see this was not only a sit-down with a full menu; however, they had plenty of food and prepped meals in ready to go refrigerators.

Although they serve plenty of coffee this isn't a coffee shop and more of a sit-down eatery. There isn't any plug-ins so if you do want to execute some laptop work, make sure your computer is fully charged.

I had an off menu item and had a makeshift sausage and cheese biscuit sandwich. The biscuit was so buttery and flaky. Damn that biscuit was amazing! As for the sausage patty it was delicious and actually fit the whole biscuit. Mad props for them using white cheddar btw!

I'll be back when I'm in the neighborhood.
name: Larder Gourmet Market  Eatery
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Delis, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Bakeries

text:
I phoned the order in and was told food would be ready in 16 mins. We arrived about 20 mins later and the pizza was not even in the oven. Had to wait about another 25 mins. 

The wings were very good but the sauce on the pizza is a sweeter taste than we were used to but also had a spicy bite. I would not recommend this restaurant.
name: Rotolo's Pizzeria

text:
I ordered the Larder Whoppa and an iced vanilla latte for lunch today. A little bit more pricey than a double quarter pounder combo at Mickey D's but definitely well worth it. This is a double meat cheeseburger with bacon tomato jam and pickles. Ok the pickles are nit house made but heck, the burger is prepared fresh when you order it! The fries are shoestring with a salt and pepper dusting that is perfect - don't smother these slivers of pure carbs with ketchup, they are perfect as they are and also prepared fresh!

The latte was good also but the large is not large enough for me (just kidding I love a lotta latte).

I'll be back to try the Cuban and maybe the turkey sandwich. Being in Metairie, it's not convenient for a trip from the Raceland/Houma but it's a good reason to justify trips to the Metairie area with a side trip to do something else.
name: Larder Gourmet Market  Eatery
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Delis, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Bakeries

text: I'm a huge fan of Station 6, so when I learned Larder was opening up, I immediately became a happy camper. After two failed attempts at making it during lunch hours, I finally made it! My co worker and I ordered and were able to find seating with no problem. I ordered the meatloaf sandwich which was one of the best I've had in a while with a side gem salad. My co worker ordered the Asian chicken salad. Both of us throughly enjoyed our food. As we were getting ready to leave, we were approached by a server that the lunch crowd was coming in, and that we would need to leave so that their would be space for other customers. Did anyone ask if we would be enjoying coffee or dessert or even possibly wine since we were paying customers? Not at all. They just assumed we were sitting around leisurely and that we had no plans of leaving anytime soon. I completely get that this is a small establishment and they are incredibly busy at lunch. And it would be understandable if we were sitting there for an extended amount of time of not eating and then were approached. But to flat out ask someone to get up after only being done with their meal for five minutes is incredibly offensive and unprofessional. I would love to try more menu items at Larder and recommend it to friends, family and co workers. But I would hate for someone to receive the same type of treatment that I received.
name: Larder Gourmet Market  Eatery
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Delis, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Bakeries

text: The Greek omelette was amazing. I added their homemade salsa and it have it v an extra kick. Don't sleep on the homemade biscuits. My team ate chicken and waffles. I almost hurt myself.... so tasty and juicy. Charmaine and Brittney were gracious hosts!
name: Daisy Dukes Diner

text:
Looking for a night out by an open fire and a few small bites or a date night? This is the place to be.
There's also an outdoor pool which adds to the overall aesthetic. Truly one of a kind in this area. 

Although I didn't get a chance to enjoy time by the fire pit, I enjoyed the cozy indoor setting. I was informed that an outside group reserved the area while a convention was in town.

Currently the menu is a bit limited, but there's still a few good options available. The crab cakes initially seemed small but they were packed with flavor, absolutely no filler which I always love. A true crab cake. Garnished with corn and avocado the flavors truly are something I could enjoy time and time again.  For this reason alone I will be back. The flat bread pizza was decent, I wouldn't recommend it if you're truly looking for something appetizing. 

My server was extremely attentive which is always a plus when dining out. The chef stopped by and was also pleasant. I hope next time I stop by the hand bites are available and I can enjoy the crab cake hand bite. 

There is a parking lot immediately adjacent where you can pay per hour. Given the time and day you visit you may be able to find street parking.

This place is definitely a hidden gem, I will be back as long as they are around. Hoping to get my chance to warm up next to the fire pit. It would be a great addition if there were two.
name: Batture Bistro and Bar

text:
If you are shipping a cake, think twice. While the king cake itself (if you are taking it home to eat) is ok, they charge more for shipping than they do for the cake. The shipping is "overnight " with FedEx. Good luck with that. More like 2-3 day shipping, but you still get to pay the overnight rate. I hope you like your king cake stale.
I reached out to customer service and was told there was nothing they could do. They argue with the carrier every year about this. Then why are you using that carrier?  And why are you charging me an arm and a leg for a service you know you aren't going to deliver?
name: Caluda's King Cake

The menu: combinations of gourmet meats, cheeses, breads and curated veggies, bakery items and gelato.

Will take me a lifetime to explore everything they have to offer.

text: Chap's chicken is very good! I got chicken strips, red beans and rice, fries, and green beans. Everything was very tasty. The workers were very friendly, and their sweet tea is AMAZING. I highly recommend chap's chicken if you're in the mood for some southern fried chicken!

text: Stopped in for brunch and everything was amazing. From the decor to the staff to the food. I can't recommend this place enough. Everybody in my party ordered something different and we all were extremely happy with the food.
name: Daisy Dukes Diner

text:
Another of the many family seafood restaurants in the metro area.  And its just not seafood.  They have a great selection of poor boy sandwiches and hot plates.  You walk up to the counter, study the menus on the walls, and place your order.  Then find a table, and go over to the side counter to pour your own drinks before sitting down.

Most of the time I order either the shrimp poor boy or the fried shrimp plate.  On the most recent visit, I had the plate with sides of fries and Italian green beans, along with a piece of toasted french bread.  The shrimp came out crisp from the fryer.  Just as I like them.  My wife caused some problems as she ordered a 1/2 shrimp and 1/2 fish poor boy without the bread, dressed on the side.  The poor lady taking the order was all confused.  Why was she ordering a poor boy without the bread?  (She didn't want the the carbs from the bread and wasn't hungry enough for a full plate.)  Anyway, we finally convinced her that we knew what we were doing.  My wife was real happy with the catfish as it was crisp and light.  And nibbled on my sides.

Nothing fancy or pretentious about this place, just good food at fair prices.  What else can you ask for from a neighborhood restaurant?
name: Koz's

text: This is a welcome addition to metairie. I love this new addition. Outdoor seating and plenty of seating inside. They sell wine, cheese, hot meals, desserts. The cupcakes were amazing! I had my street corn salad. I liked it but I wished it would have tasted more like straight up street corn. The cashier lady was super friendly and recommended a great wine to pair with the salad. It was a savignon Blanc and I ended up purchasing a bottle on the way out. They also have counter service so easier for splitting checks. This place is popular for breakfast but it's a good lunch spot too. I really need to go back and eat thr rest of those cupcakes!

text: The chicken was so juicy and crunchy! Seasoned perfectly.  For me, Eating fried chicken is a splurge. Hard to find a place that can do fried chicken well.  Perplexing to me but unfortunately it is very true.  Sides were very good as well.  This is my new favorite place for fried chicken!

text:
I have been wanting to check out this spot since I saw the sign that it was open! So, today, I decided I would venture out for lunch. 

You can sit wherever, at least during lunchtime. I sat near the TV because I wanted to look outside. I ordered a rum punch, because it was that kind of day. It was delicious! Not too strong, which I prefer. Their drink list is beautiful, so I'd love to return sometime when I can sample more (heheheh). 

For lunch, I ordered the gulf shrimp handheld. It is shrimp with remoulade and slaw on french bread. It was so refreshing! It comes with chips, which were a nice change from fries. The other item was pickled yellow squash, onion, and sun-dried tomatoes. Yummy.

 For dessert (yes, I'm gluttonous, whatever), I ordered the godiva chocolate mousse. O. my. godddddd - UHHHHH I can't even believe how amazing it was.... It was sooooo good. It had three raspberries on top and some raspberry puree on the bottom. I can't talk about it, it was so good. 

Anyway, check out this place! Lunch is Thursday and Friday from 11-2 (or 3, I forget), but they're open for lunch!
name: Batture Bistro and Bar

text:
Delicious food, fast service, beautiful brunch atmosphere! 

We sat outdoors and enjoyed the beautiful weather almost as much as the food. We ordered the boudin egg rolls after seeing a couple of pictures of them on other reviews. They were probably my favorite thing we ordered! Absolutely delicious and spicy (thank God!). We also had the bananas foster waffles which were great. They taste just like the dessert - rich and sweet. My husband ordered the avo trio and it did not disappoint. The star of his show, however, was the alligator sausage. The only thing that didn't have the "wow" factor for us was the deviled eggs. 

Everything was excellent and we look forward to returning!
name: Batture Bistro and Bar

text: I love this lil gem of a market! I come here whenever I'm inspired to cook Mexican as everything here really is a bargain. I've previously come here to collect ingredients to make pozole and this was the place to go to as they had everything on my list. Today, I stopped by to gather the essentials for chorizo tacos. I was feeling a lil lazy so I bought the pre-maid pico and guac and DANG, I was not disappointed. The guac was silky smooth as opposed to the chunky kind at Whole Foods (that would leave your wallet empty and wouldn't deliver on flavor). I picked up the chorizo, queso fresco, tortillas and cilantro and under $20, taco night was in full swing. I couldn't recommend this market more.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text: Love at first bite! The food the amazing and the ambience is spectacular. I feel like I am in NYC in the middle of Metairie. I had the Fall Salad which could be easily split three ways for the generous size. You can enjoy a nice glass of wine with lunch or pick up a bottle and prepared food for a nice dinner at home. I plan on becoming a regular.

text:
Larder is such a gem!  

Occasionally I work in Metairie and have been looking forward to giving Larder's salads a try. I made it happen and color me impressed. 

They are located on Vets and have a drive thru. I checked the drive thru order board and it lists coffees and other breakfast items, so I parked and went in to get my salad fix.

I was greeted at the counter and chose a shrimp and street corn salad. It was killer!  The shrimp were PERFECTLY cooked, and the dressing was delicious!  Every component of this salad worked. There was a slight kick of heat from the poblanos and the kale was as fresh as fresh gets.

I've been a loyal customer of Station 6 which is owned by the same restauranteur. If you're  a fan of Station 6 I feel confident that you'll like Larder as much as I do.

#ThankyouThursday2021
name: Larder Gourmet Market  Eatery
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Delis, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Bakeries

text: Caluda's is my go to King Cake shop!  They always keep you coming back with the flavor of the week. Some past favorites have been the cookie dough stuffed king cake, the white chocolate bread pudding stuffed king cake, and the bananas foster stuffed king cake. If you are more of a purist you can not go wrong with just an original or cream cheese King Cake from Caluda's. The line here can get pretty long some mornings, but the staff is extremely efficient and usually keeps the line moving pretty quickly.

text:
I grabbed lunch here this past weekend at and loved it! The Fall Salad was amazing--roasted turkey, goat cheese, dried cranberries, butternut squash, pecans, and couscous with a satsuma vinaigrette! This is the perfect spot to grab soup, salad, or a sandwich. They also have prepared foods you can take home with you, pastries, and coffee. 

The salads are pretty decent size for the price (it is on the pricier side though). Overall, I will definitely be back!

text:
So as soon as I walk-into Larder Gourmet there's a line and I heard the guy from the (side counter) say " I can take whoever's next, from here" I literally stood right in front of him and no one was coming towards him. So I went next, as soon I get to order. There is this (white middle 30's lady) turn around and tried to get to the counter to order, and realized I was already trying to order and backed up and said "it's okay" so moving forward I get to order and I wait. The white lady found her seat and sat down. I looked right at her to see if she was going to speak to me. BUT she looked like to was to good to talk to someone. 
I ABSOLUTELY LOVE how people can think they are to privileged for other people, and this lady THOUGHT she was one of them! 

I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THE LARDER GOURMET I EAT THERE ALL THE TIME! The employees are so generous and very nice! but I hate the fact that people (customers) think they can be too privileged for others. 

So next time you think your too good for others REMEMBER! You never know until you open your heart and eyes to feel and see how people feel! 

THANK YOU LARDER GOURMET FOR AN AWESOME LUNCH AND AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE.
name: Larder Gourmet Market  Eatery
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Delis, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Bakeries

text:
Metairie desperately needs more places like Larder! It's a mixture of a quick service restaurant, pre made meals, cheese shop, coffee shop, and gift shop. They also sell local items such as French Truck coffee and gelato from Piccola Gelateria. Not only is the food great for breakfast or lunch, but it's also a great place to pick up a quick gift. It's my go to place to grab some ready made meals to deliver to a friend in need. They have awesome salads. I've tried almost all of them and I've never been disappointed.     The turkey meatloaf and mac & cheese is a good comfort meal. It's also a great place to get a glass of champagne and a cheese board. 

The people are always super helpful and friendly so anytime you're not sure what to get, just ask!
name: Larder Gourmet Market  Eatery
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Delis, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Bakeries

text:
I'm from outside New Orleans, but recently moved to Oakland, CA. I frequently Hey! On a monthly basis, as I love specialty coffee and this shop is very consistent and in a few great locations in the city.

My friend Devin, who is a local roaster in Hammond, LA and I had been talking about Yemeni coffee and trying to get our hands on some. For those unfamiliar, Yemen was one do the first places coffee was grown and cultivated. It's also a hard region to export from, modern-day. I was very pleasantly surprised when this showed up at my door, sent from Devin!

I brewed a cup immediately using my Hario V60, and it was fresh and bright. The jasmine came out for me in the tasting notes, giving it a light and almost tea-like body. 

I've always loved this space to frequent, but this was an extra special surprise!
name: HEY Coffee Co.
categories: Coffee Roasteries, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes

text: After working a 14 hours shift, this place was the savior for dinner and it was Delicious!!! It had a nice little kick but not too much to where my toddler ate his entire piece!  Fries were crispy and seasoned well.  Mac and cheese was good!!  The cashier was polite and threw in a serving of a wing sauce I was interested in while reading the menu.  And the Jerk wing sauce was KILLER!!  I've passed this place probably 50 times while living in the area, but now I know how good it is!!!  Will be back!!

text:
How am i just now discovering this spot. I'm kinda kicking myself in the ass for taking so long to discover Ideal Market. I would've had no idea this market existed had it not been for one of my friends.

Ideal Market has everything your Latinx heart could desire, and there were so many finds which reminded me of my hometown, El Paso. This market has a little bit of everything for every Latinx community and it was so cool, seeing it all under one roof.

I'm super happy to know this market will have some of the specific items, I crave or want time to time. This will be more of a frequent stop for myself! Expect fresh produce, panaderia, a hot station, fresh tortillas and bolillos, tons of various candies and chips, and even a few childhood faves like guava pasta, flan kits, and more.
name: Ideal Market
categories: International Grocery, Restaurants, Grocery, Latin American, Food

text:
Was craving Chinese this weekend so checked out Yelp to see what others were saying about the sad state of Chinese affairs in New Orleans.

This place came up and was ranked pretty high. Since it's down the street from me, I decided to check them out. Tried to find their menu online but wasn't able to track one down. Figured it was Chinese so I could wing it. Placed a to go order and was told it'll be ready in 10 mins. 

Despite myself, I went ahead and headed down there. When I got there, there was one person in front of me. She was paying for her order then promptly sat down at one of the 3 tables in the place. The lady behind the counter looked at me, stared then went back into the kitchen..

10 minutes later, she emerged again when the other lady's food was ready. Still no acknowledgment but we've already had a 2 min. staring contest so I know she's seen me. 

Finally when she handed the bag to the other customer did she ask,"What do you want?" I told her I was here to pick up. Without saying a word, she went back into the kitchen. 

15 minutes later, she comes back with the bagged food in hand. Checks me out and I promptly head home. 

Sweet and sour soup- pretty good. Lots of stuff in there. Good flavors. 
Crab rangoons- have no idea why other Yelpers are raving about them....I've definitely had better. Tasted like they were fried in really old oil. And they soaked up most of the grease. 
Boneless chicken (lunch special)- good amount of food. Flavorful veggies and decent chicken

So overall, I'll probably order again since they're in my neighborhood. But only if Yummy Yummy is closed for the night.
name: Ming Garden

text:
So I've been a very loyal customer to Ming Garden for the past 3 years solid. 

The food quality is still good... the customer service/ attention to detail has gone WAY downhill. 

They CONSTANTLY forget parts of your order (they leave eggrolls out, sauce, sometimes entire dishes) so ALWAYS check to make sure you got what you ordered. 

The final straw that made me start the search for a new cheap chinese place was when they gave me a completely separate dish that looked exactly like what I normally order... until you bite into it. 

I've regularly had to make this a 2 trip pick up no matter how hard I check the food outside of just biting into all of it at the restaurant.
name: Ming Garden

text:
All around a decent take-out Chinese restaurant.

Since my job has moved, so too, have I had to find a new take-out Chinese place and I'm glad this place is here.

The reason I'm giving this place 3 starts instead of 4 or 5 is because:
1) The parking SUCKS
2) Their rice is just... ok. It's that yellow fried rice that just doesn't have the same taste
3) Their pepper steak wasn't as flavorful as it could be. Seemed bland.

But even with that going on, I'll still eat here once a week or so because their Seseme Chicken is EXCELLENT (hot, crunchy on the outside, soft and tender on the inside and lots of sauce), their Hunan Beef is damn good and they will do just about ANYTHING, it seems, to please the customer.

Their prices are just right, too.

The older gentleman might not be good with his english, but he knows how to treat customers with warm friendly service. Sometimes, maybe too friendly. I've seen him try his best to please some pretty nasty customers. Nasty customers that are either just plain stupid or who are just naturally ill-mannered. He doesn't care. He will do his best to please them and make them happy.
name: Ming Garden

text: Well worth adding to your take-out options if you leave in the area. As others have noted, the portions are generous, the place is clean, the staff is friendly, and the food is good. Won't knock your socks off but you won't be disappointed. We've gone twice so we've had 4 entries. The shrimp in the shrimp with lobster sauce are huge. The spicy garlic chicken and the muu shu pork were both good ... this is NOT one of the places that piles on the grease and leaves you feeling ill afterward. Our only disappointment was the spare ribs were very fatty so I would skip them. The nonspicy dishes are pretty mild but you can always add salt or your own spices if you want to.

text:
Ehhhh.

My quest for good chinese food continues. I was excited to see Orange Chicken on the menu. Alot of places around here dont have it, and its my fav. sigh.

But then I was dissapointed when I opened the box to see what was basically chicken fingers with orange sauce on it. The menu did say it was "battered" but thats normal for the orange chicken, seasame chicken, and general tso's chicken. It has a crispy coating that I love. Not this orange chicken. It was a thick batter that got soggy from the sauce.  The flavor of the sauce was good. I might ask to have them prepare the chicken another way next time and see if the accomodate.  

Not completely horrible, I'd try it again.
name: Ming Garden

text: The food is inexpensive, and always arrives hot. The food has a decent flavor and is ready quickly after ordering. The reason why I give it 2 stars is because there's a lot of shady people who lurk in front of the restaurant who beg for either food or money. They're pushy and it's an uncomfortable situation to try to avoid them just to get lunch. The employees don't do anything to try to get the shady people to leave. I get that it's located in not the greatest neighborhood, but at least look out for your customers!

text:
I get the General Tso's chicken or Sesame chicken combo plate. Both are very delicious. 
The shrimp fried rice and shrimp Lo Mein is also really good. 
One of the better Chinese food I've had in the city. 
The combo plate also comes with a shrimp egg roll which I love since I don't eat pork. It sometimes is too greasy which only allows me to have two bites of the egg roll, but those two bites are awesome.

I give 3 stars due to the service. The older man is very sweet but he mostly works in the back. They do have a kid working the front most times, taking orders and working the register. This kid is ruthless! I've heard him being very disrespectful to customers and has created many awkward situations. But what can you expect from a kid, no filter. Other than that food is ready in 10 min and they have fair prices. And I always have leftovers. 

So if you want some good General Tso I recommend this place.
name: Ming Garden

text:
I live a couple of blocks from this place and eating there with increasing frequency, so I thought it might be time to write a review.

As the previous reviewer stated, the crab rangoon is great!  The sesame chicken and triple delight are also particularly good.  I have a somewhat sensitive stomach and nothing I've eaten here has thrown me for a loop.  

The portion sizes are huge and the prices are cheap.  The combo dinners are enough for two adults with leftovers for lunch.  The standard a la carte items are enough for 4 people with healthy appetites.

The folks who work there are super nice, so go out and support your local Chinese take-out restaurant!

text:
A small, family-owned restaurant with a few dine-in (super-casual) tables and takeout.  The food is always delicious, and the service welcoming and attentive.  I often order the Thai Panang curry, and it is excellent -- your choice of meat or tofu in a savory coconut broth with vegetables.  The steamed white rice is as good as the best I've had anywhere.  The staff are happy to make special orders (leave out this, add that, make this dish with a different sauce, make a Combination Plate not listed on the menu, etc.).  I appreciate the number of vegetarian options on the menu, as well as the choice of shrimp egg rolls along with pork.  
I have never been disappointed with my order here, and I live around the corner, and often get takeout.
name: Ming Garden

text: My second only review of anything ever goes out to this lovely gem! I like to think I know everything mid-city, but I guess the WB has gotten to me! Anyways, I had an awesome experience at the cafe! The service was outstanding! It was like being at a casual hip Commander's Palace the way they treat you like royalty! By the time I left, I knew most of the staff! The lovely owner gave me a tour of the place to show me the beautiful back courtyard and rooftop seating which will be wonderful when it is not 100 degrees! Great place to watch a game. I had the Impossible Sliders which tasted like real hamburgers. They were great! It's a nice meet-up spot with an amazing vibe and good music. We were the last ones there (I hate being that person.), but they encouraged us to feel comfortable to stay and our server who had to leave early switched us off to the rad bartender without telling us just so we wouldn't feel rushed and have to have 2 tabs. I usually don't go back to many places due to the plethora of options in this city, but I promise you I'll be back. I was passing out menus at work today because it is so close. They have a mix of vegan and vegetarian but also other options such as Thursday Steak Night. Give it a try and support your small business owners!
name: SoulÃ© Cafe
categories: Vegan, Desserts, Restaurants, Soul Food, Vegetarian, Food

text:
Small, cozy, little Chinese lunch counter. There is a small amount of seating, I counted enough room for a total of 12 people to sit down and enjoy their lunch in-house. We got ours to go. 

Decent, yes, but 5-stars, not so much.

We had the crab rangoon, which is actually Krab rangoon, not bad, but not crab either. The portions were huge, the flavors were nice. We spent $22 and ate on it for several meals. 

The lunch deal with your choice of entree with rice and a drink for $6 is easily enough for two. I had the Triple Delight which was delightful, loads of fresh vegetables along with beef, chicken and very big shrimp.

It was 'A-OK'. It was fast and economical, but not the best I've ever had, not even close.
name: Ming Garden

text:
Unfortunately, I dropped my rating by 2 stars due to my most recent visit.

This time I ate in the restaurant. The service was great, but the food was close to awful.

Initially, I ordered the vegan gumbo and my friend ordered the tofu stir fry. Later, the cook informed my friend that he didn't have anymore tofu for the stir fry, so he ordered the shrimp.

My friend said his food was bland. Then I got my vegan gumbo which was just roux and white rice. I asked where was the Beyond sausage, and was informed that they did not have anymore. Why didn't the cook inform me when he informed my friend? Or at the very least, why not add some vegetables to the gumbo to replace the faux meat?

However, they offered to make me something else. I ordered the jack fruit burger with sweet potato fries. The burger was miserable and tasteless. The saving grace were the fries. I don't know if there was a different cook from the first day I ordered food from here, but I was extremely disappointed.
name: SoulÃ© Cafe
categories: Vegan, Desserts, Restaurants, Soul Food, Vegetarian, Food

text:
Simply put - there is no one better in the business. A group of 12 of us came to New Orleans this past weekend to celebrate my buddy's bachelor party and we wanted a unique experience that would gave us a true taste of New Orleans and its great food. Although Shaggy was out of town - his friend Cory hosted a Shrimp and Crab boil for us in his yard (coincidentally the same place Shaggy hosts his boils for Jazz Fest) . The set up was so sick and it provided a great place in the evening to chill, pig out, and enjoy our Keg. Cory was a spectacular boil master and a great person to hang out with. 

There literally is no reason not to have a boil hosted by the Crawfish King. The Jambalaya was honestly that best we've ever had - we ended up taking the leftovers not only for late night, but for lunch the next day as well. My buddy told me the boil was one of his favorite parts of the trip and I can't help but agree. When/if I'm ever down in New Orleans again you better bet another boil will be in the plan. I've already recommended it to friends considering New Orleans for a bachelor party or if they are ever down with a big group.
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue
