text:
What a breath of fresh air in a sea of loud, crowded bars.

My wife and I spent a long weekend in New Orleans last month, playing tourist since she had never been. One afternoon we were walking the city -- checked out Louis Armstrong Park then headed back toward the French Quarter.

As we crossed the street, I spotted Rampart Treehouse. Hmmm -- looked kind of interesting from the outside. We decided to stop in for a drink -- excellent decision!

Not crowded at all when we arrived, friendly bartender, and great music. The interior decor is amazing -- you could spend an afternoon just taking it all in. Uniquely cool.

We were thirsty so we ordered a couple of drinks based on a flavored vodka. They were excellent -- very well crafted by our bartender. After we finished those off, we ordered two more. Just as good as the first round.

We weren't hungry so didn't order the pizza. Apparently flaming pizza (yes -- it's ON FIRE) is a thing here -- wish I had known. I would have definitely ordered a slice just to Instagram it.

Oh. And Madame Laveau lived nearby (1020 St. Ann -- right down the street) and her ghost may stop by for a visit from time to time. Be sure to keep an eye out for her.

Anyway, based on the overall vibe, music, friendly service, and excellent drinks, gotta give Rampart Treehouse 5 stars.

A great find.
name: Rampart Treehouse
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Pizza, Beer Bar, Bars, Nightlife, Salad

text: This pizza place isn't like any ordinary one you've been to because the decorations in here are weirdly amazing. There's a whole tree set up in the middle of the parlor, beautiful wall art all over, and the restroom.... I don't want to spoil how awesome it looks inside, you just have to go see for yourself (I will say I'm sure lots of selfies have been taken in that restroom haha). About the pizza: it's good pizza!!! I mean there's not much to say other than it's good and one $5 slice is enough to fill you up! I highly recommend stopping by here.
name: Rampart Treehouse

text: I am home in New Orleans for the first time since the pandemic and really wanted to order from Five Happiness restaurant in Carrollton. My Uber Eats and Door Dash app showed the restaurant as closed so I ordered from this awful place because the ratings were pretty good and they are relatively close to where I'm lodging. Long story short, this was the worst Chinese I've ever tasted in my life. The egg rolls where meatless although they should have been shrimp and pork. The shrimp fried rice was loose in a styrofoam container. Everyone in New Orleans is accustomed to having the rice packed in the container. In top of that, the shrimp were not fresh shrimp and looked like they were just thrown in the container. There isn't enough seasoning or fried egg and there is nothing about the rice that remotely seems like it's been in a wok. AND it's yellow! The shrimp toast was burnt and tasted so weird that I spit out the bite I took and told my family not to eat it. It also has a strange smell and has a grayish color. Lastly, I ordered beef with broccoli and shrimp with broccoli. Honestly, I don't know how a restaurant this bad is surviving in a city like New Orleans. Both dishes ere mostly broccoli with the exact same weird reddish brown sauce that I have never seen before on either dish. Shameful and I waisted $50 for food no one can eat.
name: Ming Garden

text:
The CRAWFISH!!!!! That's it! That's the review! 

This new gem in the city is guaranteed to be busy on a regular. Stopped by on Super Bowl Sunday with the kids for a quick snack and they did not disappoint. 

The shrimp were well seasoned, juicy, and easy to peel. Not to mention they were boiled to perfection! The sausage was fresh with just the right bit of spice. We also tried the "Soul Roll" which was AMAZING! Tender well seasoned bbq pork mixed with succulent Mac and cheese wrapped in a roll and then fried.... YES PLEASE! The crawfish! Perfectly seasoned, a little spice but not too much, and reasonably priced today at $5.49/lb. definitely worth it!
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text:
First thing you want with a caterer is quality food. Shaggy and his crew delivered. We hosted a shrimp & crab boil with gumbo for 25 out of town guests and the food was loved by all. Great flavor, just the right spice. 

The service on the day of the boil was fantastic. Chris set us up, kept things loose and made us feel like he wanted our boil to be a success. Kelly stayed on all night and was there for everything we needed.  He went above and beyond to make sure our guests enjoyed themselves. 

Not a critique, more of a heads up, the planning communication is a little sparse. They delivered on EVERYTHING we asked for but there were times I wonder if they would. I won't doubt them again.
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text:
I was in the area and was looking to try a new vegan place and decided to try Soule Cafe.  The menu looked interesting so I ordered the 3-veggie plate which came with sweet potato fries, vegan nuggets, and vegan mac n cheese; I also ordered impossible sliders as well.  

The restaurant used to be a grilled cheese place and now they are a vegan place - it looks somewhat similar from the inside and outside, but there were some modifications that were made.

The food itself was alright - the portions were smaller than I expected, especially given the high price for the food, and the flavor did not live up to the price.  The vegan nuggets were really good, the sliders decent and the mac n cheese alright.  

Overall, average vegan food at high price and small portion size
name: SoulÃ© Cafe
categories: Vegan, Desserts, Restaurants, Soul Food, Vegetarian, Food

text: My buddy had been raving about this pop up for ages and I didn't see how simple burgers could be THAT good. It took one visit to their brick and mortar to understand the hype. Bub's keeps it simple, that's true, but the simplicity is  what makes it all the more remarkable. The classic Bub -- two all-beef patties, American cheese, griddled onions, homemade bread & butter pickles and Bub Sauce on a butter toasted brioche bun -- is perfection. Peanut Bubber and Rodeo Adobo Burger are also good but no match for the O.G. Cheese fries are done right (two types of cheese, layered) and make for a solid side. Food comes out quick and you have options to eat inside or out. Believe the hype, people.
name: Bubâs Nola

text: I dined here last night with two friends, one who is vegan and was really excited to have a double menu (vegan/non-vegan; please scroll down to see her terrible experience). First, the online menu does not match the printed menus, and they only have 2 beers on draft unlike what is advertised (according to the bartender). Second, the bartender could not make a Pimm's cup or Moscow mule, however, did make a pretty good margarita. I tried to order the 3 side vegan plate, and was told he would double check they could do what I wanted. When the server/bartender returned to the table he acted like it was all good so I didn't change my order. Two of the things that I ordered came out 15-20 minutes before my friends plates, and they were full size appetizers, clearly not the portion you would receive with a pick 3 option. I was not given the opportunity to choose how my fried cauliflower was served, even though the menu states choices of breading and sauces. My third full size appetizer was served before my friends' food, which was getting close to 40 minutes since we had ordered. When my friends' food arrived, I was immediately on red alert because the vegan option was supposed to be jackfruit, and she was clearly given a beef patty with a cream sauce on it. THE CRIME: after she asked the server to double check if her order was correct, he walked inside and walked back out, and told her it was jackfruit. She sent it back, and 15 or so minutes later he brought out what was actually visibly jackfruit with no sauces on it. She was credited 10% off the sandwich, which was only $1.70 off her meal. Our bill was rang up on one ticket, and we were told it could be split evenly 3 ways, but not by what each person ordered. I was left with $28 worth of appetizers when I had ordered a $15 plate of "pick 3." When I questioned this, my question was steam rolled as he started another conversation. I handed over my card to pay for the entire bill since it couldn't be split, and when it was returned, the server was hovering over my shoulder waiting for me to complete the tip. He said he was trying to close out, it was 6:40. He had definitely been funny and upbeat at the beginning of our experience, but I found this to be completely rude and was the nail in the coffin for me. Thankfully one of my friends saw what was happening and diverted his attention for a moment. There could have been a reason for one or two slip-ups: we were sitting outside, they just reopened a month ago, etc. But for 7+ reasons, we will never return.
name: SoulÃ© Cafe
categories: Vegan, Desserts, Restaurants, Soul Food, Vegetarian, Food

text:
Are you a thiccc burger or a smashed burger? If you're into thiccc-ys, you are missing out. If you are a smashed burger, get ready for your next spot. Bub's NOLA started out as a pop-up but now they have their own shop! Taking smashed burgers to the next level, they have some delicious ones. Here was a special they were having, it's Hawaiian themed, topped with some smashed pineapples for a little tang! Definitely go check them out; they continue to do pop-ups in addition to working the storefront as of the time of this post.

@phidingthefam

text:
This was the last stop on the Ghost/History Pub crawl, while there were four bars total, this was the only one that had a deal for the crawl. 

The place is about two or three houses from down from Marie L, the high priestess of Voodoo for the state!!! It has some interesting history, artists from all over the world come and paint on or in it, so the walls are covered with all types and styles of paintings and artwork. I sadly did not get many pictures as it was packed. 

They had two fun bartenders behind the bar. They were having a blast no matter how busy it got, we tried the special, some kind of lemonade vodka cherry drink, was not that impressed but they do have pizza but pies and by the slice. I had a pepperoni and my wife had a special which had a lot of stuff on it. Slices only for us, it is right across from Graveyard Number 1 as well!.

The pizza was good and the art was cool, a huge party bus of people showed up not long after us so we took off as it was super crowded at that point. We did meet a couple for Georgetown on the tour as well, the ghost stories were fun and learning some real history was great as well. 

All in All a fun bar and the least packed of the ones we went too, or they had more room. If you take the tour ask about the Ghost of Marie
name: Rampart Treehouse
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Pizza, Beer Bar, Bars, Nightlife, Salad

text:
Bub's NOLA is a tasty addition to the New Orleans burger scene.

I love that their burgers are smashed, so that they are nice and crispy and delicious. You can get them dressed or with bacon and, of course, a side of cheese fries.

My one teeny complaint was, on the day that I went, it was super hot and they didn't have air conditioning (this might have changed in a month or so since I visited), so eating inside was pretty brutal. They do have outdoor seating, if you want to enjoy some sidewalk life. They are also right next door to Banks St. Bar, so you can pop over and get a beer.
name: Bubâs Nola

text:
So, this was a last minute late craving for Chinese food, big mistake I REPEAT big mistake. Omg this food was not the business not even close. 

I walk in and it looks like the average hood Chinese spot (which I would have never had an issue with it adds a little spunk). The guy wasn't the most helpful, which even still i could over look. But his descriptions of what the food were so left from what they really were it was just sad. 

So I got wings w/ pork fried rice and an order of cho chos. It was sad that the ONLY thing in this whole order that was edible was the cho chos, the wings didnt even seem fresh. It was almost like they had wings that was sitting there and they re-fried them. I don't know why the rice wasnt even a descent fried rice like how bad can you really mess that up? Well, apparently you can mess it up pretty badly. My greatest suggestion is to not go to this spot even if you want some late night grub you would do better going to McDonalds.
name: Ming Garden

text:
I was a real cheerleader for this place until last night. I ordered two soft shell crab "platters". Got all the way home opened the boxes (of 90 some dollars worth of food). Company at the table..... and the "platters" had the tiniest little crab inside. ONE tiny crab per platter! I called ahead and was told a mistake was made. Ran back there leaving my guests at the table. Only to be confronted with more excuses than apologies. I was shown what a platter "should" look like complete with two crabs and a slice of French bread (this wasn't given to me though). I had to wait (even though I'd now called ahead twice) 
My grand reward was three more tiny crabs in a box by themselves. Whoopee I missed half of my own dinner party, drove back and forth twice because of your mistake and I received a bunch of excuses and an extra crab the size of the ketchup container. 
Last time you'll get my money. I can go right next door and expect great service at Fiorellas for now on!

text: This place is awesome!! It was our first time in NOLA and we got to experience this spot because it was the end of a haunted pub tour (which you should go on btw). We were hungry when we started the tour and man were we so excited that this was the last stop because WHO DOESN'T LOVE PIZZA?!  Okay so this isn't normal pizza, this is cool pizza. Haha but really, we had pepperoni slices because they sale by the slice or whole. But there are no words to describe how good this pizza was, it was cheesy and not overly greasy. It was the perfect temperature and the crust was perfect! It was crispy at the bottom but was not burnt. The crust reminded me of brick oven pizza crusts and was charred a bit but just enough to give it an extra flavor that was marvelous! And the slices are good slices, not stingy slices, real slices. They were so good my boyfriend and I ordered a third slice to share, we should have just got a whole pizza to be honest. The drinks here are good, the staff is fantastic. So welcoming and friendly, great conversation and very informative of the art in the bar. Great experience in NOLA and great pizza here!
name: Rampart Treehouse
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Pizza, Beer Bar, Bars, Nightlife, Salad

text: I attended one of the Nola Crawfish King's boils this past May. It far exceeded my expectations. Oh, my God, was it good!  Very tasty with just the right amount of spice. Folks, this was a professional boil all the way. Everything was done just right. And the Nola Crawfish King is also a great guy. Highly recommended!
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text:
This is a neat place. Filled with art from many different artists. They have a rotating display. It's very eclectic. There's a huge tree inside and the bathroom is a flowering garden on astro-turf. I'm not sure how they keep everything dust free!

We had two different experiences with the place during our visit to New Orleans. They are located right across from Armstrong park where we met for a ghost tour, so it was super convenient for my husband to grab a couple of drinks for us. He said the pizza smelled good and the staff was nice, so we dropped in again for a drink & a slice of pizza.

The second time we dropped in it was around 3:30pm on Black Friday. There was one super sweet bartender and the cook making the pizza. It was quiet, but locals dropped in to grab a drink off and on through out our visit. 

I had the magnolia drink which normally comes with Mezcal, and the bartender was wonderful about swapping it out for a blanco tequila for me. It was a lovely drink. My husband and I each had a piece of the special pizza - it had Brussel spouts and sausage. The biggest disappointment is that it was old and dry and we paid $5 for it. I'm more disappointed in myself for eating it and not saying anything about it. It wasn't good. 

This is an interesting place and if we get back to New Orleans we'd most likely get drinks again, but not pizza.
name: Rampart Treehouse
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Pizza, Beer Bar, Bars, Nightlife, Salad

text:
This place is where it's at when it comes to burgers! I'm so glad to see they have an actual location. The outdoor seating is so convenient and a nice touch for seating options. Indoors is also spacious with a retro 80's feel to it. The staff are phenomenal very welcoming and has no problems explaining the menu and other options. 
Now let's get to the food ! The reason we came. We ordered the speciality burger on the menu, the BBQ Bacon Hamburger single patty and the Impossible Royal burger with regular fries. 
The food came out fresh and hot ! The BBQ Bacon burger was amazing the Pattie's were cooked the way requested it and it melted in our mouths. One of the delicious burgers I've tasted. The impossible burger was cooked so well you'd swear it was a beef patty. The French fries were regular fries next time I plan on trying the cheese or gumbo fries.
name: Bubâs Nola

text:
After walking by multiple times, finally took the opportunity to give the Treehouse a try for lunch.  Placed an order for pickup on Ubereats, via the link on Yelp.  Easy peasy.  After reviewing the online menu, decided on Turkey BLTs.  The sandwiches were being made when I walked in.  I had a few minutes to enjoy the eclectic decor and chat with the friendly bartender while my order was packaged.  Since I'd paid via the app, including tip, no cash was exchanged.  I did mention to the bartender that I'd tipped via the app.  We both agreed that he and the cook would probably never see it, which I felt bad about.  (Note to self: cash tip next time!). 

The sandwiches were very good!  Loaded with turkey, bacon & tomatoes on fresh whole grain bread, with the perfect array of condiments.  Zaps VooDoo chips on the side, too.  Based on this experience, I'll definitely be back for another sandwich or a pizza.
name: Rampart Treehouse
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Pizza, Beer Bar, Bars, Nightlife, Salad

text:
I've been chomping these burgers for a good while now. I looked forward to any pop up they would have anywhere near me. Well as luck would have it they popped up permanently in my neighborhood. 

My go to is the bub royale. It's juicy, got the crunch of red onion, and soft brioche bun. And bonus it makes me laugh every time making me think about Pulp Fiction "What do they call it?" "Royale with cheese." 

Along with my royale I tried the degen fries. Don't recall this ever being an option at the pop up so had to give it a try. This was also very good. With it smothered in cheese and ranch made me think I was eating an American version of poutine. 

And on top of all that I even ordered the grilled cheese just to try as much as possible while I was there. It was small cheesy and comforting even though I was stuffed. 

Congrats Bub's on a brick and mortar location I will be moving in as well.
name: Bubâs Nola

text:
Hmm, I'm all for supporting small businesses and I love a good underdog story, but what's with all the 5-star reviews? 

I placed my order online from the website and it was ready in less than 15 minutes, which was convenient. I ordered the Bub's burger, small fry and brussel sprouts. The burger was the best part of the meal. I liked the soft brioche bun, sautÃ©ed onions, and two seasoned patties. The cheese was melty, but it had an off putting taste. I prefer American cheese, though. The fries were hot, crispy, and seasoned, and, yet, lacked flavor. The brussel sprouts were a disappointment because they tasted burnt. They were a nice size and juicy, but every bite had a too charred flavor. They just didn't live up to the description. Service was pleasant. 

In a nutshell, Bub's is ok. I think Company Burger, overall, makes a better burger and sides. The inside was clean, small and quaint, and parking nearby was a non-starter. I had to park a block away, but didn't mind. It wasn't too much hassle, but thought I'd mention it.
name: Bubâs Nola

text:
I wrote the updated review a few months ago and held off posting.  Today we decided to give them another shot.  Nope.  AGAIN- our to go order was wrong.  Five times.  Won't do it again despite really wanting this to work.  Wrong rolls, wrong sauce tonight (asked for blue cheese - got bbq).

This is a hard update to make - but the four times we have gone since the permanent brick and mortar space has opened our order has been a clusterf*^k.  Missing items, completely wrong order, 
one completely incompetent staff member who just can't get out of her own way, and it takes at least an hour- for anything.

The food is good - the aggravation isn't worth it.  I know places need to work out the kinks - and good help is hard to find - but right now - they're on our "no go" list until they work it out.  It's just too much drama and they try to make up for the mistakes - always - but it takes an hour + and we are not going at peak times.

We


Stopped by the new, permanent location at 5321 Franklin Ave. for some absolutely fantastic bbq.  We had a brisket plate with potato salad and slaw, a lb. of prime brisket burnt ends that were da bomb, an order of brisket boudin rolls and an order of the soul rolls.  All of it was spot on.  The white sauce for the boudin rolls and the bbq sauce (obviously served on the side) were excellent compliments to the rolls.  

The brisket had a beautiful smoke ring, the meat was cooked tender but not mush, and the flavor profile allowed the natiral flavor of the meat to shine through.

The burnt ends were some of the best I've had in New Orleans.  A few fatty pieces a few lean pieces and some combo pieces.  Again, the meat was the 
star - not the rub or salt, which is what I find happens a lot.  

Right now Shaggy is building out the permanent space and has his food truck in the parking area right next to the space.  Hours are basically Wednesday - Saturday from 11am until the bbq is gone.

You can call ahead to place an order - but the wait time if you just roll on over there is very reasonable.  It's a great addition to the neighborhood.

Hopes are that the permanent space will be open late fall....nothing but goodness.
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text:
A group of friends and I ordered 14lbs of shrimp for a boil at noon.  They agreed upon price for 14lbs was $575.  They showed up at 1030 and brought 10 lbs.  and did not mention a thing until we told the guy there is no way it is 14 lbs.  He agreed with us and said management would handle it.  Someone contacted us and said they only sent us 10 lbs (which I do not believe was even anywhere near 10 lbs) and they would knock $25 off the price.  I cannot comprehend how 14 lbs is $575 and 10 lbs is $550.  How is that proportional at all??

My recommendation is to go with another service as their company is a joke

text:
Great burger!  Best one I've ever eaten?  No, but still very good.  I went with the Royale, which I believe was the right choice... two perfect patties, cheese, plenty of red onions and special sauce.  Loved it, although the bun could have been a bit larger to better accommodate the patties, which extended a good inch or so beyond the bun.  $9.50 seems a bit high for what it was, IMO.  

My wife had the Microdose (single burger), and wasn't impressed, due to very few grilled onions and thin patty.  We both enjoyed the fries and the perfectly seasoned brussels sprouts.

The service was spot on.  We were planning to sit outside because we had our small dog, until one of the staff told us that we were welcome sit inside.  (Ahh, A/C).  I popped next door to the Banks Street Bar for drinks while I waited for the text telling me our burgers were ready.  (You're welcome to bring your outside drinks into Bub's.)

I'll be back for sure, but will have to do some convincing to get my wife to join me.
name: Bubâs Nola

text:
I gotta be honest, all the good reviews on here are blowing my mind. The only good thing I can say about this place is that they got the order right? And I guess the spring rolls were pretty good but it's kinda hard to mess those up. 
The dumplings were hella doughy and hella soggy and sticky. 
The General Tso's was... okay I guess? Not spicy at all. At ALL. Overly sweet.
The "curry chicken" was, oh Lord, like 80% onions in a thin yellow sauce. This isn't curry like actual curry, this is that shitty American curry powder that's mostly turmeric and you can buy at Family Dollar. 
The real cherry on top was the hot and sour soup. Its neither hot nor sour. Y'all, it tasted like nothing. N O T H I N G. It doesn't even taste like the stuff that's floating in it. It's a slightly gelatinous, flavorless broth with flavorless tofu, flavorless mushrooms, flavorless bamboo, and flavorless shreds of egg white. 
$25 minimum for delivery and this is what we got?
Don't, y'all. Just don't. 
I care about you. You can do better. 
Hell, even Rally's tastes like salt.
name: Ming Garden

text:
This is a hard update to make - but the four times we have gone since the permanent brick and mortar space has opened our order has been a clusterf*^k.  Missing items, completely wrong order, 
one completely incompetent staff member who just can't get out of her own way, and it takes at least an hour- for anything.  They need to work out the kinks so the food can shine

Stopped by the new, permanent location at 5321 Franklin Ave. for some absolutely fantastic bbq.  We had a brisket plate with potato salad and slaw, a lb. of prime brisket burnt ends that were da bomb, an order of brisket boudin rolls and an order of the soul rolls.  All of it was spot on.  The white sauce for the boudin rolls and the bbq sauce (obviously served on the side) were excellent compliments to the rolls.  

The brisket had a beautiful smoke ring, the meat was cooked tender but not mush, and the flavor profile allowed the natiral flavor of the meat to shine through.

The burnt ends were some of the best I've had in New Orleans.  A few fatty pieces a few lean pieces and some combo pieces.  Again, the meat was the 
star - not the rub or salt, which is what I find happens a lot.  

Right now Shaggy is building out the permanent space and has his food truck in the parking area right next to the space.  Hours are basically Wednesday - Saturday from 11am until the bbq is gone.

You can call ahead to place an order - but the wait time if you just roll on over there is very reasonable.  It's a great addition to the neighborhood.

Hopes are that the permanent space will be open late fall....nothing but goodness.
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text: Holy Smashburger!!! This place was delish!! I have really been hitting the jackpot lately when it comes to picking new food places. So it's been a long week and a have been craving a burger. I just so happen to stumble across this place on Yelp and when I saw the pictures I was straight heart eyes . This is a fairly new place I believe but they do not function like they are new. Everything went smooth and quick. Chick-fil-A speed service and restaurant quality. Everything was delicious. I ordered the bub burger and my husband ordered the hot sausage. I am usually not a fan of bread and butter pickles but I didn't change the burger at all. I wanted the whole experience and I am so glad I did. They know what they are doing...the flavors merged so well! Same with the hot sausage sandwich. We also ordered the de gen fries and they were perfection as well. The restaurant is super cute and the staff are very nice. You place your order and then wait for your order. They have both Inside and outdoor seating. After you order the cashier takes your name and number so they can text you when your order is ready. I thought that was pretty cool. They also have a rewards program to earn points for free food!! They take cash and card. Bathroom was clean. They have TVs and cool wall decor. This was seriously the best burger I've had all year and that says a lot considering burgers are one for my favorite foods. Definitely on the be back list
name: Bubâs Nola

We were scheduled for the 1PM tour of the Cemetery and needed to grab a quick bite before meeting the ghosts.  This place ended up being perfect!  

We got a few slices of pizza and a few beers and had plenty of time to get back for the tour guide.  The pizza is super cheesy, greasy, thin and foldable.  It totally reminded me of New Jersey boardwalk pizza!  It was so good after a night of late night drinking.  It really hit the spot. 

The dÃ©cor and music is really awesome.  We loved the bathroom with its flower walls too.  It was a fun spot to grab a bite and then get on down the road.
name: Rampart Treehouse
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Pizza, Beer Bar, Bars, Nightlife, Salad

text: I had been wanting to check out this burger spot  for a few months, but the timing never worked out! On the way back from evacuating from a storm they offer takeout so I figured why not support local at a time like this! I ordered a regular burger for myself and then a kids burger for my son with some fries! Idk what sauce they put on my burger but wow! Also the pickle, they seem to soak it in something because it was delicious! I'm a pickle freak! There's only one other place that I've tried a sweet pickle like that and it goes perfect with the burger. The fries were good, they reminded me of McDonalds fries, but better version! I love the fact that I could order to go through an app and I didn't have to wait with a toddler. They alert you with a text when it is ready! I can't wait to actually go inside and eat. Pricing was reasonable and I had even put a set time of when I wanted it and it just worked out so perfectly!
name: Bubâs Nola

text:
I ordered delivery through Yelp during Covid-19. Delivery was simple and timely. Prior to ordering I called to inquire about allergens. I was informed that all of the food is nut free and the majority is gluten free. I appreciate that the owners are conscious about food allergies.

I ordered the vegan fried green tomatoes salad and vegan spinach and artichoke dip. Upon receipt of the food, it instantly looked delicious. However, I did not get to taste the food until several hours later. Even after sitting for hours, the semi-cold fried green tomatoes tasted super good! I anticipated on saving that entire meal for the next day, but ended up finishing that one tomato, it was seasoned to perfection.

The spinach and artichoke dip was equally delicious lukewarm. Even the pita chips were full of seasoning and flavor. This appetizer was so filling, I ate it as an entree and actually couldn't finish all of it.

The next day, I finally got to eat the fried green tomato salad, but I had to eat it cold. Surprisingly, it did not matter! The tomatoes still tasted yummy and a salad is typically served cold.

I would definitely return to this restaurant if in the area.
name: SoulÃ© Cafe
categories: Vegan, Desserts, Restaurants, Soul Food, Vegetarian, Food

text:
Shaggy rocked it for his crawfish boil across from JazzFest! I didn't' even think I liked crawfish - never really had a good one - bam!  I am hooked by Shaggy's awesome authentic fest!  It was awesome -  I felt like I ate 1000 crawfish and if I had any more room in my belly I would have eaten more because there were so MANY crawfish - no one had to go short!  They were so perfectly prepared and spiced - truly awesome! 

So much fun!  A truly great experience - I wish I could ship him and his boiler out to California so that I could host one every weekend - since I am now ADDICTED to crawfish!  Thanks Shaggy- an awesome experience that is true New Orleans and will be part of our Jazzfest experience every year!
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text:
I was a real cheerleader for this place until last night. I ordered two soft shell crab "platters". Got all the way home opened the boxes (of 90 some dollars worth of food). Company at the table..... and the "platters" had the tiniest little crab inside. ONE tiny crab per platter! I called ahead and was told a mistake was made. Ran back there leaving my guests at the table. Only to be confronted with more excuses than apologies. I was shown what a platter "should" look like complete with two crabs and a slice of French bread (this wasn't given to me though). I had to wait (even though I'd now called ahead twice) 
My grand reward was three more tiny crabs in a box by themselves. Whoopee I missed half of my own dinner party, drove back and forth twice because of your mistake and I received a bunch of excuses and an extra crab the size of the ketchup container. 
Last time you'll get my money. I can go right next door and expect great service at Fiorellas for now
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text:
Damn that's spicy!!! This is hands down the BEST crawfish you will ever have. One bite of the Nola Crawfish King's boiled crawfish and you will be craving his  mouthwatering recipe for days or in my case months to come. 

The owner Chris "Shaggy" Davis is not only a fantastic chef but a super nice guy that will take the time to teach a newbie the proper way to eat crawfish (don't forget to suck the head) and answer any questions you may have about crawfish and the boiling process. I hear that their other boils such as crab and shrimp when the crawfish are not in season are as equally delicious. 

You can hire the NOLA Crawfish King for events both small and large. They regularly cater to rock-n-roll royalty such as Dave Matthews Band, The Black Crowes, and Anders Osborne. 

Go git you sum! NOLA Crawfish King is the real deal!
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text: I've been a huge fan of Bub's from their pop ups at Second Line Brewery so it was time for a trip to their new brick and mortar location. They have tables inside, but we sat at the picnic tables outside since we had our pup with us. I am a fan of their microdose burger and regular fries and I branched out this time. I got the peanut bubber and we split the degen fries. The peanut bubber is 2 patties, bacon, American cheese, peanut butter and is on a brioche bun. It was perfectly salty and slightly sweet and I enjoyed it a lot. The degen fries came with jalapenos, ranch, cheese sauce, shredded cheese and bacon. The shredded cheese was a bit awkward since it didn't melt but they were really good. The outdoor space was not and I can see us going there regularly.

text:
5 stars for decor - this place is too cool with their faux tree stationed in the middle of the bar with tons of decorative blooms hanging from the ceiling. We walked by during a Voodoo tour and made sure to return for drinks and lunch - oh and the pizza smell wafting outside also helped entice our return.

Service was pretty bad, but I'm chalking it up to the whole "dive bar / too cool" attitude. The drinks were good but basic drinks you could order anywhere. Pizza came out looking extra tasty but after picking up our slices we realized it was really badly burnt - and I don't mean simply charred. They made us a new pie and it came out delicious. We all really enjoyed our pizza. Good sauce, good cheese, good sturdiness to the crust even though it was thinner /comparable to a New York style pie.

I do recommend coming by for the atmosphere (though they were playing really odd international music) and good pizza -- especially tasty I imagine after a few drinks.
name: Rampart Treehouse
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Pizza, Beer Bar, Bars, Nightlife, Salad

text:
First off it's even better in person. A local I follow on Instagram posted this fun place with flowers hanging and an amazing mural in the background so I just had to find and come. Didn't think it would be this soon but I won't argue with fate. 

If you don't know it's there you literally will walk right by because I have several times now. Walking down the street I passed a place with a fun mural and was like oh wait and had to stop in. Nicely spaced out due to covid and the staff has on masks they are also very friendly. I took as many pictures as I could I think and the bartender took a few of us as well it was great. The booths are huge big enough to fit 6 people comfortably it was 4 of us. 

We got a few drink house margarita with well liquor good and pineapple amoretto (not shown ) GREAT. 

FYI head to the bathroom your camera roll won't be mad. Can't wait to come back!
name: Rampart Treehouse
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Pizza, Beer Bar, Bars, Nightlife, Salad

text: Chris and his team could not have been more awesome! We decided to have a post wedding Seafood Boil in Audubon Park as a send off for our guests. We woke up on Sunday morning and it was POURING the rain, as it sometimes does in Nola, and I was pretty bummed that we were going to get rained out. Chris and his team were there super early to scout out some good shelters so we wouldn't get totally soaked, and held the boil in the rain by one of the shelters. It was SO FUN. People had a great time and the crabs/shrimp/potatoes/corn were DELICIOUS. Chris even taught some of our shellfish-challenged friends how to crack crabs and get the most meat out of the shrimp. We can't thank you guys enough for an awesome time, rain and all!
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text: Bub's is a great local, casual hamburger spot in Midcity. I had been to their food truck once before they opened their brick & mortar location. They specialize in super thin smashed burgers made on a flattop grill. I got the Royale- two patties, onion, lettuce, tomato, American cheese, pickles, and signature Bub sauce. It super flavorful and excellent. The patties are very thin, so I highly recommend getting at least two if you want a more filling meal. The fries are also good. They are big enough to share between 2 people. It is an order at the counter restaurant. They have indoor seating, but most people were sitting outside or at the bar next door. They have a window to the bar next door, so you can actually pick up your food at the bar. We went on a Friday night and the restaurant was not crowded, though there were definitely a lot of people outside eating burgers. Our food was ready incredibly fast- less than 10 minutes for 5 people. Bub's is definitely a great addition to Midcity and is super popular with locals.
name: Bubâs Nola

text:
This is the most amazing hole-in-the-wall, local gem in NOLA! The food was so delicious! I had to come back before flying back home. I also really enjoyed chatting with the nice lady working the cash register! She was so sweet, and we gave each other travel tips for our respective states.

I don't know what they do to their potato salad, but it's addicting! I think there's probably a lot of dijon mustard in it? I'm unsure. The mac and cheese was good too. However, the crawfish stole the show. They were so fresh and big for such a good price! I wish I had more time in NOLA so that I could try more of their foods. Will definitely come back if I'm ever visiting again. Keep up the great job you guys! :)
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text: 0 stars. By far the worst dining experience I have ever had in my city. I was excited to take my mom here since she is vegan because they have advertised themselves as such. There were honestly a lot fewer options than I had anticipated. That wouldn't have been too bad if the entire dining experience wasn't so terrible. To start things off, the waitress was less than enthused that we were there in the first place (party of 4). The restaurant was dead so you would think they would be happy to have business on a Monday evening. She sighed and told us to seat ourselves. Once she returned she seemed a bit scatter-brained and did not know answers to basic questions about the menu. We ordered fried green tomatoes to start and then a jerk chicken sandwich, a SoulÃ© Burger, fried eggplant salad, collard greens, and chicken wings. It took 30 minutes for 4 small slices of fried green tomatoes. They were good but nothing special. Another 30 minutes goes by (it's been an hour at this point), and the waitress finally comes back (we are still the ONLY table seated). She says that my jerk chicken sandwich is ready, but they are having trouble in the kitchen and don't know how much longer the rest will take. She says I can eat my sandwich now and that she will bring the rest when it's ready. Jerk chicken implies spice (this was the most plain chicken breast I have ever seen with 0 flavor added- it was literally white piece of meat with no spice) Fifteen minutes pass, and I ask her if she knows if the problems in the kitchen will be a quick fix or if she recommends we just find food elsewhere if they're having problems. She doesn't care to elaborate and just shrugs her shoulders and says she doesn't know what to tell us. Literally 0 explanation. I ask her to bring the check. I honestly thought the manager/owner/chef would have apologized for not being able to cook our meal (still don't understand what was happening in the kitchen because it's an open air kitchen and we were sitting right next to it and could see them the whole time). This place did not seem to care whatsoever that the service was reprehensible and there was no accountability for what happened. They almost seemed glad that they weren't going to have to make the rest of the food. This whole experience was honestly bizarre from the get go. We immediately did not feel welcomed. We sat for dinner early evening so this wasn't even close to near closing time and we were respectful about dining in- we wore masks the entire team while seated when not eating/drinking. We even paid the entire bill for what had been brought out, and no- there wasn't any type of discount or "this is on the house for the terrible waste of your time".  There is honestly no explanation or excuse they could have ever given to forgive what happened here, but I have the feeling that they don't really care either way.
name: SoulÃ© Cafe
categories: Vegan, Desserts, Restaurants, Soul Food, Vegetarian, Food

text: The best experience in NOLA! Warm, welcoming and friendly. Definitely a place to visit.

text:
This review is for drinks/atmosphere only as I couldn't eat the pizza. They didn't do gluten-free.
I found this place before the ghost walking tour I was about to take. Raven's Omen met on the corner across from the bar. It was raining, and I was about an hour early, so I ducked into the Treehouse, but I'd been thinking I should stop in anyway. I had to use the washroom and promised the guy I'd order once out. He looked a little doubtful at first, but he probably gets a lot of a-holes who pee and run during Mardi Gras lol. 
OMG if I thought the front of the bar was cute...well, the washroom was adorable. There was a flower-filled meadow on the wall and stickers everywhere. Loved one said "You are beautiful."  So cute. There's a picture below.
The front of the house was also just magical. There is this really cool artwork on the wall, some with a voodoo vibe. Very colourful, always something new to see and take in as you look around. The best part is the tree over the bar. On the menu, it said that the magnolia blossoms overhead numbered over 500 and were hand-painted. There was also some other interesting info on there, but at the moment, I can't remember, lol. Another very cool thing was the jars hanging from the tree filled with lights. Some twinkled, like real fireflies. It was just beautiful. 
The bartender did warm up once I kept my promise. I told him I love coconut and tequila, so he made me his own concoction with a hefty dose of tequila and some coconut cream. Awesome drink! By the time the hour passed, I was buzzing like a bumblebee. I also got another to take on the tour. They do not skimp on the alcohol.
I met some really nice people who also came in before meeting for the tour. The atmosphere is friendly, and people were chatting, drinking and eating with smiles on their faces. 
A new bartender came in and she looked just like all the pictures of Marie Laveau, the voodoo queen. I told her, and that seemed to make her happy. I certainly meant it as a compliment. She was very friendly, and as the place filled up (I was the only person in there when I arrived) she kept up with the drink demand easily.
This is a great place for a good strong drink and pizza if you can eat wheat. You'll love the magic provided by the firefly adorned tree and unusual art on the walls.
name: Rampart Treehouse
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Pizza, Beer Bar, Bars, Nightlife, Salad

text:
So happy I checked this place out. Once a food truck, now  a brick and mortar location (they still do food trucks/pop ups), Bub's  Burgers was formed just last year and it's no surprise they've already  garnered a following because their burgers are amazing. I'm always on  the lookout for the best burger in New Orleans and Bub's NOLA did not  disappoint.

The exterior looks beautiful. The inside isn't too  big but also looks nice. The staff was great and very friendly. There's a  water machine if you prefer not to pay for a bottled water or bottled  drink. The prices are pretty moderate, what you'd expect from a burger  joint. 2.50 for bacon is a bit extreme but, the food was fresh, the  fries were great, and the burger overall was really, really good. Their  Bub's sauce I can best describe as a sweet mustard.

I look forward to watching this establishment grow in popularity and  will cheer for it's success with my consistent business. I can't wait to  be back! I also vlogged my experience which I advise for you to check  out at https://youtu.be/JhPx0Cdeabg
name: Bubâs Nola

text:
I made it!!! I made it!!! I made it!!!! 
      
Knowing me is knowing I AM A CONNOISSEUR of boiled crawfish... I am the judge, jury & prosecutor!!!! I BE KNOWING about the crawfish. 

This establishment is new to being a brick and mortar business.  However, the crawfish king has been around for a while catering private parties, being a the crawfish fest & serving crawfish from the food truck. So glad that he's finally in a permanent location where is easier to find him and I can get my crawfish on.

To note:  crawfish is not the only thing that they serve. They have a full menu barbecue and Boudin and a whole bunch of other stuff. But for me and my house all we are concerned about is the crawfish and that's what this review will address.

This crawfish were good & to my liking... I ate every piece of it from the rooter to the tooter. I don't know what the secret sauce, I can taste a little bit a hot sauce in there but I'm not quite sure.  At any rate, it's all that and a bag of chips. 

It's still early in the season, so the crawfish are priced a little higher than I would like for them to be, but I do expect once the season is in full swing that the crawfish prices will come down. 

I'm loving that they are less than 5 miles from my house, so I can get my CRAWFISH on whenever I want. And they're open on Sundays, so hello, I can grab me some crawfish and a daiquiri and head to the lake.  See ya there.

#locallyowned #crawfishtime #alwaysagoodtimewhereCRAWFISHareconcerned
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text: Nice server but the food experience was absolutely terrible. I hate to leave a bad review during this time but I'm hoping they work on their food a bit more so they can continue to keep their doors open. It's presented as a restaurant that is vegan friendly with many options but, it is not. My vegan friend was given real gumbo after ordering the vegan gumbo. They apologized & asked if they wanted anything else. She then ordered an impossible burger & said no dairy ( which she is allergic to) they brought out the burger with Mayo on it. Unfortunately what we ate wasn't great either. I really do hope they can focus more on whats coming out of the kitchen & providing customers with better food. I really hope they make it
name: SoulÃ© Cafe
categories: Vegan, Desserts, Restaurants, Soul Food, Vegetarian, Food

text:
Stopped by the new, permanent location at 5321 Franklin Ave. for some absolutely fantastic bbq.  We had a brisket plate with potato salad and slaw, a lb. of prime brisket burnt ends that were da bomb, an order of brisket boudin rolls and an order of the soul rolls.  All of it was spot on.  The white sauce for the boudin rolls and the bbq sauce (obviously served on the side) were excellent compliments to the rolls.  

The brisket had a beautiful smoke ring, the meat was cooked tender but not mush, and the flavor profile allowed the natiral flavor of the meat to shine through.

The burnt ends were some of the best I've had in New Orleans.  A few fatty pieces a few lean pieces and some combo pieces.  Again, the meat was the star - not the rub or salt, which is what I find happens a lot.  

Right now Shaggy is building out the permanent space and has his food truck in the parking area right next to the space.  Hours are basically Wednesday - Saturday from 11am until the bbq is gone.

You can call ahead to place an order - but the wait time if you just roll on over there is very reasonable.  It's a great addition to the neighborhood.

Hopes are that the permanent space will be open late fall....nothing but goodness.
name: Nola Crawfish King Seafood & Barbecue

text: I would give this place 100 stars if I could. I live in Mandeville and on the way home from dropping my sister at the airport (actually completely out of the way) we stopped here for dinner. We haven't been here before and we always try to find new vegan / vegan friendly restaurants on this side of the lake. When I say these are the sweetest people in the world I mean it. It said on the door that they were closed for a private event so we were devastated but went inside to ask if there was any way we could get food to go since the event hadn't started yet. They say us down, gave us drinks with refills, a free appetizer (which they absolutely did not have to do we were already intruding they're just angels) and some food that was already prepared for the event but also some that wasn't. The chef cooked me an absolutely amazing impossible burger and some wings for my friend with all (yes all) of the sauces that they had just mixed together. both meals were an absolute 10/10!!!!! Even the fries seasoned soo nicely. One of my new favorite vegan (and non) in nola!!!!!!!!

text: My friends and I stopped by the Rampart Treehouse before we started our haunted pub crawl. This spot has such a cute aesthetically pleasing vibe with friendly service. It is small but has couple booth seatings as well as high stop tables and bar seating. They have slices of pizza that you can enjoy as well as a range of cocktails, beers, and shots. I had a special of their month- strawberry margarita which was very tasty and refreshing. I took one to go for my walking tour and enjoyed every sip. My friends both enjoyed their drinks as well, and I hope to come back again if not during this trip, the next time I'm in Nola!
name: Rampart Treehouse

text: We found our new burger spot!! This place is awesome! My guy and I both ordered the original Bub burger with fries and it did not disappoint! The place connects to Bank St. Bar so if you want to grab a beer or cocktail you can hop over there and bring it back to enjoy with your meal. Great outdoor picnic tables and the staff was friendly and welcoming! Can't wait to crave a burger again so I can come back! Tomorrow? Too soon?

text: After dining here last night with my family, I understand why they had an open table on a Friday night. The service was unprofessional and disjointed. Servers were running all over the place, food seemed to come out with no regard to courses. Everything is served in teeny tiny glasses, except for soft drinks which were served in the can, and barely chilled. Water glasses were small, plastic cups like you would find in a bathroom. Food was decent but most seemed to be served with an excess of gritty parsley and lots of lemon. A fish special advertised as served on Texas toast came on a rock hard slab of burnt bread covered in an inedible sauce. A Caesar salad was actually a bowl of green leaf lettuce in a bland vinaigrette, the only thing Caesary about it were the bland croutons and a few anchovies laid on top. The restaurant was unorganized and inconsistent, and I don't know that one got one smile from the wait staff all night long. Overall disappointing.
name: Seafood Sally's

text:
Run, don't walk to grab a slice of the *SICILIAN* pizza. The yeasty dough is hard to come by in New Orleans and simply cannot be compared. These thick crusted, puffy, square slices are oh-so good. The bottom of the pizza has a slight crunch and is perfectly seasoned with sesame seeds. The dough has an airy interior and is the ideal vesicle for their touch-of-sweet sauce. Take a bite and you will uncover a hidden layer of cheese. Thank you, Paulie Gee's for bringing this to New Orleans. 

The NY slices are nothing short of wonderful but the Sicilian slice always has my heart. Mike's Hot Honey makes a nice addition to any slice! 

Finally, check out their happy-hour from 2-5 PM: buy a slice and beer and get an extra slice, free! Pizza people, rejoice!
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop

text: Cute place and great vibe. We ate on the front porch. First time here and I was NOT disappointed in the food or drink. Caesar salad was fresh, lemony and had anchovies(yeah). Sand in my Shorts is a great drink. We got the Baller Boil Platter. It was hot with heat and dang hot with spices. My sister & I silently wondered if the spice was too much. We were both pleased that we could settle in and enjoy it. Loved it all. Corn was fresh (yes I know when they have that frozen crap). Sweet potatoes in a boil was a nice touch. White Potatoes were cooked just right and did not have too much spice. The crawfish and shrimp were spicy & very good and the crab was sweet but still spicy. Loved the Turkey neck too! No complaints on the boil once I settled in and got used to the spice level. The chili butter at the base of the platter was one of the best I have had so far.  The lemongrass and herbs in  boil was a nice touch. Remoulade dipping sauce was really good and felt homemade. Service slipped a little when it got busy but overall pretty good. Definitely going back to check out the rest of the menu. Four stars because I have not been through the menu enough to comfortably give a 5 star rating. But the expressions of persons eating the crab fingers was that of pure joy! For the complaints about flies, well that comes with the package when you eat boiled seafood and meats outdoors. Phew - wimps!
name: Seafood Sally's

text:
UPDATE: As seen below, management (NY?) reached out to me to make it right and I am happy. I think they are working through the consistency issues. I will be back!! 

Stopped in to order a whole pizza to go and was incredibly disappointed in the quality. It was not remotely busy. I actually watched the guy make it while I waited - he had no other orders. The outer crust was lopsided, so cheese spilled out, and the bottom and one half of the pizza were completely burnt. I didn't have time to ask for it to be remade, but if I had, I would have definitely not accepted that pizza (which was already paid for). I really hope someone sees this and takes more control over the quality.
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop

text:
This restaurant is incredibly cute, absolutely love the old school beachy feel. Service was wonderful, our waiter was extremely attentive, helpful, and added a lot to the overall experience. 

We came for the oyster happy hour, which did not disappoint. We did the house wine which was on happy hour and is an excellent deal! 
We also ordered a crawfish and shrimp boil along with hush puppies, onion rings, and cheddar biscuits. The crawfish and shrimp were good but missing the zing that makes boiled seafood so special. Hushpuppies were forgettable although they came with DELICIOUS dipping sauce. 

Will definitely give it another try once they get into a groove, if Marjie's is anything to go on I am sure we can expect great things from this spot in the future.

text:
We were looking for a nice brunch spot on our last day in NOLA. This place was perfect, quaint, pleasant, nice atmosphere, great food, great service (thank you, Darcy for your suggestions, prompt service and yet not hovering).
it is right on Frenchmen Street which is a local treat!
name: Frenchmen All Day

text: Good Pizza in the CBD (Central Business District) seems elusive at the lunch hour. A newcomer to the game is Pauli's Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop. A colleague told me about this new place, which boasted both New York and Chicago style slices. Since I was short on time, I ducked in and quickly scanned their offerings. I was pleasantly surprised to see no fewer than 6 different pizzas on display, all available by the slice. Plus, there were both meat, vegetarian , and vegan options. The crusts varied from thin to thick. All of them looked good in the glass display! I spoke with Marie about the options and I settled on two slices: Freddy Pepperoni Square Slice (thick crust)  and a Sausage Slice (very thin crust). I enjoyed the crunch of the thick crust, as well as the rich flavor of the tomato sauce. Interestingly, the cheese on the thick crust was in the middle of the crust. Honestly, this new style of cheese placement was not my favorite because I didn't get the sense of the cheese - it seemed to be too melded with the dough maybe...? As for the thin slice, the sausage was a bit dried out, the sauce was almost non-existent, and the crust was undercooked. I'm guessing I just happened to get a slice that came out of the oven prematurely. My recommendation is slightly more sauce for sure so that there is a good flavor profile for the thin slices. The restaurant was clean and had ample seating. Once more marketing is done and people get to know this new pizza joint, they'll likely find success through customer feedback and great recommendations.
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop

text: I have been thinking about how to write this all night. We were very skeptical of this place because of 3.5 stars and my motto living in NO is not to go anywhere under 4.5 lol. We decided to give it a go and we did not regret it in the least. My family and I went here last night and had an absolute blast!!! The food was amazing and the drinks were just as good. The presentation of the food was impeccable and something you would see at a fine dinning restaurant. The bartenders made the greatest drinks and they were very professional. If you're into seafood, great drinks, friendly staff and a great time go here. I recommend the oysters (charbroiled and raw) onion rings ( warning they are spicy) any drink on their menu ( I think we tried all but 2) the fish, blue crab and wait... everything. The entire thing was great.
name: Seafood Sally's

text:
Came here for my friend's Bachelorette dinner on a weekend trip in NOLA. Overall, the customer service was amazing but the food was OK. We had the broiled oysters, which were delicious. Nice crunch and seasoning. But the shrimp on my salad was way too salty and spicy - and this is coming from a woman with Cajun roots who loves spicy food. Some of our friends complained about overly seasoned food as well - interesting, right?! It's usually the total opposite at restaurants. 

I know this place is new and I'd be willing to give them another chance when I'm in the area to see if they can iron out some kinks. Not recommended if you have high blood pressure though - they gotta chill on the salt.
name: Seafood Sally's

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': None, u'hipster': None, u'casual': None, u'touristy': None, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': None, u'romantic': None, u'classy': None, u'upscale': False}

text: Tried it on a Saturday evening. Pretty busy, but I had no trouble finding a seat at the bar. Bar staff was friendly and attentive, even though they were quite busy. Ordered some oysters to start. They aren't really in season right now, and the ones I had definitely tasted sort of bland. Not bad; just blah. I had the catch of the day, which was some kind of whitefish I wasn't familiar with. Ordered it blackened, and it was pretty good. Sides were hush puppies and a spicy potato salad. The hush puppies were decent, but the potato salad was unreasonably spicy, almost to the point of being inedible. Also, the place seemed excessively noisy, even considering the large crowd. A function of the high ceilings and acoustics I think. All in all it was ok, but given the number of choices in this city, I most likely won't be back anytime soon.
name: Seafood Sally's

text: Really, really liked the pizza. Pretty close to a New York slice. The edge of the crust needed some more poof. Most places I've tried in New Orleans don't have a poofy enough edge. Must be the water or humidity. Sadly, I was disturbed by the cashier who did not wear gloves while handling the pizza. The cashier handled pizza, wiped hands on pants, and handled more pizza! In New York, staff use long spatulas to transfer the slice to the oven and onto the plate. I will eat there again. Next time I want to see the staff wearing gloves.
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop

text:
On my lunch break today stopped in for a quick bite. I ordered a Cuban sandwich and salad. I sat inside right next to the kitchen and watched the manager/ owner have her kitchen staff prepare everything single item from the menu so she could take pictures. I waited 35 minutes for my sandwich all the while watching the kitchen staff put out only food for her to photograph. After I finished eating, I sat there waiting for my bill. My waitress was in the kitchen helping at this point and both myself and another customer had to go to the front to retrieve our bill because they were so busy with food pictures. This was so unprofessional and there were around 8-10 tables waiting at length for their food while she took photos of her food. 

Sandwich and salad were well prepared. The service was so poor that I won't be returning.
name: Frenchmen All Day

text: Very yummy! This is the real deal NY style pizza, unlike most other pizzas in town. The look inside the shop is also a classic NY style pizza joint design. There are maybe 8 booths along with maybe 8 seats at the window. A bunch of people there were also getting pizza to go when I was there. I ended up trying the Mootz and the Hellboy squared slices. They were both very good! I really love Mike's Hot Honey so enjoyed that on the top of the Hellboy slice. The sauce on the Hellboy is very sweet, I liked it a lot. The Mootz has no sauce, and is a thin slice. It was great too. I am looking forward to going back and trying a few other flavors!
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop

text:
Paulie Gee's takes you back with the classic pizza parlour look and feel! Every detail from the type of napkins to the old movies playing on the wall. It's a cool vibe. The obvious attraction is the pizza. They have the signature NY style pizza--wide slices of thin pizza. The menu is fairly simple. They have cheese pizza and pepperoni pizza, but they also have this garlic "mootz" pizza. I've never heard of it, but I ordered one slice of that and the Freddie pizza. It was a square pizza with just sauce on top and sesame seeds on the bottom. I think the cheese was baked into the crust or something. Both pizza were amazing! I loved the mootz pizza because I love garlic. As for the Freddie pizza, who knew that I've been missing sesame seeds in my pizza crust this entire time! 

The trip thing about this place is that the pizza is way too high. I think the cheese pizza was about $4.25 a slice and the other was about $4.75. That's way too much for a slice of pizza in my book. I will probably come again, but I wouldn't be a regular customer.
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop

text: Dontcha hate when a negative experience is what prompts a review? Two stars because I've had the pizza before and it's quite good. -3 because we placed an order tonight (12/10/21) through doordash. 40 minutes go by, the app says the dasher is at the restaurant waiting, then boom, "order canceled." Got an email saying my order was canceled because the restaurant was closed. Even though a dasher was supposedly there waiting. And even though they REMAINED active in doordash to place an order after our order was canceled. One day I may go back to Paulie Gee's and remember how much I like them and raise this score. But right now they've left a sour taste in my mouth.
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop

text:
Some things were perfect and others were way off.  The boiled crabs were very small, but full.  They were out of large (and apparently medium) size.  The flavor of the crabs with the chili butter was OUTSTANDING.  But all the meat stuck inside all the claws (over-boiled)?  I'm a New Orleanian and I know how to pick crabs :) The "tools" given didn't work for eating small crab claws.  The "butter" knife had a very large round end, so no way of using to dig out the stuck meat.  We were still hungry so shared an oyster plate.  The very, very small oysters were DELICIOUS.  The dipping sauce was DELICIOUS.  The problem was it was 6 tiny oysters for around $18.  No way a meal in itself.  It would have been perfect as an $8 appetizer.   Super friendly staff, great vibe.  Really good food.  This restaurant has a LOT of potential, and I would give it another try for the crabs alone.  I hope they up their game.  This is a place I would definitely bring out of towners if they can pull it together better.  A nice, but not necessary, touch would also be to offer some sort of hand wipe after eating crabs.  Opening the restroom door was tricky.    

LET'S GIVE THESE GUYS A CHANCE.  THEY KNOW HOW TO COOK!!!
name: Seafood Sally's

text:
checked them out 'cause they are new in the 'hood. Yey for them! Love the somewhat upscale interpretation of what is ubiquituos in these here parts.

The food and drinks:
*the tequila based drink with the boil spice rim was excellent
*fish dip was salty and subtley smokey
*catfish was nicely fried, not over seasoned, not too much (!) and with a lovely fresh slaw. The sauce wasn't tartar (yey) and not too heavy.

The setting:
The place has a great covered and fanned deck, a tree shaded garden area as well a nicely decorated inside. I was outside, which was comfy (for me..) even in steamy July.

The service:
very friendly and attentive.

result: I will be back for the watermelon crab salad at the very least.

only comment is that I would have preferred bread toasts like things with the fish dip rather than saltines as they were a bit soggy with the humidity..
name: Seafood Sally's

text: Lovely brunch spot with fantastic people and excellent food.  Nice big windows make for an open and airy feel.  You can choose between brewing methods for your coffee.  The croissant sandwich was great--very fresh.  My partner ordered the Cuban sandwich, but  a few minutes later the server came out to say they didn't have the bread, so he ended up switching to the two-egg breakfast.  As we were eating, the chef, Noah, noticed our dog and brought over a homemade dog biscuit.  On our way out, Noah came over again and let us know that he takes tremendous pride in the Cuban sandwich on the menu, and that he was sorry the bread hadn't been available--the supply chain right now is just tough.  He handed us a bag, however--it was a fresh Cuban sandwich on the house.  He had personally gone out to get the bread and brought it back to whip up before we left.  What incredible and thoughtful service.  And the sandwich was legit--the flavors were just right, the ham was tender, and the crisp on the bread was perfect.
name: Frenchmen All Day

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': None, u'hipster': None, u'casual': True, u'touristy': None, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': None, u'romantic': None, u'classy': None, u'upscale': None}

text:
I walked a mile from my office to get this pizza (and a mile back) and it was absolutely worth it. The round pies are the perfect specimen of NYC pizza - thin enough to fold, crispy, flavorful tomato sauce, just enough cheese for balance. I also tried a square slice, which was not too thick and had a nice crunch on the bottom from the sesame seeds, which I took a picture of but you can't really see. I actually wanted the square slice without pepperoni, but was given one with it so I just ate it rather than try to exchange it.

I did observe a couple of people receiving the wrong order and my coworker went later that day and also received the wrong order. Which is a bit strange, since there are only like 6 things on the menu. I think they're still working out the kinks organization-wise and will figure it out. 

The pizza is incredible and my order came out fast. I went early and there was plenty of seating, but by noon it filled up quickly. I'm definitely going to swing by and pick up a whole pie to take home in the near future. Also, they are vigilant about cleaning, as they have a person constantly spraying and wiping down surfaces. I wish they had a recycle bin for the plastic bottles of water and aluminum cans- hopefully they will add one. 

Worth the hype and I'm happy to know I can get my NYC fix close to home!!
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop

attributes.BusinessParking: {u'valet': False, u'garage': True, u'street': None, u'lot': None, u'validated': None}
attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': None, u'hipster': None, u'casual': True, u'touristy': None, u'trendy': None, u'intimate': None, u'romantic': None, u'classy': None, u'upscale': None}

text:
In all, I expected this place to be a little better than what it was. But I know they just opened so I'm really hoping it improves because it has a lot of potential! 

First, the space is very nice and they have tons of outdoor seating. Their courtyard and porch is wonderful. 

We got two cocktails. I got the cucumber one (can't remember the name) and it was very good! Really liked their drinks. 

The appetizer options leave something to be desired. We ended up getting the onion rings which were fried great but were pretty spicy (and this is coming from someone who loves spice). The dip they came with was also extremely spicy and vinegary which I didn't like. 

Speaking of sauces, all their sauces were disappointing and didn't really match the flavor profile of what you're eating. Most had a very vinegary taste. We also got the fried seafood plates and they served it with a vinegary green sauce which was just awful. Honestly wish they just had the basic tartar and cocktail sauce. 

The fried seafood was hit or miss. I will say the shrimp were VERY good and VERY fresh. Reminded me a lot of how my mom cooked them. And they had that sweet taste that I've only ever eaten from fresh Louisiana shrimp. The catfish wasn't as great. Very muddy and kind of soggy. seems like there wasn't enough breading or it wasn't fried long enough. I didn't eat my filet. 

Their options for sides were also disappointing. Your entrees don't come with sides. And It was weird to me that they had fried seafood without French fries. We ended up getting the cheddar biscuits which were pretty good, but just wished there were more options besides slaw, cucumbers and potato salad. 

It's also a bit pricy for what you get in my opinion. but kinda expected that given these are the owners of Margies. 

I'm interested to try their boiled seafood next time and hoping that with time they'll improve!
name: Seafood Sally's

text:
"Hot coffee and warm service"--Frenchmen All Day lives up to this sign in their front window! Ended up here after another brunch spot around the corner sat my group and then did not interact with us for 15 full minutes, while serving tables they sat after us. Thank goodness for that disaster because we were warmly greeted immediately upon walking up to Frenchmen. Our server (Sigrid? I think that's right) was delightful and on top of their game. 

Excellent coffee, spicy bloody marys, and the best shrimp and grits I've had. Don't miss out on this gem!

text: Being a pizza connoisseur, when I heard a new northern style pizza join was opening up I made a b-line for it. The staff was great. Very open to explaining what was on each slice. We tried the pepperoni (my go-to) and the square pepperoni which has a sesame seed glazed bottom. Pretty tasty!! Totally different than the normal but worth trying. The regular pepperoni was still my fav but my only con is that the pizza was EXTRA thin. Like almost no dough thin. It was opening day so I understand things are just starting out. Sauce was good. Will return sometime.

text: Being from the Northeast I grew up with a pizza place in every town. Pizza by the slice after the bars closed -pizza that can be folded in half and eaten on the go. While NOLA  is a culinary Mecca I still love me a slice of pizza. Pizza by the slice is hard to find around here. A basic piece of cheese is the benchmark of if crust and sauce is good. This hit all the marks.  Very generous slice -sauce is good not sweet and just the right amount of cheese. Folds perfectly ! Will be back
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop

text:
Came here for lunch.  Had a slice of pizza and a coke.  The pizza was delicious.  Great flavor for the pizza overall.  The sauce was great.  The cheese and pepperoni was of great quality.  
The slice was nice sized.  It was served very hot!  
The pizza did not cause heartburn or acid reflux so it's made of great quality. 
The staff was very friendly.  Overall happy with the visit. 
I would for sure go back in the future.
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop

text:
I was born and grew up in New York so I feel the way about a slice the way people from New Orleans feel about gumbo. There is a right way to do it and WE KNOW!!!  It's a Birthright! LOL Anyway, the barometer for me is always a slice of cheese.  So, we ordered a Slice of Cheese and a Slice of Pepperoni, Mootz (garlic white sauce slice) and the Hellboy (a slice of pepperoni with a Hot Honey drizzled over it. ) I liked the Hellboy but I thought the Hot Honey was not really hot at all.  I was really hoping for some theatrics or at least a mild palpitation of tongue numbing madness!  Sadly, that did not happen. However, I did like it and they sell the Hot Honey if you want to buy it.  The Cheese Slice was perfect! Thin, crispy, foldable, floppy and the right ratio of tomato sauce to cheese.  A Legit NY Slice in NOLA! 
Also, cool is the whole ambience. It is stylized like a NY pizzeria from the 70's /80's era. Orange hard laminate booths, black and white flooring, and the menu with letters you push in.  I will definitely be going back.  Got my eye on a square of a Sicilian , specifically Freddy Prize for next time!
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop

text: My husband and I had an enjoyable meal at Paulie Gee. We split a Hellboy 2 slice, a sausage slice, and a mozz slice. The hellboy was out favorite. I do with the others had a little more seasoning- the crust had no salt and the sauce tasted like plain tomato sauce. But we added some salt and Italian seasoning that was on the table which helped a lot!

text: 5 of us went for lunch. Patio with picnic tables for outdoor dining. The sautÃ©ed crab claw appetizer was excellent. We also got the onion rings. text: Had PG's on back to back nights because it was so good. My group ordered from here for a party at Stumpy's and it was excellent. The pepperoni pies were just as you get in NYC. The added greatness was the Mike's Hot Honey which I have become a huge fan of. It was so good a friend came back for her birthday and ordered the huge Sicilian and I bought a bottle of hot honey to go with it. Superb. The pizzas are on the expensive side and not in a great location but if you are in the neighborhood its not a bad spot.

text:
Wow!! This stuff is good! And I've had my fair share of pizza in NOLA. WE LOVE GETTING SLICES. So that's what we did today. It was about $3.50-$5 per slice so it was a little pricey for cheese and pepperoni. 

We got cheese, pepperoni, mootz, and the hell boy square slice! Hell boy is topped with Mike's hot honey. It was very tasty and they heated up perfectly. There wasn't a wait when we got there. And we got can soda and bottled water. 

I would definitely be back and I hope they'll have some other speciality pizza

text: Wowwwoow!!! SO good! This new seafood restaurant located on popular Oak St is soon to be our fave. We sat at the bar and had the most attentive service for as busy as they were. The menu is fairly expansive and the atmosphere is airy and relaxing. They have outside seating too for those lovely spring evenings where you can sip their fancy cocktails and slurp oysters. We had the Cesar salad and added buttered crab then tried the cornmeal fried oyster and shrimp platter. Since it was warm out, we had their chilled red wine then switched to rose. Their cocktail menu is creative so if you can't sit down for a meal, at least get a drink to go so you can check out this darling seafood restaurant. We can't wait to go back and try more items on the menu. When we walked out, a customer was saying how delicious his BOILED crabs were. :) Enjoy!!
name: Seafood Sally's

text: Where do I start?!?! The pizza was amazing and ole so delicious! It was cooked to perfection and had just the right amount of cheese to pepperoni ratio. The crust was soft and the pizza slices were huge. The cheese pizza was also very good and had the right amount of crust to toppings ratio. I couldn't just have one even though I was finished 3 slices ago. I think what set this pizza apart from others was the hot honey packets that accompanied the pizza which was so good. A great balance of sweet, salty, and spicy to bring a fun food to a different level of the fun. I would recommend this pizza shop and will be ordering again soon.
name: Paulie Gee's Crescent City Slice Shop
