text: This spot is cute little spot, you may pass it up the first time but don't be alarmed just look for the Columbia flag! The food is delicious, I got a steak arepa, your taste buds will burst with flavor as the savory taste of steak, avocado, and cheese melts away in your mouth. Come and get a taste, you will get a little taste Columbia here in the states! To top things off masks are worn by all employees, and the temperature is taken before steamed, as well as sanitizing stations.
name: Golden Gate Bistro

text:
My first time trying El Paso. I called in an order to go. I get to the restaurant and only a couple was sitting in dining.  First off, the staff seemed unpleasant like they didn't want to be there. 
Go to the bar to pick up my to go order, then decided to add a small frozen margarita to go. 
The girl gives me my frozen margarita in a glass and I said it was to go, and gives me a to go cup to pour myself and walks off without a word. 
I get home and my food looks like trash. 
Then I realized I may have been overcharged. 
So, I go look for my receipt. They give you a receipt that does not itemize or show price of items you ordered. Which is strange to me. 
One thing about a business is I don't like to feel like I'm getting scammed. 
And the way the girl ran off so fast after giving me my order, shows me they are doing some shady things with your bill once you've paid . 
I will look further into this business and how exactly they run their operation. 
Given the state of businesses right now, they are lucky they got my business. 
But it does not give them the right to overcharge customers unknowingly . 
No itemized receipt .. that's shady business.
name: El Paso Mexican Grill

text: When first approaching the restaurant it looks like any other on Magazine Street. However when you open the door and step in you are greeted with a warm inviting space that makes you feel curious about what to try first. To my delight there is also outdoor seating in the back that opened to a whimsical seating are that was setup perfectly for dining with friends of that special someone. The menu has an array of choices from boar to chicken. And of course their famous meatballs. The name sake of the restaurant "Red Gravy" surprised me. I was expecting something thick and spicy. I was happy to taste the sauce and notice it's rich tomato flavor with hints of love, goodness, and homemade flavor from Rosanne's kitchen.
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Randomly showed up on their first day.  The chips were fresh, the salsa is kind of smokey with a kick (so beware if you dont love super spicy salsa), the cheese dip was great and they even serve a hot black bean dip with the salsa that was really good.  I ordered the chimichanga extra crispy (my usual first visit menu item for all mexican places). The chimi was wonderful...extra crispy delicious chicken good amount of beans and rice that were also tasty.  The rest of the table ordered taco and burrito combos and all loved their food.  The service was speedy as well.  So for their first day they are doing well.  I hope they can maintain this quality and service because it was great!  Our server was Luis...great job Luis thanks so much!
name: El Paso Mexican Grill

text: I truly don't get the 5 star reviews here. The food is New Orleans-inspired Italian, I guess you could call it? Except the owners are recent transplants, so to a native like me it's a New Jersey interpretation of creole food, but not really. Heavily laden with creams and butters and salt and garlic. No subtlety, no nuanced flavors. Judging from the crowd who go here (tourists and recent transplants- surprise!), I'd say there are a good number of people who have no idea what New Orleans cuisine is really about. They will tell their friends, they will return to New Jersey and Cleveland and rave about this place on Yelp. And I am thankful, as this preserves the great local eateries for natives and true culinary aficionados, as God intended.
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
The food here is a reflection on what you would find in any Colombian kitchen; the servings are large and the dishes don't hold back on the flavor. The experience feels as if you are eating in a friend's home rather than a restaurant.

Some of the menu's specialties are Empandas ($2.50), a traditional corn patty filled with beef or chicken; Bandeja Paisa ($22), white rice, red beans, grilled steak, pork belly fried egg, avocado, sweet plantain, Colombian chorizo and arepa; PatacÃ³n Gloria ($18-$22), fried green plantain with lettuce and cheese with choice of pork, steak and chicken, or shrimp; and Pescado Frito ($25), a grilled stuffed fish served with rice, vegetables, fried green plantains and salad.

Everything was fantastic and the owners are so nice. They now have outdoor seating which is perfect for nice days.

I wrote about this spot for Uptown Messenger. Check it out here: https://uptownmessenger.com/2021/05/golden-gate-bistro/
name: Golden Gate Bistro

text:
Went to the parish diner on 6/15/19 at 1:53 am and it was not good at all. They had a few tables and 2 waitress. I order a burger, with lettuce, tomatoes and cheese, with a side of fries. It took them just about 30 minutes to bring burger, I always look at my burger when it comes, I am so glad I did there was no tomatoes, but the worst thing there was mayo on it,
I call the waitress over told her what was wrong, her reply was you ordered it with mayo,(I don't eat mayo, so why would order it) the burger was over done it looked burnt on one side and  brownish on the other, I did not want them to change the bun as the mayo was on the lettuce and meat, she said do you want a new one, told her no, just get the bill together, as she did the fries came over, they were over cooked you were eating  crispy there was nothing inside of the fries. So they charged me $2.99 for the fries, and $2.59 for the tea for a total of $6.11 before tip.
This was my second time there and it was just like the first time.
I will not be going back nor will I recommend it.
name: Parish Diner

text: My husband and I took a travel outside the French quarter and landed on magazine street. We found this quaint Italian restaurant and we are so thankful that we did. I had read the reviews and the reviews said it all and they were true about this little place. If I can give it more than five stars I would. We started off with mimosas which was absolutely delicious. The waiter was very cordial and polite and kind and recommended the shrimp dish is from his chef. My husband had the shrimp and grits and may I say that it's some of the best I personally I've ever tasted and he thought they were to die for. The sauce was the wonderful consistency but the flavor was outstanding. The shrimp were cooked to a perfection and season so good! I had the miso shrimp dish and it came on brioche bread with avocados scrambled eggs and a wonderful sauce on top of all of it. This dish was absolutely divine and to die for. I cannot ask ask for anything better in my experience of being in this part of New Orleans. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for true authentic Italian food from someone a chef who tends to every dish like her baby. This is a wonderful little hole in the wall, do yourself a favor and visit. Outside seating and courtyard seating available as well as inside! They are practicing social distance!!
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Got a to go order from this place -- fried Delacroix catfish with red beans, green beans and a side of gumbo. The guy that took my order sounded professional and his voice was clear. He said to be there in 15 mins so I was. My food was not ready (it took them another 12 minutes) which was odd since there was just 1 table and 1 go order before mine. Anyway while I was waiting I had a long time to observe that none of the cooks were wearing face masks, and only one of the 2 waitresses was wearing a face mask properly. The improper one, who had the mask resting on her chin, was not going to tables but she was interacting with ice, utensils, and other objects behind the counter. 

I collect my food and get home to eat. Everything looked decent enough so I started with the catfish. It was actually amazing. The fish was perfect, sauce great. Awesome flavor. Unfortunately the shrimp they also threw in there were TERRIBLE. They were rubbery, like they had been boiled for 30 minutes. Some of them had shells on still. Undeterred I cracked in to the Red beans. It was meh. Had a strange aftertaste but otherwise it was standard fare. The Green beans were also average. The gumbo was probably the worst gumbo I've had in a while. Like the shrimp, the meat in the gumbo tasted like it was cooked too long. IT was chewy and rubbery. The gumbo itself didn't really have a gumbo taste. 

Waitresses were friendly enough and the fish itself was great but everything else was bad bad bad. Strike another place that's open on Sundays in the Parish.
name: Parish Diner

text:
We stopped in for dinner before hitting up a music event. We had no real plans in terms of where we were going to stop but as we were walking by the place looked nice and we were intrigued by their drink specials on the board. We sat at the bar and our bartender was very nice. He politely explained the drinks we weren't familiar with. I was torn between my two favorites- red curry and kung pao and he also talked me through how they make theirs so I could make a decision. 

I went with kung pao and they had a really pretty presentation. I was also happy with the amount of chicken, peanuts and zucchini. Only slight downside was the amount of rice it comes with. I don't usually eat the rice but the dish is big enough to share or have leftovers but if you like rice you'd need a second serving.  

All-in-all would totally go back to try more items from their menu!
name: Zhang Bistro

So, if you're a gambler, roll them dice but plan on being there for about an hour longer than you expected while they figure out which order goes where and why there are hash browns in your drink.

text:
I've heard about this place prior to the one opening here. I love sushi and always wanted to go to this place, but there was never one here in the city. Until now! Checked out the menu and I love the theme of the restaurant. 

Walked in to place a to go order. I ordered the Spicy Crawfish Roll and the Thriller Roll. The Thriller Roll, named after the classic Michael Jackson hit "Thriller" of course. The servers were friendly, service was fast, and the ambience was great. Reminded he of Hard Rock Cafe, but it's a sushi based menu. If that's ok for me to say.

I came home, opened the containers with the sushi, took one bite, and i was hooked! It tasted so good, and I was satisfied once finished. Located on the second level in the Riverwalk Mall, it's a small but great place if you wanna grab a bite before, after or in between shopping in the mall. I highly recommend this place. I will be a frequent guest.
name: Rock N Roll Sushi
address: 500 Port Of New Orleans Pl, Ste 280

text: Tried this place while shopping in the Riverwalk. They were advertised pretty heavily and after eating there I know why. My friend and I tried the Hibatchi and the ticket time took forever. When we got our food the rice was hard and lukewarm and the meat was cold. We let the waitress know, and she apologized and offered to re-make our food and gave us a free appetizer. We had to wait additional time to get our food. We got the crispy wontons as our appetizer, which was the best tasting thing we had, but was also undercooked. The breading was pale, when its supposed to be light brown for fried food. When we got our food again it was still lukewarm and the rice was still undercooked. We were so disappointed we didn't bring our leftover food home.

text:
This spot has the best views and even better people! Owned by women, they support the community any way they can. They are located in the Riverwalk and are centrally located in the mall, right above Forever 21. 

I went with a friend and I love sushi. I am obsessed. The views look out to the MS river and you can people watch as well. We asked BeeJay what was the most popular. I'm not a fan of cream cheese in my sushi but the one we order had it in there. We ordered the Cyndi and the heart roll friend. After I told her I did not like cream cheese, they made sure it was in there but not a huge chuck like other places would do. 

The edamame is delish! I love spicy edamame. They also have RAMEN! Enough said. The broth of the spicy ramen is delish and you must add some black garlic in there.
name: Rock N Roll Sushi
address: 500 Port Of New Orleans Pl, Ste 280

text:
The French Quarter is quite overwhelming with all the theatrics, the people, the many storefronts so this place may blend in with the drama. They are a fusion restaurant combining Thai & Chinese cuisine under one roof. The place is great for large group dinners since the portions of the entrees are huge! Their appetizers were probably the highlight of our meal. We got their Shu Mai, Spicy Cucumbers, Fried Dumplings, Shrimp Wontons, Salt & Pepper Shrimp,  Spicy Fried Chick, Drunken Noodles, & Bok Choy. Make sure you are prepared for the spice level, the Fried Chicken is numbing!

text: I was there yesterday ! Yes ! I ate out twice in one day . I enjoyed an entree from their luncheon menu . The ground meat Chimichanga with beans ,rice , guacamole andlettuce , tomatoes, sour cream and cheese sauce and of course a cold beer on tap . Service was excellent. I was alone and normally with my family . The way I treat people they treat me in return . Everything was warm and not rushed . My server walked over to help me with the menu due to my leaving my reading glasses at home . Always a little humor in my reviews. They were one of the first businesses to reopen and I heard nothing but the over price reviews on Neighbor .com which I found untrue . Of course , now days everyone wants something for nothing . Stay home and eat a bologna sandwich. This business was running on a generator and I had one at my house . I know how much that gasoline was costing . My youngest daughter was eating here every day after they opened . She appreciated getting hot cooked food and a margarita on the rocks . Thankyou again for the the service, the food , and for reopening as quickly as you did after the storm .

text: Ordered 4 meals online around 7:54 PM on 2/13. Website confirmed order to be ready at 8:25 PM. Arrived 8:30 PM and order was not ready. Was told another 15 mins. Waited and again order was not ready and was told another 15 mins. When I asked to speak to the manager I was told that "she didn't have time for me." Was told another 15 mins. Still not ready . Food finally ready about 1 hour after stated ready time of 8:25 PM . Bartender told me he did see the order.  Never received a real explanation and bartender offered me a "shot." I was insulted. Food was cold and not very good. Also restaurant was over crowded and I didn't see any social distancing. I have reported this restaurant to the city. I will not return as the service was terrible and the staff basically ignored me.
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text: We recently placed a large order for takeout for family arriving in town. We ordered the meatballs, zucchini fritters, garlic bread, red gravy entree, bolognese, carbonara, shrimp fra diavolo, chicken parmesan, eggplant, and ravioli special.  Every dish was prepared perfectly and was delicious. Sometimes carryout can become overly oily and soggy but this was not the case with our fantastic dinner. We now have our favorite Italian restaurant. Thanks so much for a lovely dinner.
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text: The new space , what can I say. It's charming , homey, and enjoyable. The food was amazing. We had several dishes. The homemade Italian sausage with onions and pepper, the monkfish, you have to try , and the Zeppoles are ridiculous with a raspberry filling. Roseanne, the owner/chef, came over and checked on how we liked the dinner. Well , delicious, of course !! It's a must try in the Garden District area of Magazine. Red Gravy. You can't miss it!
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text: We were headed to a different restaurant that was closed although they were supposed to be open. I am thrilled they were closed! We were seated immediately and our drink orders were taken. My partner got a local beer and it was made from grapefruit. I don't drink (some people become "too wonderful for words" after a few, lol) but it smelled great. Our hot and sour soup was delicious and hot! (as in temperature, not spice). We ordered vegetarian pad thai, garlic eggplant, curry chicken, and a couple items to go. Each entree was delicious, hot, and our server was great! The bartender was friendly although his mask was a tad bit intimidating (S & M spikes) and all in good fun! We will go back if we can arrange it.
name: Zhang Bistro

text: Red Gravy was a very up and down place. To start I ordered a bottle of wine off of their surprisingly small wine selection which was pretty good. Then I got the meatballs appetizer which was excellent. Two large juicy meatballs that were perfect mix of pork and beef. Then had a cheese board which I think was pretty average. Definitely not bad but nothing special.  Follow that I got the special which was rabbit sausage pasta which was excellent. Finally I got the pasta carbonara which should be struck from the menu. There take on the classic Italian dish fell short by a lot even after most of the wait staff said it was excellent. I wonder if they've ever actually eaten carbonara. All in all I'd say the highs were real high and the lows real low.
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
For me, there's not much better than fresh, warm chips, house made salsa and a good margarita to pass the time.  Back that up with some solid Tex-Mex food and you got a place I will enjoy.  El Paso is the best in this area that I have found.  (btw - you can debate whether this is Tex-Mex or Mexican all you want but in fact most of these dishes, enchiladas, burritos, etc. were invented in South Texas to feed hungry workers.  See Robb Walsh's book "The Tex-Mex Cookbook".)

Back to that margarita, I ordered the house margarita which was 2 for 1 during happy hour.  Its good, not great, not too sweet with a decent tequila taste. For the price thugh quite a bargain.  Next time I will try their top shelf.  But what really hurts their drinks are the cheap plastic cups they serve them in.  A good margarita needs to be served in glass, preferable chilled.

As for the food, I had the Enchiladas Alcarbon - basically 3 cheese enchiladas topped with fajita meat, cheese sauce and a red or green sauce.  I got the green sauce as its hotter.  Delicious, the flavor and tenderness of the fajita meat was very good, the green sauce nice and spicy.  An excellent combination.

We went to El Paso on a Thursday about 5:30 PM, the service was quick and friendly.  I have heard from family that they can get backed up later in the evening.

Also our server told us they have music on Saturday nights starting at 7 PM.
name: El Paso Mexican Grill

text:
Bland food, pasta does not taste homemade contrary to their claims that all their pasta is homemade and very expensive for quality and quantities of food. We got  take out and all the containers were so flimsy that they had collapsed due to the liquid and turned over in transit,  food was super mushy and barely edible including the salad
Which was wet, soft and tasteless. Total bill for two entrees and a salad was over 80$, crazy and the portions were tiny. To be fair I'm sure food tastes better when you eat in the restaurant but I certainly won't be trying it out again. Overall a very disappointing experience, we've been trying to help the local restaurants out and trying new ones but this one is not worth the money, will not be going back for seconds.
name: Red Gravy

text:
Happened upon this place after a walking tour in the city left as at America Sports Saloon across the street and it totally salvaged an otherwise wash of a night.

Immediately greeted when entering (which I love) and was given the choice of bar or table seating. Sat at the bar and had the most pleasant experience when James who was very accommodating of my husbands dietary restrictions. Our food came out very quickly. David also helped get us settled.

The Peking duck app was great, a little fatty but that can be expected. The coconut shrimp as a rec from James was great. Nice and crispy and not too heavily seasoned.
Then I got Mongolian beef- loved! Perfect amount of food and the sauce was fantastic. Came with rice and got a combo of shrimp beef and chicken fried rice that was also great.
My husband got pad Thai and all the toppings came on the side so you could add more or have less of the peanuts and red chili or scallions.
The baby bok choy we got on the side also came with rice so hit it with the combo again. Really nice clean flavor not overly soy sauced. Garlic chunk which I love.

The portions for the money were great, took leftovers home and had them the next day and even reheated were spot on.

Happy to have gotten to find this place and speak with James and David for our meal. Would happily come back on my next trip into New Orleans
name: Zhang Bistro

text: Red Gravy serves delicious scratch-made comfort food while incorporating many clean ingredients. Most of the produce at Red Gravy is clean, local and organically grown. The grits and chicken are organic, and the seafood is wild-caught. Most of the menu is scratch-made in house, yes, even the pasta. Several gluten-free dishes are also available...including pancakes:). We ordered Lou's breakfast. The pancakes were amazing, light, fluffy, delish and made with organic flour. The sausage was mild, moist and not overpowered with spices...a truly yummy traditional breakfast.  The menu is extensive and consists of traditional breakfast foods and Italian dishes such as house-made gnocchi, spaghetti & meatballs, paninis, sandwiches, and shrimp and grits.
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
My rating is based on my experience after numerous visits (dine in and to go) which all of them have been extremely pleasurable. My entrees primarily have been from their Signature and Thai selections of the menu with a few ventures to the Chinese side. I always choose the medium spice level and it's definitely the hottest I would personally be able to handle. It's a 4 out of 5 handkerchief rating for the sinus opening level! I would order everyone of the dishes I've had so far again which is very rare for me to say about a restaurant. They have all been large portions-either large enough for two to share or lunch the next day-and reasonably priced. The duck appetizer and fresh rolls so far are my favorite appetizers but I haven't tried them all so time will tell. I love their PadThai and Red curry sauce and well the roti is another must if you enjoy a bread with your meal. 
The waitstaff are all extremely pleasant and attentive. They also offer Apple Pay which is a huge plus in my book.  The atmosphere is nice and spacious which helps with the covid protocols. They offer a large bar which is perfect when dining alone.
name: Zhang Bistro

text:
This is another spot that you may never know about unless you are looking specifically for it.  It's tucked away in a little spot in a less-traveled part of Fat City.  Centro is a more low-ball restaurant/bar, but PLEASE do not allow the appearance to put you off too much.  There is an obvious central American predilection here, but the staff show hospitality and treat you well no matter who you are.  Centro has a relatively small menu, but it's pure with a more authentic Nicaraguan feel.  Some version of a "sampler" is offered as an entree (don't remember the very long name of the dish - sorry!), which is a great big plate of almost everything.

Honestly, Centro is recommended more for lunch, as there isn't much going on in this part of town during dinner hours, and it can be a little uncomfortable.

Limited bar with imported beers.
name: Centroamericana Restaurant

text:
Taco Tuesday

Carne Asada Tacos and Chicken Empanadas

Perfectly grilled corn tortillas stuffed with magnificently cooked black beans and rice under heavenly marinated steak.
They are topped with cotija and salsa verde!
 *chef's kiss* 

Can you tell I love these tacos?

I typically order fish or carne asada tacos with a side of rice and beans. Then I end up taking a bit of my rice and beans and eating it with each bite of my tacos. 
Talk about time saving and efficient! These tacos come with the rice and beans already mixed in!

Now the empanadas. I wasn't a fan at first bite.

I'm Puerto Rican and Im used to a thinner breading with more filling. 

The breading on these empanadas is heavy and more corn based. After getting through the breading the chicken filling was immaculate! I even dipped the empanada into the sauce it's paired with and it got even better.

I'll honestly never order the empanadas again because of preference but they were delicious!

This restaurant is located in the Pythian Market which offers online ordering as well as curbside pickup!
Pythianmatket.com

Tacos are in my top 5 dishes, I'm always excited to share a new experience on my favs!
name: La Cocinita

text:
Although I'm only giving this review three stars, I'll start off by saying that the place is really not bad, at all. We sat at the bar and had some happy hour drinks (the Bali Lemon Freeze is delicious). The food is decent. BUT (and thus the rating) there is literally no spice to anything at all. We like extremely spicy  Thai and Szechuan food, and that's what we thought we were getting - not the case. We asked for ALL our dishes to be "Thai hot" (the hottest) and not a single dish was even mildly spicy, sadly. 

The Spicy Cucumber salad is not spicy. More of a soy flavor. 

Crispy egg rolls were crispy egg rolls. Good, but nothing spectacular.

The peking duck sampler was actually pretty tasty. 

The biggest disappointment was the dry red chili chicken. At a real Szechuan place, this would be numbing from the peppercorns and chilis, and pretty spicy. This one was neither numbing nor spicy, and was not really that great. 

Mapo Tofu was good, and a decent amount of food, just not spicy in the least. 

Thai Basil (beef) was tasty, but again just lacking all spice you'd want. 

If you come in looking for pretty mild Chinese or Thai food, you'll probably be OK, but be sure to know what you're getting.
name: Zhang Bistro

text:
I've been having to cut back on fried/greasy/fatty foods lately, so I was excited to see that this place offers grilled and blacked options for some entries. I placed my to-go order over the phone easily enough, and has only a brief wait when I arrived before my food was ready.

I got the blackened catfish with corn and rice & gravy, plus bread pudding for dessert. The fish was well cooked, nicely seasoned, and refreshing for not being fried. The bread pudding was very tasty too, with strawberries, blueberries, and white chocolate. If you're looking for seafood but don't want it fried (or boiled), give this place a try.
name: Parish Diner

text: Love this place! Chicken wings are to die for! Amazing seasoning. Absolutely Love the Thai tea! One of the most authentic Thai tea I've tasted besides equator in Metairie in Louisiana. Thai tea is concentrated and can really taste the tea but not overwhelming in tea nor too sweet. It's a perfect blend of milk and tea. Love it!! And I'm quite picky when it comes to my Thai tea as well. The aura of the place is very comfortable and chic, very well designed, great for pics. Order whiskey and sprite from bartender, perfect mix of both, taste good. Great bartender. Owner is so welcoming and helpful. Waiter was very attentive and helpful as well! Great service! Everything came on time and plating was beautiful! Chef came out every once in a while to see the customers enjoy their food. I got to see every aspect of the restaurant from the dining area to the kitchen work well and together.
name: Zhang Bistro

text:
We went to this restaurant when we received a recommendation from a friend. We went on a weekday evening and we were seated immediately. We looked over the menu and decided to order a cross section of items so we could try different foods. We started with the cucumber salad, the coconut shrimp and the steamed dumplings. The cucumber salad was flavor-free. The coconut shrimp appetizer was delicious and the steamed dumplings were just okay. 

For entree's, we ordered the red chili chicken and the beef lo mien. The red chili chicken was THE MOST SPICY DISH I HAVE EVER TASTED IN MY LIFE. I love spice, but this was ridiculous. I took 1 bite and could not go any further. My husband tried to get past 2 bites, but could not. We called the waiter over to inquire if it was supposed to be THAT hot and he shrugged and said, "it is spicy." I told him we were not going to be able to eat it and he just looked at me. He did not offer to replace it with anything else. We did not eat another bite of it and i assumed he would take it off the ticket. He did not. We shared the beef lo mien entree and left.
name: Zhang Bistro

text: I don't care what any other review about this place says because this is the best Mexican restaurant. They're food is pretty well priced for the size. The fajitas are to die for and they give you a huge portion for pretty average priced fajitas. The service is always attentive and great, and the food comes out pretty quickly. The staff is also very quick to refill your chop basket when it's running low. Oh, and not to mention the complimentary bean dip which is one of the best parts about this place.

text:
One of those gems that you seldom run across. Chinese food? Yup! Thai too? Yes! But you have never tasted anything you are familiar with like they serve at Zhang. Take the best dish ever, and add just a bit of flavor, spice or other kicker to put it over the top. The servers are terrific, particularly our Chris who was so entertaining and fun. Family owned, you may be shocked to discover that the bus people and table cleaners are actually the owners, who pitch in as needed all over the restaurant. 

Zhang saved us when we could not locate a Chinese restaurant who would accommodate 10 of us for our annual Christmas Eve dinner. Zhang welcomed and accommodated all of us and made the evening extra special.

So convenient in the French Quarter, we will be back, and back and back!
name: Zhang Bistro

text: When you order with your eyes. We would've ordered everything if possible. We couldn't wait to come here with friends since my spouse is Colombian . Some must if you have never eating Colombian food: the stuffed arepa, empanadas with Aji (spicy jalapeÃ±o sauce to go with empanada), bandeja paisa. The only thing that was just eeehhh was the soup. It was a little bland in flavor idk if the try to use the same broth for the two soups so they don't put the meat in it and it's served on the side. The flavor comes from the meat. It was our first time eating queso golden and it was delicious . The portions size es grande.
name: Golden Gate Bistro

text:
I was so stoked to see vegan and vegetarian options at the Pythian market in New Orleans, near the French Quarter. I decided to get the bowl with Spanish rice and black beans, squash and also the cauliflower carrot corn sofrita mixture. 

I was a little shocked at the price, but I guess a lot of the food is pricey around here, so probably a normal price for a healthy filling meal. 

I got the salsa verde and jalapeÃ±o salsa on top, which were both good. I could have used a little more in the end, and I will ask for more if I come back. The beans were great, the corn was freshly cut off of the cob (Yum!) and the squash and cauliflower were both good. Wish I'd had a little more of the cauliflower but in the end I was full. 

I would definitely add avocado next time, I needed some more fat and creamy texture in there. All in all a great lunch choice that didn't have any animal products!
name: La Cocinita

text:
Clearly I am living in the twilight zone on this one.  

I had family in town and made a reservation to have dinner at Red Gravy.

Upon arrival we were greeted warmly and seated. There were originally 6 of us on our reservation, but one of us wasn't feeling well at the last minute so she stayed behind. We were seated at a table for 4 because we were less than 6 at this point. It was a bench against the wall on one side and 2 chairs on the other. The 3 of us on the bench side were really smushed so we asked if we could have a larger table. Um.....no.  Well, can we please add a chair to one end of the table?  Um.......no.   We were literally the only customers in the restaurant for the first 30 minutes. Eventually two small tables were seated. When we left, we were still only one of 3 tables.  I'm still scratching my head. The restaurant was full of empty larger tables the entire time we were there, and we were still left to be uncomfortable.  I'm not sure if it was personal because we were short one diner, but I certainly didn't want to compromise anyone's health by having a potentially sick person join us.  If space had been limited I'd get it. If we had originally reserved a table for 4 I would get it. I don't get it. 

So now for the food.  Not bad, but most of what we wanted to order wasn't available. We ordered the meatball appetizer which was delicious, but we needed more "red gravy". Isn't this the name of the restaurant???? We asked for more and were told that the red gravy was made to order so it would take a good while. What??? Seriously???? We asked for some bread, and again, it is made to order and would be a while.  Eventually the check came, we gave the server our credit card, and lo and behold - here comes the red gravy and bread.  Too late. I give up.

We were smashed together, eating meatballs with very little "red gravy", and none of the menu items that we wanted were available. 

I just don't get it. I was so disappointed.
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Welcome to New Orleans Zhang Bistro.  In a city full of spectacular Asian food, this place on their soft opening is special.  They offer a combination of traditional Thai AND Chinese dishes.  The ingredients are so fresh, and the liberal use of Thai basil is warmly welcomed. 

I like my food generally very spicy.  They offer three options and today I went medium just to set a baseline.   It was really balanced, just enough heat, but not enough to make you sweat.   All the spices were to enhance the ingredients, not overpower them.   We had several dishes and would happily order any of them again.   

Of everything we ordered the chicken coconut soup was probably my favorite. Sweet, savory, crisp.... Perfect hot day bowl of soup, and it was 89 today.  

So glad this joint opened, it replaced some spectacularly bad restaurants that have inhabited the space over the years.
name: Zhang Bistro

text:
We have been to the El Paso here in Kenner a number of times now. The decor is nice. Typical Mexican restaurant style with Spanish music playing through the speakers. 

They always start you out with fresh warm chips, amazing bean dip, and tasty salsa. Be careful because you can fill up on that alone. 

I haven't had them but have heard that the margaritas are really good. I can vouch for the sweet tea though, it's legit and the perfect drink for a hangover, I don't know why but it works. 

My wife really likes the cheese enchiladas here. I've had the Chile rellenos, they are just okay. The nachos are good and I would order them again. I like their enchilada burrito. It is a decent size burrito filled with beef, topped with queso and the red sauce. The chimichanga is good too. Practically the same thing as the enchilada burrito except it is fried first and a little smaller. The tacos are good too. 

The service can be hit or miss. Sometimes they are on point, other times you are tracking them down to even pay the bIll. 

They have a huge bar with plenty of TVs. So if you want to get together with some friends and enjoy some beers or cocktails while watching sports, this could work, but remember it is a restaurant too, so watch the language.
name: El Paso Mexican Grill

text:
It is definitely authentic made to order Latin food.  A family owned hole in the wall place and every customer was Latino.  Enormous glasses of fresh tea!  They brought a bowl of pickled jalapeno veggies rather than chips and salsa.
We had the fried chicken tacos (taquitos), fried cheese plate & papusas.  Each plate comes with side of a coleslaw type salad.
I'm realising that authentic Latin food has very basic seasoning,  so I ALWAYS need to add hot sauce or fresh jalapenos.  My Louisiana palate demands it.
I was excited to have papusas again.  These were good....not great.  The fried plantains were very good tho.  Everything else was  just ok.
name: Centroamericana Restaurant

text:
You may be wondering, "Who comes to New Orleans" to eat Asian Fusion?"  Zhang Bistro is a delightful departure from the usual New Orleans ÃtouffÃ©e, gumbo, shrimp, red beans and rice, etc.  If you like Thai or Chinese, Zhang adds a New Orleans touch to tradition Asian favorites.  

The Thai Ice Tea and Thai Beer were great. The potion sizes are large.  I ordered two appetizers instead of a main course, and could not finish both.  The taste, quality, service, and ambiance were perfect.  

I definitely recommend Zhang's Bistro.
name: Zhang Bistro

text:
This was my introduction to Colombian cuisine and goodness I am glad I tried it. The restaurant is fairly new and very clean with interesting decorations and bright, inviting colors.  Our server was absolutely delightful and very prompt. We started with a couple of juices-a passion fruit and guanabana. Wow! Refreshing. 

My friend had an empanada as an appetizer and we split the chicharrÃ³ns-best I've ever had. There was an avocado sauce and a pink sauce served with both that were tasty and house made. 

My friend had a chicken soup served with rice, avocado, sour cream, and capers on the side. It was beautiful and he said it reminded him of the same exact type of soup that he had in BogotÃ¡.

I enjoyed the garlic shrimp, large shrimp in butter garlic sauce served with a sort of chimichurri on the side and rice and a large beautiful salad.

Finally, they brought out a flan for my friend's birthday and he said it was incredibly super with a sort of coffee like her saturated in it. 

I will definitely be back, next time to try the steak.
name: Golden Gate Bistro

text:
When I heard Red Gravy was moving Uptown and serving dinner, I knew I had to get over there!

I was excited to visit Red Gravy on a recent date night with my fiance David. The quaint atmosphere transports you and the smell of delicious food is intoxicating.

We started with the Nanni -- miniature meatballs served with red gravy and fresh ricotta. These meatballs were anything but mini, and the red gravy and ricotta balanced the flavors of the meatballs well.

For an entree, we got Red Gravy's famous lasagna Bolognese, which is layers of ricotta, mozzarella and Bolognese layered delicately together and served fresh-baked from the oven. The lasagna is made fresh, so there's a 30-minute wait time when you order, but it's worth every bite. Our waitress described it as "a true lasagna, the way it's supposed to be."

We also got an order of the Bolognese -- hearty beef and pork ragu served with rigatoni. I loved how much meat was in this, and the flavorful sauce was delicate, yet bold, with the perfect amount of spice. The tastes were exactly what you would expect from any good Italian meal.

If you're a fan of Red Gravy's famous brunch, they still serve it up on Saturdays and Sundays and offer favorites such as shrimp and grits, served Tuscan style, brulee French toast, and breakfast spaghetti, which is served with sausage sugo, ricotta and sunny egg.

I wrote about this spot for Very Local New Orleans! Read my full write up here: https://nola.verylocal.com/red-gravy-restaurant-has-been-around-for-a-decade-but-youve-never-had-it-like-this/164161/
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text:

I came home with meat, rice, beans, and EVERYTHING to put inside of a tortilla- BUT NO TORTILLAS. To take it even further, my sister ordered a bean dip and they forgot that too. I love the food, but come on. You cannot afford to mess up right now.

text:
After walking by Zhang Bistro for the past year, finally stopped in for dinner this evening.  The bartender/hostess was super friendly and seated us immediately in the fairly quiet dining room. Very comfortable, casual atmosphere.  Our server took great care of us from start to finish.  We started with a couple cold beers and their version of Tom Kha (coconut chicken) soup, which was very good but a bit more watery than I'm used to.  Went with the spring rolls with peanut sauce next, which were awesome.  

For entrees we had cashew chicken stir fry, General Tso chicken, sweet & sour chicken and walnut shrimp.  All were solid choices, however I found medium spice level to be very mild and the walnut shrimp to be a bit on the sweet side.  Definitely going to crank the spice level up a notch next time and will likely try one of the curry dishes. 

ZB is a nice addition to the lower Decatur dining scene!
name: Zhang Bistro

text:
Thank god there is another Asian restaurant in the French quarter!!! I love Dian Xin due to their dining area size, it is such a hassle to get a table... but Zhang Bistro is huge and even though you do not have a reservation it is pretty easy to get a table when you walk in! 

We came here for a dinner on the weekend and it was very busy yet I did not feel like the service was slow. We were seated pretty quickly and everything was pretty much flowing smoothly. Our order came out pretty quickly and they came out in order. Did not have any complaints regarding food item as they came out as we expected! Can't wait to come back!
name: Zhang Bistro

text:
Lousy service from start to finish.  Confirmed reservations 4 times in 2 days   Mother's day weekend Saturday night and we had a reservation at 7.  The hostess was stupid enough to say that that seated a party of 5 at our table (also a party of five) st 6 pm.  To 'Sneak them in'. How stupid do you have to be to admit that to customers who tip big and order expensive wine. The  answer is very stupid!

Safe yourself the aggravation snd go to Pascale Manale.  Or Vincent's. 

Sitting here fir 32 minutes and no bread.  

This place sucks.  

Happy Mother's Day to me. 

This place blows!
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text: This is a small little diner just off the main strip as you're coming into Chalmette, La. if you blink you'll miss it. First thing I noticed as I walked in was that it was packed with Chalmette's finest first responders. So, if the fire department, Police Department, and paramedics of this parish choose to eat here, then it must be good. My waitress was named Melissa A., she was very attentive and professional. The picture you see is the blueberry pancakes with the blueberries baked in, with a side of sausage.  I'm glad Melissa informed me that the pancakes are fairly big because it normally comes with three pancakes, but I only had two. They were delicious !!!!  (See picture)
name: Parish Diner

text:
Food was delicious. Our waiter was perfect. We shut the restaurant down and was the only party left. Stood up to leave and as I was about to complement the staff for the food the owner berated me for not wearing my mask. I am a mask wearer, vaccinated, but just forgot in the moment of leaving our table in the empty restaurant. I was taken aback at her attitude towards me and towards some of my party. 

Our party "respectfully requests you to dine elsewhere. Hate is not welcome" with us.
name: Red Gravy
categories: Restaurants, Pasta Shops, Desserts, Sandwiches, Food, Seafood, Italian, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Took my boys here today.  We are new to NOLA and were excited to try it.  While the view and sushi was good the service/accuracy lacked.  They had no lemonade...no biggie.  I ordered water for us instead.  I then ordered the crispy wontons for an appetizer, California roll (for one of my sons), VIP roll (for me), & Chicken Teriyaki & fried rice (for my youngest son).  The wontons came out and moments later my son's California roll came.  A few minutes later my VIP roll came.  After waiting for about 15mins we started eating our rolls & the waitress came and asked how things were going I let her know we were still waiting on my sons meal.  She apologized and came back within seconds with a meal but it was steak and not chicken.  We continued to eat another 10-15mins went by and I got her attention to let her know she could cancel the order.  I was very disappointed & my son was as well.   As we were leaving out he said but mommy I never got my food I'm hungry.  I ended up walking to the food court to get him a slice of pizza but it would have been nice if we received our food at the same time and could have enjoyed our meal together.  We were here almost an hour.  Very disappointed and not sure I'll return.
name: Rock N Roll Sushi
address: 500 Port Of New Orleans Pl, Ste 280

text: Amazing food! It's literal perfection. If you love fresh fruity drinks and some seriously good Columbian cuisine then this is the place you will want to try. You'll come back and it'll be your new favorite. Very gracious owners and the service was excellent. Nice outside patio and the interior was. very cozy as well. Your tastebuds will thank you.

text: I'm really tired of this El Paso. I honestly can't say anything good about them anymore. I've tried to give them chances but in the past months I don't understand what is going on here. My parents order once a week from here for all of us and there is always a problem with the food. We just kept giving them the benefit of the doubt but my god get it together people. No one wants to eat hard meat. No one wants to eat stale chips. We have even reached out to the mangers and all! At this point I don't want FREE FOOD! I want you guys to get it together . This is unacceptable. The one that's in laplace is amazing, kenner needs to get it together
name: El Paso Mexican Grill

text:
Yummmmmm! I've been searching all over for a good Chinese take out place and this is it! Tiny, hole in the wall that's exactly what you want when you're craving Chinese...which I do most nights. Definitely not an eat-in joint, but I prefer to eat my Chinese out of the box on the couch in the comfort of my own home anyway.

I'm veg and have been disgusted by a lot of places here that use extremely bland silken tofu. Hunan Wok fries their tofu and smothers it in sauce, just the way I like it. I highly recommend their General Tsao's tofu (could use more veggies but that's not what I'm there for).

It's always fast and always delicious! Only wish they were open later!
name: Hunan Wok

text: Belle Chasse Dairy Dip is one of those hole in the wall delicacies that is among the best of the best.  I have had the hamburgers there and have found them to be excellent; however, I have not eaten one recently, so they may have changed.  On the other hand, the frozen treats can't get any better than at Dairy Dip.  I personally recommend the dip chocolate shakes, but there are a myriad of flavors that you can choose.  They also have snowballs, malts, ice cream cones, among other flavors.  It's almost worth, if you don't live in Belle Chasse but are in the Greater New Orleans area, the drive to visit, depending on if you want to battle Jefferson Parish traffic and pay relevant tolls.
name: Dairy Dip

text: I know, I know Cafe du Monde is always the go to for beignets in the city BUT I am suggesting you give these guys a try. They are known for having the first chocolate beignet so if that's your thing you're in the right place. Personally I prefer them over du Monde because they taste better. Im guessing the oil they fry them in is changed regularly because they don't have that super greasy taste. They are bigger in size so I usually don't eat all 3. I also enjoy that they have coffee options I can enjoy since I can't do dairy. They offer both almond and soy "milk". I always go for the iced chai. If you aren't in the mood for coffee or beignets you can order from their other menu. It includes sandwiches and pastries as well as other vegetable/fruit juices. It's a very well rounded place that offers options for everyone not just beignets.
name: New Orleans Coffee & Beignet

text: Alright, my tastes and experience with Chinese food comes from my life in Chicago. Personally, I think we have some of the best chinese food out in the Windy City, but if you disagree, maybe you can disagree with my review of this gem in New Orleans. I type this with one hand on my phone and the other on my chopsticks, stuffing my face with my recent order from this hidden jewel of a restaurant. I've yet to try anything from them that is not gluttony enducing.  Their sesame chicken is crispy, as are many of their chicken specials. Their wonton soup is bountiful yet cheap, as is the rest of their menu. Order out, pick up, or eat in, it doesn't matter. Eat, and bring these people more revenue so they can expand or something. I don't know, I need to get back to my dinner.
name: Hunan Wok

text:
REALLY good stuff. I've sampled all of my staples from this place and it's all good. The rice is just the way I like it; not that hard yellow fried rice at most other joints, but that nice moist fluffy brown fried rice.

They give large portions even for their lower priced lunch plates, and for a small upcharge, you can get shrimp fried rice instead of pork. Really quick takeout for lunch as well. Pretty small, unassuming building, but inside you'll find a few places to sit and eat and really good chinese.

My new favorite takeout place in the cbd/midcity area!
name: Hunan Wok

text:
Not to sure what happened. I stopped by on my way to Venice for years and the burgers, fries and ice cream were delicious. But for reason unknown it went to crap. I stop by 2 times in the last month just to make sure it wasn't just an off day. 
The cheese burger was flavorless the patty had a grey look to it no seasoning the bun was hard and the tomato was rotten. I should have brought it back but I was already 20 miles down the road. Yes I did get me an ice cream and that was their only shining moment it was yummy. My fries were cold and had no salt on them I had some packets of s&p in the truck but it didn't help because they were cold and it would not stick to the fries. And no I didn't wait 20 miles to dig in to my fries I hit those up almost immediately. And what I find funny is that I had to wait for almost 10 minutes for my food after I had called it in and it took me 15 min to get there. 
Not sure if it is new people cooking but I think I'll just pass by without stopping.
name: Dairy Dip

text: As a vegetarian it's hard to find good food in a place you're not familiar with, but I stumbled across this restaurant while searching online and decided to try it out when I saw that they served General Tsao's Tofu. text:
Dary dip is my favorite lunch spot in Belle Chasse.  It is a small outdoor snowball stand with some fried food and alot of sandwhich options.  All seating is outside on picnic tables, but the area is covered. 

I love the fried shrimp plate.  It is affordable and the shrimp are fresh. Just a note, the shrimp are poboy size .  

I also love their hot dogs.  The bun is always fresh. There is nothing special about the chili but its good.    Burgers are also delicious and way better than the commercial fast food restauraunts.   

The fries are my least favorite item I've tried.  I think they would be great covered in cheese and chili but as a stand alone, they are just okay.

The snowballs are a great addition to any lunch!
name: Dairy Dip

text:
It's a place that exudes a certain neighborhood, family vibe, and I get the sense that if I were a kid growing up in Metairie I would cherish visits to the Pizza Shoppe. However, even as a decided non-kid, I am quite happy.

You can get pizza, a calzone, bread with cheese in it, breadsticks with cheese on them, or for variety, sandwiches, pasta, or a dessert pizza. So basically, it's all bread and cheese, which is fair enough given the sign on the door (they do carry a gluten-free crust, FYI). Assuming you're down for that, however, they do it well. The sauce is sweet, but not too sweet, and the toppings exude pleasing aromas and a fresh taste. They offer several vegetarian specialty pizzas (I enjoyed the spinach and artichoke). The filled breads come with two dips: spices in olive oil and tomato sauce. The banana dessert pizza that I ordered solely because it was part of a cheap online special was just delectable.

It's not an impressive place to eat in, but they are well optimized for the takeout experience and are timely (if not so fast as to make you think they didn't work on your pizza) and package things well. Having spent too long in places where solid neighborhood pizza was not available, I'll probably avail myself of this one again.
name: The Pizza Shoppe

text: I am from Texas but visit frequently, my daughter lives here with her Navy husband. We come to dairy dip every time, great burgers!! This time Our to go order was messed up, the gentleman we spoke to said it "was miscommunication" on my part but said he would replace them the next day but the next day he said he would not. I than spoke with Ryan, who by the way was much more polite and professional only calling me sweetie once lol. He not only replaced our burgers he gave us the most delicious shakes to drink as we waited. I hope that "the other guy" learns from Ryan's example of superior customer service and we will continue to get those delicious grilled cheese bun hamburgers!!
name: Dairy Dip

text:
Decided to stop by here because of its proximity to my hotel and was not disappointed! You make your order at the window and can enjoy your coffee and beignets either in the lobby area or inside the legacy restaurant. Both seating areas are very hip and have a rustic feel. The cafe au lait was very creamy and seemed like a lighter roast. I would definitely prefer this place to Starbucks however. 

The beignets come in a set of 3 along with about a pound of powdered sugar. They were fresh with puffs of steam being released as I bit into the beignet.
name: New Orleans Coffee & Beignet

text:
New Orleans Coffee & Beignet Company, located in the lobby of the Renaissance New Orleans Warehouse District, is a walk-up window with plenty of seating in the hotel lobby.

For a place with "Coffee & Beignet" in their name, there are two notable issues:
Beignets: They rarely, if ever, have them. I've been here for the past three days, and on two of those days, they had no beignets at all. Today, they had chocolate beignets only. A few years ago, they did have beignets, but apparently they can't figure out how to make them any more?
Coffee: Someone needs to teach the baristas how to steam milk. When the sound of the steaming changes, you need to pay attention, not just wander off or wait for the machine to figure out that you're not good at your job and turn off the steam for you. When the steamer has been going so long that it no longer makes any noise, you've thoroughly burned the milk. Two out of three of my mochas have been of the "chocolate and char" variety.

Finally, it's important to note that the service here is hit or miss. A couple of the employees seem enthusiastic about their jobs and work hard to help the customers. A couple other employees, today's cashier for example, are better at grumbling and rolling their eyes at customers. Some people just aren't cut out for customer service, and that's fine, but those folks should not be working the register.

In summary: If you're staying at the hotel and don't want to walk anywhere, this is a good choice. Otherwise, not so much.
name: New Orleans Coffee & Beignet

text:
We decided to try this place on the way back home from vacation. We chose this place because we saw pretty good reviews, it cost less than another place we were looking at and had a good variety.  We ordered and had it delivered to our hotel and the delivery was quick and the driver was courteous.

With that said, I don't usually give a poor rating unless the meal is truly bad in its entirety. Since there were both good and bad aspects of this meal I gave a rating of three. Though I have had better, the Supreme Pizza, Muffaletta Sandwich, Grilled Chicken Sandwich and Spinach Artichoke dip were pretty good and everyone seemed to enjoy them so I see no reason to give them a negative rating. However, the Chicken Alfredo that we ordered for my daughter was not good at all. I don't know if they left something out of the alfredo sauce or if something went bad but a couple of us tried it to make sure we had the same assessment and it just wasn't good. In fact, it was so bad that she couldn't eat it so we all gave her a little of ours to eat. 

All in all, I wouldn't stay away because of this review. I would, however, recommend maybe going in person just to make sure that if there is an issue you can send it back and get it corrected or maybe get something else.
name: The Pizza Shoppe

text: I like to think that I am on a constant quest to see how much Chinese food the human body can hold at one time; and when I want to scratch that itch the place I like to do that is Hunan Wok. Their general tsao's tofu is so good (and so bad for you) because they bread and fry their tofu before covering it in this glorious sauce. Service is fast and efficient and they always give you enough food for an especially slobtastic and slovenly Sunday of eating.

text: I've been coming here since I was a baby! The environment inside has changed a lot over the years but it's really nice inside. It's really great for parties or big groups of people, when I was younger I would have the "make your own pizza party" and everyone would be able to make their own pizza the way they'd like (it's actually for kids but we still get it today lol) Today me and my sister went since we haven't came in a couple of months and we got a make your own pizza and the pizza stuffed bread. It's always delicious!!!! The prices are really low, and it's just so much fun coming here. You get to make your own pizza and get a drink for 5 dollars, it's a really good price and it's actually a lot of fun to do. I recommend it a lot, I've loved it all these years!!!!!!

text:
Came here randomly one evening with my fiancee' after we couldn't decide what to eat.  We were pleasantly surprised!
We ended up getting breadsticks, a meatlovers pizza (extra sauce, light cheese), and a chocolate chip dessert pizza.
Every course was better than the next!  The breadsticks were pretty good, obviously freshly made.  The pizza was laden with meat, had extra sauce and light cheese as requested, and was cooked and seasoned very well.  And the dessert pizza was, well, amazeballs.  Melty chocolatey goodness with powdered sugar on top, on a sweet pizza dough.

The two guys working were very friendly and seemed proud of their work.  Great find.
name: The Pizza Shoppe

The rice was cooked perfectly the pepper steak was NOT good.. no flavor and horrible quality beef. I usually never order beef in a Chinese restaurant EVER, so my fault for reading the previous reviews thinking this Chinese restaurant was any different!!! I live in San Francisco and we have good and bad there as well. I'll be going to eat a real meal soon. This was not good . Only up side is the crap was cheap, I could care less about cheap when its gross.... and they use cheap soy sauce packets, not " double high brand". And upon leaving I heard a guy in the back sound like he hokked  up a spit ball..nasty SOB
name: Hunan Wok

text:
As an old fart stated in his review (Thanks Shannon), this place will give you flashbacks. The only real difference, is instead of a bored teenager, reading a comic, there is a bored teenager scrolling through her phone. But she was attentive as soon as she saw us coming up. 
Now, one of my first jobs was at an ice cream shop in Opryland (Once upon a time, it was a big amusement park in Nashville and to this day, I can't stand to hear the song "Proud to Be An American")...but I digress. 

While the ice cream was good, their soft serve temp was off a little and the ice cream was melting immediately.  Other than that, it was ok, while still being a bit antiquated.
If I go back, I'll try one of those po boy? thingies. I hear they are popular in this area.

text: I was visiting NOLA for the weekend and wanted a beignet close to my hotel. I randomly stopped in here because it was the closest place that was open (I was planning on going to Cafe Du Monde later in the weekend), but figured you can't have too many beignets in new Orleans. I thought the beignets were DELICIOUS! The service was quick and the girl was friendly enough....I went right before closing. It's located in a hotel bar so you think that it won't be great, but I didn't mind them at all! I actually went to Cafe Du Monde a couple days later and surprisingly have to admit I liked these better :). I didn't have anything else, but I thought the beignets were pretty good!
name: New Orleans Coffee & Beignet

text:
Went here the other night, a new and very stylish restaurant on what had once been an utterly nondescript stretch of Magazine St. Did the Coolinary menu (plus an extra app). The verdict? Excellent food, excellent service, excellent value. The only thing not excellent? My photos which don't do the dishes full justice. Can I give it 4 1/2 stars?!

I got there around 8pm. It was almost full. I was seated at a four-top, which was fine, tho I did offer to sit at the counter by the kitchen as I didn't want to take up extra space. My server Randy was very knowledgeable and guided me to choices that left me happily sated.

Started with the Verlasso Salmon (fermented Napa cabbage, cashews, cilantro, sweet peppers, sesame seeds, black garlic vinaigrette) SO delicious!! (Note: The presentation was MUCH nicer than my photo; I had already had a bite or two before taking the pic. It arrived in a kinda pyramid formation.) It's the type of dish you want to have another of as soon as you finish eating it. Sometimes in a dish like this you get lotsa the extras and only a little of the featured item. Not here; there was LOTS of salmon!

Decided to splurge and also get the Roasted Bone Marrow with pistachio pesto, oven roasted cherry tomatoes and watermelon radish slices, as you don't often see this on menus. Not only was it very very good but (a) unlike some places where you just get the marrow and some bread or, in this case, baguette slices, here the pistachio pesto, oven roasted cherry tomatoes, watermelon radish slices and, a goodly amount of, I believe, dill, fleshed it out wonderfully & imaginatively and (b) for a change, there was a pleasingly plentiful amount of baguette slices so I didn't have to ask for more. Bone marrow may not be to everyone's taste...which just means more for me!!

Crispy Pork Chop (grilled corn, mint, cucumber, avocado, buttermilk, watermelon molasses) Crispy it was; I actually thought it was too crispy, but hadn't realized that was what it was billed as--though I wouldn't've minded it being a little more tender/moister, I guess you can't complain about something for being what it's supposed to be. That said, the watermelon molasses (the brown swirl around the pork chop) was so yummy it should be sold in sex shops for people to spread all over their partner's body after which it can be licked off. Lol Seriously, I asked my server for more of it and covered that part of the chop that wasn't already covered with the buttermilk. I don't think I licked its ramekin...but I sure wanted to! 

Salted Caramel Budino (orange and pistachio)  I wasn't familiar with the budino concept and, while I enjoy caramel, the pleasures of the "Salted" part always escape me; once I got to the pudding beneath the caramel topping, however, I didn't want it to end!

I also had a very nice, and nicely priced, glass of the Syrah/Cinsault/Grenache rose. Light, refreshing, not too dry and with a nice bouquet, it was just what I was in the mood for.

About the only glitch was when I asked the maÃ®tre d' if he could turn up the light a little bit as it was awfully dark at my table; it didn't seem like it would be a big deal as the lights had momentarily bumped up just before. He came back a few minutes later saying that "the manager was busy" so apparently he couldn't do anything about it. I understand that staffing there is a little crazy due to COVID challenges but this hadn't seemed like a biggie. He did offer to move me to another table but by then I had settled in so declined. Not a biggie but it would've been nice to better see my food.

I understand that due to COVID craziness, most of The Bower's menu (the cheese and charcuterie boards) is currently from its adjacent bistro, Claret. When things return to normal, I was told that The Bower's options would expand offering more entrees along the lines of what I had. Can't wait!
name: The Bower

text:
Man, this is some solid Chinese food in the 7th ward. Nothing ultra special about the place itself but it's some damn good food coming outta there. The offerings are typical of your "American-hood" Chinese joint but there's something a little extra about this one. 

They know how to hook up the chicken, never too dry, and their flavors are nice and well balanced. Lately I've been hooked on their honey chicken combo with shrimp fried rice accompanied with the egg roll all for under $10?! No wonder I had that 6lb swing this week. It doesn't help they're walking distance from me but I think my phase will break for a minute (because I CANNOT keep doing this to myself). 

If you're in the area and in the mood, this is your spot. Definitely call ahead because it's gonna be a solid 10-15 min wait as they do make everything to order. Try their in-house sweet tea, too. You can tell they know how to make Kool-Ade.
name: Hunan Wok

text: How is it possible to screw ice cream up so badly? I went back a second time, thinking that perhaps the reason for my liquid ice cream was it being mid July. But come January it's almost just as bad. Soft serve is one thing. This is another. It's an awkward stage between soft serve and milkshake. The flavors are many... but only for sno balls. Ice cream flavors.. just chocolate and vanilla. And the toppings are limited. Price and serving size is good however. The parking lot is heinous. We got trapped by some dingus who parked his truck, with boat attached to the back right in front of the place, blocking every way to leave. Outside seating is dirty and unkept. The only way this place stays in business is that it doesn't have much competition nearby, and stuff like this is in high demand when you live in the Hell of the United States.
name: Dairy Dip

I got up and walked to the bar and tried to get someone's attention and no one would even look at me. I tried to get anyone's attention to no avail. I went back and sat down hoping someone would come over because I really wanted to order some food but no one even looked my way. I finally left. No one even acknowledged me the entire time I was there at least 30 minutes! I really wanted to try a beignet. I'll have to go somewhere else. Terrible. One of the worst experiences in a restaurant in my life. What is the problem with these people?

text:
We arrived in town on vacation Sunday night. Tired and decided to order take out. This place was touted as best Chinese in NOLA!
NOT! 
First they advertise they do take out. NOT! They offer take out thru two delivery services.
Second the prices on the website are NOT the actual prices. Much more. Don't know if delivery services get to charge whatever but we ordered large wonton soup! Below average at best. Crab rangoon appetizer. They were good! And ordered 2 dinners Hunan chicken and shrimp with shrimp fried rice and Szechuan chicken and shrimp (generous portions) . 
There were like two or three tiny farm raised tasteless shrimp probably grown in Indonesia or elsewhere! 
We found both the entree's had a kick but not much flavor! Left more than half and threw it out eventually. Hard to swallow because with the tip it was over $60 even in these worthless fiat dollars we are now spending. Dzau gau!!! 
We asked for extra soy and duck sauce and hot mustard. They gave us two tiny packets of soy, 2 duck sauce and NO HOT MUSTARD.

One last note, the egg rolls were pretty tasty!

If this is the best NO has to offer, I would wait until you got home to satisfy your Chinese take out cravings.
name: Hunan Wok

text: I love this little place! My boyfriend and I go here very frequently. We always order stuffed pepperoni bread (delicious) and the make your own pizzas. The make your own pizza is for kiddos, but they have never given us a problem about ordering it. You get to make your own pizza and get a drink for 5 dollars. It's fun and the pizza comes out great. My sister and I joke that after you make the pizza that they actually switch it out with a better one, because it's hard to believe that the one you made tastes so good. This place sometimes feels a little too warm, but that's the only downfall. It's never very crowded, and it makes a nice little lunch!

text: We really enjoyed our lunch here. Everything tasted very fresh. I got the falafel wrap with a side of tabouli AND it came with a smoothie or fresh juice. My friend got the gyro entree and it came with three sides, which was a ton of food. Our fav side was the spicy potatoes. I was also very impressed with the amount of vegan options available. This is definitely a spot you can bring a big group of people with different dietary restrictions/allergies and everyone will have delicious options. It's also very affordable!

text: Best take out Chinese in New Orleans.   I had the shrimp sweet and sour and it was perfect.  You gotta get the dumplings here they are on point.  As far as American Chinese food, you'll be hard pressed to find better in New Orleans, and they havean excellent pick up window, which is ideal for the times we are in. Open till 10, this place was really a really clutch find,  definitely a 7th ward gem. Added to my rotation.

text:
I came here with a large party of 10 people. I do not recommend this place for a large group. 

The experience wasn't good, but I'm giving this place the benefit of the doubt because the food was tasty and maybe a smaller party would be nice. 

The service wasn't great. The server wasn't quick or even remembered our requests until a second ask. The indoor reservation still put us outside on a super hot night with no fans. They would not allow any split checks.

The food was nice. There were a few vegetarian options. I tried the whipped feta and the crispy cauliflower. The whipped feta was a touch more sour than I like and extra tangy when pairs with the pickles. The cauliflower is delicious!

text:
MAJORLY BUMMED: LOYALTY CARD SUCKS!!!
The owners of this chain flaunt their statewide growth, but a manager here recently reprimanded at this store that a N.O.C. & Beignet's $100 gift card can only be used at the very store you bought it in. WTF?

I CAN'T USE IT AT:
- N.O.C. & Beignets on St Charles.
- N.O.H. & Seafood Exchange.
- or even at their doomed Legacy Kitchen.

ARE THEY FINANCIALLY STRAPPED?
So overextended they can't accomodate loyal customers?

Don't scoff, the same thing happened to Schwegmann's in the early 90's...
name: New Orleans Coffee & Beignet

text:
The ambiance and service were excellent but.....

We tried three small plates, a pasta, two entrees and two deserts. The dishes were all presented beautifully but had completely conflicting flavors and nothing made sense. The drinks on the cocktail list were o.k. We tried 7 on the menu between 4 of us and none were outstanding. Overall the meal wasn't for us and the cocktails weren't it either. Risotto was the only tasty item. A few "highlights" ... 

Fish was flavorless
Rice was undercooked
Avocado sauce on everything was unnecessary
Whipped feta taste like pickle cheese
Single octopus tentacle was less than appealing
Drinks were over thought 
Deserts were left completely uneaten 
Bill came to $400. We left unhappy, not full, and with one severely upset tummy.
name: The Bower

text:
David and I had a craving during these *unprecedented times* and Company Burger wasn't open, so we decided to go on a burger hunt. Well, first it was a snowball hunt, but either way you look at it, we ended up here.

The place has been around for like 60 years and it's nothing spectacular, but they serve all kinds of classic foods like burgers, shakes, ice cream, hot dogs, etc. You walk up and pay and eat outside, or in your car (if the times you are in are unprecedented). 

We got cheeseburgers and David got onion rings and I got fries. The burgers were great. Maybe I was just super hungry, but it hit the spot. The fries were aiight- they could have used some salt, but I'm not complaining.

For dessert, we got vanilla ice cream which comes soft serve style. WOW. OMG- it was delicious! I got a small and scarfed the whole thing- you know I can eat, y'all. They can make you a sundae, if you want to pay extra for a topping, but I was pleased with just the soft serve.

We will definitely be back and it's pretty silly that I had never been here, even though I'm a lifelong Westbanker.
name: Dairy Dip

text:
Since moving to New Orleans, I've been searching for a solid Chinese take-out spot. I am happy to say that I think I've found it! A couple nights ago, I had a serious hankering for some sesame chicken. I had tried a couple of spots in New Orleans and hadn't been impressed, so I hopped on Yelp to see if there was a new place I should try. I found Hunan Wok's page and the reviews were all so positive that I had to obviously place an order. All the hype from the other reviews were totally on point and Hunan Wok did NOT disappoint. 

I put an order in at around 5:30 on a Monday night and they told me that my order was ready for pick up by 5:45pm. I was blown away at how quickly they had it ready. I hopped in my car and was on my way. I realized once I got there that I had passed Hunan Wok multiple times and never thought anything of it. It's basically a bright pink shack and looks rather unassuming, but those are always the best places aren't they? There is some parking right in front and around the side but not a ton. Once you go inside, there are a couple of tables, but nobody that was in there was dining in. The tables and chairs are mostly there so that you can sit while waiting for your food. Service was fast and friendly. 

We ordered a sesame chicken combo plate with pork fried rice (it's only an extra .75 cents if you want shrimp fried rice), two egg rolls (one pork and one shrimp), their triple steamed dumplings, and an order of their fried shrimp appetizer. The portions are HUGE and the total only came out to $25. What a steal. We didn't order any vegetarian friendly options, but I did notice that they had plenty. 

We will definitely be ordering from Hunan Wok anytime we are in the mood for some tasty Chinese take-out!
name: Hunan Wok

text:
All the food was good but it wasn't necessary my taste. Let me explain. I want garlic in my Mediterranean food. And then I want more garlic. But for starters, we had the Athena appetizer sampler and with the exception of some garlic and a pinch of salt, all was good except the tzatziki sauce. It wasn't my vibe, I didn't taste any cucumber or garlic and the "yogurt" was thick and warm. But with the exception of preference, that was my only complaint. I prefer green pea falafel but I thought their chick pea falafel was tasty. I'm not always a fan of baba ghannouj but I liked theirs heated a little. I'm glad I started with a sampler. 

Everything else was really good and I will order again... and again. There are other things I want to try. We had the spinach pie which was yum. The chicken shawarma salad was very good and a lot more veggies than I expected. And the dressing was very tasty. The gyro platter was also plentiful and delish. We had rice and salad as sides. There was so much food there was plenty for at least a second meal. I thought the prices to be very reasonable and I'm excited to go back and get a meal with a juice.

I highly recommend you give it a try and see what you think! I think it's well worth it given the prices.
name: Athena Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian, Mediterranean, Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text:
This was the worst sandwich - not just the worst falafel sandwich, the worst any kind of sandwich - I have ever had. The falafel was dry, tasteless, and stale. Also there was NO sauce on the sandwich whatsoever: no hummus, no tzatziki, no anything at all. It was just flavorless dry falafel crumbles in a pita with one small tomato slice, about a teaspoon each of tiny onion and lettuce pieces, and some small strange pickles (which weren't terrible). 
YUCK. Now my mouth feels dry and gross. 
I also got baba ghanouj, which came with exactly one piece of pita bread. One. Piece. Seriously??? 
Skip this place, and get Mediterranean food cheaper from any of the other dozens of places around that actually care more than this place seems to. I wish I had.
name: Athena Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian, Mediterranean, Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text: I had no idea that this place made hamburgers on French bread. They are delicious and the burger is huge for the price.
