text: I have greatly anticipated dining at and experiencing The Bower.....but it "did not give what it was supposed to had gave" (IYKYK). Three stars is me being generous and giving the amazing drinks and ambiance major weight. Those two aspects were the stars of the show. The food-- average at best, quite frankly. I have removed this place from my list of recommended dining spots in NOLA. Sorry, but...those are my thoughts and "I'm gonna stick beside 'em".

text: The best Mediterranean restaurant along Veterans & I have tried a lot of them. Always consistent, tasty & served with real plates & special silverware, no plastic here unless it is to go. The food is flavorful & very good portions. I usually leave with a go box. The pita bread is special not out of the pack like Toufan and the garlic sauce is pungent & creamy. The staff is friendly &  attentive. Try it !
name: Athena Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian, Mediterranean, Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text: I went to The Bower with a friend for Coolinary. We sat outside, which was very pleasant despite it being August in New Orleans. The patio is massive and is shared by the other 2 restaurants they own. The patio is also shaded with fans, which is nice. We started off with the 51 Problems and Chargarita for our cocktails. I loved the deep red from the beets in the 51 Problems and the sugar on the rim was a nice touch. I had the whipped ricotta to start and my friend had the octopus. The Whipped Feta was delicious and was enough to share for multiple people. It came with toasted bread and pickled vegetables. My friend's Octopus was a bit charred and could have used more flavor. For the main course, we had the Paneed Pork Loin and the Red Pepper Spaghetti. The Pork Loin was definitely the favorite entree. It was crispy with a flavorful, slightly spicy sauce. The pickled vegetables on top added a nice zing. The spaghetti was also good with a large serving of burrata on top. The star of the desserts was definitely the Salted Caramel Budino. It was very light and refreshing and similar to creme brulee. The Flourless Chocolate Torte was also very good, but was extremely rich. Overall, I really enjoyed my dinner at The Bower. The patio is also dog friendly. There is only street parking, so I recommend arriving early to find a place to park.
name: The Bower

text:
We have been here several times and love going every time! The food is fresh, excellent, and great quality. Prices are very reasonable and the portions are the perfect size. The staff is very warm and hospitable and the service is great!

Everything is perfectly seasoned, the sides are delicious, and the wide variety on the menu is outstanding. I highly recommend their chicken or beef and lamb wraps and some spinach pies. The baklava is a MUST-HAVE as it is a family recipe! Unlike other places, Athena Cafe has true Greek food! 

I'll be honest - when I heard that they had a juice bar, I didn't know what to expect (Especially since it seemed like a juice bar and Greek food didn't go together). Much to my surprise, the juices and smoothies are great! Will definitely come back for more! Keep up the GREAT work Athena Cafe!
name: Athena Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian, Mediterranean, Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text: I recently discovered this place during a need for a quick lunch. The food, the service and the quality of value are all actually very good. I've tried most of the things on the menu by this point and I can tell you that you would be hard-pressed to find something on the menu that you don't find delicious. If you were in the mood for some Middle Eastern/Greek/Lebanese/whatever, this is a good place to go. In addition to the typical foods they also have a fresh juice bar if that's your thing. But I'm satisfied with the kebabs, the lamb chops and the general accoutrement. I think you will be too. Don't forget to tip your waiter.
name: Athena Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian, Mediterranean, Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text:
If you live in Metairie or surrounding areas, y'all MUST go to Athena Cafe!!! FRESHLY cooked, homemade Mediterranean cuisine. You can literally TASTE the difference! Family owned, they have created this lovely restaurant with delicious food, and they offer a FRESH juice bar (NO ADDITIVES, not even sugar) with tasty recipes of which you'll want to try all. They prepare and juice fresh fruit and veggies right in front of you, made to order! 

Lunch, dinner, and catering...Athena Cafe gives you a lot of bang for your buck! Wonderful portions, delicious authentic home cooking, clean and bright environment, and happy atmosphere. Dine in or get it to go. I HIGHLY recommend this convenient location. I definitely will be back again and again!  (And, tell 'em Kristen, the piano player sent ya!)
name: Athena Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian, Mediterranean, Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text:
Never again.
Ordered MooShu Pork with extra "pancakes' for pick up.
When I am told the cost I discover that the "current" price listed on line was nearly $2 less than what they're charging now.
Sure, I get that they are allowed to raise their prices, but they need to either A) honor that price  (especially when there's no disclaimer that prices are subject to change- truth in advertising) or at the very least B) APOLOGIZE  for it and not take an "Oh well, too bad" smirky approach to it.
Let alone zero consideration of that fact when I asked for more plum sauce (only gave a half filled sos cup -about 1.5 tablespoons worth) was going to charge me for that.*under normal circumstances I would have gladly paid for extra, but not in this case.  I went without the extra sauce, but went on with the purchase as I was super craving ot so I just went with it.
 So, for $12 I got a container filled with cabbage, a few mushrooms, and no more than about 3.5 of grizzled pork and dried out spring roll wrappers for the "pancakes ".
Super ticked off. Wish I would've checked it out before I rode my bike home with it, as I would have went without at that point considering what I got (or did not get) for what I paid.
Ugh! Lesson learned.
**note, I am not a food snob, but in the industry front and back of the house dor over 25 years. I know food and I know customer service. 
****I will also say that I used to frequent this place at least a few times a month a couple years back (getting the Mooshu pork multiple times) and I loved everything, so much so that I remember recommending/promoting this place countless times to locals/friends/and even tourists on 1 or 2 occasions. 
THIS was a huge disappointment! Especially with the price increases.
name: Hunan Wok

text:
I came with a friend for dinner on a Saturday night and we had a great time. I don't normally prefer to sit outside, but the outdoor dining area was so welcoming and spacious. It is also dog-friendly!
To start, I ordered the Chargarita cocktail while my friend had the Inside Voices. I loved the spice of the poblano tequila they used. We opted for the Coolinary menu. We shared the Octopus and Whipped Feta. The octopus was tasty, but a bit too charred. However, the whipped feta was delicious and comes with plenty of toast points to eat with. I also had the Red Pepper Spaghetti, which was delicious and came topped with burrata. My friend also really enjoyed the Paneed Pork Loin that she ordered. 
For dessert, I had the Salted Caramel Budino, which was my favorite course of the three. As someone who doesn't usually order dessert, this tasted amazing! It reminded me of caramel brÃ»lÃ©e almost. My friend ordered the Flourless Chocolate Torte, which came with fresh whipped cream and a strawberry syrup on top. It did have nuts in the crust, in case anyone is allergic.
Our server was extremely attentive and friendly throughout our entire visit, answering any questions we had about the menu. Overall, we had a fantastic time here and would love to come back and try the regular menu!
name: The Bower

text:
Went last night for date night and had so much fun. They blast the music loud and the lights are low, though could be even darker for us! Fun, cool vibe and perfect service with Erica. 

We started with a few great cocktails: 51 problems (lightly smoky beet-infused mezcal with a salted rim, which I loved way more than any sugar rim) and Rosemary's baby (light refreshing citrusy whiskey drink with rosemary syrup). We then got a few glasses of wine and a hug charcuterie board. It was $48 for 5 meats and 5 cheeses, which I will say is definitely on the pricier side, but some of the things are definitely items you can't get anywhere else-like the N'duja spreadable salami and the whipped duck leg and date rillettes (kind of tasted like a rich pulled pork that had been out in a food processor with yummy spices)-both were surprisingly delicious. They brought a big plate of warm bite-sized toasty bread slices, as well as pickled accoutrements and spreads to go with the meats and cheeses. We asked for extra bread because we ran outdo they brought us a second serving at no extra cost. 

Overall, a splurge for what we got but we felt it was worth it and had a great time!
name: The Bower

text: We've been looking for a replacement takeout Chinese food since our favorite hole in the wall, Red Apple, closed after a robbery. We've tried many of the other highly rated and popular-amongst-yelpers restaurants, but there was always something missing or "off" with the flavors of one or more dishes. Plus the price point was a little steep for something I wasn't too keen on. Due to a vehicle issue, we were stuck at home with nothing to eat and I was desperately craving Chinese. I came upon Hunan Wok. I think I found my go-to replacement!! The prices were reasonable, the food fresh, the quality was great! And an added bonus: they delivered!!! And it's not even through a delivery app!!! (I am weary about some random joe-schmo delivering my food with nothing but honor that they don't munch on it...at least with employees their job is on the line). Yes, there's a $30 minimum. But it's definitely not something to get your panties in a wad about and give a 1 star rating for. I didn't get any pictures bc honestly I wasn't expecting to be so pleasantly surprised! We ordered: hunan beef, Kung pao chicken (both extra spicy), beef lo mein, and hot and sour soup. Oh! And delivery was FAST!!! I believe it was around 30 minutes or so. We will definitely be ordering from here again!!
name: Hunan Wok

text:
Listen... This was my first time eating at a restaurant in a year (Outdoors still) and talk about an experience....  The Bower is so chic and relaxing. It makes you feel elegant even if you have your basic clothes on. It's somewhere I feel Beyonce would enjoy a cocktail and that's honestly the only type of places I like to experience.

The outdoor experience was impeccable. The turf flooring was so soft, it made me want to take my shoes off (I didn't however). The lighting and breeze just make it the perfect outdoor restaurant venue!

Cocktails... The Paloma. This is the only place I will drink tequila, but it feels right to drink tequila here because it will come out all classy that even Diahann Carroll would approve of. Also, they have a happy hour menu all the time people!

Food. My meal made me wanna sing.  The Short Ribs....
fregola verde, roasted root vegetables, celery root remoulade, natural beef, and date jus. It was so so good, it's home cooking meets chic. It was one of the first satisfying meals I had in a while. It was delightful!  I also had some of their delicious Charcuterie, their Coppa is unmatched I tell ya. 

This is a great location for dates and friend outings alike. Street parking is available; shouldn't have trouble finding parking in a two-block radius.
name: The Bower

text: Went here for a birthday dinner. It was easy to make reservations online and we were seated right away. They were very COVID conscious and had a large area set up outdoors for dining. I arrived at the tail end of happy hour and was able to capitalize on a great happy hour sparkling wine, which I enjoyed so much I kept drinking even after happy hour ended. We ordered the charcuterie board and enjoyed the meat and cheese selections. Carrying on with our dairy theme we also tried the whipped feta and Buratta appetizers. The whipped feta was delicious and the buratta came with a delicious focaccia bread that I would get again. I would highly recommend the seared scallops and the short rib. The food was very good and it would be hard to go wrong with any of their selections. The atmosphere was fun, great for an occasion or night out with friends. Restrooms were spacious and clean. Street parking.
name: The Bower

text:
Dairy Dip is another newly discovered gem that I have passed so many times over so many years yet have never stopped until Friday 25 SEP 2020.  My family and I had just experienced a not so enjoyable dinner "up the road" in Belle Chasse and were feeling a little melancholy.  Instead of turning around and heading back to New Orleans, we decided to drive south on Hwy. 23 for a ways.  Like a beacon in a storm, we saw the sign for Dairy Dip and I knew that ice cream would have us all feeling better.

This place has been a Belle Chasse staple for 50-60 years, and it screams nostalgia.  And everyone who knows me knows I love nostalgic businesses.   Although it doesn't appear spectacular from the outside, I hear the food they serve is top notch.  This little roadside gem serves all kinds of classic foods like burgers, hot dogs, corn dogs, po-boys, nachos, malts, shakes, ice cream, sno-balls etc.  It's all walk up counter service here where you pay and "eat outside, or in your car (if the times you are in are unprecedented)."  (This last sentence borrowed from Yelper Marielle S.)

As we had already eaten, we got dessert.  I wish we hadn't eaten because I think we would have enjoyed Dairy Dip more than the restaurant we had just patronized, but I digress.   My son got a regular vanilla cone, I opted for the classic dipped cone and my wife got the dipped cone with peanuts. The ice cream here is delicious and served at the perfect consistency and temperature. Simply stated, it was delicious.  Next time, we're going to order burgers and onion rings and make it a meal.  Of course we are going to leave room for dessert.
name: Dairy Dip

text: The bower exceeded my expectations! They have a great happy hour and an awesome restaurant week menu! To drink, I got the house punch of the day which was a tequila grapefruit drink. It was so good and refreshing! Next from the food happy hour menu, a friend and I tried the carrots and whipped feta. The carrots were not my favorite as they were prepared cold, but they were still pretty good. The whipped feta was awesome! Paired with pickled onions, pickles, and crispy breadsticks. Only complaint was that the bread was tough to eat. For restaurant week, I tried the beet salad, t bone lamb chops, and flourless chocolate torte! The beet salad was very colorful and tasty. The lamb was a little over cooked but it came with a house made taziki which I really enjoyed. Lastly, the chocolate torte was the perfect way to end the meal. Rich and delicious. I would definitely recommend coming here for a good meal or happy hour!
name: The Bower

text:
I got the chicken lo mein and curry chicken from this restaurant. They were both delicious and averagely priced for the area.  I might have found my new favorite Chinese take-out place!

The lo mein tastes almost pan fried. It wasn't drowning in sauce, but the flavor was all in the noodles. The curry was yummy too, with the vegetables not being overcooked at all. The chicken was plentiful, soft and tender for both dishes. They didn't skimp at all!  The curry here was not very spicy, so be sure to ask for extra heat if that's what you're into!

Pick-up was quick (15 minutes for the food to be ready after placing the order), easy and pandemic-safe (a small window to accept your food and pay for it, so you don't have to go into the restaurant at all).

My only complaint is that the neighborhood seems a little dicey. I went to pick-up my food with my boyfriend close to 10pm, and I didn't feel completely safe. (Nothing happened though!) I would probably not choose this location to go to alone at night as a young female.  I'll just go pick-up for lunch!
name: Hunan Wok

text: Well I was just introduced to this pizza place almost 2 months ago. Tonight was the 3rd time we've ordered from them! Yes they are pretty good, better than your chain restaurants who deliver. Well speaking of deliver, they delivered with no problem each time.....until tonight. When the driver got here he told me "we don't usually deliver here, just heads up, if it's slow like tonight then it's okay but not usually." I said "y'all have delivered here twice and no one has told me that, I obviously wouldn't have called if I'd known that, I'm really sorry..." He says "it's okay I'm just letting you know we don't, it takes 12 minutes to get here". Okayyyy, well this was our 3rd delivery and this is the first time they've told me that. We've ordered on a Friday and Saturday so I'm sure those were not "slow" nights. Anyhow, we live in Metairie in between Cleary & Transcontinental". It does NOT take 12 minutes to get here from there. I've been living here my entire life, if it takes 12 minutes on a slow night it's bc you're driving way below speed limit. My mother in law lives on the parish line in Kenner, which is 8 miles from me and it takes 10 minutes at speed limit (I realize you have other orders as well but I'm going on what he said). Now if they don't deliver here that's fine, but to tell me at my door after the 3rd delivery was ridiculous. First of all they've never said that to me on the phone, 2nd the driver said "they" told him to tell me. I used to deliver food and as a delivery driver that is not his responsibility to tell me that. The person who took the order, manager or owner should've. I thought it was pretty rude especially when I just paid $35 for my order plus a cash tip that was right under 20% (the only cash I had on hand), I would've added $2 more to the receipt I signed but felt so stupid that I changed my mind, and I'm sitting here apologizing like I did something wrong. Maybe it wasn't the driver, I just know I never would've relayed that message as a driver and if the people on the phone or owner couldn't tell me themselves then that makes me question them as professionals. I was excited to have a new "real" pizza place that delivers but we won't be ordering from there ever again. I don't like to feel humiliated at my front door because of a mistake they made....3 times. Why didn't they tell me this the first OR second time we ordered? Or was the driver in a pissy mood? I've been there so I understand the whole concept but it wasn't like we ordered even close to closing time so....? Oh well, the pizza is good but I won't order from people who make me uncomfortable at my own front door. For any haters, this is a "rating" website. You rate YOUR experience. Like I said the food is good, for delivery pizza. But you either do or don't deliver to my area, and then tell me at my door that you don't after I just ordered $35 worth of pizza. Unprofessional....
name: The Pizza Shoppe

text: The food is fantastic and the vibe is perfect! Describing this place in 3 words I would say "delicious and trendy." Came here with a couple friends and we really enjoyed it. They ordered the bone marrow appetizer and devoured it while I sipped on a fun and flavorful "mood ring" cocktail that changes color when the vodka and lemon juice mixture at the bottom is stirred into the purple butterfly pea tea on top, turning the drink a beautiful blue color. For entrees I got the basil spaghetti because who doesn't love pasta and basil and it was one of the most highly recommended items on their menu. The burrata cheese on top really elevated the flavor profile of a dish that seems so simple at first glance. My friends got the potato gnocchi. They loved the flavors but the portion size was pretty small. They also had shared the warm Castelvetrano appetizer and while they loved the taste, they actually had to spit out the first bite because the "warm" olives were so piping hot that it burned their mouths. Dessert was phenomenal. Basil ice cream and some sort of pudding that forgive me is escaping me right now. Despite the olives and small portions, I still would have given them 5 stars had it not been for them sitting us outside. During these strange pandemic times I understand seating is limited and I'm impressed they managed to supplement with so much tented outdoor seating, but it should be something that should be acknowledged when reservations are being made. It's just a little disappointing to walk through such a beautiful, green, luscious dining space (see my picture) that you think you'll be sitting in and to exit into a clean but temporary tented outdoor dining room in Louisiana summer heat. Also this place is a little on the pricier side - the pasta dishes ranged $17-$20 for rather small portions. But all in all, if you want a great food experience DO NOT pass this place up! I will certainly be back
name: The Bower

text:
The best place to bring kids for pizza!

My sister and I come here a few times a month as it is the kids' favorite pizza place. For $5 they can build their own pizza (drink included)! They are given all the ingredients needed to create their own pizza.....dough, cheese, tomato sauce, and pepperoni. Once they make the pizza the workers take their pizza to the oven and presto! They also give them a small amount of dough to play with and shape it into whatever they want and then they will bake that too for them. Very cool for the kids!!

The pizzas are pretty tasty here and real inexpensive ($10.24 for a large one-topping pizza. $1.25 each addl topping). We usually only spend around $23-24 for 1 large one-topping pizza, 2 kids' pizzas, and drinks.
name: The Pizza Shoppe

text: I was craving Asian food literally of any kind and I was scrolling through Yelp and stumbled upon Hunan Wok. I couldn't believe it because honestly I thought it was just a place that my home city had so because of the great experiences I've had back home I decided it was the best I could get on such short notice. I must admit they were pretty ok! Pricing was 10 and some change for the broccoli and shrimp combo (side of rice and an eggroll. Yes i know it's not in the picture but I scarfed it down before it ever had the chance or be included in the trio). The flavoring wasn't bad. Just needed a little more seasoning with Salt and pepper. Luckily they have a parking lot (thank goodness because I get tired of street parking everywhere). I ordered online so once I got there I got my food pretty quickly. Overall not a bad spot and I'd definitely give them another try in the future.

text: Great fast-casual dining. Walk up to order and pay at counter, and they bring food to you. We got chicken shawarma plates-- 11.99 for chicken, three sides, and pita bread. Good portion sizes. Indoor and outdoor seating is available. We ate outside with our dog and they were so kind to bring him some gyro (with our permission) and even some bottled water that they poured in a to go container for him to drink! Definitely recommend!
name: Athena Cafe
categories: Restaurants, Cafes, Vegetarian, Mediterranean, Food, Juice Bars & Smoothies

text: LOVEDDDDDD this spot! Came here for a girls night and we got the best seat in the restaurant, in my opinion. They have two areas each with a large circle table, that is in the window facing magazine. The area even has curtains you could close I assume if you wanted. The inside is super cute and a totallllllll vibe. Greenery hanging everywhere, ambient lighting- just a total great vibe. I'd recommend this place for a girls night, group of friends, date night, essentially anything. Definitely call and make a reservation, it is a smaller place. The food we had was awesome! I loved absolutely everything except the tuna small plate, that one was mehhh. But everything else- omg absolutely delicious! You should definitely go and check it out if you're in the area.
name: The Bower

text:
How in the world does this place get 4.5 stars? For years I've passed by this restaurant and never had a desire to drop in. However, the pandemic is really impacting the quality of our go-to Chinese spot (i.e., Chinese Tea Garden, of course), and we were looking for alternative sources. After researching Yelp, we decided to try Hunan, solely based on the reviews. 

Oh, Yelp. These reviews remind me of a trip I took to NY a few years ago and almost every restaurant I went to, based on Yelp reviews, was a disappointment. So, are locals reviewing Hunan? I don't think I'm a food snob, but I do have standards. And this ain't it. We ordered the bourbon chicken, General's chicken, and shrimp fried rice. The best thing were the egg rolls. They were fried golden and had a decent flavor. They were a bit one note, though, with mostly all cabbage and 1 or 2 shrimp. Why do I think most of these restaurants buy this stuff frozen and all they do is heat it up? 

Anyway, the bourbon chicken didn't look like chicken. That was the first strike. Secondly, it didn't taste good. Strike two. The General's chicken was slightly better, but didn't taste like anything like General's chicken. The shrimp fried rice was just ok. Strike three and four. Next!
name: Hunan Wok

text: My boyfriend and I are HUGE lovers of Chinese takeout. We eat Chinese once a week at minimum & we've tried almost every place in the city and a few on the wank as well. Hunan Wok was by far the BEST takeout I've had since I've lived here. The black pepper chicken was so freaking good, even my general-tsos-loving boyfriend devoured it. My number one rainy day craving is hot & sour soup, and up until last night I'd been disappointed by every batch I've tried. However, Hunan Wok hit the nail on the head with their hot & sour. It was just perfection. My *only* gripe is that I wish their rangoons came 8 to an order instead of 6. Needless to say, I won't be ordering anything other than Hunan Wok from here on our
name: Hunan Wok

Came here looking for another beignet place we're had years ago. It didn't look familiar but we decided to try it anyway. 

Waiting to get seated was confusing. We sat at the bar. The bartender was very nice and attentive. We ordered some beignet and beer. The beignets were too doughy, not what we had in the past at this other place. But it wasn't bad. We ordered the Ghost in the Machine beer and it was really good!! I really liked it. Would probably go back here for the beer, yum!!

categories: Coffee & Tea, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants

text:
We stopped in because it was coolinary month and I am very impressed with the beauty of this place! It gave off vacation vibes with all of the plants everywhere. 

We ordered the verlasso salmon and the sugar roots eggplant for appetizers. The salmon was really tasty with bits of kimchi that added a very nice umami to the dish. It was very flavorful! The eggplant dish was really good, but honestly would have preferred it without the eggplant and instead a varietal of mushrooms. Broth on this dish was very good although they didn't serve it with a spoon and now I wish I would have asked for one. For our entrees we got the basil spaghetti. DO NOT PASS ON THIS DISH. It was so peppery, lemony, and the burrata on top added a creaminess to it. So good! We also got the crispy pork chop which was just okay in my opinion. Pork was too thin so it was mainly a Panko crusted batter with a really really good side salad on the plate. 

We had 2 rounds of cocktails and the service was great. I would definitely come back!
name: The Bower

text:
BROOOOO
This is the spot. Look no further. We had delivery, so I have no knowledge on the actual indoors of this spot but the food was amazing. I have a thing for crab rangoon - this is like top 3 for me. I'm not kidding. I like them with the phyllo dough a certain way, and it was just like heaven. A good amount of cream cheese/crab balance. I also had the shrimp fried rice - the shrimp were great, lol idk how one describes shrimp but they were not shitty, like actual shrimp. My boyfriend got the tso's chicken and loved it too. We had the spring rolls that were great as well. I'm telling, its just good. Like what you expect from chinese food but made just then so no hard pieces of rice or chewey crab rangoons. So good.

text:
The Bower is a newer restaurant on the New Orleans scene. With a weekday happy hour from 4 to 6 PM, we took advantage of a great opportunity to give them a whirl. We started with the Cheese Plate ($11 at happy hour) and the Charcuterie plate ($12 during happy hour). Both were imaginative and plentiful. Plus, the accompanying condiments and bread really made these plates robust and flavorful. 

Of note, the charcuterie plate included duck pate with dates as well as chicken pate with orange marmalade. These locally sourced ingredients really made the entire happy hour experience to be so so enjoyable.

If you're in the area - either the Warehouse District, Lower Garden District, or in the CBD, stop by. The service is outstanding and their attention to detail in their craft cocktails and food offerings is self evident. Plus, seating is plentiful and the restaurant decor is hip and beautiful.
name: The Bower

text:
The coffee is organic so that's cool...it's pretty tasty but not brewed quite strong enough in my humble opinion haha 

It's located inside the Renaissance New Orleans Art Hotel. They have a cute window you order from then a cool dinning area under sky lights to sip on coffee and eat some beignets. 

Soooo yeah, the beignets are the best part of this place. It's $3 for 3 palm sized beignets, either with powdered sugar or filled with chocolate. I ordered powdered sugar every time and they always came out hot and fresh. They were really delicious, I honestly think they were just as good as Cafe Du Monde yet they were larger so maybe that makes them better!?

They sell beignets all day, as well as breakfast till 10:30am and other snacks throughout the day.
name: New Orleans Coffee & Beignet

text: Ugh, this place is the worst! My grandmother often asks me to stop here and pick up something for her - and each time I get this request, dread creeps over me. The parking situation is awful - there are a bunch of stores packed into this strip mall and I almost never find an open spot. There's no parking along Metairie Road, and even parking in the swanky neighborhood behind the strip mall is tough. The quality of the food is wildly inconsistent - sometimes it will be great, but more often than not the lettuce is wilted, avocado is brown, and bread is slightly stale. But the prices definitely reflect its Old Metairie location - don't be surprised if you drop around $10 for a very mediocre sandwich. The staff is curt on the best days, outright surly on the worst. I'm going to try to persuade my grandmother to start requesting orders from somewhere else!
name: The Royal Blend

Nice staff, spacious, and reliable free wifi. Not freezing cold. Tables are clean; people actually go around and clean their tables unlike other coffee chains.

There aren't enough outlets though. The outlets they do have are very loose, and my charger falls out constantly.

I think there's a missing opportunity because they have tables and counters that can fit over 30 people but only like 6 outlets. A lot of businesses can use the outlets.

Yes, I'm passionate about the lack of outlets.
name: Starbucks

text: Great tasting subs, but my main problem is they look nothing like their pictures.  I ordered the new Ruben that was "stacked high" per the ad.  It wasn't.  Even though it tasted good, I'd never get it again.  In fact, none of the sandwiches look like their photos.  But they all taste good.
name: Firehouse Subs

text:
Rude Baristas- last I checked a mocha was with espresso not a chocolate iced coffee. The coffee/espresso quality is weak and it tastes watered down. Literally my mocha I had them remake that the still charged me for tastes like chocolate water. As they remade it I watched  as the baristas talked bad about me behind the counter to each other. I'm extremely disappointed and did not deserve to be treated like an asshole when I was politely asking for what I was paying for. Get it together. 

Also my panini tasted like fabuloso cleaner. 

Not a great way to start my day. Management please hire more experienced NICE baristas. To be treated like shit first thing in the morning is the worst way to start your day.

text:
WOW!! I have heard so much about fire house subs. I actually went out my way to eat lunch there today. The parking is not bad and the establishment is clean, and has  an appeal to the eyes. From there it goes south. I ordered the Italian sub, with chili as a side. The Italian club is the worst sandwich I have had to date, and at a whopping 10$ with tax for a footlong is way over priced. The chili on the other hand was (the worst chili I have ever had). I thought I was eating warm apple sauce with Tabasco. So all in all the establishment is nice. The food and pricing of the food is outrageous. This will be my first and last time here. 
Ps. There's a subway down the street.

text:
Royal Blend is a great place for a cup of coffee, breakfast or lunch.  This place stay busy with regular patrons and has staple coffee and tea offerings, but unlike other coffee shops, the have a great hot breakfast menu.  

The lunch menu is also excellent offering sandwiches, salads and soups.  One of my favorite sides is the potato salad because it's made with sour cream instead of mayonnaise, which I know sounds weird, but tastes great.

The prices, service and quality of food cannot be beat.  It's the type of place where you can sit and chat with friends, conduct a business appointment or go it alone.  If you're a fan of Caffe Caffe, or Cafe Latte, you should give Royal Blend a try.
name: The Royal Blend

name: Starbucks

text: Am disappointed with how Starbucks has changed within the last 6 months or so. Not sure if it is management or simple personnel changes? The staff for many years was knowledgeable and friendly. Now you get clueless people at the drive thru window and updates are not being done to the board outside that sits on the grass which usually introduces a new product or drink, and the lines are long due to the lack of speed in making the orders; something that was NEVER an issue before. Also I find that my frappuccinos are getting more and more espresso that has a scorched taste to it. Long gone are the days of when Bryan (asst. manager) and Connie (manager) ran this place. Since they left Starbucks has never been the same. However the crew they had after them did a fine job up to a point and now the crew running the place leaves a lot to be desired. Starbucks is slowly becoming a place that I am avoiding and I find myself not minding the drive on West Esplanade from Starbucks to Puccinos. I honestly find Puccinos has a much better tasting product line than Starbucks - STARBUCKS IS QUICKLY BECOMING A HAS-BEEN!
name: Starbucks

text: Who ever is responsible for ordering their supplies at this location needs to start ordering the ingredients for the Cascara Cold Brew.  They've been out for over a month and other nearby locations have the beverage. Pretty frustrating.

The menu looked really enticing but I opted for a tasty chocolate chip cooking and a large iced tea. Both were just what I needed and I was off in no time.

The space was roomy with lots of tables for the lunch/breakfast crowd. The staff was nice. Definitely will stop back by when I'm cruising Metairie Road.

text:
I worked across the street from this restaurant for 4 years and mostly ordered takeout, but recently went and sat down for lunch. I really enjoyed the food. Their chicken Parmesan sandwich is super good. It has just the right amount of sauce and the chicken is crispy. I also like their fries; they are thinner and crispier, which is something I don't see a lot of anymore and kind of liked. My friend and I split the crab cakes and a small chicken pizza. The crab cakes came with fettuccine and it was creamy and delicious. The pizza was AWESOME. Spicy, and the cheese was gooey and melted to perfection. 

Our service wasn't spectacular, but it wasn't terrible. We were the only table in there and had to flag down our waitress twice. She was nice though and even split our checks, which some servers get annoyed about.

All in all, I would give this place a shot. It's definitely not your typical pizza joint.
name: Ditali's Pizza Cafe

text:
My wife and I have been here before, a while back, today's visit was a bit disappointing.

The lady who took our order was not friendly at all. She seemed preoccupied with finishing someone else's order so we had to tell her twice because she didn't get what we said the first time.

The food was ok. I had the breakfast plate with eggs, sausage patties, cheese grits, and toast. Strangely enough, hash browns are only sold on weekends, which I disagree with. The cheese grits were probably the best part of the plate. Very cheesy, very buttery. The sausage and eggs were just standard.

My wife had her plate with scrambled eggs, bacon, biscuit, and the fruit cup. The fruit cup did not look fresh by any means, although the rest of her meal was fine.

Her coffee was good, and I had a Barq's bottle to drink. 

All in all, it was just average, which explains my average rating, but the cheese grits are definitely worth getting. We may try this place again and get different breakfast items, like an omelet or waffle.
name: The Royal Blend

text: Nice little coffee shop hidden in a strip mall along Metairie Road, Royal Blend has a large selection of coffee as well as sweets and eats. The have a full kitchen with breakfast menu and some of the best desserts around. An excellent choice for a breakfast/brunch stop if your in that area.

text:
When I was in high school this was the place where every girl I knew went to get coffee if they were in the Old Metairie area.  It had pretty good coffee from what I remembered but I hadn't been in years.

I stumbled across the Royal Blend in the French Quarter a few weeks ago and had some great coffee so I decided to stop and try this location again the last time I was on Metairie Rd.

The coffee at this location was definitely not as good as the one in the Quarter.  I got an iced coffee and it was pretty bitter but not horrible.  I guess it really matters who's making the coffee or maybe they were stale beans or something.

The price was reasonable (I think ~$3) which from what I've noticed lately is pretty cheap compared to the $5 cups of coffee everywhere else.

If you're on Metairie Rd and need to stop for some coffee or food this is a decent place.
name: The Royal Blend

text:
This is a really cute cafe in Old Metairie.

Although I just stopped in here for an iced coffee, this place is so much more than a coffee shop. First of all, the iced coffee I got was amazing. It had a lot of flavor, without being overpowering.

I was really impressed by the menu here. They serve everything from pastries, salads and wraps to specialty sandwiches. I was tempted to try some food, but I was in a bit of a rush.

The shop itself has very good atmosphere and a lot of space. As Jen L. said, there are plenty of tables where you can eat and, of course, there is free WifI, if you need to get some work done.

text: I go to this place frequently because I really enjoy the Cheddar Brisket sandwich. Few buddies and I used to drive all the way to Covington (25 minutes) just to grab some of these sandwiches! This particular location seems to be still transitioning to a full functioning team as I would always see a change up in staff with a person always in training. With this constant change over the course of 8 months (?), the consistency of sandwiches are ever changing... As I would get a fraction of the meats- stingy portions of sauce- and getting a 'normal' amount of meat when I clearly paid for double meat. All in all, when you catch this place on a good day then you'll be happy you came here.

text:
My wife and go to Royal Blend, because it's the only breakfast place on Metairie Road.  The eggs and bacon are fairly good, and their croissants are too, but the rest of their fare is definitely middle-of-the-road.  The coffee is not good, because it's not fresh unless you're lucky.  For this reason we usually order the lattes.  That way we know we're going to get something freshly made.  The hash browns are tasteless, and the biscuits are fair.  Oh lastly the staff are a pretty sullen lot too.

After saying all this I'll add that if you live off Metairie Road and you spend an hour in there you're likely to run into one or more of your neighbors.  We've made several friends whom we see week after week in there lounging with their children or just hanging out.

I'll end this by saying that Metairie Road NEEDS another breakfast place.  This place needs competition.  I'm looking at you, Ruby Slipper!
name: The Royal Blend

text: Closest store to my house, so I make a trip at least twice a month. text:
This was my first experience at a Firehouse Subs and it was amazing. 

The restaurant was spotless, the service was great, and the food was delicious. I had the regular meatball sub and my husband had the sweet and spicy meatball sub. They were both so good. Can't wait to go back!

text: I stopped by because Royal Blend is close to my doctor's office in Old Metairie.  I'd never been before and always wanted to try. So glad I did! It is a larger cafe than I thought it would be; very bright and airy.  The lady who took my order was incredibly sweet. I asked for the soup of the day, but they'd *just* sold out of the last cup.  She offered me the gumbo instead and also surprised me with a small cup of what was left from the soup of the day pot so I could still try it. It was entirely unnecessary but a very nice gesture.  Both the soup of the day (can't remember the exact name but tasted like nice, thick tomato basil soup) and the seafood gumbo (also a thicker soup, which I personally prefer to thinner gumbos).  I also got a cafe au lait to go.  I love that they have options of medium, dark and chicory coffee.  Not enough cafes have that last one.  All in all, a super pleasant experience and I will definitely be back.
name: The Royal Blend

text: I'm only giving this store a 3 because their drive thru employees are super sweet every time i've been here. Today i came into the store to sit down and drink my coffee and get my breakfast. I waited in line to order and when it got to me, she seemed very rushed. i ordered my drink, AND FOOD. she didn't ring in my food, which is fine, i just waited in line AGAIN, i ordered my food and paid for it. then she tells me after i paid she doesn't have anymore of what i wanted. she then said "what else do you want?" in an aggravated voice. i told her nothing, i simply wanted what i ordered, she was very rude about it and told me she could just refund my money then. which is fine, but DONT BE RUDE. i work in the customer service industry and i would NEVER treat my customers like this. customers MATTER. i should have been told "sorry i apologize, we don't have anymore" rather than "what else do you want?"

Been coming here way before Yelp's existence! Back in the day(18 years ago), it was a chocolate chip muffin and a frozen coffee! Today it's a quick start breakfast---eggs, bacon, toast, and those absolutely amazing cheese grits! So cheesy that I get 1/2 regular and 1/2 cheese! 
The staff is quick and friendly...I love how efficient they are especially when the line is out of the door! 
Check out the lunch menu as well! Fantastic soups and sandwiches served just the way you like em! 
Grab a quick pastry or a slice of cake with your morning or afternoon coffee! 
My only complaint is that they are no longer in the French Quarter! :(
Free wifi.
Cute courtyard.

text:
The coffee is great. The food is good. The service is usually solid. Their breakfast menu is one of the bigger you will find around a coffee shop. Both the hot breakfast and the pastries are good. I'm partial to the breakfast bagel with a Canadian bacon. Always has a generous portion of egg on it. I love their cold drip iced coffees. 
Here is where I drop a star. In the mornings the crowds are big. They have a table of regulars that commandeers MULTIPLE tables daily during their busiest times. I've squeezed 6+ at a 4 top while they had 4-5 guys at a table for 12. As someone who previously made multiple trips a week there, I've dwindled to less than once a month because of this space issue and the fact that management/ownership seems fine with the rest of their customers being inconvenienced just didn't work for me.
name: The Royal Blend

text:
If you've ever been to a Firehouse Subs, this place is par for the course.  If you haven't, you're in for a treat.  Keep in mind that these aren't poboys.  They aren't less tasty, they're just different.

The bread isn't as good as Jimmy John's or Panera Bread, but it's a lot better than Subway and Quizno's.  They do a lot of sandwiches well, and you can always custom build your own, but as far as I'm concerned, the Firehouse Hero is where it's at--roast beef, smoked turkey, Virginia ham, and provolone melted on top.  I get it "Fully Involved" (fully dressed, plus mustard and onion), slather some Captain Sorensen's Datil Pepper Sauce on that baby, and drift off to seventh heaven.

Pickle comes on the side and it's tasty.  If you're going Large, and you like pickle, order an extra pickle.  The combo is of questionable value in my book, but if you're gonna get a drink anyway, just get the combo.  I like Doritos, but they have all the national brands of small-bag chips, and their baked goodies are as good as Subway (or better, depending on the item).

I go here about once a month, and I've noticed that the tables can be a little dirty AFTER the lunch rush.  I think the employees are tired and a little off their game after the rush, so as the volume drops off, they aren't as good about the wipe-down and refresh.  That means I prefer to go before 1pm or after 4pm.
name: Firehouse Subs

text:
I've never felt so compelled to write a review about a Starbucks.

I come to this location often because it's in between where I live and where I work. I'm probably here 2-3 times a week, at least.

With that said, every time I'm here my experience gets better and better. First off, the inside is spacious, clean and there's also an outdoor area with chairs and tables. 

Second, the baristas are the friendliest I've ever encountered. Whether it's cracking a joke with a customer to make them laugh, telling a customer about a latest deal, or just going the extra mile in general, the service has always been phenomenal. To be honest, it's probably the friendliest Starbucks I've ever been to.

Lastly, they're super efficient. Even when there's a long line, I never feel like I'm waiting too long, and my order has never been messed up. And to be honest, even if they did ever mess it up, I wouldn't even be mad because I know they'd handle it professionally. Best Starbucks ever!
name: Starbucks

text:
Starbucks GETS IT!!! So fresh & innovative in their business endeavors.  

(this review is 60% about the app & 40% about the service, drink, store etc) 

Hello, this mobile ordering is making my life all the easier!!!! Ya'll saw the line, I totally skipped... Bullying huh. Lol. I know, I'm not proud... But I was totally able to pull off a #stickandmove caper!!! 

Picture it: early morning, I need a cup of Joe, but I ain't (yeah i said AIN'T) up for waiting. So I pull up the trusty Starbucks app, located the closest store, placed my order & pay, then... Boom, Bang, Bing, I pull up walk in & get my order!!! Helllllo am I happy camper? Heck yeah (in my Napoleon Dynamite voice) Annnnnnnnnnd on the way out, because this Starbucks app is so cool, I can tip the barista, even after my transaction is complete!!!! Way cool.

I found my skinny cinnamon latte to be great tasting & temperature appropriate; quite PERFECT. 

Although the Barista & I didn't have much bonding time, the time I did spend with her, mainly her calling my name & me scooping my beverage.  She was pleasant, cheerful & engaging (she called my name correctly & with authority!!!!) 

Clean store. Ample parking in this shared parking lot. 

This Starbucks was VERY busy, long drive thru line, lots of folks hanging out indoors... The ordering capabilities of mobile app is sheer genius!!!
name: Starbucks

text: Absolutely breathtaking Cuban sandwich. Perfectly toasted panini. The pork and ham was exquisite. We were waited on by John and he was such a charmer, also the cooks name was Carlin and he had an amazing attitude. Definitely will be returning.  Love the staff!

text:
This is a hipsters paradise. And I am not referring to the clientele. Every time I have come, the male baristas have either well maintained beards (even well conditioned) or moustaches that they have spent a lot of time grooming and shaping into styles. They must spend a lot of their spare time grooming their faces. And their clothes? Perfectly ironed pants (even the jeans have the line from ironing) and their shirts are perfectly starched. Seriously. Its a good thing they spend so much time on their appearance, because they definitely don't spend any time at all focusing on the customer, or even what the customer JUST ordered and paid for. Or that they took any order from any customer at all. On the few times I have been, I have never seen an employee of color or female. All white males. I wonder what this says about the area, or the management of this location. Which I am shocked because this is in a diverse area.

The inside is clean, neat and well organized, though on the small side. If you are lucky, you might get something similar to what you ordered, if you ordered something like almond milk in your coffee, you will probably get regular milk in that drink. Be warned, strongly warned. But, you will quickly be given a beverage and your food order, even though it will most likely not be what you ordered at all. For example, on my most recent order, I ordered a croissant and an iced pumpkin spice latte, and they tried to give me a cake pop and a hot skinny mocha. I'm just sayin'.
name: Starbucks

text:
This is a new addition to an area that I've dubbed "restaurant row" in Lakeview. This is a fantastic little spot in the building that used to house Mondo and I just love the feel and atmosphere.

My dad and I stopped in here for lunch and I immediately loved the vibe: relaxed lunch with an upscale feel. I decided to start with an order of the She Crab Bisque because I do make a habit of indulging whenever I see it on a menu. It was fabulous! Tasty and rich- a great start to the meal.

For my entree I had the Shrimp Lucci, which came highly recommended by the waitress. This was shrimp tossed with mushrooms and pasta with a light buttery sauce. This was AMAZING! I loved how light it was, but it still satisfied my craving for pasta. It was the perfect lunch dish and I would order it again.

For dessert, I dug into the Tiramisu which was flavorful and decadent, without being too over the top. It made an already great lunch even better.

Everything here was fantastic and I will absolutely be back!
name: Elle-Jâs

text:
Stop what you're doing. Put on shoes. And no matter your mode of transportation (walk, drive, bike, Falkor, etc) head to Bywater American Bistro and order yourself some of the most creative and mouthwatering food New Orleans has to offer! The dishes offered at this neighborhood brew pub are heralded as Viet-Cajun, and we loved all of it!

We started our meal off with the cheesy egg rolls, and knew we were in for quite a treat. The outside was a perfectly crisped egg roll wrapper that crunched with each bite. Inside had mounds of oozing, gooey cheese. They were like mozzarella sticks with even more flavor than normal. For our meal we shared the  Phorrito, which had Sliced Roast Beef, rice noodles, onions, scallions, thai basil, bean sprouts, cilantro, sriracha, hoisin wrapped in a hot flour tortilla with a side of pho broth gravy for dips, and the Vietnamese Crawfish Etouffee Nachos. The Vietnamese Crawfish Etouffee Nachos has so many words in the title and even more flavors to enjoy! Fried wonton chips, chedder & cojita cheese, scallions, cilantro made for the perfect pairing for each of the beers we tried.

As for the beer selection, it was very impressive. We tried a few as it was happy hour pricing (bonus!) While they had many selections you'd expect, we really liked their Vienna lager spiked with New Orleans Chicory coffee because it felt like something you could only get in the Big Easy. It was almost as bold as the Deb Does Chocolate - Chocolate Stout which featured mammoth amounts of flavor. 

We loved our experience so much that each night during our visit we contemplated eating at Bywater Brew Pub a second (or even third) time! The customer service was stellar too. Our waiter was so chill and friendly that I wanted to be their friend. This added to the overall dope vibe of their venue, which was very welcoming and gave off the feel of a neighborhood chill zone!
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: The food was beautifully presented, tasted delicious and the service was perfect. Will visit again on our next trip to New Orleans.
name: Yo Nashi

text:
While in town and staying at hotel, we usually will ask for recommendations from the front desk. Ditali's Pizza Cafe was offered as a excellent option. 
The staff were super friendly but sadly, we found it to be a mistake when we ordered two items.
While the toppings on the Lotsa Meat pizza where fresh and of good quality, the pizza it self was under cooked and lacking flavorful sauce. 
We also ordered the Garlic Knots. Again severely disappointed! The bread knots where not warm, tasted stale and the garlic Parmesan spread wasn't even melted. 

This would be a solid skip for me
name: Ditali's Pizza Cafe

text:
The food: Exquisite seafood and beautiful plating! Their food looks like a work of art and has the taste to match. I've never had a scallop that was so tender you could cut through it like butter. I also adored the juicy oyster coated with buttery panko, the tuna maki topped with caviar, and the sweet and savory dessert of almond cake with black garlic caramel. 

The atmosphere: The restaurant was rather quiet and subdued when we went on a Thursday night. There was only one other couple dining there. The waitstaff was very friendly and attentive and the chef personally handed us each course. I wish the atmosphere had been livelier but there's not much the restaurant can do about that during a pandemic. 

I will note that each course of sushi was just a single piece. Though everything was delicious, considering the price of the meal, it was somewhat disappointing that we were still a bit hungry at the end. They did offer to repeat any course we liked, but it didn't seem worth it to order one more piece of sushi at a time. If there was an a la carte menu that had full-sized rolls, I'd love to be able to stop by here more often.
name: Yo Nashi

text:
Ooooh my second experience here. I took my son and his boyfriend . It was my son's birthday. We had a Fabolous meal. The delicious dishes just kept coming. Chef is very nice and attentive. It's pricey but worth each penny. 
I look forward to my next experience at Yo Nashi !
name: Yo Nashi

text: Great Food, great service. Appetizers were great, and chicken and shrimp pad Thai was some of the best I've had. Will not be disappointed.
name: Thai D Jing

text:
Truly an amazing and exquisite dining experience! Chef Elon Shaya and the entire Miss River team have created a flavorful New Orleans menu and thoughtful craft cocktails. 

We started with the New Orleans Rum punch, which was equally balanced in flavor, sweetness, and strength. As a result, we each enjoyed two of these cocktails!

Our meal included: Crab au gratin, Whole carved buttermilk fried chicken with sauces, red beans and rice, and baked sweet potato. 

The crab au gratin was my least favorite item. It was good, but quite an expensive appetizer. While the crab meat itself was sweet, succulent, and fresh, the serving size (approximately 6 ounces) for $18 was a bit rich. Also, the au gratin topping was appropriately toasted but the entire dish lacked flavor/seasoning and a binding component (i.e., creaminess).

The Whole carved buttermilk fried chicken is a show-stopper! The crust is crunchy and flavorful, the meat is tender, and the overall presentation is magnificent! The staff initially serves the chicken whole, for purposes of presentation. Immediately thereafter, it is whisked away to the carving station. By the time the pieces of chicken return, resting deliciously on a bed of rosemary, the accompanying sauces are there at the table waiting. There are three sauces, which are seasoned honey, crunchy red pepper, and a green herbs. Each of the sauces provided their own flavor, from sweet to spicy to pungent. Truly, the chicken was so perfectly seasoned that the sauces were not required, but they did add to the overall chicken experience.

The whole carved buttermilk fried chicken is an a la carte item, so we chose red beans and rice and baked sweet potato as accompaniments. The baked sweet potato was classic and delicious. The red beans and rice dish was well-seasoned and spicy. The red beans may be too spicy for non-Orleanians but a nice complement to the chicken. Plus, the rice was cooked perfectly!

The sweet end to the meal was lagniappe from the staff! While my specific recollection may be slightly amiss, the two different treats were chocolate chicory cookies and banana pralines. Both were flavorful and a perfect finalÃ©.
name: Miss River Restaurant

attributes.Ambience: {u'divey': False, u'hipster': False, u'casual': False, u'touristy': False, u'trendy': False, u'intimate': False, u'romantic': False, u'classy': True, u'upscale': False}

categories: Desserts, Restaurants, Cajun/Creole, Food, Salad, Seafood

text:
The hours on this place are weird. What kind of liquor establishment closes at 9? But a lot of the NOLA restaurants have weird hours. My vegetarian traveling companion was recommended this place so that's why we made it a point to try out. Service was speedy and the ambience was neat. There was live music there, though the performer did come off a bit pushy, going to each table with a bucker asking folks if they'd like to donate to the "performer" (which was her). 

Now, as I was NOT the vegetarian at the table, I got the Vietnamese BBQ shrimp. The waiter warned me that I'd have to peel the shrimp so it'd be a bit of "work". As an avid seafood-lover, I was not deterred. It was DELICIOUS. These shrimp were jumbo-sized with the heads still on, but cooked to perfection so they popped off easily after shelling. They rested atop the buttermilk biscuit all sitting in a savory broth that had me licking my fingers and smacking my lips. I love Vietnamese cuisine, but this place added the New Orleans twist I came to this city for. Definitely worth a stop here.

Oh, and they do fries RIGHT. I noticed this about a lot of restaurants in New Orleans. This city is good at fries.
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: Stumbled across this restaurant in the French quarter and it was a great find. The food was amazing, probably some of the best shawarma I've ever had. The restaurant was very clean and COVID friendly. And the service was great! Definitely recommend!

text: Where to begin. This place is truly a gem! We were visiting the area for work and found this place on a whim. The ambiance is very tranquil with a modern touch. There is a cute patio for outside seating with lights that make it a  very charming setting. As for the food- the Pad Thai and cashew nut and appetizers are PHENOMENAL. I have had many dishes around the US and Thai D Jing definitely rates top 3. We wish we didn't get so full so we could try the desserts but they looked amazing as well. Our server was great and so friendly. I can't give this place enough kudos- truly incredible and must try if you are in NOLA.
name: Thai D Jing

text: Went in for our anniversary dinner and enjoyed every dish that came out. Not your typical omakase and that's what made it stand out for us. Sometimes we get torn between if we wanted sushi or NOLA cuisine. This restaurant gives you both! Love the atmosphere of the restaurant.  We definitely will be going back.
name: Yo Nashi

text: We went to this coffee shop this morning . The staff was very friendly, helpful and made our drinks quickly. The atmosphere was quaint, and food was delicious. Our lattes were very good, definitely will be visiting here again.
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text:
A Yelp Elite perk got me into this adorable little place, but I'll be back! The draw of king cake and coffee on a chilly Saturday morning was too much to resist!

My ginger iced tea was fresh-made to order and delicious, and it comes automatically in a reusable cup! Another shout-out to Caluda's for the tender cinnamon-y king cake.

Everyone in this black-owned shop was friendly and welcoming. There's seating inside and out, and the wi-fi password is prominently displayed-no asking necessary. They have various pastries in a case on the counter, and if they do sandwiches (not sure about this), it will be a great little lunch stop.
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text:
I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this place! My family is from Thailand, and I visit every year so I've had authentic Thai food. This is the closest restaurant yet in the U. S. that I've been to!

FOOD: Wonderful. I recommend the green curry and Khao Soi (with beef). 

AMBIANCE: Cute! Modern and simple. Very clean. 

SERVICE: Everyone was friendly and attentive. The owner came out and was serving. He and his wife run a great establishment!
name: Thai D Jing

text: Brews were good! Would like to come back for more. Garage doors provided a nice frame for the neighborhood. Burger was nothing special, but the Brussels had a nice sauce.

text: My fav place in New Orleans. Always reliably delicious Lebanese food, hookah and good music. Get the toummeah (white garlic sauce) on the side of your plate/wrap.

text: Checked out a new spot that opened during covid and it was great! We made a reservation although I don't think it's required. Beautiful, spacious dining area and bar with bright colors and tons of local art. It was so exciting to go somewhere new and feel so safe! Service was friendly with great personal recommendations. The cheesy egg rolls and spring rolls were great. Lots of texture and flavor complimented the local brews we ordered. Our entrees, delivered quickly, hit the spot! The Bahn Mi burger was packed with flavor and texture and cooked wonderfully! I was happy to learn that cilantro could be eliminated and many of the meat-centric apps and sides could be prepared for vegetarian diners! Vietnamese and Cajun cuisine is a perfect fusion. GO. DINE. Support your neighborhood restaurant and service industry workers!
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: Omgeeee Yes!! This place rocks! First off, I used to walk by this place with my Dog and the workers are always giving her their homemade dog treats! Their kindness and the overall good vibes of this place had me wanting to try it out. Today I tried it out and it was amazing! First of all the servers were so kind and really good at their jobs. It's very spacious, they have these cool garage style doors that they have open which creates a lovely airy open space, they have bar seating, and they also offer outdoor seating. The drinks were strong, I had the Ginger JalapeÃ±o Mescalrita, my mom had a Mai Tai. The food was delicious super fresh and oh so good. I had the Tofu Burger which had a really good garlic soy aioli and cheese grits! You can get the tofu grilled or fried I had the fried version, the brioche bun was fresh and delicious. My mom had the Grilled lemongrass pork belly lettuce wraps. We both loved our food and the service! The owner was there and he walked to every table to introduce himself and ask us all how we were enjoying our experience. The prices are fair, the food is delicious and the drinks are strong! I highly recommend this place. Also they have a Happy hour everyday from 4-6!! Got to there! Enjoy
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text:
I love this place! I'm already obsessed!

Customer Service and Atmosphere. The service is impeccable. I have already been over 7 times and I had a great experience each time with the staff. The staff is friendly, helpful and I love that they give recommendations once they get to know you. It's a really good experience. They are also very responsive on social media. The atmosphere is also very cute! It's a bright location with a good amount of seating. They are following all COVID protocol. Mask is of course required and two hand sanitizing stations are available for patrons. Btw the hand sanitizer is high quality. Also, they have an award system!


Drinks. So far, I only have tried the drinks! Currently, my favorite tries include the Mulled Spiced Cider and Peppermint Chai Latte, which are beyond delicious. This crew is great at playing with flavors. They could definitely brew you up something delicious.  They even brewed up a drip non-caffeinated coffee on spot for my mother, which made her feel fancy. This is definitely a great place to try different coffee and non-coffee drinks for a reasonable price.


Parking. Street parking is available. You definitely will find parking either right in front or directly across the street so no issues there whatsoever.

This is definitely one of my favorite new coffeeshops! It's all a black-owned coffeeshop!
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text: We had a party of eight. Kyle was very accommodating and followed up weekly before our dinner. Staff was amazing. Chef Matt and his saucier were amazing. Each course was better than the previous. We paired the meal with a sake tasting. This is easily one of the best meals of the last few years. Come for the experience l, stay for the food.
name: Yo Nashi

text: I love this place. I have had almost everything on the menu and i loved it all.  The best Italian salad and i asked for extra anchovies and it was perfect. The pizza is delicious and the double cut pork chops is to die for.  The negative responses that i viewed are nonsense. Go and try it for yourself.

text: Good food and nice ambiance. Pretty packed for a Tuesday night! Chargrilled oysters were delicious. Got the kids pizza which the kids ate all it and it came our pretty quick. Lettuce wedge was great and the pasta bolognese! So delicious.  Needed a little parmesan and salt and pepper but was good after you added that. She didn't bring us the Parmesan originally and we had to ask for it which seems strange at an Italian restaurant. And we also had to ask for tomatoes with the lettuce wedge which was strange. Also, bread did not come out at all and I feel like that should be a staple if you're at an Italian restaurant. Server did the best she could waiting on us because I feel like it got busy SUPER quick and she was in the weeds. I want to give it 3 1/2 stars so I'll give 4 since this is a brand new restaurant and give it some time to fix the kinks. I'd definitely come back to try some more stuff on the menu. Oh and if also wasn't that expensive for an Italian place so that's good!
name: Elle-Jâs

text:
Oh yum. I'm glad Re suggested this is as our family dinner last night. Because it was very tasty. We were a big group so we got a variety of items. I really liked my tuna sandwich (cooked rare); my piece of tuna was lovely and really big ... I'm eating the last 1/3 for my lunch today and it came with a small salad so yum! Katie loved her burger so much that it was GONE. I got to sit next to John (and watching a 14 year old inhale pepperoni pizza like a machine was an impressive sight) and his pizza and his dad's looked delish.  Others got a meatball sandwich, a steak sandwich and a calzone. Everyone enjoyed their food and had zero room for dessert. Did I mention that the menu is HUGE! 

I was impressed by the size and cleanliness of the restaurant. And our server was very sweet and it was her first day! I felt bad that she had to put up with our silliness. She did a great job and asked about refills and boxes and whatnot. They do not have a liquor license but you can bring your own. And my iced tea was fresh brewed and tasty because y'all know I'm a tea snob.

I'll have to go back and try the spinach calzone after hearing Re rave about it... oh and that cranberry salad. Yes I see that in my future.
name: Ditali's Pizza Cafe

text: One of my new years resolutions always seems to be to write more reviews, but I haven't gone much anywhere in 2021 yet! So happy I finally made it to Bywater Brewpub! Really just wanted a snack and try the beer but then wanted EVERYTHING on the menu. My partner and I got the margarita and Slip-n-fall golden ale, with the pork rillettes and cheesy egg rolls (with sweet chili remoulade waaaat?! So good). Then the phoritto (pho ingredients wrapped up like a burrito, if that isn't obvious). It came with a dipping sauce, and I was like no way is that a reduced pho broth, that would be too perfect, and it waaaas. Inhaled it all. Also got the Ahn Luu gives you wings. Whole wings (menu said 3, but came with 4) covered in a traditional Vietnamese sweet/salty sauce with buku herbs, and side of rice noodles to soak up all that good good. ALSO everything came out lightning fast and hot. You could tell nothing was just sitting under a heat lamp. Our waitress was so cute and funny, and checked on us the perfect amount of times. THEN after our bill was paid, she came out with a free slice of king cake! It was devine, covered in a frosting with a hint of lime that was so unique. COVID Test: Tables were spaced out more than 6 feet, and we sat by huge garage type doors for good air circulation. No staff had lose masks or their noses out. Can't wait to go back and try more menu items! Clap clap clap!!
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: Very very underwhelming. I was looking forward to trying a new omakase style restaurant as I've enjoyed the omakase experience in the past, but I was left feeling underwhelmed especially considering the price of the meal. The portions are extremely small (one tiny piece of nigiri per course) and we felt like the larger piece of fish that is given as the last course was simply served to make you feel full after having seven courses that left us unsatisfied. I appreciate the fusion style of the dishes but the quality of the fish was unimpressive and is not up to par to compete with other fusion omakase restaurants that NOLA has to offer. If you're going to spend money on an omakaze experience in NOLA, Nagomi with Chef Kaz is the way to go.
name: Yo Nashi

text: This is the only pizza place in the area that is worth eating.  It is a little more pricy than other but I guess what it takes to get a decent pizza.   I highly recommend this place when looking to fulfill the urge for pizza.

text:
I was craving shrimp pad thai yesterday and my guy brought home one. Their shrimp pad thai had no veggies inside but it was absolutely delicious and the best one I've ever eaten. There was so much flavor and the shrimp was huge! I want another one as I am writing this review. 

I dined in here one time and sat outside. They had a mini garden in the back parking lot which was fun to see. Lots of papaya plants but no papaya salad on the menu yet. Hoping to see it make it on the menu one day. I also ordered a shrimp with cream cheese appetizer and a curry bowl with crispy noodle on top. The shrimp appetizer was amazing. Huge shrimp inside with the perfect amount of cream cheese. The wonton wrapped on the outside was deep fried to perfection. Super crispy with melted cream cheese and juicy jumbo shrimp. The curry bowl was also flavorful but didnt come with lots of veggies inside. So it was pretty heavy. The shrimp still had shells on and there was a salty sauce sautÃ©ed with shrimp that I didnt like at all. 

Service was friendly and excellent. They checked on us pretty often and all the food came out fast and piping hot. Definitely a must try and now on my favorite list of thai restaurants.
name: Thai D Jing

text:
For those who aren't familiar, 'Omakase' is basically a Japanese version of a chef's tasting menu (mainly high grade sushi) where the dishes are prepared directly in front of you by the chef made famous in US recently because of the documentary "Jiro Loves Sushi."

That out of the way, Yo Nashi is a fusion take on this where the experience (and part of the allure of Omakase-style dining is the experience) is decidedly Japanese but Chef Matt mixes in Western fine dining influences in with the expected high grade sushi. 

And Matt and his team do it very well. 

All of the dishes were well thought out and fresh with the service being outstanding but not over-the-top stuffy fine dining. The staff (all three of them) seem to truly care about your experience and ensuring you thoroughly enjoy your food. And I did!

Word of warning. This experience is not for everyone. There are no California Rolls, big bowls of soy and wasabi to dip your sushi in, or anything of that sort. You simply sit down, order a drink(s) if you'd like it, and then wait for Chef to put food in front of you. 

So, if that's NOT what you're looking for, I'd highly recommend visiting the crew and enjoying a meal to remember.
name: Yo Nashi

text:
Park Island Brew is great! I love the cozy vibe of the inside and I love that there's nice seating on the boulevard outside, under the trees. When I stopped in, I just got a regular iced coffee, but I know that they do all kinds of specialty drinks including milkshakes. The staff is super friendly and everyone is being Covid safe, so I felt good about spending a little time here. If you're looking for a neighborhood coffee joint, this is the spot.

I wrote about this spot for Mid-City Messenger! Read that article here: https://midcitymessenger.com/2021/01/27/park-island-brew-opens-during-pandemic-because-people-needed-a-place-to-go/

text:
We are here from out of town. We were looking for something less tourist-y and more of a local vibe. Found this place on a random social media post and saw Vietnamese/Cajun mix of food and went for it. 

Service 5/5 When arriving we were greeted promptly and told to pick a seat. Our server was the person that seated us and she began serving us immediately. She told us to call her Baby D we think!(it was hard to hear through the masks lol). She was an absolute beast of a waitress. Couldn't have asked for a single thing more from her. Also she was cool as hell. 

Environment 5/5 They were playing great music over the speakers. Had local artists on the walls and the place was spotless. Very hip and a great place to kick back and hang out with friends. 

Food 5/5 We had the Vietnamese Crawfish ÃtouffÃ©e Nachos(our favorite item of the night) and when I say they were amazing.... we almost ate the paper. For our entree we had the Yaka Mein with an order of Cheesy Egg Rolls. Also great tasting. 

Drinks 5/5 they had a good variety of craft beers on tap and all the ones we tried were tasty. Unfortunately they weren't able to serve their own beers yet due to complications from COVID. But the beers they did have were sourced locally. The cocktails we had were also good especially their spin on an Irish Coffee. 

Long review but they don't have a lot so I figured I'd give everyone a comprehensive review. Definitely give this place a shot especially if you are a local. They deserve your business. The chef and owner both stopped by the table and said a hello and thank you. Seems like an upstanding business ran by people who really care.
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text:
So the first time I ordered from Ditali's via Postmatws, it was awesome! The second time, which is today, I'm pissed. I ordered a Lotsa Pizza, Zeppolas, Crab Cakes, Parmesan Funduta Fries, and Spaghetti and Meatballs. Pizza was never packed with the order. Crabcakes were small - like the size of my 4 yr old's hand, and the spaghetti was all curved to the front section of the to go plate. Now I understand that the costs of certain ingregredients is rising, thus the cost of the food and order rise as well
 But for what I spent and what I was missing, it just doesn't add up. I live on base, so right there I have to meet the delivery person at the gate. But it goes to show you never know who is ordering. Everything else with the order is fine. Postmates gave me a credit of $19 for the pizza. I would like to see that back in my account and cancel my account with Postmates instead. Yes I sent them two comments as well.
name: Ditali's Pizza Cafe
