text:
Surprise! New Orleans now has their very own Four Seasons; adding a beautiful new bar & a grand dining experience. I was finally able to go check them out one Sunday evening. As soon as you enter you can't miss the large, breathtaking, beautiful chandelier. We debated on either sitting there or trying @missrivernola.
We decided to walk over to the dining room. Of course they were fully committed but were trying to accommodate us. A couple was finishing up at the bar in the restaurant, so we decide to grab a drink by the Chandelier bar until those seats became available. We ordered the "French 75"& "Cognac Nada Colada". Both were very good. Soon after, we were able to grab seats at the bar in @missrivernola.
Eric was our server for the evening. He was pretty good, personable, and knowledgeable. Â The space was beautiful & very elegant. The bread served that night was sweet potato brioche, accompanied with the choice of oil, butter or my favorite honey. Oh child, we were definitely fighting over those little rolls LOL.
For our first course, we started with the "Louisiana BBQ Shrimp" & per Eric's recommendation the Gumbo. I hated the gumbo. The roux was much darker than I like, leaving it with a charred taste. The shrimp however was a hit. Nice size & I loved the pesto, green herb toast that was paired; gave it some nice flavor. We were told the kitchen was sending out a complementary "Giardiniera Salad" to make up for the gumbo. It was an iceberg salad, with a muttaletta like topping & Italian dressing. I do not eat olives so I was not crazy about it. Also, I later noticed we were charged for it. Something we didn't ask for. Now talk about leaving a bad taste in my mouth.
Main course, we ordered the "Redfish Courtbouillon" & "Prime Beef Ribeye", added on a side of jasmine rice, roasted sweet potato, & collards. Honestly, I was very impressed how well those collards were cooked, & my steak was cooked perfectly. However, nothing else really wowed me. The redfish lacked so much flavor, & had oysters in it after I requested none. Sweet potatoes were ok. I was expecting so much more from such a grand place.
Overall I was not that impressed. I will be back to revisit the Chandelier Bar!
name: Miss River Restaurant

text:
Reserved a spot 2 weeks in advance here for my birthday dinner and I was very fascinated from start to finish of the courses. I love dressing up and this is one of those places where I have an excuse to do so. The service was top notch. I enjoyed the experience of not knowing what the courses had in store until ready to devour and that the chefs would take care of me, an exciting surprise! The atmosphere was dim, but still well lit (like Batman walking from the shadows and suddenly you see everything around you), intimate for me and my partner, and not too cold/hot (the perfect room temperature).

They didn't have the cocktails we wanted; You're Pretty and Oishii, so we had the Virga and Wrecking Ball. I enjoyed mine, but hers was a bit too bitter for her liking. I was so ashamed of myself each time they served us and told us what we were about to consume for I could only remember parts of what was described and the other time I was admiring the presentation (at least the ones that weren't just a single sushi roll). This is what I remember off the top of my head from start to finish:

Salad Pickled Radish
Kimchi seared Tuna with vinegrate paste?
Speckled Trout
Tuna Roll
Glazed Salmon
Butterscotch Wagyu (costs extra, but worth)
Fall Spice Cake with White Chocolate Mousse and a few specks of pomegranate (even the smallest bites left a impactful taste)

They do give you the option of eating the same sushi course again.

I left here not full to the wall, but a perfect amount where I'm satisfied and I don't have the capacity for food as I once did. This is one of those places I would go for an occasion, meaning I would like to go back again for a different variety course. It's not that I didn't enjoy today's course, but I love trying new things, broaden my horizons!
name: Yo Nashi

text:
Yes I am a fan along with everyone else and for the reasons everyone else stated, but y'all still gonna get this review. Ya heard.  
I love love love when businesses fill an actual need. From the mouths of the folks in the neighborhood a coffee shop in this location was a need. Also, it feels a need for me too as more folks are working from home it is nice to have a meeting place to offer that doesnt require them to come downtown.
If there was one word to describe Park Island it would be thoughtful.  From the reusable or recyclable to go cups, to the sourcing of the coffee, to the creative and regularly refreshed coffee concoctions they have really been thoughtful. 
The customer service, chef's kiss. They always remind me to get my points. I've noticed true regulars have the orders remembered. Also, although during mornings it just one person working drinks and orders, lines are pretty decently taken care of.
If you are going to use this as a meeting space or work space do know that it can get full during obvious peak times. Also though the seating is sufficient it isnt the amount of say a Backatown or Coffee Science. I've always been able to get seating between 8am and 8:30am. But I have looked around at 9am and 9:30 and found just one indoor space left.
So, now that you have all my hot tips, go, get your life at Park Island Brew.
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text: Food is phenomenal but this review has to do with the inconsistency in opening hours and the advertised times of the business. I went to the restaurant at 6 pm on a Sunday night (the Google page and Instagram says they are open until 8) just for me to be turned away in my Uber saying that they were closed. I thought to myself l, okay fair they may have run out of food. I then attempt to go to the restaurant on Wednesday and just to be sure about the opening times, I check their Instagram. WHY DID THEY POST THAT THE RESTAURANT WAS CLOSED FOR THE DAY DEPITE HAVING IN THEIR BIO "Wednesday - Sunday 1-8 pm". I came all the way from Canada just for this food and I am highly disappointed in their lack of opening times and adherence to advertised hours. I've never had this issue before in coming to this restaurant but this experience really put a bad taste in my mouth. DEESXQUISITE PLEASE DO BETTER!!!
name: Deesxquisite

text: I've had several Omakase experiences at other establishments. Presentation and waiter service was good. However I felt like it was extremely overpriced for what was served. Some plates seemed overly seasoned/salty/sauced. For me, if I'm being served quality sushi/fish, I'd like to enjoy the taste of it.  I also would have liked a bit more interaction with the chef. I would try other Omakase experiences first.

text: It's amazing! Friendly staff, cozy environment, and the coffee is delish! I tried the King Cake Latte today, which turned out to be a perfect balance of sweet. My go to is White Choc Cinnamon. Next time I'll try the food.

categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text:
I try to wait for new spaces to work out the kinks before giving them a try, but I heard good things, so I took my chances.

My husband and I were lucky enough to snag a 2 top at around 6:00 without a reservation. Within about 15 minutes the restaurant was completely full. I'll definitely make a reservation next go round.

The menu is full of all things Italian, and everything coming out of the kitchen looked delicious and generous in size.  We knew we wanted pizza and did our best to stick to our plan. We ordered a margherita pizza, a veggie pizza, marinated mushrooms, white clams, a fleur de lis for myself (vodka, chambord, and pineapple juice), and the hubs had a glass of Chianti.

Here's the rundown:

Marinated mushrooms - sooooooo good, but lots of thin strips of salumi. More salumi than mushrooms.
White clams - They were very flavorful, but the menu says they're served with bruschetta. Not the case. They came atop pasta. Not what I was looking for. I love bruschetta so much and was disappointed.
Margherita pizza - very tasty - loved the thin crust and sauce
Veggie pizza - Tasty thanks to the crust and sauce, but wasn't expecting the veggies to be zucchini and yellow squash. Was thinking I'd see some sundried tomatoes, maybe Roma tomatoes, fire roasted bell peppers, mushrooms - really any of those. 
Fleur de lis - delicious!!
Chianti - really tasty

Our server was amazing. She was attentive, friendly and so professional. The entire staff seemed to be on top of their game.  

I'm looking forward to visiting again.
name: Elle-Jâs

text: I would have given them 5 stars but the customer service is horrible!!! Yes this place has great food but they seriously need to work on customer service. Today they had a $15 plate deal. They made paying customers stand outside in the cold and rain for 2hrs and 30 mins for seafood. Absolutely disgusting and very disrespectful of peoples time! They did not have a logical system at all. Literally stood in line for us a place an order. They didn't have any pre-made or put a limit on how many plates people could get. To add insult to injury, the staff and employees were giving out plates to their families and friends first. I literally watched cars pull up to side of the building and get multiple plates. It literally took up my entire day; left the house at 12:30pm and didn't get food until 330pm!

text:
This is the type of place where Nola locals (and those in the know) go to find some good seafood. I had a taste for chargrilled oysters...and my gf (who is a local) took me here.

Well...I wasn't disappointed. The wait wasn't long...the price is what you would expect to pay for them (in the 20s) and when my # was called to retrieve my bevy of deliciousness...my inner "phat kid" was all too happy to grab the bag.

Once at her house...I dug in...ummmmmmmmmmm....tender yet crispy, very flavorful...STORYTIME...years ago a friend introduced me to the chargrilled oyster, I was a person who sneered at the thought of eating something that looked so slimy and ugly...yes, I said it. ..."but try it chargrilled!"...once I did...I've never looked back...PhatKid was happy.

Anyhoo...if you find yourself in Nola and want to branch off from the .25? Check this place out...Imma try their crab/shrimp plates as they looked DELISHHHHOUS.......don't be skurd.
name: Deesxquisite

text:
right across from the fair grounds!

just a first try, but wanted to get this on the page to help flag attention to this new black-owned coffee shop. they have a whole range of coffee and tea options (you can get extra espresso in your cold brew!) and then also various bottled drinks (apple juice in the little apple shaped bottles). sipping some cold brew and munching on this banana bread that has a citrusy or ginger-y thing going on, lovely surprise.

they're still getting settled, but looks like they have a cold case that will get filled with yummy things, and the interior booth seating is cute. there are a couple of tables available for outdoor seating, and what's great is that they even come out and disinfect them between seatings (yay!)

looking forward to seeing them grow.
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text:
This has the be the worst Starbucks. I live right here and always mobile order, but lately the app ALWAYS says literally everything is out but when you go they don't know why because it's not out. I had to start mobile ordering the second I woke in the morning for it to be ready in time because even mobile ordering it's never ready at the time it's supposed to be ready. I used to mobile order about 5 minutes before I'd walk out and it's 10 minutes from my house, say I order at 6:45 it'll say ready for pick up at 6:55 I get there for 7 and it's still not ready and I end up waiting another 15+ minutes sometimes my order gets lost, I've had to cancel my order so many times because of almost being late for work EVEN THOUGH i ordered SO early and made sure I had enough time.
The first few times it's ok but it started happening EVERY TIME and I wake up so early for work that it's not usually busy when I go.

My drinks never consistent- I order the same thing ever time and a few times it was either not full to the top like it usually is or ALLLLLLLLL half and half no coffee what so ever. The lady even noticed it before I did once & offered to make me a new one bc she knows my order, I never see her anymore   I now go to the one on vets and it's been SUCH a change- the same drink that I've ordered for a year consistently tastes and looks SOOOOOOO much different at the vets store, it's perfect every time. It's ALWAYS there when I get there I walk in and walk straight out even if I ordered as I'm leaving my house. I've never had any issues with the app saying items were out when they weren't. Even when they were extremely busy once my drink was still ready when I got there- I don't know who manages the chateau Starbucks but it needs new management bad.
name: Starbucks

name: Thai D Jing

text: We visited Yo Nashi this past Sunday. We are all foodies that love, appreciate, and are willing to pay for good food and good atmosphere. We were super excited about not knowing what would be on the menu. The first course was a baked oyster, the second course was a butternut squash bisque with jumbo lump crab, and the third course was a tuna medley of sorts. These were all good, not the best food I've ever had, but nonetheless good food and very nicely presented. The following course was served as 5 pieces of sushi on a single plate. One was a very nice and creative Wagyu piece. The rest were mostly good, but a few days later, and I'm unable to recall what they were. The server, a very nice woman, asked if we liked any of the pieces. We said the Wagyu piece was very nice. So she brought an additional piece with no mention of an additional charge. Next up was an entree of Halibut, I believe. Again, not super memorable a few days later except for it was dry and over cooked, but we were hungry. So we ate it. We even swapped pieces to see if it was a singular piece that was over cooked... it was not. They were all over cooked. Next we were served a deconstructed apple pie. Nice, but again, not stellar and a bit underwhelming. Since the meal claimed to be 8-10 course, we started counting. The 5 pieces of sushi were considered 5 courses. We felt a bit duped and it felt like false advertising. For $89, we expected a course or two to be a bite or two, but not 5 to be a single piece of sushi. It felt really dishonest. Additionally when the check came out, the additional piece of Wagyu sushi was not in fact complimentary, but an additional $9 per piece. All in all it was very underwhelming and felt very dishonest.
name: Yo Nashi

text:
We love Alon Shaya's other restaurants, so we were so excited to try his new one. It's located in the new Four Seasons and the setting is absolutely gorgeous. You can't ask for a better looking and feeling ambiance. 

As far as the food goes, we started with the duck and andouille gumbo. This was by far best thing we ate all night. If you go, definitely get it. We then had the eggplant pirogue and summer squash green curry. While both were tasty, we looked back at the menu and wished we would have tried something else like the fried chicken. I guess that means we'll need to get back!

Everyone was super friendly as well. Service was a bit on the slow side, but I'm assuming that is only because it was brand new and kinks are still getting ironed out. 

Overall, it's a great spot if you're looking to dress up a little and have a ritzy dinner on the town.
name: Miss River Restaurant

text:
Very Impressed!!! This Japanese style cuisine utilizes local ingredients to cultivate one of the best experiences I've had in a while ! This restaurant only seats up to 20 people at a time, so I would recommend making a reservation or calling ahead a time! 
This experience includes 5-course meal (menu changes daily) from the chef of the night, Jackie was amazing!!! The food was phenomenal, although the portions are petite, I left feeling satisfied! They have a creative cocktail, wine, and sake list that pairs well with the food. The service was also one to remember, Thanks Amber!! Overall, I'm local and would recommend this experience to anyone.
name: Yo Nashi

text: This place was so bomb! This black owned establishment left nothin to be desired. The food was amazing and the vibe was just as good. It looks as though it's mainly takeout but we were seated on the outside and it was perfection. They had one of my favorite artists on repeat and they served up the tastiest crawfish and shrimp I've had since visiting New Orleans hands down! A far cry from the normal tourist faire, plus it felt like we were at a family reunion with all the good seafood eating family style down south! I highly recommend this restaurant, and will definitely be back when I visit again!
name: Deesxquisite

text: This place is spectacular! Great service, amazing food. I'm very impressed. Will definitely come again.
name: Yo Nashi

text: Shout out to this fabulous place! Was in NoLa for a long weekend and just a little tired of the usual fare and wanted something different. Found these guys buy the French Market and had not only had an awesome dinner but an awesome time! The manager who was waiting tables due to the waitresses' family emergency and the chef were just the nicest people! The food was delicious, had the lamb...tender, juicy, and perfectly seasoned. The hummus was outstanding and my friend loved her chicken shwarma! We even scored some free falafels! Had a great red wine too...the place has a very cool vibe and nicely decorated/designed. Thanks boys for a fun night, we'll be back!
name: Lebanon Grill

text: I'm so glad this spot is finally open. I've been eyeing it since August! It's in a GREAT location-- right across from the fairgrounds (you can watch them run the horses in the morning). I've been a couple times on my way to work and I've been the only one in there both times. The staff is extremely friendly and will help you decide what you want if needed. The coffee was also delicious! I've gotten a lavender latte and The Hustle which is a honey oat latte-- highly recommend either! I might make this my new spot on my way to work since it's most accessible for me. Also it's local and black-owned!
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text:
Starting my hump day off with @parkislandbrewcoffee was the BEST decision I made today....and likely will be . 

I need to give them just made props cause the amount of pure wizardry that goes into my coffee every time I go in here is purely well for lack of a better word magic. 

You need to understand how amazing this woman is. Like I know coffee makers are called Baristas but like this is something else. She's like a mixologist of coffee. I walk in she asks what I'm feeling today and BAM! THE MAGIC STARTS!! Just by giving her a keys words. Straight up love watching her work her love of what she does SHINES through so hard. 

Just trust me you need to go and now!
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text: Don't sleep on Dee's!   This food was so damn good!!!   For $16  we had food for 2 meals. Couldn't eat it all. Shrimp so big I thought they were prawns.  Friendly and clean. Staff super nice and helpful to 2 travelers.  One of the best meals I've had in New Orleans and on this cross-country trip.
name: Deesxquisite

text:
This place is outstanding.  My lady and I stopped in there for lunch on a Friday and sat at one of the sidewalk tables facing the French Market.  The owner was a super nice guy and very friendly.  Our server was great and helped us what was enough vs. too much.  You'll want to order way too much upon your first visit.

We shared the Maza platter, which included: hummus, baba ganoush, tabouleh, house salad, homemade labneh, falafel,  kibbeh, and  halloumi cheese.  The bread is homemade in their woodfired oven.  Everything was was fantastic.  The labneh and kibbeh were incredible.

One big standout here is their falafel.  It tasted like no other falafel we've had before.  It was crazy good.  After a long night of heavy food and boozin' it was really nice to have a healthy option, especially in the Quarter.  

Lebanon Grill has a nice selection of wines too. Overall, this will become a staple of our NOLA visits.  I highly recommend anyone to check them out.  100% worth the visit and we'll definitely be back.
name: Lebanon Grill

text:
My review for this coffee shop is long overdue. After moving to the city a few months ago, I was on the lookout for a local coffee shop. I stumbled upon Park Island Brew and haven't looked back since. 

First of all, the coffee is incredible. I've tried the vanilla latte, the Hu$$le, and the chai. I highly recommend getting the Hu$$le especially if you have a long work day ahead of you. It has the right amount of espresso, oat milk, and honey! If you try the chai or dirty chai, add rose! One of the baristas recommended that to me and my friend when we went in and it was a delicious addition to the coffee! 

Second, the service and ambience in this shop is always top tier. The team is always so sweet, giving recommendations, and playing amazing music. I love to see thriving, black-owned businesses with badass teams like this! 

Park Island Brew is consistently amazing, dog-friendly, and overall a great place to grab some coffee and treats.
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text:
Y'all. That king. Cake. Latte. Is. Amazing. 

I used to live in the area and even sat in on the community meeting when it was first proposed to turn the old barbershop into a coffee place and I was ALL in. There's not much in the way of coffee in the fairgrounds triangle and they did a great job of filling the void. 

The space inside is a lot bigger than I thought it'd be, knowing how much square footage they were working with. There are a few booths and I expect that when covid is over they might have some bar window seating, as well. They also have some outdoor tables on Gentilly and D'Abadie. 

Now, onto the coffee...
My husband enjoyed his latte but I was really impressed with my king cake latte. It tasted more like a pumpkin spice/vanilla latte to me, but I love those too and I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't sickeningly sweet. It was just enough sugar to feel like a treat but not enough to make my teeth feel like they were in sweaters. 

I can't wait for Jazz Fest to return and for more people to discover this place because they deserve it!
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text: Great food I had the chicken pad Thai and it did not disappoint.   Staff was very friendly. Portions are large,  I could only eat half, which was great I has the rest for dinner.  I highly recommend this place.
name: Thai D Jing

text: Meal was great. Environment was clean. Chefs were friendly and will answer any questions.
name: Yo Nashi

text:
Oh my kase! The omakase at Yo Nashi did not disappoint. The chef cooks the food right at the counter so all the delicious smells that are usually trapped in the kitchen are right in front of you. Have you ever seen the docuseries on Netflix, "Salt, Heat, Acid, Fat?" The food here was the epitome of this philosophy. Each dish had the perfect balance of flavors and really highlighted the quality of the ingredients. 

Since it's an omakase, what we got may not be what others get when they embark on this food journey, but it would be a disservice to not talk about the dishes they served us. One of our favorite courses was the nigiri course. We got four nigiri of beautiful fish complemented with equally delicious accouterment - like local foie gras! Another favorite of ours was a pompano with beurre blanc, roasted squash, and eggplant. If there was no one around I would have licked the last of that beurre blanc straight off of that plate. The dessert was perfect - tangy, creamy, and light. The perfect end cap to a wonderful meal!
name: Yo Nashi

text: The wait staff and what appeared to be managers looked agitated, or bothered by our presence. The waitress we got seemed to have an attitude as well. We had Eggplant Parmesan, Lasagna,  Creamy Crab Soup, Gumbo, Veal Picatta, and Redfish.The Red sauce they use is terrible. It's sickeningly sweet and has weird flavors going on that you wouldn't expect in a red sauce. The Eggplant tasted burnt which made matters worse. There were also hard chunks of meat that couldn't be chewed. The Pasta in our dishes was mushy. If you are looking for Italian cuisine, KEEP LOOKING! This definitely isn't Italian. We will not be returning to this restaurant.
name: Elle-Jâs

text: Let it be known I normally don't give 5starz, but by far this establishment deserves way more. Let me first give credit to the owner for catering to New Orleans during the pandemic while the majority of other restaurants shut down or had a limit menu. Also this establishment has been serving the first responders first hand by delivering food to the medical staff. A little help goes along ways, and it shows. Now let's get to the food! Me and my family have been going here since the first stages at a different location and I have to talk about the consistency they show throughout the food. Only the best ingredients starting with the signature famous sauce, top quality potatoes & corn to the D&D sausage and big big ol dungeons crabs. All New Orleans elite team please stop by and get a plate they will not let you down!
name: Deesxquisite

text:
I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with this new little gem in the Bywater area! They are a current partner with JAMNOLA and we discovered through their to-go program they offer one free beer with your meal when you show your to-go cup and ticket from that day.

I have to yell from the get go how badass it is that Bywater Brewpub has gender neutral stalls and bathrooms for both bathrooms. Probably the only place in New Orleans I've yet to see this at.

Anyways back to the beer, especially their own beers, because they were F-I-R-E! I loved their Slip-N-Fall and Better Daze Ahead. Order a few of them! They also sell other beers and a beer flight.

Food is fusion based as it's a blend of Cajun and Vietnamese cuisine and flavors. Your table is served chopsticks and utensils.

Started off with their Pickles & Pig plate and Cheesy Egg Rolls as apps for the table.

Pickles & Pig is pickled vegetables and crispy cracklin bites. It's actually fried char siu pork so it was a great nibble. Easily can be shared between 3-4 people.

The Cheesy Egg Rolls were delicious and perfect for any cheese lover. Think of these as airy mozzarella sticks. My only bit is that you'll need to order two of these as they only come in three's.

Opted for the Fried Chicken Sandwich and this is not any regular chicken sandwich! It was a unique breading method as the chicken is done karaage style. Light and fluffy. I really should've ordered a second one. Came with a side of phottuccini and it was a unique take on mac n cheese.
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: Crawfish Etoufee nachos are the best nachos I have ever had.  The Louisiana/Asian food is finger licking good.  The beer is excellent with many choices.  Margaritas were generous and strong.  The fried rice is to die for.  Come by now!  The beignet bites are the best way to end a meal.
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: My husband and I decided to try Elle-J's for our date night. The place was packed, but the wait was short. The food was absolutely amazing! We had the Char-Grilled Oysters, The Clam White, The Italian Sausage Spaghetti, and The Caprese Salad, with the Chocolate Cake for dessert! Oh-Em-Gee! Phenomenal! And our server, Our sweet little server didn't miss a beat. She was so friendly and genuine! This is the first of many visits to come.
name: Elle-Jâs

text:
So refreshing!!!! 

I absolutely HANDS UP THEN DOWN, LOVE it here. Only EXTRA thing that I need when coming here is a HAMMOCK. (Note to self: next online purchase is a traveling hammock...)

The location is ideal, owner is a doll, the staff are helpful + patient, the drinks, coffee, pastries are ALLLLLLL on-point!!!! 

I initially came here for a social media event + since that first visit, I've been here several times & make it my business to tell others. 

The pleasant disposition of the owner is EVERYTHING for me. She's always smiling, quick thinking & accommodating. Sometimes, I go in with an idea of WHAT I DON'T WANT, and she's able to give me a quick, think on your feet recommendation that SASSIFIES, yes I said sassifies, me. And upon my planned return, I tell myself to get that again, but I always get something different. 

The choices of food & beverage selections is REMARKABLE... who knew all this was available byway of a coffee house. I've come several times with my niece to get an COOKIES-N-CREAM shake... kudos to the owner & staff for the versatility; trust me it's appreciated!!!! 

The wait times are NEVER long!!! This is a major plus!!! Especially when you're ON THE GO... no time to wait it out. And to my pleasant surprise, you can order online, just scan the QR CODE & boda-boom-boda-bing; your order will be ready when you get there!!! 

Coffee, shakes, pastries + EXCELLENT CUSTOMER, find me here boo-boo!!!!

text:
This is the real deal. Right down to a hookah after dinner.  Middle Eastern bridal party music D J  videos playing a clap along beat.  If you like Lebanese Middle Eastern food, head down to Decatur St.
Jordanian Chef Mario is cooking up the goodness, with both a big smile and personality.  Waitress Rania is delightful even if soft spoken. She oersonally made us a Nutella crepe with oreo ice cream for desert, which now appears in my dreams.  The filet mignon shish kebab, the hummus, the pita bread, and gyro are some of my faves, but I'm still working my way through the menu.
name: Lebanon Grill

text:
If I could give this place less than 0 stars I would. I am all for supporting small businesses especially family owned, but this place is a disgrace. I called in for carry-out and from the very beginning I knew this wasn't going to be good just by the lady's attitude on the phone. She sounded like she didn't want to be there, didn't know the allergen information on the sauces, basically very rude tone from the very beginning. I told her my order, 9inch, traditional ny style, homemade pizza sauce ( i specifically asked if it had dairy in it because some do use dairy in it and she asked to make sure and said no) and some veggies. (keep this in mind for later) Me, being that I wanted to give this place a chance, I let it go and drove 15 minutes later to pick up the pizza. 
I get there and I wasn't greeted at all even though she was standing right in front of me and even looked at me and just asked "you're here to pick up?" I said yes and she went to go grab my order. I opened the box and long & behold there is cheese on the pizza. I told her I never said I wanted cheese on my pizza and she had the audacity to correct me and say that she took my order correctly on her piece of paper. I told her why would I ask for cheese pizza if i previously stated that I was lactose intolerant and even asked for clarification on the pizza sauce allergens. There was no pizza sauce at all on my pizza, just veggies and cheese. So I had to wait ALL over again for my order to be remade. 15 minutes later, I open my pizza box and there is still no pizza sauce on my pizza, instead there's BASIL PESTO. How they interpreted homemade pizza sauce to basil pesto, is just mind boggling. All three of the workers were just staring at me as if I was speaking another language, as if they did NOTHING WRONG. Not only did they not follow directions, but I really don't understand how you can work in the service industry, taking people's orders incorrectly, not once but TWICE. And to top it all off, their rudeness just put me off completely. Safe to say I will not be returning and will tell everyone I know not to visit this place. Spend your money elsewhere. The pizza was bland, nothing special about it at all. You get better service at Pizza Hut.
name: Ditali's Pizza Cafe

text: DON'T SLEEP ON THIS SPOT! We got to the restaurant 10 minutes before closing. Hours on their site is different so you may want to call just to be sure. Although they were in the process of closing the kitchen, the staff was super friendly and accommodated our order. Let me just say the food deserves more stars than Yelp allows. Everything was so flavorful and had that spicy kick New Orleans is known for.  We got the 40 Orty which could easily feed 4 people. Just as important as the food was the stellar service. Thanks for making our first New Orleans meal this weekend one to remember!
name: Deesxquisite

text: This is such a great highlight in New Orleans!!! When you walk in, it's a great ambiance that doesn't feel stuffy. I've never had food like this in the area, and it's such a treat. The staff practices safe guidelines, with empty seating between parties. The cocktails are also delicious, and I was so impressed by the main chef & pastry chef. They're so accommodating. Coming from eating out in New York, this place is one to beat. 10/10
name: Yo Nashi

text: Delicious chefs tasting menu with locally sourced gulf fish! From start to finish the best meal anyone in our group has ever had! Highest recommendation!!!
name: Yo Nashi

text:
Guys, I am really REALLY disappointed with how absolutely terrible the service and food quality was here today. It was so bad that honestly I am never coming back and I have no doubt in my mind that this place is going to go under in near future if things continue on their current path. 

We came in as soon as they opened, so 10:30 am.  No one welcomed us, we were just met with blank stares. Whatever, we ordered two large sandwiches, one Steak and Cheese and the other was Brisket and Cheddar. It took them over 20 minutes to prepare two sandwiches. There was only one person who had ordered ahead of us, so I have no clue why it took that long to make two subs. There were at least six employees there, so staffing was not the issue. We eventually get our sandwiches, and they were terrible. They did not toast the bread, our sandwiches were made incorrectly and the quality of the meat was poor. To make a bad situation worse, both my husband and I experienced stomach pains within an hour after leaving. This was literally our first meal of the day, so there is no question as to what could have caused our discomfort. I'm just happy our toddler did not eat anything while we were here, so at least he was spared feeling ill. 

Believe me when I say that you're better off going to Subway or any place that serves sandwiches for that matter. I would avoid this place like the plague, unless you enjoy bad food prepared by poorly trained employees. Eat here at your own risk!
name: Firehouse Subs

text:
I've been eating Thai D'Jing's veggie pad thai since its food truck days on the downtown LSU campus in New Orleans. Mr. Jeerasak is so kind -- he once graciously obliged to serve me pad thai at 10am from his food truck, a whole hour before they officially opened for business! --  and I was so excited to learn that he and his wife, Mrs. Suda were opening a brick-and-mortar, living example of "mom and pop" restaurant!

We dined in the casually romantic pink restaurant on a Friday night without making a reservation because we typically eat pretty early. I'd recommend making one though if you're going to dine at 6pm or later. Because we were early, we got to catch some of their happy hour specials. From the HH menu, we ordered the chicken sticks, veggie egg rolls, and shrimp and cheese rolls as part of the 3 mini apps for $10; the creamy Tom Yum soup for $5, and the roti with red curry sauce also for $5. Everything was delicious but oh my goodness, you have got to get the roti with the red curry sauce! The sauce is to dieeee for! 

For our actual meals, we got the egg fried rice and veggie pad thai with no tofu cooked at a medium spice level. Whew, that medium spicy is something good, yall! It was a tad spicy even for my Indian palette so I'd recommend going for mild and asking for sriracha on the side in case you don't wanna wrestle with your GERD later on in the night. All of this was washed down with some Singha beer, served with a frosted glass, of course! 

On a previous occasion, I picked up two veggie pad thais to go and they were packaged really well. I do think that pad thai tends to congeal a tad so I'd recommend either dining in or eating it ASAP.

Service was excellent! COVID precautions in place. Please check out Thai D'Jing for your next thai food craving! Their menu is available online. And for my fellow, LSU folks -- there are plans to bring the truck back at some point!
name: Thai D Jing

text: Miss River was a miss. This highly anticipated restaurant in the new Four Seasons hotel at the foot of Canal Street has everything going for it - pleasant dÃ©cor, well-regarded chef Alon Shaya, a decent menu concept - but it completely underwhelmed. On our first visit we gently complained to the server how their Open Table listing never showed reservation availability other than 2:30 and that they did not respond to multiple emails asking for a dinner reservation on our anniversary (the manager later explained that they leave most tables available for hotel guests). The menu was limited, perhaps because they had recently opened and we were still in pandemic so I ordered a fish dish - usually a safe bet in this seafood mecca. Nope! It was actually bad! At first it tasted simply over-salted but after a second bite I concluded it was a bad piece of fish. When the server saw I had barely touched it she offered to exchange it for something else, which I accepted. To their credit, the manager later stopped by and said he wanted to comp our entire meal - an excellent service recovery. Feeling guilty about their generosity we returned a month later to give them another try, and again we were underwhelmed. Even though service had just started, staff were romping all around the dining room moving things, putting things away and generally being a distraction. Weird pop music was playing, not in sync with the classy vibe of the place. Though friendly and polite, the servers lacked the polish you'd expect in a high-end place like this. And the food was nothing special and cost easily twice what you'd pay elsewhere in town. We texted our impressions to the manager (who had previously given us his contact info), he thanked us for our feedback and said he'd discuss these issues with his staff. Sorry in this town, TWO strikes and you're out. I hate to see a restaurant fail, so hopefully this one will get enough traffic from out-of-towners (the aforementioned hotel guests) to stay afloat.
name: Miss River Restaurant

text:
I never realized how there wasn't a coffee shop in this area until I visited Park Island Brew. It's honestly perfect because it's right across from the racetracks and it's a great addition to the Fairgrounds neighborhood.

Park Island Brew is a direct trade coffee shop which means they ensure the farmers are paid more than fair. This was so enlightening to me as I always thought fair trade was good and I was shocked at the loopholes fair trade can enable.. It was a great education moment and one I plan to be mindful about.

With ample amount of parking in the neighborhood it's a great spot to enjoy a coffee and a baked good There's a few tables inside and outside; however, keep in mind every other table is closed due to COVID-19 safety practices.

With a gender neutral bathroom and free wifi, you just have to add Park Island to your rotation.

Their blends are made in-house and their cold brew was damn good. What really stood out to me was their use of reusable to-go cups for iced drinks and recyclable to-go cups for hot beverages. Such a great touch!

#BlackOwned #WomanOwned #OpenToAll
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text:
Our dining experience could be summarized by the following two-word phrases:

Impeccable service. (Hats off to Sara -- she was phenomenal!)
Espresso martinis. 

These folks could serve me char on a platter and I would eat it happily! You feel like royalty from the moment the doors to the Four Seasons are opened for you. Table service is coordinated like the symphony orchestra. 

The espresso martinis were a special of the night but I intend to ask for these   on my next visit regardless. Kent, behind the bar, made an excellent Sazarac and La Louisiana (he described this as a notch up from the Sazarac) from my +1 while we waited for our table. 

Additionally, the decor is stunning all over -- from the bathroom to the bar to the tables. Unfortunately, there is not much of an outdoor view to appreciate but I had my sweetheart across from me so that's all I needed. 

Now, on to the food. We had the mini seafood tower (a good amount of food for two people), the gumbo which is served with white rice (cooked in bacon stock) and potato salad (get your Louisiana on whatever way you like it!), oyster stew, butter pecan pie with ice cream, and of course, delicious bread!

We found our bill was quite reasonable for the exceptional experience we had. Find a reason to get dressed up, make a reservation by calling because the host can accommodate requests earlier than Open Table (in my experience), and head downtown for an incredible night. 

I foresee Miss River becoming a Nola classic!
name: Miss River Restaurant

text:
I've been wanting to try Yo Nashi ever since hearing about this new omakase restaurant opening in New Orleans, which is a rare find here in the south. I wanted to go on the weekend of my birthday, except Baton Rouge experienced a freeze in the beginning of the week which wasn't pleasant and threw off all of my plans.

Well I finally got to try Yo Nashi last night and I'm honestly disappointed. I've read the reviews about how the owner says it's a "New Orleans omakase, not a Japanese style omakase", but I wasn't expecting so much cooked food. The flavors were a bit lackluster with the exception of two or three courses. Two of my biggest complaints is that we were served red snapper twice as I have never been served the same fish twice during an omakase dinner (red snapper plain, then red snapper with caviar...), and that the final course was bland and tasteless. I managed to get photos of everything except for the ora king salmon nigiri because I was just too hungry.

The verdict is that I wouldn't come back. I had very high hopes for Yo Nashi, but This isn't my first rodeo, and I've never left hungry after omakase like I did here, especially for a similar price point. I've always been at least satisfied or actually very full. Unfortunately, we ended up going to another spot after to fill our bellies and satisfy our cravings.
name: Yo Nashi

text:
This place is super cute and cozy, and across from the race track to boot! I got to try the ginger lime rooibos tea for a Yelp Elite Perk, and I bought a mulled apple cider to take to my boyfriend.

The ginger lime tea (I found out later that rooibos is a type of red tea) was so fragrant and packs a punch of flavor. I loved it and highly recommend it!

However, I have to take one star away for the mulled apple cider. It was sufficiently spiced, but the apple cider itself was super diluted, like apple juice mixed with water. Calling it cider is an offense to New Englanders like me.

I had to take another star away for their employees being careless with masks. Some of the batistas had their noses exposed while working or pulled down their masks to yell out customer names for orders right over the beverages. With the variant strains being more contagious than the initial strain, we should be more careful than ever. I took the drinks home and microwaved them to be safe.
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text:
Worth crossing rivers and bridges for!

Travel along gritty 5th street in Gretna and there's not much to see. Until you get to the bright pink cottage, where you absolutely MUST hang a right into the tidy parking lot. Here, at the newly opened Thai DJing restaurant, Jeerasak Boonlert and his wife, chef Suda Ounin are making savory magic against the backdrop of their hard-won American dream. The Thai-born husband and wife team create sheer magic - on a recent dinner enjoyed under the stars (inside and outside dining is available) we enjoyed flash fried calamari with a spicy dip of chili and fish sauce, soy-powered basil stir fried shrimp and a divine ginger salmon, perfectly cooked (medium rare) with a broth bright mirin and soy sauce.  Can't wait to go back.
name: Thai D Jing

text:
I can not say enough good things about Yo Nashi. Not your typical sushi place, Yo Nashi serves omakase style which simply means the menu changes weekly depending on what's in season and what quality ingredients are sourced. Besides the Tuna w/ seared foie gras ( photo #9), you will have a different selection of 9-10 courses weekly. 

Yo Nashi is one of a kind in New Orleans where Chef Mack takes your taste buds to a place you didn't think sushi could. While you sit watching, he prepares every dish himself with the help of some of the most impressive sous chefs in the city, taking the time to explain the nuances of each dish. It's the attention to detail that separates Chef Mack and Yo Nashi from all other sushi bars in New Orleans.
name: Yo Nashi

text: This place is very delicious! I love supporting black owned business, he has really stuck his neck out for the city and the community. Please buy your seafood here! Great combos and prices & actually worth it.
name: Deesxquisite

text: Everything about our experience at Park Island Brew was great! The barista made personalized drinks for my husband and I based off our personal preferences and the drinks were amazing! We got a Lavender Chai Latte and a Dirty Chai Latte. We live in Texas but Park Island Brew will definitely be on our itinerary every time we come to town!
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text: I wanted to eat here but once I got there I was looked at like I didn't belong. The way the lady spoke to me was unethical. Her first words were can I help you? What are you doing here? Then she told me the menu was too expensive for me so I left. Please be mindful how you speak to people because all you are is an employee.
name: Yo Nashi

text:
Dinner was wonderful! Our server, Nora, was nice, attentive and spot-on with her recommendations. I asked her what her favorite dishes were, and she of course, said that everything is great, but she particularly liked "The Phoritto" and the "Cajun Fried Rice". Both descriptions sounded good, so we got them both and shared. Both were so different and so tasty. They were both so good that I can't even tell you which one I liked better. The Phoritto had a "pho broth gravy" for dipping that had a spicy zip to it. The Cajun Fried Rice was a great combination of so many different flavors; I liked every single part of it, but I think the sausage might've been my favorite part.

We didn't really need any more food, but the Beer Beignet Bites sounded so awesome that we decided to go for it. The chef brought them out to us herself, and they were so hot and fresh and delicious! They're served with a chicory coffee dip, and OMG was that ever good! And they really are teeny little beignets, with each one being bite-sized, so it was just the right amount of indulgence.

The owner was making the rounds to all of the tables to see if we were enjoying everything. It's always nice to know that someone truly cares about your experience. In fact, it was apparent that every employee was very invested in making it a great experience for the customers. They really take pride in what they're doing, and they have every right to be proud! 

They're working on brewing their own beer too -- coming soon!
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: Forgot half the order, but I didn't remind my wife to double check. Seemed like a pretty sloppy execution overall. Would still order again but expectations have been lowered.
name: Firehouse Subs

text: Believe the 5-star reviews. This place is fantastic! I have no idea what used to be here, but the space is so welcoming and charming, very open with plenty of outdoor seating also. Super cool local art all over the walls. We came for the crawfish, which did not disappoint! Just the right level of spice, and the edamame was a unique twist. I also tried the grilled veggie spring rolls which were a delicious healthy option and a generous portion. We did a beer flight and enjoyed all 4 of them. So many menu items sound tempting, I can't wait to come back and try more!

text: Great stop on our bike tour through town.  We were pleasantly surprised with the tasty brews.  We are IPA folks and enjoyed the Hoppy Daze so much we stayed for a while on a lovely Friday afternoon.  Since we were too full from brunch, we only had a snack, spring rolls with shrimp.  A flavorful light app.  We wished we could have sampled more food but maybe on our next trip.  A cozy neighborhood place with fab food, nice brews & great people.

text:
*covid review 
We stopped in tonight for dinner and we really were blown away. Super chill vibe, great aesthetics, good atmosphere, AMAZING food & great service!! We had a couple of drinks that were all fairly priced, the crawfish etouffee nachos were to die for and the ramen was really really good. Service was great, she was so attentive and gave great recommendations & we loved talking with her! The chef and the owner stopped by our table which was nice. This place is new, so I hope their business continues to look up, because this is a 5 star stop for sure!!!

text: I absolutely loved their seafood plates. Apparently, they chargrill their crab legs or something special like that. They sell a variety of crab types, and you're able to buy a plate with one crab type and add a different type of crab legs. I got a Dungeness crab leg plate, and I added snow crab legs to my plate. It ended up being way too much food. The plates come with shrimp, corn, sausage, and potatoes. My favorite part may have been the corn. It's covered in the same butter they cover their crab legs in. I really enjoyed it. This spot is much more affordable than some of the other places around town. They do run specials during the week too.
name: Deesxquisite

text: We just moved to the Lakeview neighborhood and our first night here we decided to stop at Elle-J's. Yelp called it "Hot and New" and it's also a combination of our names, so we had to try it out. It's conveniently located on Harrison street and has a supper club feel when you walk in. The menu is mostly Italian food with some good fish and meat options. They were having a $2 beer special on some random bottles so I got a hoegaarden. We shared a caesar salad which was overdressed and nothing special. By this time, we had 3 waiters approach us and ask if we were ready to order. We were sitting at the high tops, which was open seating, so seems like the wait staff is less organized on the bar side. I asked the waiter for a recommendation and she suggested the eggplant parmesan so I got that. My fiance got the black drum. My eggplant parmesan had too much breading and the marinara sauce they make is very sweet - too much for my taste. My fiance's black drum was tasty but the side portions were pretty small. At this point, the crowd that was starting to walk in was older. We don't know the neighborhood super well yet, but we could tell this wouldn't be our place in the future.
name: Elle-Jâs

text:
I recently went to Elle-J's for the first time. I did not know what to expect, but had heard good things. When we arrived, we walked into the front door and had the option to sit in the bar area. We chose to sit in the restaurant and were seated in a booth. The restaurant was casual, but nice and had a great atmosphere! 

For drinks, I ordered a Lakeview Sunset. It was a pretty good drink. The spinach dip and chicken Parmesan were both delicious. I would definitely order both again! The menu was full of Italian options and I would love to go back to try other options. 

I will definitely be going back to Elle-J's in the future!

Today i enjoyed park island brew's seasonal king cake latte. Loved that they carry different milk alternatives! It was topped off with festive sprinkles of mardi gras. Tasted like a slice of king cake without the extra calories! Ample seating, would be a great place to have a date or study. They had water by the door with fruit in the dispenser, which is a nice touch. I will be back to try their "hussler" latte and grab some of their delicious baked goods( croissants, banana bread, king cake, muffins) shortly. 
-
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text:
Ordered 2 pizzas and a chicken tender basket from here through uberEats so I never actually set foot inside the restaurant. 

Chicken Tender Basket- came with 3 "chicken tenders" on top of a bed of fries. I hate to be harsh but I've had bar food that tastes better than this. The chicken tenders were edible (not good, but edible) however the fries reminded me of the kind you buy in the freezer section.

Ragin Cajun- Nice crispy crust, not huge on flavor. Came with crawfish, red peppers, and some other things I can't remember. It was an ok pizza.

Fiery Hawaiian- Also had a nice crispy crust. Pineapple, hame, jalapenos, and regular/canadian bacon. I'm actually confused because the website states that it's a homemade sauce on this pizza but the sauce on the pizza we got was a touch sour and really spicy (I'd liken it to hotsauce). It was so spicy it was inedible for my family. This is just not a well balanced pizza. I ended up eating basically the whole thing by myself LOL .

There are other pizza places that are way better like Olive Branch or Specialty Italian Bistro for example.
name: Ditali's Pizza Cafe

text: HUGE portions of really delicious food! Hummus was amazing and the pita that they served with it was thick and hot. The chicken shawarma plate came with so much chicken that was crispy and perfectly seasoned. I would probably get the sandwich next time because it was an insane amount of food. You can definitely share here! Inside aesthetic is a little chaotic lol but it's cool you can sit outside and they keep the large door windows facing the French Quarter open for people watching. Only complaint was that the music was sooo loud. Other than that, great dinner!
name: Lebanon Grill

text:
So my first visit here left me with mixed feelings. On the one hand, my sandwich was delicious. On the other, the chick at the register was kinda rude. Not so much in what she said, but in her attitude. Very brusk, no thank you, no smiles. I mean, I take my sandwiches seriously, but this was dedication to a bad mood gone awry.

Still, the Steak and Cheese sandwich was delicious and prepared perfectly; heavy with meat and fresh veggies, with a fresh and crispy roll. I haven't had one of these in quite some time and I will be back for this one! It reminds me of the steak sandwiches I used to be able to get on the Westbank many, many moons ago. So, could there be some sense of nostalgia when I'm biting into this fluffy pillow of yum? Of course! Doesn't the best food do that to you? For you?

So while the customer service was a little off, it was still fast and delicious and super filling. I'll totally be back!
name: Firehouse Subs

text: Visited on May 30, 2021, and every beer in the flight was absolutely spot on. The Vietnamese boiled crawfish were sublime. Best crawfish I've ever had. Great staff too. Well, we'll done - a tour de force.
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: Wow!! We were blown away by the 9 courses offered and stunning cocktails galore. We went to celebrate the remembrance of my Japanese mother and I could not wait to taste their food based off their reviews. They did not disappoint nor did the cocktails served icy cold, my fave. You will leave full and wonder when you can come back. It is spendy so it is a treat but treat yo self!! Life is short.
name: Yo Nashi

text:
This is what they mean by food porn y'all. I seriously felt like having a glass of whiskey with a cigarette after the meal because it was that good. I don't even smoke cigarettes but I'd happily light one just to have a Pulp Fiction moment to show my gratitude to the chef. By far one of the best meals I've had in New Orleans.

You are coming here for an experience that will blow your damn mind away and over stimulate your taste buds. Yo Nashi is an omakase restaurant, so think of it as multiple tastings with set courses decided by the chef and their team. 

I highly recommend grabbing a reservation ahead of time because this is a very intimate experience. You're sitting right across from the chef and their team as all the chairs are against the "sushi bar" for a total of maybe 15 seats at most. The dark tones of the restaurant create a cozy atmosphere perfect to catch up with friends you haven't seen in a moment or a special meal for whatever the reason may be.

Freaking A, the smells coming from the kitchen y'all. Seeing their team in action and how strategic they were with plating was surreal. Every dish presented to us was divine. I really loved the spacing and teaming of each bite as you were able to enjoy genuine conversations with your "table".

What I'm still dreaming about to this day (no seriously, I probably have a daily thought about this meal) were the cuts of tuna, fish, and bluefin. The chef informed us they had actually caught it fresh and it seriously tasted like we were on the gulf coast ourselves. Ever piece of sushi or sashimi was SO F*@#ING GOOD. It seriously melted in your mouth and I'm not even exaggerating about that.

***One thing you'll really walk away from your dining experience is how the chef breaks down each tasting and conveys the cooking process and ingredients in a way that even the most novice of eaters can understand. This isn't a pretentious restaurant or undermines those who might not be fully versed. It was such a refreshing personality of a restaurant of this caliber to have!

So a few dishes I actually remembered to write down were (don't forget it's omakase style so don't expect all of these to be featured when you dine in, most likely will rotate or differ due to chefs inspiration/taste when you go in):

-Heirloom Tomato Gazpacho: Super light and refreshing. Adorable presentation!
-Red Snapper Sashimi: HELL YES. I can't explain it any other way lol. It had pickled beets and radishes which complimented it perfectly.
-Spiced Crusted Bluefin Tuna: literally a euphoric moment in your mouth. Melted in your mouth.
-Lemon Fish: had toasted avocado and sesame seeds. I'm not even a fan of avocado and I enjoyed this.
-Wagyu: This was an extra $$ add-on but for the love of foodies, DO IT IF IT IS AVAILABLE. It had chanterelle mushrooms and corned cream sauce. I seriously shed a happy tear because I was blown away by it. I took my time with this dish because I wanted to savor every moment with it.

We probably had at least 12+ tastings and it was nicely wrapped up with a dessert. I should've licked the dessert plate clean tbh. It was light and had blueberries and a lemon based shortcake.

I'm coming back. I have to come back. Someone please take me back to Yo Nashi.
name: Yo Nashi

text:
They are here and hopefully to stay. It is my first time here. I am so impressed with the variety of beers they brew. They haven't sold out to the IPA nightmare that so
Many other companies have they have one IPA on this visit , I hope  they don't go past more than  2 IPA's at one time. I had the urban south a delightful sour with cucumber and lime very summery beer. The queen of the south was a nutty red ale I enjoyed that also, the 3 in my flight was the blackberry Hefeweizen which had a even measured bitter sweet with a berry finish. The food was a star for me this time the flight and bite had a great little bites with each beer and just enough to snack and I still could eat my most flavorful bite of 2021 for sure, maybe if all time, let me introduce you to "PHoritto"- pho soup flavors in a burrito with the noodles, hoisin, Thai basil and the pho gravy for dipping, I just poured it on the container was a little small to dip. The flavors were wonderfully matched that if a deconstructed bowl of Pho. Thanks to the Chef. Great service,location and nice staff. I also like the feeling of the place and decorations. I will be back to try the IPA and any other creations they come up with. It says brew pub but they have a cocktail menu, wine and sake as well.
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text:
This was a delightful surprise after walking through the French Quarter in search of food. It was very different than the cuisine we had become accustomed to throughout our visit to New Orleans, and although unanticipated, it was a welcome detour off the beaten path of food. 

I ordered a chicken skewer sandwich, fries and a salad. I had a hefty appetite, but it was still no match for the amount of food delivered to the table. Everything was incredibly flavorful, I just couldn't eat it all. I felt badly not eating more-I hate to waste food.
name: Lebanon Grill

text:
Anyone who follows me on this knows that I only bother with truly superior experiences or very poor ones.  

This was definitely the former.  Awesome amazing dining experience. Wonderful food in a chic CBD setting. 

This will be a standard for years to come!

Expensive but worth every penny. A true Luxury dining experience. 

If you want cheap, eat awful food in the quarter.  This is high gastronomy at its best.
name: Yo Nashi

text:
Went here for an early Mother's day dinner to beat the Mother's day rush, and plus, to try this place out! Figured this would be a good place choose aside from your bigger chained Italian restaurants. The restaurant is very spacious with plenty of tables around along with a stocked bar area. I called ahead to reserve a table to make sure we won't have to wait because you know, it's Mother's day weekend. We were greeted and seated right when we walked in which the host were on their job. Our server was very polite and attentive to our needs throughout our time there making sure we had refills and/or other condiments.

For starters, we ordered the fried calamari which was fried perfectly with a good crunch and did not taste oily which was acquainted with a marinara type sauce. We also ordered salads which were also both great and prepared very nicely on a plate. However, I did not get a picture of it because the mommies were ready to dig in! For our entree's the pappardelle bolognese, meatballs and spaghetti and the pizzas all came out nicely with large portions and great flavor. If I had to put a con with the food, it would be the pizza's being a bit flimsy and soft, but had a good crust. Although, my kids still enjoyed it.

Overall, we had a great experience here at Elle-J's which we all left pretty stuffed and didn't even make it to the desserts. I'll definitely stop by to dine in again to venture into the other dishes they have!
name: Elle-Jâs

text: We heard great things about this newly opened Thai restaurant from a friend and decided to see for ourselves. Food was delicious and service was attentive. We will definitely be back!
name: Thai D Jing

text: Had the opportunity to finally try Elle J's.  We started with the shrimp signirelli. .. broiled and topped with a combo of bread crumbs, artichoke hearts, and parmesan cheese.   While not a terrible  dish it is nothing we would get again. The shrimp quality definatley left something to be desired.. We followed that with the torta de spianci pizza.  A pie topped with creamed spinach,  mushrooms,  grilled onion and fried artichoke hearts. This I thought was just delicious. A rich,  creamy, cheesy pizza goodness . We also tried the pork chop leone.  A pounded and panned pork chop topped with lemon butter and crab.   While we removed the crab the chop was perfectly tender and delicious. We thought the crab was substandard. On to dessert of white chocolate bread pudding. This to us was like a cloud soft..airy...creamy...rich...delicious.   we ordered an extra to take home.   Some hits, some misses but overall enjoyable.  Ps. They made a nice aoerol spritz as well.
name: Elle-Jâs

text:
Long awaited brew pub was worth the wait!!  They don't have their own brews on tap yet, but soon.  They're featuring beers from local breweries (at least 10 right now, so plenty to choose from) and a fantastic kitchen of Cajun/Vietnamese fusion food.  We loved the menu so much, we totally over ordered:

Yaka mein: Enough for two and they'll split the bowl for you at no charge.  Not too salty, lots of beef and yummy noodles.  "Old sober" fills you up and warms your tummy.
Pickles & pigs: Hands down the best cracklins I've ever had, ever.
The Phoritto: Had to take it home because we ordered too much food and were stuffed.  Warmed up well.  Fresh tortilla and all the ingredients from a beef pho. Came with a roux-style pho dippin' sauce - heaven! 
Spring rolls: Fresh delicious huge rolls of happiness. The secret ingredient (apple) makes these stand out. 

In addition to the fantastic food, the service was impeccable.  The ambiance has a "we've been here forever and we care about our restaurant" feel, even though they've just opened.  Big roll up doors to add some fresh air, lots of seating, unisex bathrooms, and some TVs if you want to catch the game.  Looks like they have tours of the brewery space too.
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text:
What a great place and overall experience! 
Good for groups and able to accommodate group reservations in a variation of set ups (despite being a fairly small space, they really utilize it very well without people feeling too close to each other).

The menu has pictures of all the offerings. I consider that brilliant and a big attraction. And while without those appreciated pictures, make sure you wait to hear the specials for the day before making a decision! Chances are, they will be something really tasty and appealing. 
Another standout quality is the staff. Everyone treated the restaurant and each of the customers as they were personally invested in success of the business and the experience of the guests. That's a pretty impressive quality. Our glasses were never empty, no questions were unanswered and we were engaged with at all the right times. Friendly, but efficient. 

Suggestions: 
We had each of the appetizers, and they were all fantastic (even the tofu and in not usually into that). Everything was cooked great, but the sauces are what really turned things up from good to great. Salad Roll is good and Papaya Salad was great (but don't get overly brave when it comes to temptation of getting Thai Spicy vs. medium...it catches up with you by the end). Most main dishes come with protein and spice level options, but the team will be  happy to guide you through any decision making and seemed very accommodating to dietary restrictions of multiple variations.
A thing to know, is that parking is in the back of the building. Back entrance also features the handicap ramp and while accessible, most of the lot is gravel with those embedded pattern shapes, so may not be the easiest to navigate in a wheelchair or with a stroller, so plan accordingly or make sure you park closer to the cement slab. 

Overall, great experience! Only regrets, not having had saved space for dessert. There will need to be a follow up visit in order to remedy that.
name: Thai D Jing

text:
Give me Firehouse over Subway any day. It's bittersweet because Firehouse reminds me of Quiznos in its prime; although, I think Quiznos was superior in quality to both of these delis. Tsk, tsk. 

I love Firehouse's steak and cheese sub. It is my go-to sammich. It amazes me how they put the right amount of mayo every time and I love me some mayo. Now, on this most recent outing, my sandwich was lukewarm and I don't understand why. I picked up my free medium sandwich, by the way, thanks to T-mobile Tuesdays, drove to the nearby mall and parked. That took all of...two minutes? My sandwich had the temperature of a sandwich that had been sitting for 10 minutes. Temp aside, the bread was pillowy soft, the steak was well seasoned and the peppers were on point. The medium is pretty filling too.

Service was great and fast. Of course, there weren't many customers because of Covid, I imagine. But it was another opportunity to support a small business.
name: Firehouse Subs

text:
Stopped in for a few brews during our last New Orleans visit and Pearl took great care of us, chatting it up with us and making sure our glasses never had a dry bottom :)  The local draft selections were very well represented and well varied for our wandering tastes.
The happy hour food we had (crawfish etouffee nachos) were absolutely delicious.  I was skeptical that it would work but the wonton nachos were the perfect compliment to the etouffee topping. So good!!! We also split the burger and you can tell they make their own bread. We think the bun was the star of the burger (but the burger was excellent too). Nicely done guys and we will be back next time in town to see Pearl!
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: New favorite coffee shop!! I typically order almond milk and these are the best almond milk lattes/teas I've ever had. It's a nice atmosphere, the tables they have are pretty well distanced and their drinks are so good I don't mind driving to get my things to go from them! Baristas are always friendly and obviously awesome at their jobs. Love this place!
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text: The restaurant should not be missed. Not only was the food flavorful, but there was a lot of it. We had the snow crab in a flavorful butter garlic sauce with potatoes, corn and sausage. The service and friendliness of the staff went way beyond any I have ever experienced. I just wish I could give more than 5 stars.
name: Deesxquisite

text: Absolutely blown away by the staff, food quality, and overall experience. Found on a total fluke as my pregnant wife and I were waiting for some friends. Grabbed an order of fries, and humus to go expecting the usual gyro shop boring fries, but not even close.... totally blown away by just fries and hummus so much so that we ended up there the next day for lunch... it turned into like a 2 hour lunch. The shawarma wrap - crazy good. The pizza... never would guessed - bomb. Literally point at something on the menu, and it's lights out. Needless to say if you need a break from the usual New Orleans grub, and want some of the best Lebanese style food... check it out. Save your dollars on the so-so French market food, and check out this place!
name: Lebanon Grill

text:
Our first visit to Firehouse Subs was a fantastic one!

We didn't have time to dine in, since we had a sleeping baby and cold food in the truck- so this review is based on our take out experience. 

Matt ran in and ordered a large Firehouse Steak and Cheese for us to share, although they had lots of tasty options on the menu (I'm talking about you, Firehouse Beef & Cheddar Brisket). While he was inside, I noticed that if you check-in on Yelp you can get a free cookie! I called Matt in a hurry and to fill him in on the Yelp swag and he managed to check-in and snag one before they finished making our sandwich. I'm so glad he did because their cookies are absolutely delicious! Not too hard, not too soft and filled with lots of chocolate chunks- what's not to love? We devoured our cookie on the ride home, and couldn't wait to dig into our sandwich. Well let me tell you, the Steak and Cheese did not disappoint. The bread was perfectly toasted, and the steak was thin and well seasoned. It also had an excellent ratio of steak to bell pepper. It held up extremely well on our 10 minute drive home, so I can only imagine it would be even better if we had the chance to dine in. 

Matt reported that the service he received was very friendly and that all of the employees greeted him when he arrived. One of my favorite reasons for giving this chain our business is that a portion of their proceeds goes towards first responders! This is  such a wonderful cause, and one that is close to my heart as my grandfather was a firefighter. These individuals put their lives on the line everyday to help other families in need, so I love contributing to organizations that give back to those who serve our communities. 

I encourage you to give Firehouse Subs your business if you're in the area. There is also a special they are currently running- $4.99 for a medium sub! So there is no better time than the present to try them out!
name: Firehouse Subs

text: I was surprised to find a place like this in the midst of the French Quarter, and while I was gung-ho to try all the local NOLA cuisine, my traveling companion was a vegetarian, and looking for something besides veggie pasta and salad, so I obliged. This place was quality! Shaddad was an awesome and friendly waiter who made great conversation with us. I wasn't looking for a hearty meal here, so I got the hummus with lamb and the presentation of the dish set in front of me was 100%. I felt like I was doing my body justice on this vacay, ingesting hummus with olive oil and little herb things I couldn't identify, but ate nonetheless. Not even a real meal and I still couldn't finish it because the portion was plentiful and accompanied by warm, fresh pita bread. Will be flying back home with the leftovers lol.
name: Lebanon Grill

text:
Sheeeeesh. Chef Matt is working it at Yo Nashi. If you're coming here expecting authentic Japanese omakase - leave those expectations at the door. As the owner, Kyle, would say, "It's New Orleans omakase, not omakase in New Orleans."

$89 for omakase (chef's choice). I left super full and super satisfied.

The menu has smaller changes daily, but weekly they will have larger changes depending on what they can source for the week. 

I had an amazing tomato bisque. It was light and refreshing. And the cucumbers gave it a good crunch. The most memorable dish during my meal was the tartare. Accompanied with Compressed watermelon that was extra sweet and paired well with the tartare. Everything else we had was great, too. 

They have a good selection of cocktails + wines by the glass and bottles and Japanese alcohols. 

Would definitely recommend and will be making a reservation to come back soon!
name: Yo Nashi

text: Excellent food and service. Will definitely return.  Presentation of food added to enjoying my meal.  Every thing I ordered was delicious, especially the She Crab Soup.
name: Elle-Jâs

text: We tried Yo Nashi for the first time tonight and WOW what a great dinner. The restaurant concept is Omakase, which is a chef's tasting. We were delighted by each course. My favorite was a scallop, egg, and pork belly combination. Delicious! The cocktails are also inventive and unique. We will definitely be going back! Highly recommend!
name: Yo Nashi

text: Great Beer and awesome menu!  We had the beer flight on a previous meal which had a great selection. On my second trip we started with shrimp rolls, I had the lettuce wraps and she had the shrimp fried rice.  Both were really great!
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: So good!  Really enjoyed the atmosphere and vibe.  Food was so good and fresh, the fried chicken sandwich even burnt my mouth. Very juicy and the bun was on point.  Get the crawfish nachos, you won't be sorry.   Staff was also super friendly and the chef Josiah was very kind and also maderecommendations from the menu!   Definitely a new favorite spot!
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: After hearing that this delicious New Orleans food truck opened a restaurant in Gretna, we had to go. It was even more amazing than what we had remembered. To drink, I had the Spicy Thai Lemongrass Margarita. Perfect amount of spice and sweetness. For dinner, I had the Khao Soi. It is apparent that so much thought goes into, not only the unique flavors, but also the presentation. They're like works of art. Highly recommend this little Gretna gem.
name: Thai D Jing

text:
Fantastic!!

Came with the whole cousin crew to try out a Thai place on the Westbank. I was a little hesitant at first because I always felt that Thai food was not for me. Thankfully I was really wrong.

The outside of the restaurant is a house prettied up and on the inside, it looks sleek and modern. The menus have pictures of all of the items so you can't really have a problem visualizing what type of food you will get. The food to get is by far everything! Haha, we did not have a bad app, entree, or for some, dessert. 

I had the chicken fried rice and it was delightful! Their crab rangoons are pretty dope as well. This is a nice tucked away secret and well with the try. Give it a try!
name: Thai D Jing

text: So excited to have this gem in Old Gretna. From their beginnings as a phenomenal food truck to a brick and mortar establishment, this place knocks your socks off. First of all, the place is adorable and quaint. Secondly, the drinks are unique and delicious. Third, the staff is stellar and professional. Now the food, the quality and flavors are unmatched. Everything on the menu is delicious. The pad Thai is a fan favorite with my family. The owners of this place are some of the sweetest humans on the planet. How can you not want to continually support great owners who product great products. Cheers Thai D Jing. You've won us over!
name: Thai D Jing

text: One of my favorite breakfast and lunch  places in the New Orleans metro area! Great coffee, wraps, muffins, cinnamon rolls, CHEESE grits and more! The staff is incredible as well!
name: The Royal Blend
