text:
Go to your bar, make a drink and prepare to read a true review of Yo Nashi. 

After reading the mixed reviews on food quantity I had some doubts but I am here to tell you there is no shortage in quantity of food. Perhaps if you sit at Cracker Barrel and eat their large chicken fried steak weekly you could leave Yo Nashi hungry. However, it was 10 portions served with the utmost attention to detail and flavor. Chef Mack was a great guy. I asked a ton of questions as I think all people who love food should. He mentioned he had worked at Commanders and it showed. I can't say enough how his attention to detail made the meal extravagant. As we left I told him it was in my Top 10 meals ever and that is not an exaggeration. Their prefix menu was $89 which I must admit I thought was high but now I'm ready to go back!  They offered A5 Wagyu beef as an additional option but we backed out on that. 

Now to the actual meal. Amber was gracious enough to write it all down for me so I could include it in this review. I had noticed numerous posts without a description. So here goes......
1) fresh oysters with satsuma mignonette
2)Poached Shrimp with grilled green onion sauce 
3)Seared scallops over cauliflower purÃ©e
Nigiri servings:
4)Salmon w/ sesame ponzu
5)seared halibut w/ black garlic and miso 
6))Spicy tuna.....OMG. The best!!!!!!! (I had an extra)
7)Tuna w/ foie Gras and truffle 
8)Jumbo lump blue crab roll (two pieces)
9)Pan seared redfish w/sweet potato chestnut mushrooms, lobster beurre Blanc
10) Chocolate trio w/expresso meringue and hazelnut crumble 

So yeah, tons of food. All crafted and served with perfection. Truly a great dining experience that I will treasure until my next visit. I'll let the pictures help seal the deal. Don't hesitate to add this place to your list of dining adventures in NOLA. In a city with 100's of incredible options this will be in your top tier. Cheers!
name: Yo Nashi

text: Worst firehouse I've ever been to. They are unorganized and extremely rude. The cashier girl has an attitude every time I come here. This time, she rushed me through my order, didn't receive the right information, and then proceeded to blame me and argue with me for her mistake on making the sandwich wrong. She should be fired.
name: Firehouse Subs

text:
This was one of the most anticipated restaurant openings this year. Restaurants are still proving that even amid an ongoing pandemic, they are still driving innovation. This extravert is here for the new dishes, expanding my wine vocabulary and seeing amazing views.

Ok, so review time! My visit to Miss River inside Four Seasons New Orleans was nothing short of incredible. I absolutely loved the Food Stage where chefs extravagantly plate our signature dishes. Very attentive service was paid to us! The server brought wine to the table on a few occasions

The whole covered buttermilk fried chicken was sumptuous and plush. It was served with dipping sauces. This dish was my favorite 

Other dishes we enjoyed:
Crab Au Gratin
Gumbo
Red beans
Salad 
Cake with a sparkler was the absolute best. I would get any cake on the menu

My overall review of Alon Shaya's love letter to LOUISIANA is a welcome addition to the New Orleans area. My vote is it is the hottest and most luxurious restaurant on the scene now!
Photo by: Katherine Kimball
Insider tip: Book your reservations online ASAP.
name: Miss River Restaurant

text: My husband and I (and thousands of other Bills Fans) were in NOLA for the Thanksgiving Day game. A vendor at the French Market (Oscar of New Orleans, who I also recommend!) highly recommended  the recently-opened Lebanon Grill. It was tastefully decorated, super clean and very friendly staff. We had to wait a bit by no fault of their own. Like many other business owners, they were not expecting the volume of Buffalo tourists. They called in our waitress to help with the rush. The food is authentic and cooked right in front of patrons. Take a break from Creole and Cajun and check them out!
name: Lebanon Grill

text:
I had a king cake iced latte at Park Island Brew this morning and loved it!   How have I never been here before? 

They're located across the street from the Fairgrounds and parking was a breeze. This spot is so cool. From the actual building to the bright interior and delicious java, it just embodies a New Orleans coffee experience.  

The staff was friendly and knowledgeable of their menu.   I also picked up a couple of baked goods - another big win.

I'm looking forward to my next latte.

text:
My husband and I came here for our anniversary dinner. We love fine dining experiences like these. We love michelin star restaurant dining and although this place doesn't have a star, it should!

I can't remember what alot of the ingredients were but I was pleasantly surprised when every single course was presented. I never had an asian fine dining experience before and I cant wait to come back. 

Highly recommend the a5 wagyu upgrade. It melts in your mouth. Already planning our next trip back.

text:

The potato salad was very nice. The brioche bun and accompanying dips were excellent. BBQ shrimp was very good. Muffaletta was good. 

Restaurant/atmosphere 9/10
Food 8/10

text:
I am a huge fan of Chef Alon Shaya. Every time I eat at one of his restaurants I am really impressed. I always recommend his restaurants for friends from out of town. So, I had high expectations.

When walking into the hotel, you see a beautiful chandelier bar. I didn't get drinks here but it look really nice. Since I went for lunch, it wasn't very crowded. I liked that because it wasn't too loud. I was also celebrating a family members birthday, so as we got to our table they had a cute gold balloon and a handwritten happy birthday card. Such a cute touch! 

While you are getting situated and looking at the menu, the waiter brings out sweet potato rolls that were actually amazing. They were warm and came with 3 things to dip the bread in -- olive oil, butter, and chili infused honey 

To start we got the blue crab au gratin (which we were told was best selling) and the oysters en brouchette. Both were delicious. The blue crab came with these saltines that were seasoned or something (I forgot what they had on them but they tasted better than a regular saltine). The oysters came with bread and a little salad of jalapeÃ±o and cilantro. I honestly think the bread was a little dry and not really needed and the jalapeÃ±os were too spicy for the dish. It completely overpowered the flavor of the oysters. But I hate spicy stuff so maybe other people will like it. 

As an entree I got the blackened snapper that was recommended by the waiter. It was really good. It came on top of some roasted squash with a citrus sauce on top. I really liked it. I also needed something with substance so I also ordered a side of French fries. They came with 3 dipping sauces -- ketchup, garlic aioli, and a horseradish aioli. The fries were good and I liked how it came out with 3 dipping sauces. 

To finish, I got an expresso martini that was quite good but not like amazing. I like a more coffee flavor but I still drank it all. After you eat, they give you a few little treats and we got these little brownies and banana pralines. I didn't try the praline but the brownies were good. They also gave us a complimentary piece of chocolate cake for the birthday we were celebrating. 


So you may be wondering, why 4 stars? Well, since I have eaten at all of the other Alon Shaya restaurants in NOLA, this one was just as good as the other ones but Miss River is way more expensive. I know the four seasons is a really fancy hotel but if you want to get food by chef Alon Shaya you are better off going to one of his other places and your bill will be significantly lower. The menu had a MKT price for the blue crab au gratin but when the bill came it was $45. $45?! I don't think that was worth $45. It probably wouldn't be best selling if people saw it was a $45 appetizer. I am glad I tried it but this place will probably be where the hotel guests will dine because they don't know any better.
name: Miss River Restaurant

We had chicken pad thai & beef pad thai, soo good!! we ended with the chocolate cupcake, the best thing i've had in so long, i need to go get another, the creme brÃ»lÃ©e, so good, and the mango cupcake, wow so good!!! the service was amazing, the waitress was very informative, she helped us pick all of the amazing things we had!

text:
The cutest and best place for a coffee annnd other specialty drinks !! 

I stumbled upon park island by chance when I tell you this place hits just right, it absolutely does!

Located right across from the fairgrounds this establishment does not have parking however there is an abundance of street parking. 

Greeted upon entering staff very sweet and helpful! They were all down to earth and super insightful when trying to pick my beverage. They do have specials and daily drinks that are featured. 

There's such a variety here and it's incredible!! 
I got an iced mocha which is super basic but still hit the spot!!

10/10 going back to try one of everything!!
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text: Have you ever gone to a coffee shop and order a fancy latte and it taste just like every other latte and it was way overpriced. Well that is definitely NOT this place. The price is great and the flavors in their lattes are even better! The Hu$$LE is my favorite with delicious notes of honey in each sip! The rose vanilla latte is absolutely beautiful and heavenly as well. I love how cozy the little cafe is and the playlist is up my ally! I would hang out there all day if I could. Highly recommend
name: Park Island Brew
categories: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Food, Cafes, Breakfast & Brunch, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Food Trucks

text: Best Pad Thai EVER!  I had been waiting and waiting to try Thai Djing and when I found out they opened a restaurant location I knew I finally had to try them out.  I went in thinking it was about to be just another basic Thai restaurant experience, but boy was I wrong.  I got the Shrimp Pad Thai and it was OUT OF THIS WORLD.  And I'm not overexaggerating.  It tasted like no other Pad Thai I've had before and I could tell it was authentic.  It had the most delicious flavor and I couldn't stop gushing about how amazing it was after every bite.  I rarely get this impressed by a meal, but this one was just insanely good.  I'm also so happy to see that the Westbank has gained another great restaurant!!  Thai Djing is my new favorite Thai restaurant, hands down.
name: Thai D Jing

text:
One of those places that we have been to many times and never had a bad meal.

The salads are always fresh, pizzas are awesome and the pasta dishes are tasty.

The service is always on spot, bringing our food in a timely manner and keeping our drinks filled.

I definitely recommend this place!!!
name: Ditali's Pizza Cafe

text: This spot in New Orleans is a must if your visiting the state. If you love good seafood and want it fast I suggest you go here. They have indoor and outdoor seating. The  staff are very accommodating and friendly. The Seafood Plates are reasonably priced. I can't forget to mention how bomb the food is. The dungness crab plate is out of this world. The seasoning and the sauce they use is fireee! I don't know what they put it in but babyyy you will want to come back for more.
name: Deesxquisite

text: I had the bad fortune of having a cat in the emergency vets for 3 days and kept driving by this little strip mall. Today I decided to stop in and explore. What a pleasant sunrise. My niece and split Mariginy Wrap with mesquite smoked turkey, crisp bacon, crumbled blue cheese, leaf lettuce, tomatoes, fresh avocado with aioli mayo served in spinach wrap. With a side of some awesome coleslaw. If my selection is any indication of the rest of the food it is DELISH ! I can't wait to try more. We also had a Cream Cafe which is a warm blend of cold drip coffee milk and brown sugar.

text: This spot is a hidden gem in old gretna it gives you a very home vibe (used to be a house). The food was great and the service was well. I had a feeling it would be great if how packed it was on a Tuesday night! If you are craving for some yummy affordable Thai food this is your place to try!
name: Thai D Jing

text:
We had a great meal and experience! Service was amazing. There are only 4 people working, one in the back, Chef Mack, Kyle & Savannah up front. They were extremely personable and friendly throughout our meal! We had some great sake recommendations and the omakase was unique and delicious. 

I do want to mention they did an amazing job of social distancing as well. There is only bar seating and there were two empty seats between each party. During the whole meal, there were probably less than 10 people in the small restaurant at anytime.

You're definitely paying for the experience and delicious food and while you don't leave full, we left satisfied. Try it if you can get in. Prime dining is booked out for 3 weeks already. Would definitely come again, in fact, already have a second reservation for next weekend!
name: Yo Nashi

text: How does this place only have 35 reviews?! Hands down the best sushi we've ever had. Ever. From the food to the experience itself - it defines perfection. We stumbled upon this gem during their opening month and have been back multiple times since then. Each time we visit NOLA we make it a to-do to stop by here for an amazing dinner and we have never been disappointed. Looking forward to our next encounter!
name: Yo Nashi

text:
Spectacular new restaurant located inside the brand new Four Seasons. I am currently staying at the hotel and decided to pop in here for lunch. Blaine was my server and he was absolutely dapper looking and very welcoming. His recommendations were all spot on. I had to try a muffuletta sandwich and the one they serve here is ginormous! I even got the half order and couldn't even finish half of my half! The fries that accompanied the sandwich came out hot and crispy with the most delicious trio of dipping sauces- the garlic aioli being my favorite! Blaine wrapped up my leftovers and brought me some complimentary treats- thank you! I've been wanting to try the famous Nola pralines so I was ecstatic. 

The aesthetic here gets 5 stars! Service and professionalism of the staff was bar none. It's the four seasons after all and they are the best of the best! Bring your wife, bring your date, bring your best friend- you won't be disappointed I promise :)

text: We found out about the place online.  Great reviews were correct.  Started with a Lemondrop Martini and a St. George Porter.  From there we went with the Crawfish Nachos and Fried Ribs.  Special was Fried Rice with Shrimp and Sausage so we had to try that, too.  Loved everything.  Finished with beignets.  Nate was an excellent server and Mahun, the owner, stopped by to check on us.  We can also tell you that the burgers got good reviews from our neighbors.
name: Bywater Brew Pub

text: Everything was delicious, the staff was super friendly and helpful and this place is just adorable! Don't blink or you'll miss it even with the pink exterior! Popular Sunday brunch spot apparently because it was packed! Definitely going back!
name: Thai D Jing

text: I finally strolled in to deeexquisite located on St. Bernard Ave a block from circle food store after hearing rave reviews. I'm NOLA bred so I know good food and I actually love spicy food but our food today was entirely too spicy to the point I couldnt eat my corn or potatoes. My coworker felt the same way! I enjoyed the lobster as it wasn't too spicy but it did have green stuff on the top part of the lobster, never seen that before and I ve eaten lobster at several restaurants before without seeing that. I do believe maybe the corn and potatoes were soaked too long in the juice which may have cause the spice was but overall the wait time was not too long and I will just try them again on another day! Love supporting black owned businesses!
name: Deesxquisite

text: This place was. The worst. I would not give a rating but staff walk around like zombies and forgot half my order and all won't t break I felt if was on purpose after 15 minutes and inquiring 3 times. They blew me off. The cashier gladly gave my money back. First and last visit.
name: Firehouse Subs

text:
I was a long time fan of the Thai D Jing food truck (I got it religiously in graduate school on Pad Thai Tuesday and was crowned the Thai D Jing King by med school classmates) and was incredibly excited to hear they opened up a physical restaurant.

Let me preface by saying this success couldn't have happened to nicer people. The owners have been a constant positive presence throughout town and having used them for catering orders I've found them to be a delight to work with. 

Here they have room to grow and are able to branch out and offer a larger menu and include a bar service. Thankfully the classics are still incredible - the pad thai is some of the best in New Orleans. While I'm sad they aren't doing the food truck anymore I now find myself looking for excuses to venture over to the westbank and eat them again whenever I can
name: Thai D Jing

text: Probably best to avoid for breakfast. Went at 9am on a Saturday and they didn't have much to select from. Half the breakfast menu "was unavailable" and the pastries were just okay. Willing to go back to try their Vietnamese food possibly.

text:
I live around the corner from this restaurant. It has been there since what seems like forever. Whenever we are hungry and tired and do not feel like going out or cooking, or if I am in a big hurry, we order some food from here. It is your typical Chinese place. Quality is decent. Decor is nothing to write about. Sometimes the place smells a bit like cleaning solution. I never eat here but know quite a few people that have and like it. It is very close to Ochsner Hospital and a lot of the nurses and staff come here for lunch. At night, it is always pretty empty, which could account for that smell I am talking about. Maybe they start cleaning the floors at night when I go in to pick up my food. The service is always pretty snappy and served with a smile. I like this place and I try to sponsor it when I can. 

If you are looking for some quick, inexpensive Chinese food this place will fit the bill.
name: Chinese American Cafe

text:
While there are many great things here in New Orleans, Chinese food is not one of them. I've eaten Chinese food from every mentionable city in the USA - NOLA just doesn't have it. I currently live in Uptown and every place I've ordered from has been subpar to say the least. Until I came here.

One rainy Saturday night, while visiting a family member hospitalized at Oschner and too exhausted (lazy) to go out, I decided to order delivery from this place. Within 30 minutes from the time I placed the call, I had two steaming hot takeout containers filled with shrimp and broccoli, chicken lo mein, and shrimp fried rice, along with a cup of hot and sour soup, delivered to my room (they brought it straight to my ROOM, ya'll) at the Brent House Hotel. 

First off, don't listen to these other reviewers. I've noticed that some Yelpers love mentioning details that are completely irrelevant and don't pertain to the quality and taste of the food, when I'm pretty sure that's the most important part of a review (e.g; solicited by a bum and somehow that's the restaurant/employee's fault? Seriously??)

Anyway, back to quality and taste - the food was amazing!! The shrimp were HUGE and fresh! My veggies were super crunchy, Lo mein noodles were delicious, and the fried rice had the perfect ratio of sauce/veggies to rice (not salty at all)! Now if this place could deliver all the way to Uptown, it would be a dream come true!! 10/10 would recommend - I'll be driving across town next time I'm in the mood for some good Chinese!
name: Chinese American Cafe

text: I've have only eaten take out from here so I cannot really speak to the ambience or the waitstaff. However, what I can say is that compared to a few other chinese places I have had around the city that are supposed to be "better" or perhaps just look more polished, this place is the best. The food is 4/5 stars in my opinion, taking into account what it is, which is really, really well priced, fast food Chinese (not health food, not fine dining, no frills). Large portions, delicious food, well priced. Try the orange chicken!
name: Chinese American Cafe

text:
The Kolache Kitchen in the CBD is open (signs on the door still say "Coming Soon" but they're open)! I haven't been to any of their other locations, but boy am I glad this opened near my office. My coworker loves their Baton Rouge spot, so I decided to check them out. You order at the counter, no seating except for a few stools at a counter. 

Everything is reasonably priced. I got the egg & cheese kolache which was good, but their breakfast taco is can't miss. They make their breakfast taco to order and it comes with to-die-for salsa on the side. 

Everyone here is also super friendly! If you're looking for a quick grab-and-go option, definitely check this spot out. I've already been twice and will be back again.
name: The Kolache Kitchen - New Orleans

text:
I stopped here for a quick take-out dinner on a cold, rainy night.  I was pleasantly surprised and wished it was closer to my house!  I ordered General Tso's chicken and Orange Chicken and both were delicious and super fresh!!  The rice was tasty and moist.  I gave my eggroll to my friend so I can't vouch for that, but all in all is was a great experience.  I went in to order and my food was ready about 15 minutes later.  The inside is a little rough, but I'm not going to judge because it's obviously a small family operation and I wasn't eating in so it's not my problem.  

If you're looking for "real" gourmet Chinese food, keep moving.  But if you want a great, fresh, affordable, neighborhood-type takeout Chinese joint, this is your place.
name: Chinese American Cafe

      When I went to my truck in my dermatologist Parking lot I had a lady who ran a business in the same business to it tap on my window yelled at me for parking there and I told her I was just at the dermatologist a second ago but she just stood there for a second mean mugging me while it poured rain then she walk off !!! I just wanted a treat for myself since I was alone on my birthday :( and that what compelled me to write this review because it was a Juxtaposition on how different business operate and gave me some appreciation for this small cafe

text:
The hubs and I have been meaning to check out Chez Pierre, and today was the day.

The first thing you see when you walk in is a case filled with  dreamy French pastries.  It's enough to bring a tear to your eye if you've got a sweet tooth that controls your life like I do. But as we were here to have lunch, I digress.

There is a menu board behind the register/counter and there are menus on the counter.  It's your regular Vietnamese fare and the menu covers all of the basics.  We each ordered the vermicelli  - he had the chicken and I went with the grilled pork.  We also ordered pork spring rolls.  Once we had placed our orders at the counter we took our numbered stick and found a table.  

Our food was delivered shortly thereafter by a very sweet waitress. 

The good:

Very flavorful proteins
Fresh ingredients
Clean tables
In general - the food all tasted great.
A very attentive, sweet waitress. Loved the service.

The bad:

There are oscillating fans on the ceiling that were blowing pretty hard and there's a pretty powerful AC unit as well.  As it's a small space, I was a little chilly.

The grilled pork was a little fatty 

We had to ask for sriracha as it wasn't on the table. 

I certainly won't let those minor things stop me from visiting again and again, I'll just bring a sweater next time.  And I'll definitely be back soon to try  some of their sweets.
name: Chez Pierre French Bakery And Cafe On Harrison, Lakeview

text:
I LOVE KOLACHE KITCHEN.

It's honestly pretty exciting to finally have them outside of Freret St. and to have access to them in the CBD area. The staff here is so friendly. This location is a little bit smaller than their first location in New Orleans, but they have a community table with stools to eat right quick.

Food is superb and I'm just so happy my kolache obsession continues getting fed. Just know they don't have a soda fountain but the star of the show is their food menu so I highly recommend supporting them and checking them out.

My food was delicious and I think everything was priced very well. 

I had two different breakfast tacos and the bacon and cheese kolache.

The tacos were kind of a mess to eat. Definitely not good for eating on the go like I tried to do. 

The kolache was a new thing to me. It's like bread that wants to be a croissant? That's the best way to describe it... and it's stuffed with deliciousness. My only knock on that was that I wish it was served to me warm instead of room temp. I can just imagine how elevated it would be to take a bite and have a warm gooey cheese pull! 

Overall, a great breakfast!

text:
I've heard a lot of hype about pacos tacos, especially the rock tacos so I had to give it a try for myself. Walking in, there were a few tables and I saw a section for drinks and a sauce bar. The cashier is to the right when walking in. I placed my order fairly quickly and once I was done paying and picked a table to sit at, my order was already finished. That seemed oddly fast for me. We ordered 2 orders of rock tacos and 2 cokes. 

The food was underwhelming. It was room lukewarm and not hot at all. Didn't seem fresh to me. The sauce bar has a lot of variety, but I couldn't distinguish a lot of the sauces. There's a board that tells you the names and heat level, but on the sauces itself, there is no label of indication. The consome had steam coming out, but it was also barely warm. I was pretty disappointed having heard so many great reviews. I felt like the tacos were missing something. They weren't the most flavorful, but not bland either. I'm not sure what it was missing. One of the best sauces was I think an avocado sauce. It was a thicker light green color and was really good. I didn't really like any of the other sauces. 

Service was fast and the workers were really friendly. Our order came out to about $22. Not too bad. Maybe my visit was a fluke. At least I'm hoping it was.
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text:
Upon entering, you can smell the aroma of food and what I assume as cooked meat. I was promptly greeted by the staff and handed a menu. The menu is simple, not a lot of options, which is good because it forced you to order quickly. I ordered the birria, which is a burrito wrapped in a standard flour tortilla but then it's wrapped up in a layer of grilled cheese. It was essentially a grilled cheese burrito with the content of beef, rice, and beans inside. It also comes with a side of ramen, which is so interesting, since I've never heard or seen of ramen + Hispanic food coming together. The burrito is huge, so come hungry. Also I personally feel like the layer of grilled cheese is a lot and makes the meal heavier. I had to scrape off half of the cheese off, then I felt it was proportionally appropriate and I was able to get a good bite of rice, cheese, etc. It was extremely flavorful. 

I also ordered the quesadilla with brisket, or the 'penny' according the menu. They overly stuffed this quesadilla and I felt the brisket was on the drier side. I had to add sour cream from home to balance the dryness. There's also a salsa bar which is pretty cool and the sign shows the volume of heat for each salsa. I was pretty much a sissy because I thought the tomatillo was too spicy! 

Overall good experience with good food and friendly staff. My only critique besides the brisket being on the drier side was that majority of the staff did not wear masks. Our State hasn't issued that we can remove masks in public settings yet, and I appreciated that all the customers upon entering wore masks.
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text: Nice spot in NOLA for Kolaches - easily as good as some of my favorite spots in Texas.  I had the cheese and fruit and the cheese and sausage.  Both were excellent.
name: The Kolache Kitchen - New Orleans

The tofu was so hard I almost broke a tooth trying to chew it, so I just spit it out. The shrimp and fish were meh but we were both hungry so we ate them. Also got a strawberry kolache. The bread was good but the strawberry was just a plop of red sugary goo. All of this cost us $34. Waste of time, money, and calories.

text: I absolutely love the Kolache kitchen. I was first introduced to this establishment in Baton Rouge while attending college, I was immediately hooked. Now living in New Orleans I'm so excited that we have two locations! This location is right by my job in the CBD and however you can certainly miss it if you're using gps. I passed it up twice because the signage is kind of small but it's worth the hassle of trying to find. I ordered the Patton sausage and bacon Kolache. The Patton sausage Kolache was outstanding, I absolutely loved it! The bread is soft, sweet, warm and outright sinful. It was stuffed with meat and the prices are super reasonable! After two I was stuffed. The building was clean and good music was being played as I waited in line. The staff was nice could be a little more friendly but they were pleasant to say the least!
name: The Kolache Kitchen - New Orleans

text:
I've been here twice now. The first time was early afternoon. Brunch crowd had died down. The restaurant wasn't real busy. Service was great. I ordered the All That Jazz and a quite strong mimosa. Enjoyed them both. The sausage patty had a weird taste tho.
Second visit was in the height of brunch. It was post Ida and very busy. There was also a large party in the back room. The service was much slower. However, I'll cut them slack given the post Ida situation. I ordered the Tchoupitoulas. It was scrumptious. 
I'll definitely be back. That Tchoupitoulas is worth a return visit.
name: Up & Adam Eatz

text: Delicious! I got three tacos al pastor. Meet was tender and well spiced, with pico de Gallo plenty of veggies, great salsas, authentic - my friend got the burrito and was ha ha happy. My other friend got the shrimp tacos and had zero complaints. Will be back!
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text:
The food is absolutely amazing and the chef is very accommodating. However, don't come if you have things today you'll be waiting half a day for service. You'll wait a long time just to speak with some to get seated. You'll wait another 20 minutes just to get your drink order so order your food at the same time cause you not gonna see nobody for another 20 minutes. The food comes out very fast cause the chef is wonderful, but the service... abysmal.

We showed up at 10:30 and didn't get out until 12:10 just waiting.

text: Pleasantly surprised at how fresh and delicious the chicken caesars  salad was at such a quaint place. Most places you go to now days use low quality "meat"/meat parts. They served high quality white meat chicken breast. It did not taste microwaved but rather grilled with good intention. The Caesars dressig tastes so rich and creamy. Very good quality Caesars dressing as well and the Romain was so fresh, I wouldn't doubt they were growing right in the back.request they go light on the parm unless plenty of parm is your thing. ENJOY!

text: I go there quite a bit to pick up lunch. The chicken banh mi and the shrimp spring rolls are my usual. Everything is always good. text:
Coming from San Diego to New Orleans i think I know some stuff about tacos. The employees at our hotel kept recommending this place so my fiancÃ© and I went as soon as Ida cleared and places opened up. We tried it 2x to have a honest review lol

Some things I would say is their trompo meat could be seasoned way more all u taste is the sweet from the pineapple. As well as upgrading both corn and flour tortillas for a more authentic taste. Their "guacamole " is just smashed avocado with no salt or lime.

I love their arachera meat, the penny quesadilla w meat, the Rock taco with the consomÃ©. I like that they have all toppings individually wrapped It keeps it sanitary and fresh. The Margaritas are delicious!!! Both prickly pear and the horchata one! overall I recommend for this place at least be tried out once the employees always are super nice and sweet especially the cashier :) plus it brings us a little feeling of being back home near the border with Tijuana tacos
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text: I have been in search of good Birria Tacos for awhile now and I have to say this spot did not disappoint! It's a no brainer to come for Taco Tuesday! This spot offers a free taco on Tuesday with any taco order! Just don't forget to mention it to the cashier! The spot was packed when I got here but we managed to get a table for 5! The wait was not long at all! The kitchen is an open concept so you can see them making your tacos in front of you! I don't know about you but a good taco has to come with good salsas/hot sauces! And boy did they deliver! The sauce bar was open with every sauce individually packed in containers and condiments packed in their own bag! It was super convenient with a sign explaining each spice level ranging from mild to what I thought was liquid fire which I loved! lol After dinner, a gentleman walked around to each table and asked us for feedback! I believe he was the owner! Would definitely recommend this spot! Well done guys!
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text: Seriously this place is amazing!!!! I honestly see no reason this place has any bad reviews like it was so amazing! I've been looking for Birria in town forever and finally my wait is over! I also don't think the prices are bad at all! Im so excited to live so close to this place!
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text: I was excited to see that this spot has birria tacos! (I'm behind the trend, I know.) So I put in a to-go order of Rock tacos and a side soft shell steak taco to try them out. Overall, I'd have to say it was ok. The pork in the Rock tacos was flavored well and they did not skimp on meat; also, 3 medium sized tacos for $8.50 isn't bad at all! However, I was disappointed with the consome broth...it had no flavor to me! I ended up using the side dipping sauces to add flavor. And the steak taco was meh. Not that my expectations are super high for a flour tortilla with meat, onions, and cilantro, but the meat was super tough and dry and not very flavorful. So, overall, I believe  that this spot is good as "chain" taco restaurant, and some dishes are probably higher quality than others. I'd grab the Rock tacos again at some point when I'm in the area.
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text:
They're ok, nothing to rave about. 
I ordered the al pastor, chorizo, and birria tacos. They were all ok but lacked flavor in my opinion. I would go again but probably only order the birria as it was the better tasting taco option. Give it a try.
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text: Food was really tasty but portions were small for the prices. Rock tacos or "birria" tacos was $9 for 3 and a small cup of the consome. It does not include rice or beans. The 5 for $11 tacos allows you to pick any meat. Staff could be friendlier.
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text: This spot is new and I'm glad I tried it. I ordered inside and got birria tacos to go. The hostess was a bit aloof and not very friendly. Luckily, their food makes up for that. The birria tacos were delicious! They also have a salsa bar where you can choose as many sauces as you'd like, and that was awesome.
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text:
Holy sh*t. My favorite baker who opened and ran the original la Boulangerie has opened up a bakery in Lakeview. 

He has the BEST pastries and croissant I used to probably go twice a week before Donald Link bought it in 2015. 

I cannot believe our luck. I've been asking for a neighborhood bakery(breakfast pastries) with seating area for years in this part of town (Lakeview/metairie) .

He had the BEST pastries and croissants. I cannot believe our luck. And my a*s that will enlarge as a consequence. I've been asking for a neighborhood bakery for years in this part of town. 

The line was long  but expected and the pastries were everything I remember. 

Thank you thank you for coming to Lakeview

The line was long  but expected and everything I remember. 

Thank you thank you for coming to Lakeview!
name: Celtica French Bakery
categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French

text: I'll start by saying I've been eating here once or twice a month for 2 years now and have enjoyed it. This last visit I got pepper steak and onions with shrimp fried rice, and halfway through eating the rice I found a used band-aid in my rice. It is shaped as if it fell off of a finger. They of course denied that it came from one of their employees and did not do much to make up for the incident. The only reason they aren't getting 1 star is because of how many times I've eaten here with no problems. Very unfortunate that I'll have to stop eating here as it was convenient and pretty good.
name: Chinese American Cafe

text: Most of the pastries and meat pies we've had have been fantastic. We ordered a BÃ»che de NoÃ«l (Yule Log) for Christmas. It was $36 for a 12 inch log-and we ordered traditional chocolate. It looked very pretty. It tasted AWFUL. It was just cake and whipped cream-it didn't taste like chocolate AT ALL-and the whipped cream wasn't sweet. text: Came in not knowing what to expect from the birria ramen bowl. Left out wanting the birria ramen bowl EVERYDAY!  It's really that addicting. Imagine your grandmas beef stew but better and with ramen noodles.  The birria was savory and tender and just downright delicious. I was so full from the ramen I barely touched the burrito. text:
What a charming, chic little neighborhood French Bakery.  

They're located on Robert E. Lee, and there's a parking lot behind the building.  

The case is filled with rich looking, gorgeous pastries and there are several varieties of breads behind the counter.  There are a few tables inside so that you can sit and relax while you enjoy your treats.  On this visit I picked up a few things to go - a baguette, a chocolate croissant, and a cup of hot cocoa.  The pastries were every bit as good as any pastries I've had in Paris.  The cocoa was very tasty, but not as thick as a French hot chocolate.  

I'm looking forward to making my way through the entire pastry case in time.
name: Celtica French Bakery
categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French

I went on taco Tuesday and it turns out you get a free taco! I asked what the worker recommended and she quickly said the pork. I got it and it did not disappoint! She also recommended the swirl margarita. The survive was amazing. One of my friends dropped her food and they happily and quickly replaced it! Definitely will be recommending and returning

text: This place is such a gem! They bake fresh bread loaves for purchase. They have a variety of French pastries to choose from. The Nutella brioche is a must for chocolate lovers! The coffee is artfully made. There is inside and outside seating available. Quiche comes in two different traditional French flavors. You can get items to go and to eat there. Employees were extremely helpful and kind.
name: Celtica French Bakery
categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French

text: I'd heard this was a spot to try, being a new establishment and black owned.  I was very eager to go, because it's my desire to support my own when I can as much as I can.  Well let's just say I was very disappointed and underwhelmed.  I ordered the basic two egg breakfast with scrambled eggs, grits, bacon and a biscuit.  This should be easy.  Well not even close!  The eggs were over cooked and dry, the grits was like paste and although I asked for a biscuit I was brought toast (1)slice and I'm not sure if it was even toasted, because it was still white.  They did correct it by bringing me a biscuit a C- at best.  Now I've had subpar breakfast before, but what made this one so disappointing was it was $14.   When you can get the same type breakfast and much more tasty I might add for about $5.  I'm rooting for them and want them to succeed, but the only way to do so is to always put the best out there.  Now I don't have a problem with the $14 price tag, I have a problem with the quality of food offered.  The server on the other hand was great.  I believe her name is Angelique
name: Up & Adam Eatz

text:
Kolache Kitchen is a cute spot on Freret St serving Kolaches (among many many other things!). Right now during Covid, there is a max limit of 5 customers inside the building at once, so be mindful that you might have to stand outside for just a bit. Masks are required. I always appreciate this dedication to employee and customer safety! 

For the food: I got the cream cheese kolache and a frozen Vietnamese coffee. My partner got the BBQ brisket sandwich. We both loved these menu items. I will say, as a vegetarian my menu options at Kolache Kitchen, especially in the savory foods department, are pretty limited (but I have a huge sweet tooth so it's not a huge issue). I did ask my partner what he thought of the BBQ Brisket and he said it was delicious, and that he loved the chipotle Mayo side. All in all, would recommend. I'm looking forward to going back and trying more sweet kolaches
name: The Kolache Kitchen - New Orleans

text:
I finally got around to trying this place out this past Saturday and I was disappointed. I ordered 2 pork tacos and 2 roast beef tacos with beans and rice and a drink. The total came to $18.50. Ok it's a bit expensive but as long as the food is great I don't care. Well the food was not great or good. It was average. I asked for the pork tacos to not include pineapple in them and of course they still put it in there because the "cook" was already preparing my food as I was talking to the cashier. I'm their only customer BTW why the hell are they trying to rush my order  before I finalize the purchase???? 

The rice was ok but the beans were canned generic pinto beans. The roast beef tacos were ok but the corn tortillas were not strong enough to hold the meat so they wrap 3 tortillas for each taco. And now for the reason why I'm writing this review. They dumped about a 1/2 pound of rancid smelling onions in my box. I ate the meal in my car and that smell is still in my car 4 days later. I only had the food in my car for 20 minutes. I will never be back to this poor excuse of Mexican food!
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text: Too expensive and not a large enough variety.  The petit fours I got were not fresh and not impressed.  I won't be returning.

text:
This is apparently a new location on the Westbank, so the dÃ©cor isn't completed yet, but I like how it looks so far!  It's a neat open concept eatery with the cooking done in full-view of the customers.

I purchased a shrimp version of their Dog Burrito (~$11 regular price), and it was fantastic! The cheese on the outside of the burrito had been grilled to perfection. Slightly burnt cheesy goodness adds that savory umami flavor on a soft tortilla to create a little corner of heaven in your mouth. The shrimp, beans, and Spanish rice were well-seasoned, and the raw onions and cilantro added a bit of zest.  Really delicious burrito!  It was also huge, so perfect for me to split with someone if I'm having other foods with it!

They have a selection of hot sauces and extras (pickles and some toppings) you can try as well.  Let me tell you, the hot sauces were no joke. I tried a few and they were HOT.  Fun extra though if you're into heat!

I also tried a tamarind flavored soda. I like that distinct tamarind taste! That was yummy, but a little bit pricy (~$3).

I also got to try their Birria Ramen complimentary as a Yelp Elite Perk.  This was disappointing if you were actually expecting ramen. It was more like a beef noodle soup (instead of a chicken noodle soup).  The noodles were not quality ramen noodles.  I thought it might be the instant kind that you can cook in the microwave. The broth was beefy and flavorful, but it was too salty - maybe it wasn't a good batch.  The beef was only partially edible for me since it contained a lot of blubbery pieces (some people like beef fat, but I don't).  All in all, the ramen was not good.  They have other great food here, don't try ramen at a taco place.  Although I will say, I AM Japanese and a self-proclaimed ramen snob, so you can take my opinions with a grain of salt!  Like I said, this is a taco place, so I won't take any stars off for this.

The one-star loss actually comes from the lack of masks on the staff.  All of the customers had masks on, but 5 out of 6 employees I saw there did not have a mask on at all - not even on their chin.  I went to Pacos Tacos before the mask mandate was removed as well, so no excuses.  Even without a mandate, it's best if businesses have their employees continue wearing masks.
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text: Breakfast was served for the two of us. Mine was just fine. unfortunately, my friend's was not. First, she was brought bread, not toast. Secondly, her eggs were undercooked. It took too long to get the re-dos. I was finished my breakfast before she got her eggs again. This time, they were almost scrambled, not over easy. When a 2nd order was brought up, it was just as raw. We had to ask for salt & pepper. we had to get up and get a fork , and we had to ask for butter and jam. No bueno!  How difficult is it to screw up eggs and toast? The bacon and grits were good. And the music was too loud.
name: Up & Adam Eatz

text:
Okay, we like Vietnamese food! We have been to a good number all over the country.  This was really good! I had the pork Banh Mi' and the bread was perfect, the meat was grilled with an extra seasoning that made me think of hot sausage that reminds you that you are in New Orleans.  Very good! The shrimp spring rolls tasted really fresh probably because you could pick your own protein.  

Also had the Pho, it was rich and yummy. A little heavy on the black pepper, but I liked it.  

The service was great and the tub of chili oil on the table said we were in the right place. 

Pastries look good, but we have not tasted those yet.
name: Chez Pierre French Bakery And Cafe On Harrison, Lakeview

text:
Spicy Boudin Kolache and Chorizo + Egg Taco

I've see this business in several parts of the city and finally decided to try it because it's conveniently located across from another establishment I frequent.

I was early for my appointment and had a very light breakfast so I decided to look up the menu online.

There were SO MANY options, I was actually a bit overwhelmed but very excited.

Due to COVID-19 and the changes in hours for many restaurants and businesses I called ahead to determine if this location was open.

The woman that answered the phone was very rude and though she gave the information I needed, her attitude was terrible!

On to the food....

I ordered the boudin kolache and while the breading was heavy (normal and expected for a kolache) the bread was perfectly toasted and had a delightful sweet taste. The flavor of the breading with the spice and richness of the boudin filling was perfect.

My kolache was already made and placed into a bag upon ordering.

The chorizo and egg taco was made to order. The tortilla was stuffed with a spicy chorizo and fluffy eggs. They were accompanied by a tangy pico de gallo and a salsa on the side.

This was delicious breakfast taco.

The food definitely deserves 5 stars, but good service and what always does it for me!

Try Kolache Kitchen!
name: The Kolache Kitchen - New Orleans

text:
Came to visit their newest location in the area and grabbed a quick 5 for $10 street tacos. I love I can choose as many meats I want and do a mix and match moment. Decided to go with two pastor, two suadero, and one arrachera. 

Pastor is marinated pork cut straight from the trompo! Love that it's served with pineapple and trompo is a cooking method on it's own. Pretty cool machine to be honest and a great indicator that it's the real deal.

Suadero is almost butter like in the sense it falls apart and is so tender. It's a style of brisket that is perfection.

Arrachera is a skirt angus steak grilled so this is a great option if you have a very picky eater with you.

I'll definitely be back!
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text:
The West Bank finally has a dedicated taco spot! Paco's Tacos is here to make all of my taco dreams come true. I stopped in here on a Tuesday, and I think it was Taco Tuesday or something because when I ordered the five tacos for $10 deal, the woman who took my order through in an extra taco. Score! 

I got the the Arrachera, Birria, Suadero and Chorizo tacos. It was all so good! The meat was sliced fresh and it's all made to order. They even have a salsa bar, so you can add your own fixins as you see fit. They have margaritas too, so I'm going to have to go back and try them. On Wednesdays, they have two for one margaritas, so you can get two margaritas for $12, which is pretty good.

I'm pretty excited that Paco's tacos is in the area, and I will definitely be visiting here regularly.

I wrote about this spot for Big Easy Magazine. Check it out here: https://www.bigeasymagazine.com/2021/04/28/pacos-tacos-brings-its-authentic-street-tacos-to-the-westbank/
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text: Called in for a takeout order around 7pm.  I was told it would be about 15 minutes, but I was tied up at work and didn't arrive until nearly 7:30.  I walked in and was told my order wasn't ready yet, so I paid and waited 5 more minutes or so while more customers came in and sat down.  I wish I could say it was 100% totally worth it, but it wasn't. To be fair, my General Tso chicken was very hot and crispy, and the sauce was less sweet than other locations (which I really appreciated), but the broccoli and carrot I often associate with the dish was nowhere to be found, and the shrimp fried rice was unfortunately bland-- I ended up pouring the dregs of the chicken sauce over the rice.  I have yet to find really top-notch Chinese takeout (yes, I know General Tso chicken is not traditional, but it is on nearly every takeout menu in America) in Nola and this was on par with many, so I can't be too critical.  I might visit again if I were passing by and really hankering for Chinese food, but if I'm going out of my way for it, I have a few other places I prefer.
name: Chinese American Cafe

text: I got an omelet.  It was extremely tasty, yet very greasy / oily. It was a good sized serving as well.  The waitress seemed a bit confused by my order (it wasn't an exact specific menu item) but the chef personally came out to make sure I got what I wanted.  The coffee is very good.  Biscuits are unique, still not sure if that is a good thing or not.  The atmosphere was excellent. Everyone was very friendly, welcoming and helpful.  The main reason I give a 4 not 5 is price. Very high pricing.  $18 for a 3 item omelet............  I've been in NOLA a few days now and have gotten the same item for $11 - $13 in numerous other places.

text:
I had looked forward to visiting with my wife for a casual dining experience. What a disappointment!!! 
First entering the building, the music is very loud and echoing so you can barely hear any one speaking to you. Next with all the employees and I being the only one placing an order, I was ignored while the employees took care of their conversations first. After 5  or more minutes and just before I turned to walk out someone noticed me. When I asked a few questions about the menu and recommendations, the response was almost a non- response. At best the food was mediocre with poor presentation.  The employees were loud among themselves which added to the noise discomfort. The echoing noice was painful and we left before finishing the meal. It was just a bad experience all the way around. Try El Patron if you want a really good taco!

text:
We are in town visiting my dad and decided to get tacos. The prices were reasonable and the food was made to order. The tacos were generously topped with meats and cilantro/onions. Regular tacos were 5 for $10. The Birria tacos were 3 for $8.50 I believe. The Birria tacos were pretty good. I liked that they weren't greasy. The salsa bar was loaded with yummy sauces.  I love that everything was individually packaged and easy to grab and go. The employees were nice. One of them gave me a bag for my salsas. 
Me and my sisters share 3 different tacos.
Birria tacos 5/5 
Skirt steak tacos 4/5 
Trompo (pork) 3/5 the meat was a little dry to me. 
My husband had a dog house burrito. 
3/5 he said it lacked flavor.

text: I'm updating my review after being there several times now. Soooo I really really want to like this place. I love Vietnamese food and there is no other place near our house. The food has always been great. However we decided to get pastries for a couple of house guest the other night. And the 2 cakes that we bought tasted off. The guest complained they tasted "freezer burnt / not fresh". So we apologized and called chez pierre the next morning. The lady on the phone was very nice and told us to come in. When my mother in law went to return the cakes she said the man was rude and argued that is not what "freezer burn" taste like. And refused a refund on one of the cakes. We are talking $4.50, I mean come on, we arnt trying to scam you. We were a little embarrassed that our guest complained about the bad tasting parties we served them. We just wanted to bring it to the attention of the restaurant. A little advice to a new business. Maybe make it right for customers who complain about quality. I think I'll drive the extra distance next time for Vietnamese, this place isn't ready yet.
name: Chez Pierre French Bakery And Cafe On Harrison, Lakeview

text:
Ok this is a tough review because of the service. 
The building is lovely, they have parking in back. Very cute tables and chairs on side of building with flowers in wee vases.  Cool art inside. All in all great presentation. 

Had a ham and cheese croissant, one hot  coffee one ice coffee and one dessert. 

The coffee was exceptional! Smooth and wonderful. The ham and cheese croissant and yummy and the dessert with the whipped chocolate filling was spot on. 

I know that they are just opening so hopefully the service will get better.  Didn't get half my order the first time so had to use my card twice. I said twice we were eating outside at their tables and I still didn't get plates till I specifically asked. No tray but I saw someone else with one after us so not sure if they are sitting out for you to take but I didn't see it.  Another person outside had a real coffee cup so again one has to ask for that vs to go cup ? 

I will go back for the food but will wait just a bit for service to work out kinks.
name: Celtica French Bakery
categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French

text:
Nope.
Nope.
Nope.

I happened to try this one day when I had about 45 minutes to kill and happened to be in the area. 

No cars in the parking lot usually means it's not going to go well. This was one of those times. I walked in and there was a table of Asian people (Well that's a great sign, right?). When they saw me, they all slowly got up and went into the kitchen. Oops. That was the staff. 

With great trepidation and not enough time to go elsewhere, I put in my order.

While I stood by the chair (Wasn't about to sit in that nasty thing.) and waited (a looong wait) a couple came in. Neither of them ordered first. Both looked at me...then asked if I'd give them some money. WTF?? I tried to be polite and told them I only had a credit card. 
The women then asked if I would buy her lunch. Double WTF!??
Um., No. They turned around and left. The entire time the woman at the counter just watches and didn't say a word. I'm guessing that happens often.

I finally got my food and left, 

Despite everything I still went to eat the food. I've never seen Mongolian beef that was orange. First bite told me it wasn't what I ordered and I could not tell you what it was supposed to be by taste. I'm not completely convinced it WAS Chinese food. I'm not even completely convinced it was food. 

After reading about it having one of the worst Health department records in the area, it makes more sense. But how do you stay in business with that bad a score and that terribly a level of food?
name: Chinese American Cafe

text:
Perfection!

I've looked forward to Kolache Kitchen since construction began last year. Didn't know what to expect, but was intrigued by such an ambitious concept eatery opening in the heart of the CBD. After 5 years in this neighborhood, I've seen niche spots like this come and go.

So my expectations were cautiously optimistic. Yesterday, during my dog's morning walk I popped in for just one kolache. Just to see if the food was good, as I told the cashier. She replied, "there's no if it's good. It is." And boy was she right.

I returned this morning, again with my pup. This time for several different items. Imagine my surprise when the cook asked if I wanted my steak taco medium or well done. I'd never been asked that in this town, and for a moment thought I was back in San Diego.

If you live or work in the CBD or French Quarter, do yourself a favor and stop by Kolache Kitchen on Carondelet. Prices are a bit lower than you'd expect for the area. Cashiers seemed friendly, and the breakfast is wonderful.
name: The Kolache Kitchen - New Orleans

attributes.Ambience: {'touristy': None, 'hipster': None, 'romantic': False, 'divey': None, 'intimate': None, 'trendy': None, 'upscale': None, 'classy': False, 'casual': True}

text:
IMMACULATE, AMAZING, ENJOYABLE, TASTEFUL and would recommend to anyone in the Greater New Orleans area or out of town guest. The ambiance, the staff and the food are all 5 star. 

Upon arrival to the restaurant, we were greeted at the door requesting COVID vaccination cards. Of course we are all vaccinated; however, my 89 year old grandmother forgot her card at home. I was so sad and begin to share with Derrick how I am in town from HOUSTON. Adam immediately sprung into action, grab a table, an umbrella for shade, pull out the chairs and welcomed us to an area outside. I was very pleased to see they were following COVID protocols which is a must for me. 

Then the waitress arrived with a beautiful smile describing the menu as if she was a walking book. As we prepared to order beverages we were informed the COFFEE is the brand of the company. It was truly on point with taste, pizzazz and warmth. I was very impressed with the level of Entrepreneurship. 

We choose two appetizers and they were so delicious I wanted to order the same two again. 

 Then the arrival of the well plated food. The chef literally won me with the appetizers let alone the food. Everything was fresh, tasty,and savory on the palate. 

The customer service is top notch. The staff continuously circled to every table serving and not even allowing you to run out of items. 

Then I begin to inquire about meeting rooms for small parties. Adam directed me to the 3 different doors which allow private entrance with shutter doors from the public to allow privacy. THIS IS A MUST DURING COVID TIMES. 

The most impressive feature was the Handicap accessible equipment noted to the stairs of the building. There are larger establishments who are not as equipped as this business. 

I ENCOURAGE EVERY PATRON TO VISIT THIS ESTABLISHMENT AND LET ME KNOW YOUR THOUGHTS. I PROMISE YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED.
name: Up & Adam Eatz

text:
Quiet and timely for a random Friday morning. The building is an old creole townhouse turned restaurant with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. 

I ordered coffee, the garden district omelette, and sides of grits and catfish. The coffee was distinct. With subtle hints of sweetness that reminded me of maple flavor. The egg omelette was large and packed with spinach, mushrooms, peppers, onions, and tomatoes. The grits were cooked perfectly. Creamy and just the right amount of salt. However a side of grits was $7! Seems a bit over priced in my opinion but I ordered and ate it anyways. The side of catfish was superb. It was fried lightly, with the right amount of crunch and seasoned well. I'll be back again to try some more menu items and have a cocktail or two. 

No parking lot. You will have to find a spot on the street or take the street car.
name: Up & Adam Eatz

text:
I love this place! I was so excited to find another French bakery! The decor is so pretty. It's a cute little place for afternoon tea or coffee date :) My favorite so far are the Mille Feuilles, cream puff, the quiches, and croissant sandwich. 

The chocolate  eclair was good, but a little too rich for me. I might try the regular cream filling next time. The strawberry tart was good, but a little too sweet for my taste. 

This was actually my second visit this week because I wanted to try everything. You can definitely taste all the love in their pastries. This has been one of my favorite places outside of Europe for French Pastries so far.
name: Celtica French Bakery
categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French

text:
When the birria craze first cropped up in mid/late 2020, I had to see what all the fuss was about and quickly googled "birria near me". Paco's Tacos was the first to pop up, so of course I headed out there to see wassham. 

Babbbyyy, these are some of the best birria tacos in the city of NOLA metro area -- known as their "Rock Tacos", the birria meat is dripping in the flavorful consome (broth) and is well seasoned without being too salty or spicy. That way you can control the spice level with their assortment of salsas. 

Additionally, they even have Birria ramen, as well as Costras (think traditional queso fundido and your choice of meat). 

Since trying the Metairie location, I was so elated to see that they now have a location in the heart of the West Bank on Manhattan. This location gets pretty crowded, and has limited indoor seating & alcohol choices compared to Metairie location -- so it's perfect for to-go or a quick lunch.

Pro-Tip: Dip your Rock Tacos in the consome & then the spicy quacasalsa dip on the side 

So safe to say Paco's Tacos is #TheFrench75DietApproved so get your eats on and tell em #TheFrench75Diet sent ya.
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text: I recieve emails from 'Only in Louisiana' that highlights different places in Louisiana with visiting our trying. Today Paco's tacos was featured. Needles to say...I SHOULD HAVE PASSED. I've gotten better food from Taco Bell. The meat on my Rock taco was super salty and the tortillas were to tough to chew. The cheese in my quesadilla was burnt, picture attached, didn't eat it.  Last minute I bought one of their horchata drinks...  Watered down worse than skim milk, and so grainy it felt like I was drinking chalk water. Dumped out, how it doesn't kill my grass. Will not return!
name: Pacos Tacos Harvey

text: I always go there for the Rock Birria Tacos and they never fail! Service was good and quick! Would also recommend the prickly pear margarita to anyone new

text: This is a truly authentic awesome French bakery. The croissant is the real deal!! It reminds me of being in Brittany and visiting the bakery in the small town where my family live. The baguette is awesome. We tried the quiche Lorraine and the almond croissant is also amazing. On another outing we had the opera cake along with a ham and cheese croissant. Excellent product, they have pride in what they do and use the best ingredients to create the best products. The place is brand new, very warm inside and the friendly service tops it off. I have been to every other bakery here in the city and nothing here in New Orleans comes close to this one.
name: Celtica French Bakery
categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French

text: Finally I found my Maestro Dominique back. Coming back to New Orleans my croissants, baguettes paradise is back. Merci beaucoup

categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French

text:
finally made it here.   the baked goods look great, and I got bread and beyond today, including a mocha.   the mocha only has one size, and it was $6, probably the most expensive thing I got today, but it was not 12 ounces.   The cup was interesting cause you don't need to worry about burning your hand with your hot coffee, but it was so small that it got stuck in the cup holder in my vehicle.   I had a hard time trying to dig it out.     It was gone in a few sips too.   Def not 12 ounces.

The bread is yummy, but the bag it came in is not good for keeping bread fresh.   A brown paper bag would've been better.   I immediately tossed the bag, and got it in something to keep my bread from going stale.

I noticed king cake for sale, and that is a NO NO its not mardigras season.    King Cake should not be served before january 6th.

I love the idea of using things that might help the environment, or might help save a penny here and there, but there comes a point where simplicity is more important than leading with new products such as that 6 or 8 ounce cup of coffee.    Please with the king cake.   its bad luck.
name: Celtica French Bakery
categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French

text: FINALLY!!!!  A real baguette.  My daughter is a student at Mount Carmel.  I have passed Celtica every day.  Today I decided to take a look, attracted by the sign in the window that promised (in French) a real baguette.  I bought two, went directly home, ground some beans and made coffee.  The baguette was so good with just unsalted butter that I almost, but not quite, forgot the coffee.  I also took an eclair home for my daughter and a napoleon for my wife.  I expect loads of praise for the good deed.  I will pick up croissants the next time.  They looked wonderful - as did everything else they had.  Echo Jennifer C. and the other five star reviews.  Now the best bakery in the area.  I am concerned it will get crowded when more people find out about it.
name: Celtica French Bakery
categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French

text: Delicious! I loved my meal here! I got a birria burrito that I took home and it was still delicious when I reheated it later that day. It was HUGE too! text:
I was very disappointed in the food from here. The Chantilly cake had absolutely no flavor - I could have been eating a dish sponge and not know the difference. I threw it in the trash. The beef banh mi was the strangest banh mi I've ever had - one side of the bun literally had soy sauce poured onto it, the other one dab of mayonnaise. The beef was not saucy or marinated and was tough (not to mention there were very few pieces On the sandwich).  I threw away the bun and ate the insides. The shrimp rolls were normal shrimp rolls except that the shrimp still had the hard shells on the tails! So you have to undo the roll to take off the tails, which ruins the roll and turns it into a huge mess. The peanut sauce that comes with the shrimp rolls is good. I didn't like the food. 
However, the inside of the restaurant is beautiful, and the staff was very friendly and helpful, hence the three stars. I won't be back.
name: Chez Pierre French Bakery And Cafe On Harrison, Lakeview

text:
This bakery has a huge selection of pastries and sweets. I was thoroughly impressed and must come back to try them. However, I stopped in for lunch so I can only attest to my savory experience here! I most definitely will be back. 

Five stars for the baguette! The bread . The lunch menu is limited but has a great selection for build-your-own sandwiches. There are many sandwich combo options! My only problem: I appreciate a bit of guidance and wish they had some selections to start. Building sandwiches is difficult and when presented with so many great spreads and toppings sometimes it's best to leave these things for professionals.  

Lastly, I do wish that they rid themselves of disposable plates for orders in the bakery!
name: Celtica French Bakery
categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French

text:
THE best thing that ever moved to my street! (Wuerpel, that is ;)

Their ham and cheese croissants are a family favorite.  Their coffees are just amazing- it changes my days for the better. 
We order their "Build your own" sandwiches often - made with their fresh bread and the finest of ingredients. I personally love the baguette with ham and brie; it was my favorite until last week's ciabatta with brie and their roasted chicken (WOW!)- so great!! =)

If you haven't gone yet- give it a try =) and I hope you enjoy it too!
name: Celtica French Bakery
categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French

text: Terrible service and terrible food.  Upon entering the restaurant, I was immediately taken aback by how dirty the restaurant was.  It isn't a place you can go sit and have a meal.  Just a carry out restaurant with a few tables and chairs.  There was trash all over the floor, the tables and chairs.  Restaurant had not been cleaned in weeks and showed.  My son really wanted to order so we proceeded to the counter to order.  There was no appreciation for the customer or the money being spend.  Very caviler and borderline rude when taking order.  We ended up getting shrimp lo mein and honey chicken.  Both subpar and not worth any money.  I would NOT recommend this location.  Save your money.
name: Chinese American Cafe

text:
TAKE OUT REVIEW:
Ordered takeout over the phone:
All that Jazz omelette ($18), roasted breakfast potatoes ($5)
Order was correct, service was prompt (though they quoted 15mins and it was a closer to 25), so this review is just for the food. 
I'll give them a little slack since it was take out so it's never as good as dine in, but honestly what I got for takeout wasn't worth the price. 

The omelette itself was fine. The eggs could've used a touch more salt or hot sauce, the filling inside was a pretty solid amount, but I'm not sure if it was from the fillings or the cheese they used on top, but there was a good amount of oil puddled underneath the omelette. The price is honestly a bit pricey in my opinion - $18 for the omelette and two pieces of toast.

Potatoes - super let down. There was only one photo on Yelp from like three weeks ago and that is definitely NOT what I got in my order. The amount given was good, but it's literally just fried potatoes with a side of ketchup. They didn't seemed seasoned at all and didn't come with anything. For $5, I wasn't expecting to get what could've been frozen breakfast potatoes (they didn't seem frozen, but idk for sure). The potatoes are also what made the wait time a bit longer. I wouldn't mind the wait if the potatoes were worth it, but they were not at all. 

Overall: maybe I'd come back? I've seen good reviews especially for other stuff, but this honestly wasn't the best first impression.
name: Up & Adam Eatz

text:
Went here for brunch on a Sunday. They mainly operate on reservations. I didn't make a reservation so we waited about 15mins to see if a reserved party would show. In the meantime, we saw several people were turned around due to being at capacity. I was wondering why their names weren't added to the waiting list should a party not show. 
After 15mins passed we received a text stating that our table was ready. 
We were greeted from our waitress with water. Complimentary pastries/ biscuits are not offered at this restaurant. 

Appetizer: 
We started off with the beignets, they were very light and flaky but also a bit on the greasy side. This dish is more of a dessert than an appetizer. 

Entree: 
For an entree we order the catfish and grits, this was delicious. The fish batter was fried to perfection with a slight lemon flavoring but not overbearing. The grits were the perfect consistency with a melted cheese on top. 
The other entree was the tchoupoutolas (spell check) omelet. This was huge and very thick. But the crawfish were just the right amount. It was accompanied by either a biscuit or toast. We decided on the biscuit. The biscuits didn't seem homemade, more like frozen biscuits, the size is very large. 
Service: 
The service was great, our waitress kept our drinks filled and checked on us enough not to become annoying. I will be back.
name: Up & Adam Eatz

text:
I am so thankful that the founder of La Boulangerie opened up their own bakery again! I have watched as La Boulangerie's bakes go down in quality and up in price, and I was missing the amazing pastries I had grown up on at the OG Boulangerie before the Link restaurant group sale in 2015. 

Going here took me back to my childhood. I used to get the chocolate almond croissants, strawberry tarts, apple cinnamon danishes, and galette des rois all the time growing up, and they are as delicious as I remember them! There is truly so much care that goes into making the food here, and you can tell in the high quality of each item. 

Celtica is a special spot that's up to french patisserie standards! If you're fed up with the bready, Americanized croissants that are so common in the US, then you'll love the offerings here of impeccably flaky pastry. 

Oh, and the space is beautiful and bright, with a nice outdoor seating area!
name: Celtica French Bakery
categories: Food, Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, French
